HOMAGE'S MISSION IS TO PROMOTE INDEPENDENCE, PRESERVE DIGNITY, AND ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH THE PROVISION OF SERVICES FOR OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES. SINCE 1974, WE HAVE BEEN COMMITTED TO PROVIDING QUALITY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR OLDER ADULT POPULATION, AND TODAY WE ARE THE LARGEST AND MOST COMPREHENSIVE NONPROFIT SERVICE PROVIDER FOR OLDER ADULTS, PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES IN SNOHOMISH COUNTY. OUR GUIDING PRINCIPLES OF INDEPENDENCE, DIGNITY, AND QUALITY OF LIFE ARE REALIZED THROUGH FIVE INTERCONNECTED SERVICE AREAS: FOOD AND NUTRITION, HOME REPAIR, TRANSPORTATION, HEALTH AND WELLNESS, AND SOCIAL SERVICES.

SINCE BECOMING AN AMERICORPS SENIORS SPONSOR AGENCY AND TAKING ON THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN 2015, HOMAGE HAS CONTINUED TO EXPAND AND DEVELOP THIS VALUABLE PROGRAM IN KING AND SNOHOMISH COUNTIES. HOMAGE STAFF HAVE SUCCESSFULLY RECRUITED, TRAINED AND MATCHED VOLUNTEERS WITH REFERRED SENIOR AND DISABLED CLIENTS BASED ON GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION AND THE DESIRED SERVICE ACTIVITIES.
 
THE NUMBER OF SENIOR COMPANIONS SERVING IN URBAN AND RURAL AREAS OF SNOHOMISH COUNTY AND IN SOUTH KING COUNTY HAS INCREASED SIGNIFICANTLY.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM EXPANDS THE AGENCY REACH WITH THE HELP OF THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS. THIS SUPPORTS AN EVER GROWING NUMBER OF OLDER ADULTS TO CONTINUE TO LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. 

IN RESPONSE TO COVID19, THE HOMAGE SENIOR COMPANION STAFF HAVE WORKED WITH HOMAGE ADMINISTRATION AND IN LINE WITH STATE AND COUNTY PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS TO DEVELOP AND ADAPT THE WAY THE SENIOR COMPANIONS SERVE CLIENTS SO THAT THE VOLUNTEERS AND CLIENTS STAY SAFE. SINCE MOST OF THE VOLUNTEERS AND CLIENTS ARE AT HIGH RISK FOR COVID19, AT THE START OF THE PANDEMIC, VOLUNTEERS WERE ASKED TO DISCONTINUE IN-PERSON VISITS AND TRANSPORTING OF CLIENTS AND INSTEAD SERVE CLIENTS THROUGH REGULAR PHONE AND/OR VIDEO CHATS FOR SOCIAL SUPPORT. THIS ADAPTED SERVICE CONTINUES CURRENTLY. BECAUSE OF AMERICORPS SENIORS APPROVING AND EXTENDING THE COVID19 TEMPORARY STIPEND PAYMENTS TO THE SENIOR COMPANIONS, HOMAGE HAS ONLY LOST TWO VOLUNTEERS DURING THE PANDEMIC (DUE TO OTHER FAMILY NEEDS) AND HAVE ON-BOARDED AND TRAINED SEVEN NEW VOLUNTEERS TO INCREASE OUR TOTAL VOLUNTEER NUMBER TO THE CURRENT 40. 

IN ADDITION, SINCE MOST MEETING LOCATIONS CLOSED DUE TO COVID19, THE HOMAGE SENIOR COMPANION STAFF TRANSITIONED ALL MONTHLY AND NEW VOLUNTEER TRAININGS TO AN ONLINE OR CALL-IN FORMAT ALONG WITH MAILING MONTHLY PACKETS THAT INCLUDE MEETING AGENDAS, TRAINING MATERIALS AND PROGRAM INFORMATION TRANSLATED INTO KOREAN AND VIETNAMESE FOR SOME VOLUNTEERS. ALL VOLUNTEERS HAVE BEEN ABLE TO ACCESS THESE TRAININGS WITH HOMAGE STAFF AND/OR STATION STAFF SUPPORT.

HOMAGE IS ABLE TO USE ITS LONG-STANDING NETWORK OF SNOHOMISH COUNTY AGENCY PARTNERS TO EXPAND PROGRAM PARTNERS AND HOPES TO ADD NEW PROGRAM STATIONS ONCE IT IS SAFE TO DO SO, WITH THE PROPER COVID PROTOCOLS IN PLACE. HOMAGE KNOWS THE NEEDS OF SENIORS IN BOTH COUNTIES WILL CONTINUE TO GROW AND SEES THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM AS AN EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT WAY TO ENGAGE AND SUPPORT SENIORS AS VOLUNTEERS AND OFFER SUPPORT TO OTHER ISOLATED AND HOMEBOUND SENIORS. 

IN 2019 HOMAGE SCP PARTNERED WITH CATHOLIC COMMUNITY SERVICES OF EVERETT TO OFFER EXTRA MILEAGE TO THE SENIOR COMPANIONS OF SNOHOMISH COUNTY AS A LOCAL IN-KIND CONTRIBUTION. THE HOMAGE SCP ADVISORY COUNCIL IS ACTIVE AND OFFERS REGULAR ADVICE ON PROGRAM STRATEGIES AND DEVELOPMENT IN THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE. WE LOOK FORWARD TO CONTINUING TO OFFER AND COORDINATE THIS VALUABLE PROGRAM IN KING AND SNOHOMISH COUNTIES.

THE LEWIS COUNTY SENIORS (LCS) IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WITH A MISSION TO PROVIDE NUTRITIONAL AND ENRICHMENT SUPPORT FOR SENIORS. DURING THE PANDEMIC, LCS HAS PROVIDED OVER 200,000 MEALS TO SENIORS COVERING AN AREA OF NEARLY 2,500 SQ. MI OF FORESTED MOUNTAINS AND VALLEYS. THESE MEALS WERE BOTH INDIVIDUALLY DELIVERED AND MASS-DISTRIBUTED AT UP TO 8 SITES THROUGHOUT THE COUNTY. 
DURING THIS PAST YEAR, LCS HAS SET UP A TELEPHONE NETWORK WITH VOLUNTEERS CALLING AND CHECKING ON OUR SENIORS. WE HAVE NOTED A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF SENIORS WHOM WE HAVE REFERRED TO ONE OF OUR COMMUNITY PARTNERS, CASCADE COMMUNITY HEALTH (CCH) FOR COUNSELING AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SUPPORT AS WELL AS THEIR 24-HOUR CRISIS HOTLINE. WE HAVE OBSERVED THE INCREASED NEED FOR THIS SORT OF SUPPORT WHILE NOTING THAT A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF OUR SENIORS LIVE ALONE IN RURAL AREAS WITHOUT ACCESS TO COMPANIONSHIP, FAMILY AND OFTEN WITH LITTLE OR NO INTERNET ACCESS. WE RESPECTFULLY SUBMIT THIS APPLICATION WITH SEVERAL GOALS IN MIND.
OUR OBJECTIVE WILL BE ON AGING IN PLACE AND OUTPUT H4A MEASURED BY OUTCOME H9A WITH SERVICE ACTIVITIES ENCOMPASSING COMPANIONSHIP, NUTRITION AND FOOD SUPPORT, OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION AND ADDITIONAL TRAINING AND REPORTING FOR ELDER ABUSE AND SELF-NEGLECT. WE MAY, AS NEEDED, ADD OUTCOME H14A, THOUGH CURRENTLY WE HAVE LITTLE SPECIFIC INFORMATION REGARDING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. 
FIRST, WE INTEND TO INCORPORATE VOLUNTEER COMPANIONS INTO OUR SERVICES. SECOND, WE INTEND TO EMPOWER THEM WITH TRAINING TO DETECT ELDER ABUSE AND MEDICATION MISUSE DEFINED AS UNDERUSE, OVERUSE AS WELL AS ABUSE PARTICULARLY OF OPIOIDS AND AS A LACK OF FINANCIAL SUPPORT TO BUY PRESCRIBED MEDICATIONS. THIS TRAINING WILL BE PRESENTED IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CCH AND THE HOPE ALLIANCE WHICH HAS AN ESTABLISHED HISTORY OF WORKING WITH SURVIVORS OF FAMILY AND DOMESTIC VIOLENCE AND SEXUAL ASSAULT.  THIRD, WE INTEND TO REACH OUT TO ELDER MEMBERS OF THE LGTBQIA COMMUNITY. 
LEWIS COUNTY COULD BE REASONABLY DESCRIBED AS A VERY CONSERVATIVE COUNTY. ANECDOTAL EVIDENCE INDICATES THAT THERE ARE A SIGNIFICANT NUMBER OF LGTBQIA SENIORS WHO REMAIN ?HIDDEN?. FOR THIS REASON, WE HAVE PARTNERED WITH A LOCAL FACEBOOK DIVERSITY SUPPORT GROUP, THE LEWIS COUNTY LOLLIPOP GUILD (LCLG). WE INTEND TO TRAIN VOLUNTEER MEMBERS OF THIS COMMUNITY TO CONNECT SPECIFICALLY WITH ELDERS WHO MAY FEEL MORE COMFORTABLE AND CONNECTED WITH THESE VOLUNTEERS RATHER THAN WITH THOSE FROM THE BROADER COMMUNITY. 
IN THE FUTURE YEARS OF THIS GRANT, IF AWARDED, WE ALSO INTEND TO BROADEN OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH TWIN TRANSIT OF LC WHICH HAS RECENTLY INTRODUCED A DIAL-A-RIDE PROGRAM (DARTT). THE DARTT PROGRAM PROVIDES A DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE CURRENTLY COVERING THE MORE URBAN AREAS OF LC.  WE INTEND TO EXPAND OUR CURRENT RELATIONSHIP WITH TWIN TRANSIT, WITH WHOM WE PARTNERED IN THE EARLY MONTHS OF THE PANDEMIC, TO EXPAND THIS DOOR-TO-DOOR SERVICE THROUGHOUT LC, PROVIDING MUCH NEEDED TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO HOSPITAL AND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS FOR OUR RURAL SENIORS.  THESE SENIORS MAY BE ACCOMPANIED OR MET AT THESE MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS BY THEIR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL BE TRAINED TO ACT AS COMPANIONS, NOTE-TAKERS AND PROVIDE OTHER NEEDED SUPPORT FOR THESE SENIORS. OUR INTENTION IS ALSO TO EXPAND OUR COMPANION SERVICES TO THE COWLITZ NATION.

AN ESTIMATED 115 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER ALL 115 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND ACCOMPANIMENT TO HELP ACCESS MEDICAL CARE, INCREASE FOOD SECURITY AND ASSIST IN MAINTAINING OR ESTABLISHING SOCIAL CONNECTIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 115  VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED NECESSARY COMPANIONSHIP , TRANSPORTATION AND OR RESPITE SERVICES TO 400+ COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN NEED; ALLOWING THEM CONTINUED INDEPENDENTS IN THEIR OWN HOMES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $747,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 85,500 IN MATCH FUNDING FROM LOCAL GRANTS, AGENCY MATCH AND IN-KIND DONATIONS (LEGENDS, WORLD VISION, COMMUNITY DONATIONS).

AN ESTIMATED 54+ SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND ACCOMPANIMENT TO  HELP ACCESS MEDICAL CARE, INCREASE FOOD SECURITY AND ASSIST IN MAINTAINING OR ESTABLISHING SOCIAL CONNECTIONS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE- YEAR GRANT, 54+ VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED NECESSARY COMPANIONSHIP , TRANSPORTATION AND OR RESPITE SERVICES TO 250 OR MORE COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN NEED ALLOWING THEM TO CONTINUED INDEPENDENTS IN THEIR OWN HOMES.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $353,560 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY LOCAL GRANTS AND IN-KIND DONATIONS. (LEGENDS, LIFEGATE, CATHOLIC CHARITIES)

AN ESTIMATED 21 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN LINN, BENTON AND LINCOLN COUNTIES. ALL 21 FOSTER GRANDPARENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION, WITH A LENS OF SERVING THOSE IN RURAL AREAS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE OCWCOG SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE SERVED AN ESTIMATED 58 LOCAL SENIORS WITH AN ESTIMATED 52 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF 135443 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 21515 FROM LOCAL SUPPORT TO INCLUDE LOCAL MATCH AND IN-KIND FUNDING.

JEWISH FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY (JFSA) IS A COLLABORATIVE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO HEALING THE WORLD ONE LIFE AT A TIME.  IN OPERATION SINCE 1977, OUR AGENCY STRIVES TO MAKE LONG-TERM IMPACTS THROUGH PROJECTS THAT BUILD ON OUR EXISTING CAPACITY.

AN ESTIMATED 75 AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 38 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY). OF THIS NUMBER, 75 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. 

SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP THROUGH REGULAR HOME VISITS,  THE PROVISION OF TRANSPORTATION, DELIVERY OF ESSENTIAL SUPPLIES, AND TELEPHONE REASSURANCE.  ACTIVITIES ARE DESIGNED TO MEET THE INDIVIDUAL CLIENT'S NEED FOR INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND IMPROVE THEIR INDEPENDENT LIVING CAPACITY.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS AN INCREASE IN PARTICIPANTS WHO REPORT AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. 

THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $244.685  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $170,752 IN NON-FEDERAL SOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 43 AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 41 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP, SOCIAL OUTINGS, GROCERY SHOPPING AND ASSISTANCE WITH ACCESSING OTHER SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, NINETY-PERCENT (90%) OF THE CLIENTS SERVED WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $73,862 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $355,292.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

AGINGNEXT, FORMERLY POMONA VALLEY COMMUNITY SERVICES IS A NONPROFIT WITH SIX VITAL PROGRAMS SUPPORTING OLDER ADULTS IN 16 CITIES. CELEBRATING OVER 46 YEARS OF SERVICE, THE AGENCY'S MISSION STATEMENT IS, "TO SUPPORT AND EDUCATE ADULTS AND THEIR FAMILIES TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCE AND TO AGE WELL AT HOME AND IN THE COMMUNITY." OUR ORGANIZATION MADE NUMEROUS ADAPTATIONS DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC.  WE HAVE AND WILL CONTINUE TO INTERACT THROUGH OUR GRANT CYCLE WITH OUR CLIENTS AND VOLUNTEERS BY TELEPHONE, MAIL, AND TECHNOLOGY. ELECTRONIC COMPONENTS OPTIONS SUCH AS ZOOM CHATS, ON-LINE EDUCATION, AND SUPPORT GROUPS HAVE BEEN USED IN COMBINATION TO INCREASE VIRTUAL COMPANIONSHIP AND SOCIAL INTERACTION. AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP PROJECT IS A FUNDAMENTAL PROGRAM FOR OUR ORGANIZATION AS IT REPRESENTS EVERY ASPECT OF OUR MISSION. 
AN ESTIMATED 34 TO 42 AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THIS PROJECT. OF THIS NUMBER 38, AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION FOR ISOLATED OR HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS. THROUGH THESE ACTIVITIES, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE AND CONNECT ISOLATED OR HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS WITH SERVICES NEEDED, ALLEVIATE SOCIAL ISOLATION, HELP TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND PROVIDE TEMPORARY RELIEF TO CAREGIVERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT,  THOSE RECEIVING VOLUNTEER SERVICES ARE EXPECTED TO HAVE INCREASED SOCIALIZATION, DELAYED PLACEMENT AT ASSISTED LIVING SETTINGS, EXPENDED FEWER HEALTH CARE DOLLARS AS A RESULT OF THE DELAYED PLACEMENT, AND REDUCED DEPENDENCE ON FAMILY MEMBERS AND CAREGIVERS. THE AMERICORPS SENIOR COMPANION FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $205,407.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 223,292.00.

THE SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA-BASED SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) HAS BEEN SERVING SAN FRANCISCANS SINCE 1984. SPONSORED BY THE FELTON INSTITUTE/FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY OF SAN FRANCISCO (FSA) SINCE ITS INCEPTION, THE PROGRAM IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY BY PLACING SCP VOLUNTEERS, AGE 55 AND OLDER, IN COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS TO INCREASE PROGRAM CAPACITY AND OFFER MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO ACTIVE, LOW-INCOME SENIORS. OUR VOLUNTEERS DEVELOP SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS IN ORDER TO ASSIST THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR COMMUNITY. OUR SCP PROGRAM'S GOALS ARE FOCUSED ON REDUCING THE EFFECTS OF SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS WHILE INCREASING SOCIAL CONNECTIVITY FOR CLIENTS, AS WELL AS RESPITE SERVICES FOR UNPAID FAMILY CAREGIVERS OF CLIENTS.

FSA IS REQUESTING A GRANT OF $35,264 TO FUND 7 VSY (VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS) TO VOLUNTEER AT 4 DIFFERENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WITH A GRANTEE SHARE OF $72,631.00 FOR A TOTAL AMOUNT OF $107,895.00.

BECAUSE THE NEED IS GREAT, FSA WAS SUCCESSFUL SEVERAL YEARS AGO IN OBTAINING TWO LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES FOR A CURRENT 22 ADDITIONAL VSYS PER YEAR, WITH 15 VSYS FROM THE SAN FRANCISCO DEPARTMENT OF AGING AND ADULT SERVICES (DAAS), AND 7 VSYS FROM THE SAN FRANCISCO MUNICIPAL AGENCY (SFMTA), SERVING 14 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. OUR CNCS PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH THESE VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WITH VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING IMPORTANT SUPPORT TO OLDER ADULTS IN CASE MANAGEMENT, SOCIAL, HEALTH-RELATED PROGRAMS AND SUPPORTIVE SENIOR HOUSING. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION CAN BE PROVIDED AS REQUESTED BY CNCS. FOR THIS APPLICATION, WE WILL FOCUS ON THE OUTCOME ASSIGNMENT WORK PLAN FUNDED BY CNCS. 

FOCUS AREA: HEALTHY FUTURES, SERVICE ACTIVITIES: COMPANIONSHIP: THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR OUR SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE PEER- TO- PEER SUPPORT WITH FRAIL HOME-BOUND CLIENTS IN SUPPORTIVE SENIOR HOUSING AND IN THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING WEEKLY HOME VISITS TO THREE TO FOUR HOME-BOUND CLIENTS, PROVIDING TRANSLATION ASSISTANCE, ESCORTING TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, LIGHT ERRANDS SUCH AS PICKING UP PRESCRIPTIONS OR ESSENTIAL FOOD AND MITIGATE THE EFFECTS OF SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 7 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT UP TO 24 CLIENTS AT 4 SITES ENCOMPASSING THE GOAL OF ALLEVIATING THE NEGATIVE EFFECTS OF SOCIAL ISOLATION, LONELINESS AMONG FRAIL, HOME-BOUND CLIENTS AND IMPROVE CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING THROUGH PEER-TO-PEER COMPANIONSHIP ACTIVITIES.

AN ESTIMATED 50 AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. ALL 50 AMERICORPS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, ASSISTANCE WITH MEAL PREP/NUTRITION, TRANSPORTATION, FAMILY CAREGIVER RESPITE AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ALL INDEPENDENT IN-HOME CLIENTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LESS SOCIALLY ISOLATED AND ABLE TO REMAIN LIVING AT HOME FOR A LONGER PERIOD OF TIME; ALL RESPITE CLIENTS ARE EXPECTED TO ALLOW FAMILY CAREGIVERS THE ABILITY TO GO TO WORK/ATTEND TO PERSONAL AFFAIRS. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $324,812 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $137,608 FROM THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO GENERAL FUND WITH AN EXCESS AMOUNT OF $5,195.

THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IN CALIFORNIA UTILIZES LOW-INCOME SENIORS TO ASSIST SOCIALLY ISOLATED, FRAIL ELDERLY, DISABLED ADULTS IN COLTON, FONTANA, GRAND TERRACE, HIGHLAND, LOMA LINDA, REDLANDS, RIALTO, SAN BERNARDINO, AND YUCAIPA.  AMERICORPS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO ALLOW DISABLED ADULTS THE ABILITY TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOMES AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS RESPITE TO AVOID CAREGIVER BURNOUT. VISUALLY IMPAIRED CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE ASSISTANCE WITH READING AND WRITING AND CLIENTS WHO ARE A FALL RISK WILL RECEIVE ASSISTANCE AMBULATING. THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO FIFTH STREET SENIOR CENTER AND THE PERRIS HILL SENIOR CENTER STATIONS' VOLUNTEERS SERVE 75% OF THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO SCP CLIENTELE; SPECIFICALLY SOCIALLY ISOLATED, DISABLED ADULTS. THE REMAINING 25% OF CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO SCP CLIENTS ARE INVOLVED WITH VOLUNTEER STATION SAN BERNARDINO ADULT DAY HEALTH CARE CENTER FOR ADULTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND ADULTS WITH DEMENTIA AND WITH THE INLAND CAREGIVER RESOURCE CENTER.

OUR LEGAL NAME IS "LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICES OF SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA" (LSSSC). WE ARE A PRIVATE CALIFORNIA-BASED 501(C)(3) NONPROFIT ORGANIZATION WITH HEADQUARTERS IN FULLERTON, ORANGE COUNTY. IN 2021, WE EMBARK ON OUR 77TH YEAR OF SERVICE TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL PEOPLE WITH LIMITED OPTIONS SO THAT THEY CAN LIVE IN SAFETY AND WITH DIGNITY AND HOPE. WE OPERATE PROGRAM SITES IN DISADVANTAGED AREAS IN SIX SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA COUNTIES. WE PROVIDE INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WITH SERVICES RANGING FROM BASIC NEEDS AND PERMANENT HOUSING TO EDUCATION AND MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES. WE ARE PRESENT IN SIX SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA COUNTIES AND OFFER NEARLY 100 PROGRAMS TO SOCIALLY AND ECONOMICALLY DISENFRANCHISED POPULATIONS. WE PROVIDE OUR PRIORITY POPULATIONS (SENIORS, HOMELESS, VICTIMS, MENTALLY IMPAIRED, ABUSED CHILDREN, LOW-INCOME, FIRST-GENERATION STUDENTS, ETC.) OFFERING TOOLS AND RESOURCES THAT MOVE OUR CLIENTS TOWARD INDEPENDENCE
AN ESTIMATION OF  40 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE SERVED. ALL OF THESE SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTING SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS; WELLNESS CHECKS, RESPITE CARE, CAREGIVER SUPPORT; IN-HOME VISIT, AND GENERAL COMPANIONSHIP. WEEKLY VISITS TO IN-HOME CLIENTS BY SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ALLOW ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIORS AGE 65 AND OLDER TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE. SENIOR COMPANIONS PROVIDE VITAL HUMAN CONTACT AND COMPANIONSHIP TO SENIOR CLIENTS, SOME OF WHOM HAVE LITTLE OR NO CONTACT FROM THE OUTSIDE.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS OUTLINED IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES STRATEGIC PLAN. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, LSS-SC ANTICIPATES THAT MOST OF THE SENIORS' WILL BE ABLE TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. WE ALSO ANTICIPATE SENIORS WILL FEEL LESS LIKELY TO BECOME DEPRESSED CAUSED BY ISOLATION AND LONELINESS, RESULTING IN AN IMPROVED HEALTHIER LIFESTYLE. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $230,519.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENT BY $35,958 OF LSS-SC WITH NONFEDERAL RESOURCES. ADDRESSING HEALTHY FUTURES' NEEDS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITIES BY FOCUSING SPECIFICALLY ON INDEPENDENT
LIVING (AGING IN PLACE). ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, BUYING GROCERIES, VISITATION, OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW SENIORS TO LIVE MORE INDEPENDENTLY.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
IN BUILDING A PATH FORWARD FROM THE PANDEMIC PERIOD, THE CITY OF OAKLAND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, UNDER THE AUSPICES OF THE HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT, AGING AND ADULT SERVICES DIVISION, IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING SUPPORTS THAT BENEFIT THOSE WHO ARE AGING WHILE CONTRIBUTING TO THE WELL-BEING OF ALL AGES.  THE CITY OF OAKLAND?S HUMAN SERVICES DEPARTMENT (HSD) DEVELOPS AND IMPLEMENTS SUPPORTIVE INITIATIVES TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND THEIR FAMILIES.
THIS RENEWAL APPLICATION WILL SUPPORT THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES PERFORMED BY A MINIMUM OF 51 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS. OF THIS NUMBER, 46 AMERICORPS SENIORS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES (PRE AND CURRENT PANDEMIC) INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, WELLNESS CHECK, AND NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT.  ADDITIONALLY, UNDER SAFE PERFORMING ENVIRONS, VOLUNTEERS WILL PERFORM EXPANDED SERVICE ACTIVITIES DURING THIS PANDEMIC/COVID-19 PERIOD INCLUDING PHONE VISITS AND DELIVERY OF GROCERIES AND OTHER ESSENTIAL RESOURCES TO ASSIST THEIR CLIENTS AND TO MINIMIZE ISOLATION.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE AND COMPANIONSHIP.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-GRANT YEAR, 255 FRAIL AND ELDERLY PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE RECEIVED AND REPORTED IMPROVED AND CONNECTED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING DURING THIS PERIOD OF THE PANDEMIC AND A REDUCTION IN FEELINGS OF ISOLATION.
THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 329,233 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 35,737 GRANTEE SHARE AS MATCH.  HOWEVER, THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO BE SUPPORTED BY OTHER CITY INVESTMENTS IN SENIOR SERVICES INCLUDING USING SENIOR ASSETS WORKERS TO SUPPORT PROGRAM IMPLEMENTATION AND CASE MANAGERS TO SUPPORT PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS.

BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF APPLICANT'S ORGANIZATION AND ITS MISSION:
CENTRAL COUNTY UNITED WAY (CCUW) IS A PROVEN LEADER IN IDENTIFYING COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH ITS EXTENSIVE CONTACT WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES, LOCAL NONPROFITS, AND LOCAL CITIZEN GROUPS. CCUW'S MISSION FOR MANY YEARS HAS BEEN TO RAISE FUNDS AND ALLOCATE THOSE FUNDS TO A VARIETY OF AGENCIES THAT THEN PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY. UNITED WAY'S MISSION IS TO FOCUS ON EDUCATION AND HEALTH AND WELL-BEING AS WELL AS FUNDING HANDS-ON PROGRAMS THAT OFFER DIRECT SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY WITHIN THESE THREE FOCUS AREAS. THIS ALLOWS CCUW TO USE ITS CONTACTS, RESOURCES, AND STAFF IN A MANNER THAT ENSURES POSITIVE OUTCOMES IN THE COMMUNITY. WE WILL UNITE AND EMPOWER OUR TEAM TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF OUR COMMUNITY IMPACT AND GROW OUR FOUNDATION OF DONOR PARTNERS. THIS HANDS-ON APPROACH PLAYS WELL INTO ITS SPONSORSHIP OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM BECAUSE IT ALLOWS CCUW MORE RESOURCES FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE PROGRAM.

AN ESTIMATED 15 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE WESTERN RIVERSIDE COUNTY AREA. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 15 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS OR PHARMACIES, GROCERY SHOPPING, AND LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION.  OUR SENIOR COMPANIONS CAN COMMUNICATE THEIR OBSERVATIONS; WHETHER GOOD OR BAD, WITH THEIR CLIENT'S CARETAKER, FAMILY MEMBER, OR SOCIAL WORKERS. THIS IS A VERY HELPFUL BENEFIT ON BEHALF OF THE CLIENT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF OUR PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP THAT HELPS ELIMINATE FEELINGS OF ISOLATION AND LONELINESS TO THE SENIORS OF OUR COMMUNITIES.  THESE SERVICES WE PROVIDE WILL ENCOURAGE THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND WILL IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL ENVIRONMENT.  WE ANTICIPATE THAT THIS SERVICE WILL NOT ONLY BENEFIT THE CLIENTS, BUT OUR PROGRAM GOAL ALSO INCLUDES A DESIRE TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF OUR VOLUNTEERS.  WE WANT THEM TO GROW THROUGH SERVICE AND KNOW THEY PLAY A VALUABLE ROLE IN OUR COMMUNITIES TODAY.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY THE ORANGEBURG-CALHOUN-ALLENDALE-BAMBERG (OCAB) COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. IS APPLYING FOR RENEWAL (Y1-3) FUNDING FOR THE OCAB SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, JULY 1, 2021-JUNE 30, 2024.  OCAB COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. IS A PRIVATE, NONPROFIT AGENCY WITH A MISSION TO ELIMINATE THE CAUSES AND CONDITIONS OF POVERTY IN ORANGEBURG, CALHOUN, ALLENDALE, AND BAMBERG COUNTIES, SOUTH CAROLINA BY DEVELOPING STRATEGIES TO ENSURE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR DISADVANTAGED AND UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS. SINCE 1966, OCAB HAS OPERATED A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES DESIGNED TO ASSIST AND PROMOTE ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY, AND FOSTER SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN ITS SERVICE AREA. 72 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AT A TOTAL FEDERAL COST OF $429,821 ANNUALLY ARE REQUESTED, WITH THE NONFEDERAL MATCH WAIVED FOR THE PROGRAM YEAR.  66 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE UNDUPLICATED IN OUTCOMES-BASED PLACEMENTS AT A COST PER OUTCOMES-BASED VSY OF $6,512.44. THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVE IS AGING IN PLACE IN BAMBERG, CALHOUN, AND ORANGEBURG COUNTIES. AS A RESULT OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, THE OCAB SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROPOSES TO CONTINUE TO MEET THE IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS OF INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR ELDERLY RESIDENTS, RESPITE FOR FAMILY CAREGIVERS, AND SOCIAL INTEGRATION OF ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES, ALL OUTCOMES-BASED, AND SENIORS IN ADULT DAY CARE (LEGACY PROGRAM). VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING BY PLACING SENIOR COMPANIONS IN HOMES TO HELP MEET VITAL DAILY NEEDS OF ELDERLY AND DISABLED SENIORS, SUCH AS ASSISTANCE WITH EATING AND MEAL PREPARATION, PERSONAL CARE, PHYSICAL EXERCISE, AND LIMITED TRANSPORTATION FOR APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER NECESSITIES. CAREGIVER RESPITE SERVICES FOR FAMILIES OF HOMEBOUND ELDERLY AND THOSE WITH DEMENTIA AND ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE INCLUDE LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREPARATION, ESCORTING, TRANSPORTATION, AND MEDICINE REMINDERS. THE PROGRAM WILL ENSURE THAT COVID-19 SAFETY PRECAUTIONS AND GUIDELINES WILL BE ADHERED TO FOR THE SAFETY OF THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS AND CLIENTS.  AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROGRAM YEAR, A MINIMUM OF 75% (27) OF 36 INDEPENDENT LIVING CLIENTS AND 75% (18) OF 24 RESPITE SERVICE RECIPIENTS WILL ACCOMPLISH HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AS OUTCOMES, AS MEASURED BY THE INDEPENDENT LIVING PERFORMANCE MEASURE AND RESPITE PERFORMANCE MEASURE SURVEYS RESPECTIVELY. 75% (6) OF 8 SENIOR COMPANION CLIENTS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AT THE DISABILITIES AND SPECIAL NEEDS CENTERS WILL ACHIEVE INCREASED SOCIAL INTEGRATION AS MEASURED BY A SCALE APPROPRIATE TO THE POPULATIONS SERVED. COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE ONE-TO-ONE SUPPORT FOR PERSONAL SKILLS DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING, AND ASSIST WITH NUTRITION, PERSONAL CARE, SOCIAL, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITH INDIVIDUALS.  THE OAKS PACE ADULT DAY CARE WILL PROVIDE ONE-TO-ONE SUPPORT FOR PERSONAL SKILLS DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING, AND ASSIST WITH NUTRITION, PERSONAL CARE, SOCIAL, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITH INDIVIDUALS.

MOUNTAIN PROJECTS, IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, AND IS RESPONSIBLE FOR HELPING CHANGE PEOPLE'S LIVES, IT EMBODIES THE SPIRIT OF HOPE, ASSISTS IN THE IMPROVEMENT OF COMMUNITIES, AND ENHANCES THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS WHO RESIDE IN THE SEVEN WESTERN COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA.  MOUNTAIN PROJECTS, INC.  A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY HAS CONTINUED FOR THE PAST 53 YEARS TO PROVIDE  VITAL SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY, DISADVANTAGED AND GENERAL PUBLIC IN WESTERN NC.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE ESTABLISHED NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS AS OUTLINED IN THE FOCUS AREA OUTPUT OF H4A, H9A AND H14. THESE SERVICES WILL INCLUDE: TRANSPORTATION, RESPITE, AND COMPANIONSHIP, AS OUR SCP VOLUNTEERS SERVE OUR SENIORS BY IMPROVING THEIR ABILITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY A QUANTIFIABLE INSTRUMENT WILL DEMONSTRATE OUTCOMES CONSISTENT WITH THE NATIONAL STANDARDS. SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL ENCOURAGE AND ASSIST SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE. HOME MANAGEMENT TASKS, AS WELL AS COMPANIONSHIP WILL PROVIDE THE VOLUNTEERS OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP THEIR SENIOR CLIENTS MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCE IN THEIR HOMES. SCP VOLUNTEERS WORKING IN THE RESPITE CATEGORY WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO THEIR CLIENTS BY ALLOWING FAMILY MEMBERS TIME TO COMPLETE ACTIVITIES NECESSARY FOR A REASONABLE QUALITY OF LIFE.  THIS RESPITE PROVIDES THE FAMILY CAREGIVERS A MUCH NEEDED BREAK FROM THEIR VERY DEMANDING CARE GIVING ROLE.  SENIOR CENTERS WILL RECEIVE OTHER VOLUNTEERS, WHO WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO CLIENTS WHO NEED HELP TO PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES.
BY UTILIZING THE MEASUREMENT INSTRUMENTS CREATED BY CNCS, PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENTS WILL RECORD THE DOSAGE RECEIVED BY THE SENIORS AT THEIR VOLUNTEER STATIONS. THE ADVISORY COUNCIL MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS, SCP CLIENTS, AND THE COMMUNITY, AS WELL AS THE PROJECT STAFF WILL HAVE ACCESS TO DATA THAT WILL MEASURE THE IMPACT AND DETERMINE IF THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY ARE BEING MET. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 65 CLIENTS WHO WILL RECEIVE IN-HOME CARE TO HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE.

AT THE GSU AREA SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (GSUASCP) AN ESTIMATED 29 UNDUPLICATED SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 29 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES DURING THE PANDEMIC OF COVID-19 WILL INCLUDE SAFE, SOCIALLY DISTANT, SAFE FACE TO FACE VISITING OUTSIDE WHEN WEATHER PERMITS, TELEPHONE REASSURANCE, RUNNING CRITICAL ERRANDS FOR FOOD, MEDICATION OR OTHER ESSENTIAL NEEDS, AND SAFE ASSISTANCE WITH NUTRITION. WE EXPECT 58 CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER AS AN OUTPUT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES AND THE OBJECTIVE IS AGING IN PLACE. EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE FULTON COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR SERVICES (FCDSS) HAS A LONGSTANDING HISTORY OF CONNECTING FULTON COUNTY SENIORS TO THE RESOURCES THEY NEED TO REACH THEIR GOALS FOR ACTIVE AGING, CARE, AND INDEPENDENCE. FCDSS SERVICES SUPPORT AGING IN PLACE WITH RESPECT, QUALITY, AND DIGNITY. THE ROBUST AMBASSADOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM FOCUSES ON ADDRESSING A CRITICAL PROBLEM THAT AFFECTS OLDER ADULTS IN FULTON COUNTY AND HAS BEEN EXACERBATED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC: SOCIAL ISOLATION. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL BUILD RELATIONSHIPS AND PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION AND INDEPENDENT-LIVING ASSISTANCE ACTIVITIES TO THE OLDER ADULTS SERVED, HELPING THEM REMAIN INDEPENDENT. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, A SUSTAINABLE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM WILL EXIST AND THERE WILL BE DECREASED SOCIAL ISOLATION AMONG FULTON COUNTY SENIORS. THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE HAS A PROVEN 28-YEAR TRACK RECORD FOR MANAGING THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN DUVAL COUNTY (DCSCP).  THE PROGRAMS GOAL IS TO ASSIST SENIORS TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING, AND ASSIST SENIORS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. AN ESTIMATED 40 AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, ALL OF WHOM WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE SHOPPING ASSISTANCE, PAYING BILLS, AND ESCORTED SERVICES WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES (AGING IN PLACE). AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 40 HOMEBOUND SENIORS WILL HAVE IMPROVED SOCIAL SUPPORT ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $260,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $64,831 OF MATCH FROM THE CITY OF JACKSONVILLE GENERAL REVENUE FUNDS. THE FUNDS ARE SECURED.
THE ONSET OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS SHIFTED HOW THE PROGRAM OPERATES AND AFFECTED HOW WE WILL ACHIEVE THESE OUTCOMES. THE PROGRAM STAFF WILL UTILIZE ONLINE RECRUITMENT TOOLS TO GENERATE A POOL OF DIVERSE VOLUNTEERS, NETWORK WITH NON-PROFIT AGENCIES AND CREATE A HEAVY ONLINE PRESENCE. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE THEIR REQUIRED MONTHLY IN-SERVICE TRAININGS THROUGH A VIRTUAL PLATFORM. VIRTUAL AND DRIVE THROUGH RECOGNITIONS AND APPRECIATIONS EVENTS WILL BE PLANNED REGULARLY TO MAINTAIN A HIGH MORALE AND RETENTION OF VOLUNTEERS. THE PANDEMIC CREATED ANXIETY AND DEPRESSION AMONGST A GOOD PROPORTION OF SENIORS.  A BEHAVIORAL HEALTHY AWARENESS EVENT WILL BE INCLUDED IN PROGRAM EVENT IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL HOSPITAL, THE THEME WILL BE "STAYING  MENTALLY HEALTHY THROUGH COVID-19 CRISIS.
 ONCE IT IS SAFE TO GATHER IN GROUPS, VOLUNTEERS WILL RETURN TO IN PERSON TRAINING AND PROGRAM STAFF MEMBERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT TRAININGS ON PROGRAM, VOLUNTEER, AND RECRUITMENT MANAGEMENT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE MOBILE COUNTY COMMISSION (MCC), WHICH HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) OF MOBILE COUNTY SINCE 1982, IS SUBMITTING A GRANT APPLICATION FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2021 RENEWAL (YEAR 1 OF 3) FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) OF MOBILE COUNTY. FUNDING WILL ALLOW A MONTHLY AVERAGE OF 76 SENIOR COMPANIONS (SC?S) TO SERVE WITHIN THE GEOGRAPHICAL AREA OF MOBILE COUNTY, WHICH INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING CITIES: MOBILE, PRICHARD, SARALAND, SATSUMA; SEMMES, CHICKASAW, CITRONELLE; BAYOU LA BATRE, CREOLA, DAUPHIN ISLAND, AND MT. VERNON.  THE SCP HAS BUILT A CORE OF PARTNERSHIPS WITH AGENCIES SUCH AS THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN RESOURCES, MOBILE HOUSING BOARD, U.J. ROBINSON ADULT DAY CARE CENTER, AHEPA, AND VIA COMMUNITY CENTER ESTABLISH A NETWORK OF SERVICES NEEDED BY THE CITIZENS OF MOBILE COUNTY.  BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS AND TO HELP IN RESPONDING TO RECOVERING OF COVID-19, THE SCP OF MOBILE COUNTY LOOKS FOR PARTNERSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT ALLOW SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITIES BY PROVIDING ACTIVE OLDER ADULTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO ASSIST IN MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS AND SUPPORT THE ROLE OF PARTNERS TO DELIVER ESSENTIAL SERVICES FOR THOSE RESIDENTS IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE. WHILE SERVING, SENIOR COMPANIONS VOLUNTEERS WILL OFFER NECESSARY ASSISTANCE WITH EDUCATION ON COVID 19, DAILY LIVING ACTIVITIES, MEAL PREPARATION, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING -INCLUDING DISINFECTING THE HOME, MEDICATION COMPLIANCE; ESCORT TO DOCTORS' APPOINTMENTS, AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL MEET HEALTH NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AIMED AT KEEPING SENIORS TO "AGE IN PLACE" AND INCREASING THEIR ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  THESE ACTIVITIES FALL INTO THE SCP?S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND WILL PROVIDE A MEASURABLE RESULT FOR FEDERAL ACCOUNTABILITY. DURING THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL PLACE 68-69 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS (90% OF TOTAL VSY'S) IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WITH ACTIVITIES THAT HAVE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES SUCH AS INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE CARE.  THE REMAINING 7-8 SCP VOLUNTEERS (10% OF THE TOTAL) WILL SERVE IN THE CAPACITY BUILDING AND/OR OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES BY ASSISTING THE ELDERLY, MILITARY VETERANS, DISABLED ADULTS WITH DAY-TO-DAY ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SITES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

CURRENTLY, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FUNCTIONS UNDER THE GRANTEE SENIOR LIFE MIDLAND (SLM); WHICH PROFOUNDLY RESONATES WITH THE FOCUS OF SLMS MISSION STATEMENT THAT READS "IS TO ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES RELATED TO AGING AND DEVELOP EFFICIENT, FLEXIBLE, AND COMPASSIONATE WAYS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY." IN DOING SO THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS A VERY SIGNIFICANT PLACE AND ROLE IN OUR SENIOR COMMUNITY IN PROVIDING QUALITY OF LIFE THROUGH OUR VOLUNTEER SERVICES. AN ESTIMATED THIRTY-ONE (31) AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, PRESCRIPTION PICK-UPS, CLEARING HOME PATHWAYS FOR CLIENT ACCESSIBILITY, AND ACCOMPANYING CLIENTS TO SENIOR CENTER MEALS AND ACTIVITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES IS THIRTY-ONE (31) UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $197,101.00 IS THE REQUESTED ANNUAL FEDERAL GRANT AMOUNT, BASED ON $6500.00 COST PER VOLUNTEER, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $71,453.00 THE ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. SENIOR COMPANIONS WHO PROVIDE THESE VOLUNTEER SERVICES EMPOWERS THEM TO CONTRIBUTE TO A COMMUNITY THAT IS ISOLATED, FRAIL AND NEED OF ASSISTANCE IN DAILY CHORES, AND DESIRE TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES. THIS VITAL PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN VOLUNTEER AND CLIENT IS A WIN-WIN SITUATION FOR BOTH GROUPS OF SENIORS. THE VOLUNTEER OFFERS THE MOST ESSENTIAL COMPONENT OF COMPANIONSHIP BY FILLING THE GAP OF THE MOST BASIC FACTOR OF HUMAN RELATIONSHIPS.  FOR ALL THE VALUABLE SERVICE SENIOR COMPANIONS PROVIDE IT MAKES THE PROGRAM VIABLE AND CRITICAL NOW MORE THAN EVER AS WE NAVIGATE THROUGH THE IMPACT OF COVID-19.

THE STATE OF TEXAS, COUNTY OF HIDALGO-RIO GRANDE VALLEY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (RGV-SCP) PROJECT WILL BE SPONSORED BY THE HIDALGO COUNTY COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCY LOCATED IN EDINBURG, TEXAS. THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY IS AN AREA LOCATED IN THE SOUTHERNMOST TIP OF SOUTH TEXAS. IT LIES ALONG THE NORTHERN BANK OF THE RIO GRANDE RIVER, WHICH SEPARATES MEXICO FROM THE UNITED STATES. THE REGION CONSISTS OF HIDALGO, CAMERON AND WILLACY COUNTIES. IT IS ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING REGIONS IN THE UNITED STATES. COUNTY PROJECTIONS INDICATE A SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN THE SENIOR POPULATION OF WHICH 23% ARE OF LOW-INCOME. MAJOR HEALTH ISSUES FOR THE SENIORS IN THE VALLEY ARE DIABETES, OBESITY, KIDNEY DISEASE AND HEART DISEASE. THE CNCS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE RGV-SCP PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND THE OBJECTIVE ADDRESSED IS AGING IN PLACE. THE PROJECT WILL ENGAGE 75 VOLUNTEERS 55 AND OLDER, ESPECIALLY THOSE WITH LIMITED INCOMES, IN PERSON-TO-PERSON SUPPORTIVE COMPANIONSHIP SERVICE TO SENIORS IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENT LIVING.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL CUMULATIVELY SERVE APPROXIMATELY 78,300 HOURS ANNUALLY.  EACH VOLUNTEER WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF 5 HOURS AND MAXIMUM OF 40 HOURS WEEKLY AT $3.00 AN HOUR. ALL RETURNING VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE 40 HOURS OF ACCRUED LEAVE ANNUALLY. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ABLE TO USE ACCRUED LEAVE FOR PERSONAL ILLNESSES AND FAMILY ILLNESSES WHEN NEEDED. IF THE VOLUNTEERS DO NOT USE THE ACCRUED LEAVE HOURS WITHIN THE GRANT YEAR, THEY WILL RECEIVE THE ACCRUED LEAVE AMOUNT AT THE END OF THE GRANT YEAR. THE SCP VOLUNTEERS WHO USE THEIR PERSONAL VEHICLE TO TRAVEL TO CLIENT'S HOME WILL BE PAID .50 MILE AND RECEIVE SUPPLEMENTAL ACCIDENTAL, LIABILITY AND EXCESS AUTO LIABILITY INSURANCE. LEADER VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE 8 STIPEND HOURS A MONTH IN ADDITION TO THEIR WEEKLY STIPEND NOT TO EXCEED 2080 HOURS ANNUALLY. THE RGV-SCP PROJECT STAFF WILL ENSURE THE VOLUNTEERS DO NOT EXCEED THE REQUIRED STIPEND HOURS PER YEAR. 100% OF THE 75 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED MEASURES IN SENIOR COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP, COMMUNICATING CLIENT NEEDS TO PROGRAM STAFF AND FAMILIES, EXERCISING, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, AND PROVIDE INFORMATION ON GOOD HEALTH PRACTICES AND PREVENTION. BY DOING THIS, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT TO CLIENTS TO DECREASE SOCIAL ISOLATION AND INCREASE INDEPENDENT LIVING TO THE ELDERLY, THE DISABLED AND VETERANS SO THEY CAN REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND OUT OF NURSING HOMES.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE OVER 155 SENIORS (CLIENTS) IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES TO REDUCE SOCIAL ISOLATION BY PROVIDING DIRECT SERVICE A MINIMUM OF 3 TO 15 HOURS A WEEK FOR EACH INDIVIDUAL CLIENT. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN SENIOR RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $480,204 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $59,831 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM THE COUNTY OF HIDALGO, TEXAS FOR A TOTAL OF $540,035 FOR RGV-SCP PROJECT.

AN ESTIMATED 76 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE DALLAS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. ALL 76 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: COMPANIONSHIP, MEAL PREPARATION, TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE, AND RESPITE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH PRIORITY MEASURES IN RESPITE AND INDEPENDENT LIVING. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 55 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES AND 40 CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $389,157 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $148,488 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION FOUNDATION, INC. IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PLANNING, COORDINATING, AND EXECUTING PROGRAMS AUTHORIZED BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ENTITIES TO ALLEVIATE AND ATTEMPT TO ERADICATE POVERTY IN SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA.  THE MISSION OF DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY IS TO PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AMONG OUR CITIZENS, TO SECURE OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK, TO LIVE IN DECENCY, AND WITH DIGNITY.
WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDING FOR THE DELTA SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN THE AMOUNT OF $254,628 TO BE USED FOR 39 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER WORK IN CARTER, COMANCHE, GARVIN, MCCLAIN, MURRAY, AND STEPHENS COUNTIES, LOCATED IN SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA.  DELTA SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AT MINIMUM 43 ELDERLY ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, OR MENTAL HEALTH LIMITATIONS.  EVERY VOLUNTEER WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.
SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FRAIL SENIORS IDENTIFIED BY LOCAL HOME HEALTH-CARE AGENCIES, REFERRALS, AND OTHER COLLABORATIONS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CLIENTS BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, HELPING CLIENTS WITH CHORES SUCH AS LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, BUYING GROCERIES, AND FINDING TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS.  THE VOLUNTEER WILL MEET WITH EACH CLIENT 3-5 DAYS A WEEK AND SERVE 15-40 HOURS PER WEEK ASSISTING CLIENTS IN MAINTAINING AN INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLE.
SC VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE NON-PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TO ASSIST PRIMARY CAREGIVERS IN TAKING CARE OF SENIORS WHO ARE HOMEBOUND.  SPECIAL DUTIES WILL BE ASSIGNED AT PLACEMENT BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF THE CAREGIVER/CLIENT.  THE VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE RESPITE SERVICES AT A MINIMUM OF 2 TIMES PER WEEK AND MUST NOT SERVE MORE THAN 40 HOURS PER WEEK OR 8 HOURS IN ONE SINGLE DAY.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE DELTA SCP IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN PREVENTING OR DELAYING INSTITUTIONALIZATION OF ADULTS, PRIMARILY OLDER ADULTS, WITH MENTAL, EMOTIONAL, AND/OR PHYSICAL IMPAIRMENTS WHO NEED OUTSIDE ASSISTANCE TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR FULLEST POTENTIAL TO MANAGE THEIR LIVES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE CARE TO HOUSEHOLDS IN WHICH THE BURDEN OF CARE RESTS WITH HOUSEHOLD MEMBERS WHO FIND IT DIFFICULT TO PROVIDE THE LEVEL OF SUPPORT NEEDED TO PREVENT INSTITUTIONALIZATION.
THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME AT THE END OF THE GRANT WILL BE THAT AGING ADULTS AND CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE CARE AND SERVICES ALLOWING THEM TO HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $254,628 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY ANTICIPATED FUNDING OF IN-KIND DONATIONS TOTALING MORE THAN $25,463.

THE NATCHITOCHES PARISH GOVERNMENTS' OFFICE OF COMMUNITY SERVICES (OCS) IS SEEKING AN AMERICORPS SENIORS-SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $241,028.00 WITH GRANTEE MATCHING IN-KIND OF $27,016.00 TO BE USED OVER A THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD TO DEVELOP SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP). DECEMBER 15, 2020 THE AMERICORPS APPROVED ALL PROGRAMS MATCH WAIVER FOR FY21. THIS GRANT IS TO HELP ISOLATED SENIORS DEVELOP RELATIONSHIP WHICH ENCOURAGE INDEPENDENCY AND HELP IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES. 
37 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 20 HOURS PER WEEK FOR 52.2 WEEKS AN ANNUAL TOTAL OF 1,044 STIPEND HOURS.  THE GOAL IS TO KEEP THEM IN THEIR OWN HOMES.
SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
        1.	COMPANIONSHIP/SUPPORT
                 A) ACCOMPANYING CLIENT TO APPOINTMENT.
                 B) ENCOURAGING CLIENTS TO DO THEIR PHYSICAL THERAPY EXERCISE, FOLLOW DOCTOR'S ORDER, OR NURSING CARE PLAN. 
                 C)  MONITORING MEDICATION (NOT DISTRIBUTING)
                 D)  ASSIST WITH LIGHT GROOMING
        2.	NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT
                 A)  ASSISTING WITH SIMPLE MEAL PREPARATION 
                 B)  ACCOMPANYING A CLIENT TO A NUTRITION SITE
       3.	SOCIAL/RECREATION
                A)  PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TALKING, LISTENING
                B)  PROMOTING A CLIENT CONTACT WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS
                C)  ACCOMPANYING A CLIENT TO A RECREATIONAL, SOCIAL, OR EDUCATIONAL EVENT
       4.	HOME MANAGEMENT
                 A)  SHOPPING, DOING ERRANDS
                 B)  WRITING LETTERS, READING, SORTING BILLS
                 C)  LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING WITH THE CLIENT
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THIS PROJECT PERIOD, JUNE 30, 2022, THE FOLLOWING ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES WE WILL ACHIEVE:
      1.	CLIENTS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. (H9A)
       2.	CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  (H14)
THE CHALLENGES PRESENTED BY THE PANDEMIC REQUIRED SOLUTIONS THAT WERE CREATIVE, TIMELY AND FLEXIBLE.  EVEN IN THE FACE OF ADVERSITY, SCP VOLUNTEERS CONTINUE TO IMPROVE LIVES AND STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES. DURING THE COVID 19 STAY AT HOME ORDERED BY GOVERNOR EDWARDS, SCP PROGRAM STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS HAVE BEEN REACHING OUT TO CLIENTS VIA A VARIETY OF WAYS:
        1.  DAILY VOLUNTEER CHECK IN PHONE CALLS TO SEE HOW THEY ARE DOING, MAKING REFERRALS TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES THEY MAY NEED SUCH AS FOOD, SHELTER, MENTAL HEALTH OR OTHER SENIOR PROGRAMS.  PROGRAM UPDATES WERE ALSO PROVIDED.
         2.  REQUESTING A "TEMPORARY ALLOWANCE" PAYMENT TO ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS FOR SUPPORT ANY ECONOMIC HARDSHIPS DURING THE STAY SAFE AT HOME ORDER.
          3.  DEVELOP AND DISTRIBUTE VOLUNTEER SUPPORT DOCUMENTATION TO KEEP VOLUNTEERS UP TO DATE ON PROGRAM ACTIVITIES.
          4.  DISTRIBUTION OF VOLUNTEER IN-SERVICE MATERIALS FOR STAY HOME ACTIVITIES INCLUDING PHYSICAL EXERCISES TO DO AT HOME, READING AND HOMEWORK ASSIGNMENTS.
         5. RECOGNITION FOR VOLUNTEERS WAS DIFFERENT FROM PREVIOUS RECOGNITIONS, WE USUALLY HOST A CELEBRATION MEAL FOR THEM, BUT THIS YEAR WE HAD TO THINK OUTSIDE THE BOX TO LET THEM KNOW HOW VALUABLE THEY ARE AS VOLUNTEERS FOR HOMEBOUND SENIORS. - "DRIVE THROUGH RECOGNITION".

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO ASSIST THE ELDERLY AND ADULTS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN OUR COMMUNITIES LIVE MEANINGFUL, DIGNIFIED, AND INDEPENDENT LIVES IN THEIR HOMES. WE DO THIS BY DOING THINGS THAT A GOOD NEIGHBOR WOULD DO; WE VISIT WITH THEM, WE CHECK ON THEM, WE HUG THEM, WE TAKE THEM TO THE GROCERY STORE AND PHARMACY, WE TAKE THEIR TRASH OUT, WE PLAY CARD GAMES WITH THEM, AND WE SIT WITH THEM WHILE THEIR PRIMARY CAREGIVERS REST OR RUN ERRANDS. OUR PROGRAM IS VITAL TO THE SUCCESS OF THESE INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN LIVING AT HOME, WHERE THEY WANT TO SPEND THE REST OF THEIR GOLDEN YEARS. WE HAVE SUCCESSFULLY ASSISTED HUNDREDS OF INDIVIDUALS BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE SERVICES. BY USING ASSIGNMENT PLANS, TASK SHEETS, AND OUR MONTHLY REPORTING SYSTEM, WE ARE ABLE TO SUCCESSFULLY TRACK THE SERVICES WE OFFER OUR CLIENTS. ALL OF OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE TRAINED TO PROVIDE SERVICES IN THESE AREAS; HOWEVER EACH VOLUNTEER IS ONLY COUNTED 1 TIME IN EACH OUTPUT. WITH AGING IN PLACE AS OUR OBJECTIVE, WE HAVE CHOSEN TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP AS OUR SERVICE ACTIVITIES. WE HAVE ESTIMATED THAT WE CAN PLACE 30 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN OUR TRANSPORTATION CATEGORY SERVING 40 CLIENTS WITH A TARGET OUTCOME OF 30. WE HAVE PLACED 70 VOLUNTEERS IN THE COMPANIONSHIP CATEGORY TO SERVE 190 CLIENTS WITH 160 OF THEM REPORTING A 3 OR A 4 ON THE FIRST 2 QUESTIONS OF THE SURVEY THAT INDICATES PERCEIVED ISOLATION AND LONELINESS. WITH RESPITE, OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP WHILE PROVIDING RESPITE FOR A PRIMARY CAREGIVER OF A CLIENT. WE HAVE PROJECTED 30 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 30 CLIENTS IN THIS CAPACITY, WITH 22 CAREGIVERS REPORTING AN INCREASED PERCEPTION OF SOCIAL SUPPORT. OUR PROGRAM WILL STRIVE TO ACHIEVE THESE NUMBERS WHILE CONTINUING TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN OUR COMMUNITIES.

AGE WELL IS THE LARGEST OF THE FIVE AREA AGENCIES ON AGING (AAA) IN VERMONT.  THE OTHER FOUR AGENCIES ARE IN FAVOR OF US TAKING THE LEAD ON THIS STATEWIDE APPLICATION, DUE TO OUR STRONG INFRASTRUCTURE AND INCREDIBLY SUCCESSFUL VOLUNTEER PROGRAM THAT HAS NEARLY 1282 PARTICIPANTS.  WE HAVE SERVED AS A SENIOR COMPANION STATION FOR THE LAST 23 YEARS AND OUR ORGANIZATION HAS BEEN SUPPORTING OLDER VERMONTERS AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES FOR OVER 46 YEARS.  THE GEOGRAPHIC AREA THAT WE SERVE INCLUDES ADDISON, CHITTENDEN, FRANKLIN, AND GRAND ISLE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN VERMONT, REACHING NEARLY 10,000 INDIVIDUALS ANNUALLY. WE CARRY OUT PROGRAMS AUTHORIZED BY THE OLDER AMERICANS ACT - FEDERAL LEGISLATION THAT CALLS FOR LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS TO TAKE THE LEAD IN CREATING A COORDINATED SYSTEM OF SERVICES, FOR OLDER PERSONS ACROSS THE COUNTRY. 
AS THE LEADING EXPERTS AND ADVOCATES FOR THE AGING POPULATION, WE BELIEVE THAT HEALTH HAPPENS AT HOME AND FOCUS ON LIFESTYLE, HAPPINESS AND WELLNESS--NOT ON AGE. WE HAVE PROVIDED VERMONTERS WITH THE NECESSARY SUPPORT TO MANAGE THEIR DAILY LIVING NEEDS, WITH THE GOAL OF KEEPING THEM ACTIVE, HEALTHY AND INDEPENDENT. OUR WIDE ARRAY OF PROGRAMS ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND IMPROVE HEALTH OUTCOMES.  COMMITTED TO HELPING INDIVIDUALS AGE WELL, WE REDUCE BARRIERS BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO HEALTHY MEALS, IN-HOME CARE AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES. DELIVERED BY STAFF MEMBERS AND OUR INCREDIBLE VOLUNTEERS, OUR SOUGHT-AFTER SERVICES, ARE DESIGNED TO MEET THE DIVERSE NEEDS OF OUR CLIENTS, THEIR FAMILIES AND CAREGIVERS. WE DO NOT CHARGE FOR SERVICES PROVIDED. AS A NONPROFIT, WE RELY ON DONATIONS AND ENCOURAGE CLIENTS TO CONTRIBUTE IF THEY ARE ABLE TO DO SO.
AN ESTIMATED 49 AMERICORPS SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES AND ENGAGEMENT WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND IN-HOME SUPPORT, HELP WITH SHOPPING AND MEDICAL TRIPS, ASSISTANCE PAYING BILLS, READING MAIL AND HELP WITH MEALS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES- AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 418 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $318,500 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $76,121 (ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES). THE INTENDED RESULTS OF THIS SUPPORT WILL BE MORE SOCIALLY CONNECTED AND SUPPORTED OLDER VERMONTERS THAT WILL HAVE THE NECESSARY RESOURCES TO LIVE AS INDEPENDENTLY AS POSSIBLE IN THEIR OWN SETTING OF CHOICE, WHICH IS TYPICALLY IN THEIR OWN HOME.

THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, OFFICE OF HEALTHY AGING (OHA), WHICH IS THE STATE UNIT ON AGING, IS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF RHODE ISLAND'S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP).

OHA'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR MEN AND WOMEN, AGE 55 YEARS AND OLDER, INTERESTED IN VOLUNTEERING TO SUPPORT AND PRESERVE THE INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY OF ELDERS, ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES, FAMILIES AND CAREGIVERS.

AN ESTIMATED 83 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE UTILIZED AS PART OF THIS PROPOSAL. ALL SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE DOING SERVICES DIRECTLY RELATED TO ACHIEVING LISTED OUTCOMES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, FOOD DELIVERY, RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, AND PREVENTION EDUCATION REGARDING SCAMS AND ELDER ABUSE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, INDIVIDUALS BEING SERVED WILL ENJOY AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL SUPPORTS AND ENGAGEMENT, WITH THE INTENT OF REMAINING IN THEIR HOME A LONGER PERIOD OF TIME. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $431,303 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $64,956 IN STATE MATCH.

OHA IS REQUESTING 83 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY) AND FUNDING OF $431,303.

OHA'S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL IMPROVE A RECIPIENT?S QUALITY OF LIFE BY SUPPORTING THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO WOULD OTHERWISE BE ISOLATED AND WITHOUT SOCIALIZATION. IN ADDITION, THE SCP WILL PROMOTE HEALTH EDUCATION IN AN EFFORT TO ENABLE RECIPIENTS TO REMAIN IN THE COMMUNITY.   ACTIVITIES INCLUDE SUPPORT WITH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ISSUES, PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE THE IMPORTANCE OF EXERCISE FOR A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE, ENCOURAGING SOCIAL INTERACTIONS, PROVIDING RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, AND TRAINING SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS TO EDUCATE RECIPIENTS ABOUT EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS.

OHA WILL STRENGTHEN SCP VOLUNTEERISM IN RHODE ISLAND COMMUNITIES AND BUILD UPON ITS COLLABORATIONS WITH OTHER COMMUNITY AGENCIES. RHODE ISLAND?S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL OPERATE WITH THE COLLABORATION OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS AT LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS AND CASE MANAGEMENT AGENCIES THAT ARE CATCHMENT AREAS FOR SERVICING ELDERS.

OHA COLLABORATES WITH THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH IN THE AREAS OF FALLS PREVENTION AND CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT.  TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED FOR SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS ABOUT THESE TOPICS SO THAT THEY WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE IMPORTANT INFORMATION TO RECIPIENTS WHILE ENCOURAGING PARTICIPATION IN ANY RELEVANT ACTIVITIES.

THE OUTCOME WILL BE A MARKED INCREASE IN RECREATIONAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES AND GATHERED TIME WILL MEASURE ACCOMPLISHMENTS.   SCP PARTICIPATION WILL INCREASE IN ALL SOCIAL SETTINGS.   SOCIALLY ISOLATED CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE SUPPORT SERVICES TO DELAY THE ONSET OF STRESS-RELATED ILLNESSES. FAMILIES WILL HAVE A PLAN FOR CONSISTENT RESPITE CARE. THERE WILL BE AN INCREASE IN FRAIL AND ISOLATED CLIENTS WHO WILL RECEIVE SERVICES TO STRENGTHEN AND PRESERVE INDEPENDENCE AND IMPROVE HEALTH.   IN THE EVENT OF A STATE EMERGENCY, SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE PREPAREDNESS TRAINING TO SHARE WITH OTHER COMPANIONS AND RECIPIENTS.

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, RESPITE, TRANSPORTATION, AND NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES -- AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 109 OLDER CLIENTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND 16 CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $260,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $26,000 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE COMMUNITY PLACE OF GREATER ROCHESTER, INC. (CPGR) DELIVERS HIGH-QUALITY, COST EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER ROCHESTER AREA.  CPGR HAS SETTLEMENT HOUSE ROOTS THAT SPAN 100 YEARS AND HOLDS STRONG TO ITS MISSION "TO PROVIDE NEIGHBORHOOD-BASED PROGRAMS, SERVICES, AND RESOURCES WHICH STRENGTHEN THE GREATER ROCHESTER COMMUNITY, ONE PERSON, ONE FAMILY AT A TIME."

AS BABY BOOMERS AGE, THE "GRAYING OF AMERICA" IS PROGRESSING AT A PHENOMENAL RATE. IN "A PROFILE OF OLDER AMERICANS: 2019," THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES REPORTS THAT THE NATION IS PROJECTED TO AGE SIGNIFICANTLY. BY 2040 THERE WILL BE ABOUT 80.8 MILLION OLDER PERSONS, OVER TWICE THE NUMBER IN 2000. AS THE NUMBER OF ELDERLY AMERICANS CONTINUES TO INCREASE, THE NUMBER OF FRAIL ELDERS, AND THEIR NEEDS, IS ALSO EXPECTED TO GROW.   

FOR THE PURPOSES OF THIS PROJECT, CPGR IS REQUESTING 78 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY'S) TO PROVIDE OLDER ADULTS SERVICES THAT WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOMES BASED ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS AGING IN PLACE. ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE  COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES (COMFORT, SOCIALIZATION, READING, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, ETC.) AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES (GROCERY SHOPPING, ACCOMPANYING CLIENT TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, PRESCRIPTION DROP-OFF AND PICK-UP, ETC.). AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 85% OF CLIENTS RECEIVING COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES OR TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. 

CPGR IS REQUESTING A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $507,000 AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $129,106 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SPONSOR ORGANIZATION: UNIVERSITY OF MAINE CENTER ON AGING

THE MISSION OF THE CENTER ON AGING (COA) IS TO PROMOTE AND FACILITATE ACTIVITIES ON AGING IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND EVALUATION, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TO MAXIMIZE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF OLDER CITIZENS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN MAINE AND BEYOND. 

THE UMAINE CENTER ON AGING SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) WILL BE RECRUITING TO SECURE AND PLACE 12 NEW SCP VOLUNTEERS INTO SERVICE, IN ADDITION TO THE 47 EXISTING VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES, BEFORE THE PANDEMIC, INCLUDED BUT WERE NOT LIMITED TO COMPANIONSHIP, CAREGIVER RESPITE, AND OCCASIONAL TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE. DURING THE PANDEMIC, WE HAVE WORKED TO ADAPT AND MODIFY OUR STRATEGIES IN ORDER TO MAINTAIN SERVICE PROVISION. THIS INCLUDES ESTABLISHMENT OF A PEN PAL PROGRAM, TELEPHONE REASSURANCE CALLS, VIRTUAL VISITS, AND VEHICLE VISITS. ONCE RESTRICTIONS ARE LIFTED BY THE CDC AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EXPERTS, WE WILL BEGIN OFFERING A HYBRID SERVICE PROVISION MODEL TO INCLUDE CONTINUATION OF PANDEMIC ALTERNATIVE SERVICES, THE OFFERING OF TRANSPORTATION TO VACCINATION SITES FOR ELIGIBLE CLIENTS, AND THE GRADUAL RESUMPTION OF TRADITIONAL SERVICES AS PERMISSIBLE AND SAFE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE UMAINE CENTER ON AGING SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM REMAINS, "HEALTHY FUTURES -- AGING IN PLACE."

SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE HOMEBOUND SENIORS WITH SUPPORTIVE SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING STATUS IN THEIR OWN HOMES FOR AS LONG AS IN PRACTICABLE, AS WELL AS RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND SENIORS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, WE ANTICIPATE THAT 15 OF 20 CAREGIVERS (75%) AND 120 OF 170 HOMEBOUND (70%) AND ISOLATED SENIORS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED THEIR SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORTS.  

THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $318,042 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY  $14,340 SUPPORT FROM THE STATE OF MAINE, AND $30,000 LOCAL FOUNDATION SUPPORT. THE TOTAL NON-FEDERAL SUPPORT EQUALS $44,340.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
	FAMILY SERVICES OF CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS (FSCM), A 501 (C)(3) NON-PROFIT HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ORGANIZATION PROVIDING SERVICES AND SUPPORTS FOR HUNDREDS OF CHILDREN, FAMILIES, AND INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS, PROPOSES TO SERVE AN ESTIMATED 38 AMERICORPS SENIORS? SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) VOLUNTEERS ANNUALLY THROUGH THE FY2021 AMEMRICORPS SENIORS SENIOR COMPANION FUNDING OPPORTUNITY. THERE WILL BE 38 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE FSCM AMERICORPS SCP PROGRAM WILL FOCUS ON THE HEALTHY FUTURES OUTCOMES IN THE AREA OF AGING IN PLACE WITH AN ACTIVE LENS OF ADVANCING RACIAL EQUITY THROUGH OUR WORK.  OUR DIVERSE POOL OF VOLUNTEERS IS REFLECTIVE OF THE COMMUNITIES WE SERVE AND WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS THROUGH THREE WORKPLANS THAT INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, RESPITE SERVICES, AND COMPANIONSHIP WITHIN ADULT DAY HEALTH (ADH) FACILITIES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 600 SENIORS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING; AND 240 CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT, AS WELL AS 360 RECEIVING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES.  THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $245,781 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $27,347 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. 
	DURING THIS PROJECT PERIOD, ACTIVITIES WILL ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING: 1) LIVING AT HOME OFFERS SENIORS A SENSE OF COMFORT AND INDEPENDENCE, AND OFTEN COINCIDES WITH BETTER MENTAL AND PHYSICAL HEALTH. WEEKLY VISITATION FROM A SCP VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE 1-1 ASSISTANCE AND COMPANIONSHIP AND CREATE AN OPPORTUNITY FOR SENIORS TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES LONGER; 2) BEING A CAREGIVER IS DEMANDING AND CAN BE BOTH EMOTIONALLY AND PHYSICALLY STRESSFUL.  SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE WEEKLY RESPITE SUPPORT TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS, WHO OFTEN BECOME OVERWHELMED AND NEED A BREAK FROM THEIR CAREGIVER RESPONSIBILITIES; AND 3) ADH PARTICIPANTS OFTEN REQUIRE ASSISTANCE AND ACTIVITIES TO HONE THEIR COGNITIVE ABILITIES AND THAT HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR ENDURANCE AND STRENGTH.  SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ADH PARTICIPANTS WITH 1-1 COMPANIONSHIP AND ASSISTANCE AS WELL AS SUPPORT WITHIN GROUP ACTIVITIES. 
	WITH INCREASED ISOLATION AND MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES EXACERBATED BY COVID-19, AND WITH INCREASED AWARENESS OF RACIAL INEQUITIES IN OUR SOCIETY AND HOW THEY RELATE TO BARRIERS TO CARE IN OUR COMMUNITIES, THE FSCM SCP WILL FILL A CRITICAL NEED.  THE BENEFITS OF THESE THREE WORK PLANS ARE TWO-FOLD: PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORT THAT ALLOWS SENIORS TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND COMMUNITIES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE AND PROVIDING THE SCP VOLUNTEERS WITH SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT ENABLE THEM TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH INCREASED FEELINGS OF WELL-BEING, PURPOSE, AND 
ACCOMPLISHMENT.

THE EVANGELICAL LUTHERAN GOOD SAMARITAN SOCIETY HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN SOUTH DAKOTA (SCP) SINCE 1978. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF SENIOR COMPANIONS OF SOUTH DAKOTA (SD) IS HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE, PROMOTING INDEPENDENT LIVING AND PROVIDING RESPITE CARE.
  SENIOR COMPANIONS ASSIST THEIR CLIENTS WITH ACTIVITIES INCLUDING MEAL PREPARATION, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, AND TRANSPORTATION FOR GROCERY SHOPPING AND HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS. THIS SUPPORT HELPS OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. ALSO, THE WEEKLY CONTACT WITH THE SENIOR COMPANION HELPS REDUCE ISOLATION AND INCREASE SOCIALIZATION.
  COMPANIONS ALSO PROVIDE RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS, PROVIDING A BREAK FROM THE STRESSFUL 24/7 CARE OF THEIR LOVED ONE. WITH IN-HOME RESPITE SERVICES, CAREGIVERS CAN EXPERIENCE CLOSER TIES TO THEIR COMMUNITY, GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONNECT WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY, WHICH ALSO DECREASES THEIR FEELING OF ISOLATION.
  AN ESTIMATED 58 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL HAVE OUT-COME BASED ASSIGNMENTS SERVING AN ANTICIPATED 250 PLUS CLIENTS STATEWIDE, PROVIDING 60,552 HOURS OF ASSISTANCE. WE HAVE ALSO ADDED EXPENSES IN EXCESS OF $39,170 FOR 10 NON-STIPENDED VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE.

AN ESTIMATED 38 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE SERVICE AREA OF UTAH & WASATCH COUNTIES WHICH ARE LOCATED IN THE NORTH-CENTRAL PART OF THE STATE OF UTAH. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES, WITH THE UTILIZATION OF OUR 38 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS, AND COLLABORATION FROM OUR 5-6 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, IS TO BE A DETERRENT IN DECLINING PHYSICAL, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL HEALTH, AND HELP INDIVIDUALS REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY RELIEF FROM THE STRESSES OF CARE GIVING BY PROVIDING SHORT TERM ASSISTANCE, TO AN ADULT WHO IS THE PRIMARY CAREGIVER, FOR A PERSON WITH CHRONIC DISABILITIES, ALZHEIMER'S, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, ETC., AND PREVENT PREMATURE PLACEMENT IN LONG TERM CARE FACILITIES. SPARK THE CHANGE COLORADO (SPARK), FORMERLY KNOWN AS METRO VOLUNTEERS, WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 74 AMERICORPS SENIORS SENIOR COMPANIONS (SC) VOLUNTEERS ENROLLED IN ITS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP). OF THIS NUMBER 74 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. COMPANIONSHIP IS THE OVERRIDING ACTIVITY AND IS OFFERED WHEN ASSISTING WITH DAILY ACTIVITIES, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION SERVICES, AND ENGAGEMENT WITH COMMUNITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, APPROXIMATELY 400 OLDER ADULTS SERVED BY SC VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING (A SURVEY RESPONSE RATE OF 80% OF 500 CLIENTS). THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $479,483 AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY  $53,962 BY SPARK THROUGH NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
SPARK'S SCP SERVES IN 5 COUNTIES: ADAMS, ARAPAHOE, DENVER, JEFFERSON, AND DOUGLAS COUNTIES. CITIES SERVED REPRESENT A MIX OF URBAN AND SUBURBAN NEIGHBORHOODS IN DENVER, AURORA, WHEAT RIDGE, WESTMINSTER, THORNTON, LAKEWOOD, LITTLETON, ENGLEWOOD, CONIFER, MORRISON, AND CASTLE ROCK. INDIVIDUALS SERVED AND SCP VOLUNTEERS ARE LOW-INCOME AND WILL BENEFIT FROM THE COMPANIONSHIP ACTIVITIES. SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS BENEFIT BY REMAINING ACTIVE, MEETING A SOCIAL OR DAILY NEED, AND FEELING VALUED. IN THIS WAY, SCP MEETS THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR THEIR CLIENTS.

PIMA COUNCIL ON AGING (PCOA) REQUESTS 37 VSYS (38,628 HOURS) PER YEAR FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) SERVING PIMA COUNTY, ARIZONA. WE REQUEST $238,264 IN FEDERAL FUNDS, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $28,500 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS SERVICE CATEGORIES.

AS A REPLACEMENT GRANTEE, PIMA COUNCIL ON AGING PROPOSES TO HONOR THE FUNDAMENTAL PROGRAM MODEL THAT HAS ASSISTED SO MANY OLDER PEOPLE IN OUR COMMUNITY SINCE 2001, WHILE INCORPORATING ELEMENTS TO MAXIMIZE LIMITED RESOURCES AND FOCUS ON THE GREATEST NEEDS OF PIMA COUNTY'S OLDER ADULTS. THROUGH SCP, WE WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND IN-HOME ASSISTANCE WITH DAILY LIVING TO HELP HOME-BOUND OLDER ADULTS MAINTAIN THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE POSSIBLE WHILE LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES. RESPITE SERVICES PROVIDED BY SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL HELP CAREGIVERS TAKE PERSONAL TIME TO ATTEND TO THEIR OWN NEEDS AND AVOID BURNOUT. RESEARCH SHOWS THAT RESPITE CARE REDUCES ABUSE AND NEGLECT AND IMPROVES OVERALL QUALITY OF CARE, AND EXTENDS THE TIME OLDER ADULTS CAN LIVE IN THEIR HOME OF CHOICE. 

BASED ON LONGSTANDING RESULTS FROM THE SCP IN PIMA COUNTY, WE ANTICIPATE THE FOLLOWING PROJECT OUTCOMES:	
OUTCOME 1: 80% OF OLDER ADULTS WE SERVE WILL REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY, OUT OF INSTITUTIONALIZED CARE; AND OUTCOME 2: 80% OF CAREGIVERS WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE IN-HOME CARE FOR OUR OLDER CLIENTS AS A RESULT OF RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES.

AN ESTIMATED 18 AMERICORPS SENIORS SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, 18 AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION, NUTRITION, HEALTH AND EXERCISE EDUCATION, DISASTER PREPAREDNESS, RESPITE FOR PRIMARY CAREGIVERS, AND COMPANIONSHIP. TRAINED SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE REGULAR ASSISTANCE, ENCOURAGEMENT, AND SUPPORT TO OTHER SENIORS IDENTIFIED BY NONPROFIT AND PROPRIETARY HEALTH CARE ORGANIZATIONS IN OUR AREA. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES: AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AS A RESULT OF SC SERVICE, CLIENTS EXPERIENCING DIFFICULTY ACCOMPLISHING PERSONAL TASKS, SUCH AS WALKING, USING TELEPHONE, PREPARING A MEAL, SHOPPING, FILLING OUT FORMS, WRITING LETTERS, ETC. WILL EXPERIENCE INCREASED ABILITY TO ACCOMPLISH PERSONAL TASKS. CLIENTS WHO OTHERWISE EXPERIENCE RAPID DECLINE WILL BE ABLE TO MAINTAIN IF NOT IMPROVE FUNCTION FOR EVERYDAY LIFE ACTIVITIES. CLIENTS WHO CANNOT IMPROVE PHYSICALLY, DUE TO THEIR SPECIFIC ILLNESS OR DISABILITY, INCLUDING ALZHEIMER'S AND/OR DEMENTIA, CAN EXPERIENCE IMPROVED COGNITIVE ABILITIES, REDUCED ANXIETY AND IMPROVED GENERAL SENSE OF WELL-BEING.   CAREGIVERS, IF INVOLVED, WILL FEEL RELIEF FROM STRESS AS A RESULT OF RESPITE PROVIDED BY THE SC. AS A RESULT OF FRIENDSHIP, SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE PROVIDED BY SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS, TRANSITIONAL FACILITY-BASED RESIDENTS WILL: 1) FEEL LESS ISOLATED AND HAPPIER DURING THEIR FACILITY STAY; 2) IMPROVE DESIRE TO PERFORM PERSONAL TASKS, INCLUDING ENCOURAGEMENT TO PARTICIPATE IN REQUIRED PHYSICAL/OCCUPATIONAL THERAPY, FEELING MORE PREPARED TO RETURN HOME; AND 3) RETURN TO INDEPENDENT LIVING WITH INCREASED KNOWLEDGE OF COMMUNITY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES TO HELP MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENT STATUS. SCS ALSO REMAIN ACTIVE AND SOCIALLY CONNECTED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES & REPORT IMPROVED HEALTH AS A RESULT OF THEIR SERVICE.

BLUE GRASS COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP (BGCAP) IS THE LEGAL APPLICANT.  BGCAP HAS DEDICATED RESOURCES TO ENABLE LOW-INCOME, DISADVANTAGED AND DISABLED FAMILIES AND INDIVIDUALS OF ALL AGES AND ETHNIC BACKGROUNDS TO ATTAIN SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND MOTIVATION TO BECOME FULLY SELF-SUFFICIENT. 
ON MARCH 13, 2020, KENTUCKY GOVERNOR, ANDY BESHEAR, SUSPENDED ALL SENIOR SERVICES DUE TO THE CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) PANDEMIC. BECAUSE OF THESE SUSPENSIONS, VOLUNTEER AND CLIENT NUMBERS HAVE DECREASED. MANY VOLUNTEERS AND CLIENTS ALIKE ARE CONCERNED WITH RETURNING TO ASSIGNMENTS WITH THE EFFECTS THE VIRUS HAS ON THE AGING POPULATION. AN ESTIMATED 56 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 54 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: SOCIAL INTERACTION, RESPITE, MEAL PREPARATION, MEDICATION REMINDER, PERSONAL CARE, AND LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING. CONSIDERING THE CORONAVIRUS (COVID-19) PANDEMIC, VOLUNTEERS AND CLIENTS ALIKE ARE TAKING PRECAUTIONS WHEN RETURNING TO ASSIGNMENTS. THESE PRECAUTIONS INCLUDE MASK WEARING, HAND WASHING AND SANITIZING, AND ASKING COVID-19 SCREENING QUESTIONS WHEN ENTERING THE HOME TO ENSURE ONE IS NOT EXHIBITING SYMPTOMS. ADDITIONALLY, VOLUNTEERS WERE PROVIDED A STOP SIGN TO PLACE ON THE DOOR OF THEIR CLIENT'S HOME TO PREVENT PEOPLE FROM ENTERING WHEN SITTING WITH THEIR ASSIGNMENTS.
 THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. ELDERSERVE IS LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY'S LARGEST NON-PROFIT DEDICATED TO ELDER SERVICES.  OUR OLDER ADULT POPULATION IN LOUISVILLE CONTINUES TO GROW EXPONENTIALLY.  AT ELDERSERVE, WE BELIEVE IN THE POWER OF COLLABORATION TO SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS AS THEY AGE IN PLACE BY FOCUSING ON OVERCOMING SOCIAL ISOLATION, SUPPORTING INDEPENDENCE, PROMOTING WELLNESS, AND PROTECTING THEM.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS A STALWART OF ELDERSERVE'S OUTREACH TO OUR AGING COMMUNITY. THE CITY OF CHICAGO, DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND SUPPORT SERVICES (DFSS) WORKS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO CONNECT CHICAGO RESIDENTS AND FAMILIES TO RESOURCES THAT BUILD STABILITY, SUPPORT THEIR WELL-BEING, AND EMPOWER THEM TO THRIVE. DFSS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING DIVISIONS: CHILDREN SERVICES, YOUTH SERVICES, HUMAN SERVICES, HOMELESS SERVICES, SENIOR SERVICES (AREA AGENCY ON AGING), DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, AND WORKFORCE SERVICES. THE CENTRAL PURPOSE OF DFSS IS TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE, CLIENT-ORIENTED HUMAN SERVICE DELIVERY SYSTEM EMPLOYING A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OUR MOST VULNERABLE RESIDENTS, AND TO ADMINISTER RESOURCES AND PROVIDE DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO A NETWORK OF OVER 300 COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROMOTE THE INDEPENDENCE AND WELL-BEING OF INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES. 

IN FY 2021, THE SCP WILL MAINTAIN ITS CURRENT NUMBER OF FEDERAL VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS OF 57 AND THE NUMBER OF NON-FEDERAL VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS AT 21. THE DOLLAR AMOUNT REQUESTED FROM CNCS FOR FY 2021 IS $324,134. UNDER THIS PROPOSED GRANT APPLICATION, OUR PROJECT WILL ADDRESS INDEPENDENT LIVING AND HEALTHY FUTURES. THE PROPOSED GRANT APPLICATION WILL ADDRESS INDEPENDENT LIVING BY EMPOWERING SENIORS TO CONTINUE TO LIVE IN THEIR OWN HOMES AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF SENIOR COMPANIONS AND HEALTHY FUTURES BY PROVIDING SENIORS ACCESS TO INFORMATION REGARDING FOOD PANTRIES, FOOD MOBILES, FARMERS MARKETS, HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND CONGREGATE DINING, AND HEALTH AND NUTRITION CLASSES TO HELP PROMOTE HEALTHY EATING AND LIVING. THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, WE WILL CONTINUE TO ACTIVELY ENGAGE IN INCREASING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE HEALTHY FUTURES IN THESE CHICAGO COMMUNITIES.

AN ESTIMATE 92 AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER,ALL AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO THE ALZHEIMER'S PATIENTS, ASSISTING PATIENTS WITH PERSONAL CARE (HYGIENE), HELPING PATIENTS TO EAT NUTRITIONAL FOODS, MONITORING THE PATIENT'S PRESCRIBED MEDICATION, ENGAGING THE PATIENTS IN RECREATIONAL AND EXERCISING ACTIVITIES, HELPING WITH LIGHT CHORES AND PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP INCLUDING TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, AMONG OTHERS.IT IS IMPORTANT TO MENTION THAT BECAUSE OF THE COVID-19 CRISIS, WE MODIFIED AND DECREASED THE SERVICE OF COMPANIONSHIP OF VOLUNTEERS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS WITH THE PATIENTS.
THE COMPANIONSHIP SERVICE WAS INTERRUPTED SINCE MARCH 16, 2020 BY THE GLOBAL PUBLIC HEALTH CRISIS CAUSED BY COVID-19, IT BEGAN ADAPTING WITH NEW CONTAGION PREVENTION PROTOCOLS TO RESUME THE ACCOMPANIMENT SERVICES OF THE VOLUNTEERS IN THE HOMES OF THE ELDERLY WITH ALZHEIMER'S DIAGNOSIS.THIS HAS GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONTINUE GIVING SERVICES TO THE PATIENTS, ALTHOUGH IN FEWER HOMES, UNINTERRUPTEDLY, SINCE JULY,2020.AT THE MOMENT ALL THE SERVICE STATIONS HAVE THEIR VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP SERVICE.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS VOLUNTEERS PROVIDES COMPANIONSHIP TO THE ALZHEIMER'S PATIENTS.IT IS IMPORTANT TO CLARIFY THAT THE PROGRAM PROVIDES MONTHLY TRAINING TO ALL AMERICORPS SENIORS VOLUNTEERS AND CAREGIVERS  TO HELP AND IMPROVE THEIR SERVICES AND CARE WITH ALZHEIMER'S PATIENTS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, IT IS EXPECTED TO HAVE BEEN SATISFIED THE NEEDS AND BETTER THE LIFE OF CAREGIVERS AND THE PATIENTS. THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $438,028 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 10% NONFEDERAL.

PROGRAM SUMMARY. THE SOUTHEAST PUERTO RICO SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SEPRSCP) OF PROPOSES TO ADVANCE JUSTICE AND EQUALITY UNDER THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA. THE SEPRSCP WILL ADDRESS HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVES AND ACTIVITIES IN FOUR GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREAS, THE PUERTO RICO MUNICIPALITIES OF HUMACAO, YABUCOA,  NAGUABO, AND CEIBA.  HAI IS CURRENTLY A GRANTEE OF AMERICORPS RSVP IN HUMACAO AND YABUCOA.
THE SEPRSCP ADDRESSES THE AMERICORPS SENIORS AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE OF INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. SEPRSCP ALSO ADDRESSES THE SPECIFIC SCP PERFORMANCE MEASURES OF THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA: AGING IN PLACE/ACCESS TO CARE AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITY: RECOVERY FROM COVID-19. OUR WORK PLANS INCLUDE 40 UNDUPLICATED AND REFLECT COST-EFFECTIVE PROGRAM PRACTICES. THE SEPRSCP WILL ENGAGE FORTY ADULTS AGE 55 AND OVER AS SCP VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORT TO OTHER ADULTS WHO NEED EXTRA ASSISTANCE TO ACCESS PRIMARY AND PREVENTIVE HEALTH CARE AND TO REMAIN AT HOME OR IN THE COMMUNITY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. OF THIS NUMBER, 40 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AN AVERAGE OF 20 HOURS PER WEEK. THE SEPRSCP SEEKS TO ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE CHANGE IN THE SERVICE AREAS BY WORKING TO REMOVE STRUCTURAL RACIAL INEQUITIES, ADVANCE RACIAL EQUALITY, AND INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR AGING IN PLACE AND ACCESS TO HEALTH CARE. SEPRSCP WILL COLLABORATE WITH TWO RELATED PROGRAMS CURRENTLY OPERATED BY THE GRANTEE, THE AMERICORPS RSVP AND THE HHS SENIOR MEDICARE PATROL, AIMED AT PROTECTING SENIORS FROM HEALTH CARE FRAUD AND ABUSE. WE WILL ALSO COLLABORATE OTHER AMERICORPS PROGRAMS IN PUERTO RICO; WITH RELATED FEDERAL, STATE, AND COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS; AND WITH THE OFFICE OF THE PUERTO RICO OMBUDSMAN FOR THE ELDERLY. THE APPLICANT IS MAKING AVAILABLE THE PERSONNEL AND FACILITIES OF OUR SAN JUAN OFFICE TO HELP ASSURE THE SUCCESS OF THE SCP. WE ARE ALSO CONFIDENT THAT THE PARTICIPATING MUNICIPALITIES WILL MAKE AVAILABLE PERSONNEL, FACILITIES, AND OTHER RESOURCES TO SUPPOR THE SCP. NONETHELESS, IN VIEW OF THE CONSTRAINTS PLACED BY THE PANDEMIC ON SECURING AND DOCUMENTING IN-KIND COMMITMENTS, THE APPLICANT IS ADHERING TO THE AMERICORPS WAIVER OF IN-KIND FOR PROJECT YEAR 2021 AND WILL MAKE AVAILABLE THE REQUIRED IN-KIND MATCH IN PROJECT YEAR 2.

THE CENTRAL REGION BOARD ON ELDERLY AFFAIRS INC.(  JUNTA CENTRAL PARA ASUNTOS DE LA VEJEZ INC. AS IN SPANISH), IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION  ESTABLISHED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO SINCE AUGUST 1992. 
THE CENTRAL REGION BOARD HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER PROGRAM IN CAGUAS AREA FOR THE PAST  TWENTY EIGHT YEARS (28). IT HAS ALSO PROVIDE A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES TO MEET THE ELDERLY POPULATION NEEDS.
OUR MISSION THIS THREE YEAR GRANT IS TO GIVE PEOPLES AGE 55 YEARS AND OVER THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONTINUE TO BE VALUABLE AND PRODUCTIVE MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. 
DURING THIS GRANT 45 SC VOLUNTEERS, DISTRIBUTED IN FOUR VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WILL PROVIDE PERSON TO PERSON SERVICES TO 80 OLDER ADULTS AND INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES ALLOWING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AS LONG AS POSSIBLE AND IMPROVED THE QUALITY OF THEIR CURRENT LIFE. 
THE VOLUNTEERS ALSO WILL PROVIDE A TIME OF TEMPORARY RELIEF TO CAREGIVERS, ALLOWING THEM TO HANDLE THEIR OWN NEEDS KNOWING THAT THEIR FAMILY IS IN GOOD HANDS. THIS WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF BOTH THE CAREGIVER AND THE CARE RECIPIENT.
EACH VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE AT LEAST 20 HOURS A WEEK OF SERVICE. SOME OF THE SCV ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES SUCH AS PREPARING MEALS, PERSONAL CARE, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING AND ACCOMPANY TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. 
OUR GOAL AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT IS THAT OLDER ADULTS RECEIVING OUR SERVICES HAVE IMPROVED THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES, INCREASE AND PERCEIVE THEIR SOCIAL TIES AND HAVE BEEN ABLE TO LIVE AN INDEPENDENT LIFE AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.
MORE THAN 500 EARTHQUAKES HAVE SHAKEN PUERTO RICO SINCE DECEMBER 28, 2019. PUERTO RICO DECLARED A STATE OF EMERGENCY FOLLOWING THESE EVENTS. THE REGION HAS NOT STOPPED SHAKING SINCE A LARGER 6.4 MAGNITUDE EARTHQUAKE ON JANUARY 7, 2020. TO THIS IS ADDED THE ARRIVAL OF COVID-19 PANDEMIC IN MARCH 2020. 
PROBLEMS LIKE GOING TO THE SUPERMARKET, WHICH REPRESENTS A PLACE OF CONTAGION, ACCESS TO MEDICINES, GOING TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, MAINTAINING HYGIENE MEASURES AND CLEANING AT HOME, AMONG OTHERS, ARE AGGRAVATED FOR THESE ADULTS WHO MOSTLY DO NOT COUNT WITH RELATIVES OR CAREGIVERS AVAILABLE TO GIVE THEN SUPPORT.
THERE IS AN ATMOSPHERE OF UNCERTAINTY THROUGHOUT THE ISLAND AND ANXIETY AMONG THE ELDERLY POPULATION HAS TRIGGERED.
TODAY MORE THAN EVER THESE GRANT WILL HELP OUR ELDERLY POPULATION AS WELL AS THEIR CAREGIVERS TO MAINTAIN THEIR MENTAL HEALTH AND WELL BEING AND TO RECOVER FROM THE PANDEMIC.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $232,940 WILL BE SUPPLEMENT BY $35.941.00 OF NON FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF ALLEGHENY COUNTY WILL PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE IN-HOME SERVICES TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS TO ALLOW THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  THIS ALIGNS WITH THE OVERALL MISSION AND VISION OF THE ALLEGHENY COUNTY AREA AGENCY ON AGING, WHICH IS TO HELP ALLEGHENY COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO ARE 60 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER LIVE INDEPENDENT LIVES.

TO PROTECT THE HEALTH AND SAFETY OF BOTH VOLUNTEERS AND PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS, THE PROGRAM WILL CONTINUE TO CLOSELY MONITOR THE COVID-19 SITUATION IN ALLEGHENY COUNTY.  IF CONDITIONS ARE SUCH THAT IN-PERSON VISITS ARE NOT ADVISABLE, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL CONDUCT TELEPHONE RE-ASSURANCE CALLS AND/OR VIRTUAL CHATS WITH ASSIGNED PARTICIPANTS.

THE TOTAL NUMBER OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS (VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS) FOR THIS PROJECT IS 90.  OF THESE, 83 WILL BE PLACED IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES/INDEPENDENT LIVING FOCUS AREA.  APPROXIMATELY 25% OF PARTICIPANTS BEING SERVED IN THE INDEPENDENT LIVING CATEGORY WILL ALSO HAVE A FAMILY CAREGIVER WHO WILL BENEFIT IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES/RESPITE FOCUS AREA.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THESE SERVICES IS THAT 85% OF PARTICIPANTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT FROM HAVING A SENIOR COMPANION.
