,,THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY TELESPOND SERVING SENIORS OF LACKAWANNA COUNTY SINCE 1974 AND CURRENTLY RECRUITS VOLUNTEERS FROM LACKAWANNA COUNTY, PA. THE AGENCY HAS THREE MAIN GOALS: TO HELP PEOPLE IMPROVE THEIR LIFE PROSPECTS, TO HAVE FAMILY FUNCTION ADAPTIVELY, AND TO HELP CLIENTS REDUCE RISK TO ACHIEVING AND MAINTAINING SELF-SUFFICIENCY. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF LACKAWANNA COUNTY , PA IS REQUESTING $383,201 OF FEDERAL SUPPORT TO MANAGE 94 VOLUNTEERS AT FOURTEEN VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING  AND RESPITE CARE. TELESPOND SENIOR SERVICES CONTRIBUTES $197,848 OF NON- FEDERAL SUPPORT.   94 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CLIENTS WITH AGING IN PLACE BY ASSISTING WITH TRANSPORTATION, FOOD ASSISTANCE AND OTHER SERVICES. THESE CLIENTS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE ON ONE ASSISTANCE TO CLIENTS HELPING THEM WITH SOCIALIZATION, ADVOCACY, RECREATION, NON MEDICAL ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING FOR A MINIMUM OF 5 HOURS/WEEK. THESE SERVICES WILL ASSIST THE CLIENT IN REMAINING INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOME AND PROVIDE CAREGIVERS WITH NEEDED REST AND RESPITE. ADDITIONAL, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS WITH RESPITE SERVICES FOR A MINIMUM OF 5 HOURS/WEEKS. THE CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, AS A RESULT OF HAVING A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER IN THEIR HOME.
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, 465 CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE SERVICES TO HELP THEM REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOME. CLIENTS WILL SHOW AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES WITH REPORTING INCREASE SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.,

AN ESTIMATED 75 AMERICORPS SENIORS WILL SERVE AS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) VOLUNTEERS THROUGH PHILADELPHIA CORPORATION FOR AGING (PCA).  OF THIS NUMBER 75 AMERICORPS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS TO ALLOW OLDER ADULTS TO SAFELY AND INDEPENDENTLY AGE IN PLACE. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES OF SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL INCLUDE SOCIALIZING, PROVIDING RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, ESCORTING CONSUMERS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND ON ERRANDS, ASSISTING WITH TASKS OF DAILY LIVING SUCH AS LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, REMINDERS TO TAKE MEDICATION AND ASSISTANCE WITH MINOR HOUSEHOLD MANAGEMENT. THE AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP WILL UTILIZE THE HEALTHY FUTURES SERVICE CATEGORY. PERFORMANCE MEASURES WILL EXAMINE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SENIOR COMPANIONS IN ASSISTING CONSUMERS IN MAINTAINING INDEPENDENT LIVING, PROVIDING RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, AND INCREASING LEVELS OF PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AMONG CONSUMERS AND CAREGIVERS. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE AMERICORPS ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 334,935 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $100,534 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS.  PCA HAS SUCCESSFULLY MANAGED SEVERAL LARGE FEDERAL GRANTS, AS WELL AS NUMEROUS STATE AND PRIVATE FOUNDATION GRANTS. WITH 31 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE IN MANAGING SCP, PCA IS FAMILIAR WITH THE PROGRAM'S FINANCIAL REQUIREMENTS AND CONSISTENT IN ITS ABILITY TO ACHIEVE DEFINED GOALS.

BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT'S MISSION IS TO ADVOCATE, LEAD, AND PROVIDE SERVICES OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF THE RESIDENTS OF BALTIMORE CITY. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) OPERATES UNDER BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT'S DIVISION OF AGING AND CARE SERVICES UNDER THE FEDERAL GUIDELINES OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES AMERICORPS SENIORS PROGRAM. 
BALTIMORE CITY SCP PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY FOR 50 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO HOME-BOUND SENIORS. THE CLIENTS SERVED UNDER THE PROGRAM ARE IDENTIFIED AS OR MAY BE FRAIL, HAVE PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE, FUNCTIONAL, OR INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES. THE PROGRAM ENCOURAGES INDEPENDENCE AND FOSTERS MAINSTREAM INVOLVEMENT AND SOCIAL INTERACTION BETWEEN THE SENIOR COMPANION AND THE CLIENT.
THE SCP OFFERS VOLUNTEERS AGES 55 AND OLDER, AN OPPORTUNITY TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELIGIBLE PERSONS AND RECEIVES A BI-WEEKLY STIPEND. AN ESTIMATED 50 BALTIMORE CITY SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CLIENTS WITH IN-HOME ASSISTANCE SUCH AS MEAL PREPARATION, ESCORT TO THE DOCTORS, SOCIALIZATION, AND RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS.
 DURING THE CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AS ISOLATION PREVENTERS BY PROVIDING PHONE COMPANIONSHIP AND RESOURCE REFERRAL AGENTS THAT WILL CALL ON BEHAVE OF CLIENTS IN NEED OF SUPPORT RESOURCES. AFTER THE PANDEMIC IS OVER AND THE STATE AND LOCAL GOVERNMENT RE-OPENING NOTIFICATION IS RELEASED, VOLUNTEERS WILL RETURN TO COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES OFFERING IN-HOME OR RESPITE CARE AND SOCIALIZATION CARE IN ADULT DAY CENTERS.
 THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVE (1) STATES:  OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, FOCUSING ON INDEPENDENT LIVING, RESPITE CARE AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES THROUGH ADULT DAY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS TO PROVIDE COMPANION SERVICES TO 150 CLIENTS. 60 CLIENTS WILL BE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AND 10 WILL BE CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES, AND THE REMAINING 80 CLIENTS WILL BE IN AN ADULT MEDICAL DAY SETTING WITH ASSISTANCE FROM A SENIOR COMPANION. THE CNCS GRANT WILL PROVIDE $318,301 AND, $66,341 IN LOCAL FUNDING MATCH. CNCS PROVIDED 49 VSY HOWEVER THE BUDGET WAS CALACULATED FOR 50 VSYS TO TOTAL THE FEDERAL FUNDING OF $318,301.

THE ASIAN AMERICAN CENTER OF FREDERICK (AACF), MARYLAND IS APPLYING FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROJECT AS A SINGLE STATION.   AN ESTIMATED 40 AMERICORPS SENIORS SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 40 AMERICORPS SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, NUTRITION SERVICES, RESPITE SERVICES, MEDICAL SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION, AND EDUCATION / TRAINING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THERE WILL BE AN ESTIMATE OF 380 BENEFICIARIES WITH IMPROVEMENT OF SOCIAL SUPPORT OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, FOOD SECURITY, AND INDEPENDENT LIVING CAPACITY.  THE AMERICORPS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $260,000 FEDERAL WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $31,909 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.  AACF'S VISION IS EQUITY AND SHARES A SIMILAR MISSION OF AMERICORPS TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES, AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING.  AS WE ARE GOING THROUGH UNPRECEDENTED CHALLENGES FACING OUR COUNTRY, WE WOULD FOCUS ON OUR ROAD TO RECOVERY BY CREATING A SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) FOR ELDERLY RECIPIENTS.  OUR WORK PLANS SUPPORT A THEORY OF CHANGE BASED ON THE NEED TO REMOVE STRUCTURAL RACIAL INEQUITIES, REDUCE HEALTH DISPARITIES, ADVANCE RACIAL EQUALITY, AND INCREASE CAPACITY IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE SUSTAINABLE CHANGE FOR AGING IN PLACE IN FREDERICK COUNTY.  THE NEEDS FOR CHANGE ARE SUPPORTED BY LOCAL DATA AND THE CHOICES OF PROGRAM ACTIVITIES ARE GUIDED BY EVIDENCE-BASED INTERVENTIONS LEADING TO INTENDED OUTCOMES. IN OUR PROGRAM DESIGN, WE BELIEVE IT IS ABSOLUTELY CRITICAL TO LAY A GOOD FOUNDATION FOR TRAINING SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WHO SERVE DIVERSE POPULATIONS. WE ARE CONCERNED ABOUT ALL OLDER POPULATIONS BEING UNDERSERVED, PARTICULARLY IMMIGRANT SENIORS WHO LACK OF CAPACITIES THEMSELVES AND FACE ALL KINDS OF BARRIERS.  BECAUSE OF COVID, WE WILL ADDRESS HOW TO SAFELY DELIVER FOOD, MEDICINE, PPE, AND MATERIALS TO NEEDY SENIORS TO HELP THEM OVERCOME FEAR AND ISOLATION, WHILE CONTINUING TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND SAFELY. IT IS OUR INTENT TO RECRUIT SOME BILINGUAL AND BICULTURAL SENIOR VOLUNTEERS AS A STRATEGIC INTERVENTION. THESE SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL GAIN SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE TO SUSTAIN A MORE EQUITABLE SERVICE ON HOW TO NAVIGATE SENIOR HEALTH, HUMAN SERVICES AND HOUSING FOR SOME OF THEIR OWN MEMBERS IN FREDERICK COUNTY. THE ROI (RETURN ON INVESTMENT) FOR FEDERAL FUNDS IS SOUND AND COST EFFECTIVE WITH DESIRABLE OUTCOMES.

THE SOUTH PLAINS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PRESENTLY USES 41 FEDERALLY FUNDED VSY'S AND 2 STATE FUNDED VSY TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE 7 COUNTY RURAL AREAS. THE HOURS ASSIGNED TO THE CLIENT VARY DEPENDING ON THE CLIENT NEED AND AVAILABILITY OF COMPANIONS IN THAT PARTICULAR COMMUNITY. 60 CAREGIVERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM.

HUMAN BEINGS ARE SOCIAL CREATURES. OUR CONNECTION TO OTHERS ENABLES US TO SURVIVE AND THRIVE. YET, AS WE AGE, MANY OF US ARE ALONE MORE OFTEN THAN WHEN WE WERE YOUNGER, LEAVING US VULNERABLE TO SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS, AND RELATED HEALTH PROBLEMS. STUDIES INDICATE THAT SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS AFFECT APPROXIMATELY ONE-THIRD TO ONE-HALF OF THE ELDERLY POPULATION AND HAVE A NEGATIVE IMPACT ON PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH.  IN AN EFFORT TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE AND EXTEND INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR ADULTS AGED 60 YEARS AND OLDER, THE ALAMO AREA COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (AACOG) BEXAR AREA AGENCY ON AGING (BEXAR AAA) IS APPLYING FOR THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE SENIOR COMPANION GRANT PROGRAM.  BY RECRUITING AND ENGAGING SENIOR COMPANIONS, THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING (AAA) WILL FOCUS ON PROVIDING ASSISTANCE AND COMPANIONSHIP TO ISOLATED AND HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS LIVING IN BEXAR COUNTY, AND POSITIVELY IMPACT AND REDUCE SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS.  

ACCORDING TO THE PEW RESEARCH CENTER, 12 MILLION, OR 11% OF PEOPLE AGED 65 AND OLDER, LIVED ALONE AT THE TIME OF THE RECENT CENSUS. IN BEXAR COUNTY, OF THOSE 65 YEARS AND OLDER, 51,935 OR 8.3%% OF THE POPULATION LIVE ALONE.  AS PEOPLE GET OLDER, THEIR LIKELIHOOD OF LIVING ALONE ONLY INCREASES. FEELINGS OF LONELINESS CAN NEGATIVELY AFFECT BOTH PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH, AND PERCEIVED LONELINESS CONTRIBUTES TO COGNITIVE DECLINE AND RISK OF DEMENTIA. AS PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH DECLINES, THE INDIVIDUAL IS LIKELY TO BECOME UNABLE TO LEAVE THE HOME TO SEEK SOCIALIZATION.

WHEN LOOKING AT NEEDS WITHIN THE AGING COMMUNITY, A LACK OF AVAILABLE RESOURCES AND SERVICES FOR ANY TYPE OF IN-HOME CARE HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED.  DUE TO A LACK OF FINANCIAL RESOURCES AND THE INABILITY OF FAMILY MEMBERS TO CARE FOR THEIR LOVED ONES, THE RISK OF ISOLATION INCREASES FOR MANY HOME-BOUND OLDER ADULTS.

SOME OF THE VOLUNTEERS' ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO EASE LONELINESS AND SOCIAL ISOLATION, ASSISTING WITH TRANSPORTATION AND MOBILITY OPTIONS, AND PERFORMING LIGHT CHORES. CONCILIO CAMPESINO DEL SUDOESTE INC. (CONCILIO CDS INC.) IS A 501(C)3 PRIVATE COMMUNITY-BASED NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972 IN SOUTHERN NM.  ORGANIZATION HAS A SERVICE HISTORY IN ADDRESSING NEEDS IN SENIOR ISSUES, HEALTH ISSUES, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND SOCIAL SERVICES.  WE SERVE STATE-WIDE IN NM AND ITS SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.  THE COMMUNITIES BEING SERVED BY ORGANIZATION INCLUDE AREAS THAT ARE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED AS A MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS.  THE POPULATION THAT WE SERVE INCLUDES, BUT NOT LIMITED: SENIORS, YOUTH, FAMILIES, MIGRANT/SEASONAL FARM WORKERS & THEIR FAMILIES, IMMIGRANTS, AND A LARGE PERCENT OF PEOPLE WHO ARE MONOLINGUAL SPANISH OR BILINGUAL.  ORGANIZATION ADDRESSES HEALTH DISPARITIES, ECONOMIC CRISIS, POVERTY, EDUCATION, HUNGER, AND OTHER AREAS THROUGH COMMUNITY VOLUNTARISM. OUR MISSION: TO ELIMINATE POVERTY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF MULTI-GENERATIONAL CIVIC ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SERVE OUR COMMUNITY WITH PASSION AND COMMITMENT.

THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS REQUESTING FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR FIFTEEN (15) VSY'S FOR THE AMOUNT OF $97,691.00. SUPPLEMENTAL ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED FROM THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO, AGING & LONG TERM SERVICES  BUREAU OF $21,676.0.00 AND TRIBAL GENERAL FUND OF $11,000.00. 

     THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANIONS CONTINUES TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELDERS TO ELIMINATE ISOLATION AND DEPRESSION.  SENIOR COMPANIONS CONTINUE TO GO VISIT WITH THEIR ASSIGNED FRAIL ELDERS IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY ON A DAILY BASIS. THE PROGRAM CONTINUES TO RECRUIT POTENTIAL ELDERS THAT ARE 55 AND OLDER IN SERVING AS A SENIOR COMPANION.  WE ANTICIPATE CONTINUING TO PROVIDE A MUCH-NEEDED SERVICE TO OUR FRAIL ELDERS IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY. 
     THE MISSION OF THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL FOLLOW THE CORPORATION MISSION TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING.  SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL MEET THE COMMUNITY HUMAN NEEDS.  FIFTEEN (15) SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING:  1. ASSISTANCE AND FRIENDSHIP TO ELDER ADULTS WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING TASKS.  2. INDIVIDUALS ARE 55 YEARS AND OLDER MAY SERVE AS A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER.  3. ELIGIBLE ELDER MAY SERVE 15 TO 40 HOURS A WEEK OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE; 4. THE ELIGIBLE ELDER MUST BE INCOME ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A STIPEND. 
     THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SCOPE OF SERVICE HAS ALLOWED ELDERS IN THE PROGRAM AS VOLUNTEERS TO REMAIN PHYSICALLY AND MENTALLY ACTIVE, A GROWTH OF THEIR SELF-ESTEEM THROUGH CONTINUED PARTICIPATION IN NEEDED COMMUNITY SERVICES.  SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE CONFIDENT IN PROVIDING SUPPORTIVE SERVICE TO ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, OR MENTAL HEALTH LIMITATIONS, ESPECIALLY OLDER PERSONS, IN AN EFFORT TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENT LIVING AND AGING WITH DIGNITY.  THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS EARN A STIPEND AND OTHER BENEFITS WHICH ENABLE ELIGIBLE PERSONS TO PARTICIPATE AS A SENIOR COMPANION WITHOUT ENDURING COST TO THEMSELVES.  ALL SENIOR VOLUNTEERS MEETING THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENT WILL BE PAID A STIPEND OF $3.00 PER HOUR AND NOT EXCEED 2767 PER YEAR.  THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PAID A STIPEND FOLLOWING THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, PAYROLL SCHEDULE EVERY TWO WEEKS. 
      THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SCOPE OF SERVICES PROVIDED ARE THE FOLLOWING 
1.  INDEPENDENT LIVING, 
2.  IN- HOME CARE 
3.  RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS. 
INDEPENDENT LIVING:  SENIOR COMPANION SUPPORTS TO OUR FRAIL ELDERS IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY PROVIDES SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN THEIR OWN PRIVATE RESIDENCE.  THE GROWING NEED FOR INDIVIDUALIZED SOCIAL SUPPORT SERVICES FOR ELDERS IS NEEDED IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY.  RESPITE CARE:   FOR FAMILY MEMBERS MOST OFTEN EXPERIENCE A VARIETY OF HARDSHIPS WHEN CARING FOR AN ELDER RELATIVE.  MOST FAMILY MEMBERS CONSTANTLY CARE FOR THE ELDER SUFFER FROM A HIGH LEVEL OF STRESS, LACK OF ADEQUATE TIME AWAY FROM THEIR CAREGIVER ROLE OR PROBLEMS RELATED TO EMPLOYMENT AND INCREASED FAMILY PROBLEMS.   THIS NOT ONLY AFFECTS THE CAREGIVER'S ABILITY TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE CARE TO THEIR ELDER FAMILY MEMBER, THIS MAKES AN ELDER AT GREATER RISK FOR INSTITUTIONALIZED PLACEMENT.  CLOSE FAMILY INVOLVEMENT IS NO LONGER PREVALENT IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY WHEN IT COMES TO ELDERS; DUE TO FAMILY MEMBERS WORKING OFF THE RESERVATION.  DURING THE TIME WHEN THE ELDER IS HOME ALONE RESULTS TO LONELINESS, DEPRESSION, AND ISOLATION.  WITH THE SENIOR COMPANIONS, OUR ELDERS EXPERIENCE SOCIALIZATION AND COMMUNICATION WITH INCREASED INTERACTION WITH THE ELDER TO BE MORE RESPONSIVE AND INTERACT WITH A SENIOR COMPANION. 
RESPITE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO FAMILY MEMBERS.   SENIOR COMPANION WILL PROVIDE SUPPORTS OF COMPANIONSHIP BY FRIENDLY VISITING, LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING OF GETTING DRESSED FOR THE DAY, MEAL PREPARATION, NUTRITION INFORMATION, MINOR HOUSEH

THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION IS COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC). CSC IS A NON-PROFIT MULTI-SERVICE CENTER THAT HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES IN ROOSEVELT COUNTY SINCE 1965, HOSTING THE SCP PROGRAM SINCE 1985. THE CENTER PROVIDES SERVICES & EXPANDED OPPORTUNITIES FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH, FAMILIES, & THE ELDERLY OF PORTALES & ROOSEVELT COUNTY. THE MISSION OF CSC (CSC) IS TO PROVIDE ON-GOING OPPORTUNITIES TO EMPOWER ALL OF THE PEOPLE OF ROOSEVELT COUNTY TO COLLABORATE IN REDUCING COMMUNITY PROBLEMS. THIS ENLIGHTENED CONCEPT WILL BECOME THE NORM OF THE COMMUNITY. AN ESTIMATED 24 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ROOSEVELT & CURRY COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER 24 SCPS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, NUTRITION/FOOD SUPPORT & RESPITE SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE SCP PROGRAM (SCP) VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ADDRESSED THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY BY MEETING OR EXCEEDING THE OUTCOMES; NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT IS $6192 AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY THE NEW MEXICO AGING & LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT (NMALTSD) INVESTMENT OF $142,260. IN ADDITION, CSC HAS FUNDING AVAILABLE THROUGH LOCAL SHARE (.24%, $342) TO SUPPLEMENT WHERE THERE MAY BE BUDGET SHORTFALLS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (SCSVP),  LOCATED IN CENTRAL NEW MEXICO IS THE INCUMBENT PROJECT SPONSOR OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND RSVP PROGRAMS ARE ALSO SPONSORED BY SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. SANDOVAL COUNTY ENCOMPASSES 3,716 SQUARE MILES OF GEOGRAPHICALLY DIVERSE GEOGRAPHY, CULTURES AND PEOPLE.  THE MAJORITY OF COMMUNITIES ARE LOCATED IN RURAL AND OFTENTIMES, CHALLENGING GEOGRAPHIC SETTINGS.  THE SENIOR POPULATION IS A MICROCOSM OF THE LARGER DIVERSE POPULATION, WITH THE MAJORITY BEING OF CAUCASIAN RACE, FOLLOWED BY NATIVE AMERICAN AND A MUCH SMALLER AFRICAN AMERICAN RACE, WITH APPROXIMATELY 38% OF HISPANIC ETHNICITY.  THE HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS LIVE IN BOTH RURAL COMMUNITIES AND THE LARGER, MORE URBAN CITIES OF RIO RANCHO AND BERNALILLO, ALL LOCATED WITHIN SANDOVAL COUNTY. SEVEN VSYS/SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE TARGET POPULATION OF HOMEBOUND SENIORS WITH LIMITED FAMILY AND FRIEND SUPPORT DURING THE GRANT YEARS OF JULY, 2020- JUNE, 2023. THE SENIOR COMPANIONS' SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, SHARING MEALS AND PASTIMES AS WELL AS TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WHICH ALLOW THE SENIOR CLIENTS TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND REDUCE THE CHANCE OF BEING PLACED IN A MORE ASSISTED LIVING ENVIRONMENT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED SERVICES TO APPROXIMATELY 24 HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS WHO WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, THUS ENABLING THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. THE SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM DOES NOT RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDING. THE PROGRAM IS FUNDED THROUGH THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT FOR $62,300.00 AND IS SUPPLEMENTED BY $8,538.00 OF LOCAL FUNDING.

CITY OF ALAMOGORDO MISSION: THE CITY OF ALAMOGORDO IS A MUNICIPAL CORPORATION THAT EXISTS SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING THE BEST POSSIBLE SERVICES TO OUR CUSTOMERS - THE CITIZENS OF ALAMOGORDO. WE ARE COMMITTED TO PROVIDING THESE SERVICES WITH HONESTY, INTEGRITY, COMPASSION, FAIRNESS AND A COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE. PART OF OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS 55 AND OVER, WHICH IN TURN HELPS US PROVIDE AN ENVIRONMENT OFFERING SUPPORT EDUCATION, RECREATION, NUTRITION AND ENTERTAINMENT FOR ELDERLY RESIDENTS IN ALAMOGORDO AND THE SURROUNDING AREA. OUR GOAL IS TO HELP SENIORS ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN A VITAL, PRODUCTIVE ROLE IN LIFE EITHER THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM OR AS A CLIENT RECEIVING THESE SERVICES. FUNDING SOURCES: WE CURRENTLY DO NOT RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDING: HOWEVER, WE ARE REQUESTING $67,750 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDING FOR 11 VSY'S SERVICE CATEGORIES: AGING IN PLACE COMMUNITY NEEDS: TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELDERLY PERSONS WHO ARE FRAIL AND HOMEBOUND OR THOSE LIVING IN NURSING FACILITIES. OTERO COUNTY IS LARGELY RURAL AND SOME ELDERLY RESIDENTS DO NOT HAVE REGULAR CONTACT WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY MEMBERS. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROVIDES HOMEBOUND RESIDENTS WITH A COMPANION ON A REGULAR BASIS. THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES THAT MUCH NEEDED HUMAN CONTACT WHICH IMPROVES THE QUALITY LIFE THROUGH SOCIAL INTERACTION FOR THOSE WHO WOULD NOT HAVE IT IF THE PROGRAM DID NOT EXIST. RESEARCH-BASED METHODS: TIME SHEETS AND SURVEYS OUTCOMES: COMPANIONS WILL REPORT THAT THEY ARE LESS LONELY, DECREASED ISOLATION AND MORE EMOTIONALLY STABLE WITHIN THEIR ENVIRONMENT.

THE CITY OF SANTA FE, NEW MEXICO, DIVISION OF SENIOR SERVICES MISSION IS TO OFFER PROGRAMS AND SERVICES DESIGNED TO ALLOW OLDER ADULTS TO REMAIN LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES AS COMFORTABLY AND AS INDEPENDENTLY AS POSSIBLE, AND TO HOPEFULLY AVOID INSTITUTIONALIZATION. ONE WAY OF ACCOMPLISHING THIS IS THROUGH VOLUNTEERING IN OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WHERE THEY HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO REMAIN ACTIVE AND SOCIALLY ENGAGED. WHEN OLDER ADULTS CONTRIBUTE TO THE WELL-BEING OF OTHER SENIOR CITIZENS, IT CULTIVATES A SENSE OF PURPOSE AND EXTENDS BENEFITS BOTH WAYS.  THE 2014 STUDY CONDUCTED BY SCIENCE DAILY STATES THAT ?OLDER ADULTS WHO STAY ACTIVE BY VOLUNTEERING ARE GETTING MORE OUT OF IT THAN JUST AN ALTRUISTIC FEELING - THEY ARE RECEIVING A HEALTH BOOST TOO, RESEARCHERS REPORT.  VOLUNTEERING IS ASSOCIATED WITH REDUCTION IN SYMPTOMS OF DEPRESSION, BETTER OVERALL HEALTH, FEWER FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS, AND GREATER LONGEVITY.

 THE SANTA FE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROPOSES SERVING A PROJECTED 34 VOLUNTEERS; ALL OF WHICH WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE AND SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION, COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE CARE.  AT THE END OF THE ONE YEAR GRANT CYCLE, APPROXIMATELY 93 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE ASSISTANCE WITH ACCESS TO FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $7,289 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $161,461 IN NEW MEXICO STATE FUNDS AND $43,691 IN LOCAL CITY FUNDS.

THE MISSION OF THE SIERRA JOINT OFFICE ON AGING (SJOA) IS TO ESTABLISH A CONTINUUM OF SOCIAL SUPPORT AND HEALTH SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS AND MAXIMIZE THEIR INDEPENDENCE, ENABLING THEM TO LIVE SUCCESSFULLY ON THEIR OWN TERMS IN THEIR OWN COMMUNITIES. THE GOAL IS TO ENSURE THE USE OF ALL AVAILABLE RESOURCES AND SERVE AS AN ADVOCATE FOR THE ELDERLY POPULATION. AN ESTIMATED 7 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL SERVE. THEY WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELDERLY SENIORS IN OUR COMMUNITY. SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED WITHIN PRIVATE RESIDENCES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENCOURAGE HEALTHY AGING BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING, THE ABILITY TO IDENTIFY INDIVIDUALS AT RISK AND TO INTERVENE TO PREVENT LONELINESS AND DEPRESSION WHICH AGGRAVATE CHRONIC HEALTH PROBLEMS. AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD WE ANTICIPATE A DECREASE IN THE INSTANCES OF LONELINESS AND DEPRESSION OF THOSE ELDERLY WHO ARE WITHOUT INTERVENTION OF WHICH COMPANIONSHIP PROVIDES.

THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION IS THE DEMING LUNA COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING, INC. (COA).  THE COA IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) CORPORATION OPERATING AS A SERVICE ORGANIZATION IN LUNA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO SINCE 1976.  THE COA HAS BEEN THE LEADER IN IMPLEMENTING SERVICES AND PROGRAMS IN LUNA COUNTY WITH A STRONG MISSION OF PROMOTING INDEPENDENCE, PRESERVING DIGNITY, AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR A DIVERSE POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN OUR COUNTY.  OUR ORGANIZATION ADVOCATES AND PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICES TO OLDER, LOW-INCOME ADULTS WHO HAVE HEALTH AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS, ENABLING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN A DIGNIFIED MANNER WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY.  THE COA CURRENTLY OFFERS OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGH PROGRAMS LIKE THE SENIOR EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT, SENIOR COMPANION AND RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS.

FOR THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION?S SCP PROJECT, AN ESTIMATED TEN (10) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF ?HEALTHY FUTURES? IN THE COMMUNITY.  SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE IN NEED OF SOCIALIZATION TO PREVENT ISOLATION AND LONELINESS.  

AT THE END OF A TWELVE MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE TWO STATIONS WILL BE THAT BOTH CLIENTS AND SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL REMAIN ACTIVE WHICH WILL LOWER THE ONSET OF CHRONIC DISEASE OR FURTHER ADVANCEMENT OF DISEASES, DEPRESSION, ISOLATION AND LONELINESS BY CREATING A POSITIVE OUTLOOK.  THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN CLIENT AND COMPANION WILL ALSO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS IN PHYSICAL, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT TO OUR SCP PROJECT IS $5,100 DOLLARS.  THE PROJECT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH STATE FUNDS OF $61,607.  THE PROGRAM WILL ALSO RECEIVE $7,012 OF IN KIND FUNDS FORM THE CITY OF DEMING FOR A TOTAL OF $68,619 (NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES).

WHETHER YOU ARE PADDLING DOWN THE PECOS RIVER OR WALKING THE TRAILS IN CARLSBAD CAVERNS OR THE LINCOLN NATIONAL FOREST, YOU ARE EXPERIENCING THE MANY NATURAL WONDERS IN EDDY COUNTY, NEW MEXICO.  EDDY COUNTY, WITH A POPULATION OF 58,460 IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHEASTERN SECTION OF THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO.  THE COUNTY INCLUDES CARLSBAD, ARTESIA, AND THE VILLAGES OF LOVING AND HOPE.  IN 2019, SIXTEEN PERCENT (16%) OF THE POPULATION WAS 65 YEARS AND OLDER; AND OF THESE, 19% WERE LIVING BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL.   
SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO COMMUNITY ACTION CORPORATION HAS SUCCESSFULLY SERVED OLDER ADULTS RESIDING IN EDDY COUNTY VIA THE SENIOR SERVICE PROGRAMS AND THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, SINCE 1965. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE 2020-2021 - GRANT PERIOD IS: HEALTHY FUTURES.  THE OBJECTIVE IS: AGING IN PLACE. THIRTEEN (13) SENIOR COMPANIONS (INPUTS) WILL PROVIDE 27 OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN ASSIST LIVING HOMES AND PRIVATE HOMES (TARGETS) WITH COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES. (SERVICE ACTIVITIES)  THE ANTICIPATED OUTPUT IS THE NUMBER OF HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES: RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES [INCLUDING COMPANIONSHIP] THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS THE NUMBER OF HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $32,073 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED OF NM STATE FUNDS BY $56,844

HELP NEW MEXICO, INC. (HELPNM) IN RIO ARRIBA, SAN MIGUEL, MORA AND GUADALUPE COUNTIES HAVE BEEN OPERATING AND ASSISTING COMMUNITIES STATEWIDE FOR OVER 54 YEARS TO CREATE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND PROMOTE ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES TO STRENGTHEN FAMILIES THROUGHOUT NEW MEXICO.  ESTABLISHED IN 1965, HELPNM HAS PROVIDED SERVICES TO COUNTLESS LOW-INCOME, MIGRANT/SEASONAL FARMWORKERS, ABUSED AND NEGLECTED CHILDREN, DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, DISADVANTAGED YOUTH, AND SENIOR CITIZENS. HELPNM PROGRAMS INCLUDE ADULT EDUCATION, FINANCIAL LITERACY, ON THE JOB TRAINING, WORK EXPERIENCE, FAMILY OR INDIVIDUAL CASE MANAGEMENT, EARLY CHILDHOOD AND YOUTH DEVELOPMENT, EDUCATION, NUTRITION, AFFORDABLE HOUSING, EMERGENCY ASSISTANCE AND SENIOR PROGRAMS.  HELPNM SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO SENIORS ACROSS NORTHERN NEW MEXICO.  HELPNM THROUGH ITS EXISTING CAPACITY PROPOSES TO RENEW OUR PROGRAM FOR CONTINUED OPERATION.  AN ESTIMATED 46 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  ALL OF THE PROPOSED SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ACTIVITIES. HELPNM SCP WILL SERVE RIO ARRIBA, GUADALUPE, MORA, AND SAN MIGUEL COUNTIES BY PLACING SENIOR COMPANIONS WITH OTHER SENIORS TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE SCP IS THE HEALTHY FUTURES MODULE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, SCP INTENDS TO PROVIDE OUTCOMES THAT DEMONSTRATE SENIORS ABILITIES TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES, ASSURE SAFE ENVIRONMENTS IN THEIR LIVING SPACES, AND REDUCE THE FEELING OF ISOLATION. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $81,661.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $198,647.00 IN STATE AND LOCAL RESOURCES.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT IS THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE (CITY) DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR AFFAIRS (DSA). THE MISSION OF DSA IS TO BE A COMMUNITY LEADER, WHO IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS, INVOLVES SENIORS AND PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN CREATING A COMMUNITY THAT ENHANCES EVERYONE'S QUALITY OF LIFE BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR POTENTIAL, SHARE THEIR WISDOM, MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE, AND LIVE WITH DIGNITY. IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THIS MISSION, DSA OFFERS ADULTS AGE 50 AND OLDER A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES AND PROGRAMS DESIGNED FOR ACTIVE TO FRAIL ADULTS THAT PROMOTE HEALTHY AGING AND INDEPENDENCE. THESE SERVICES AND PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED TO MEET INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF SENIORS THROUGHOUT THE ALBUQUERQUE/BERNALILLO COUNTY AREA. DSA OPERATES 6 SENIOR CENTERS, 2 MULTIGENERATIONAL CENTERS, 4 SPORTS/FITNESS CENTERS, AND 17 MEAL SITES. IN ADDITION TO THESE CONGREGATE CENTERS, DSA PROVIDES SERVICES TO SENIORS THROUGH HOME REPAIR AND RETROFIT SERVICES, CARE COORDINATION, INFORMATION AND  ASSISTANCE SERVICES, SENIOR TRANSPORTATION, AND A CENTRAL KITCHEN. THE CITY THROUGH DSA SPONSORS SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS-SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM AND RSVP.
      THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT AMOUNT OF $117,588 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $85,673 FROM THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND $102,265 FROM THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE. THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT A TOTAL OF 27 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS; 24 FEDERAL VOLUNTEERS AND 3 STATE FUNDED VOLUNTEERS IN THE ALBUQUERQUE AND BERNALILLO COUNTY METROPOLITAN AREA AND NATIVE INDIAN COMMUNITIES IN CIBOLA AND SANDOVAL COUNTIES.  IN PARTNERSHIP WITH 3 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, 24 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS AND WILL ADDRESS THE FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH AN OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE.  AN ADDITIONAL 3 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES WHILE SERVING IN ADULT DAY CARE CENTERS. VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND ONE-ON-ONE ATTENTION. VOLUNTEERS WILL ENCOURAGE CLIENTS TO SOCIALIZE AND PARTICIPATE IN SINGLE OR GROUP ACTIVITIES.
      AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL HAVE SERVED OVER 450 UNDUPLICATED ADULTS WHO HAVE REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND OVER 50 UNDUPLICATED ADULTS IN OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES THAT NEED ONE-ON-ONE SERVICE AND COMPANIONSHIP/ATTENTION.

CITIZENS FOR THE DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED, INC. (CDD) PROVIDES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH CONTRACT SERVICES THROUGH THE FAMILY, INFANT & TODDLER PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN BIRTH -- THREE YEARS OF AGE, A DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WAIVER PROGRAM FOR HANDICAPPED ADULTS FROM THE AGE OF 21 THROUGH ADULTHOOD, AND SPONSORS THE COLFAX COUNTY  SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS. CDD IS APPLYING FOR SIXTEEN VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS AND $75,352 IN FEDERAL FUNDING AND EIGHT VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEAR AND $56,230 IN STATE FUNDING, TO SUPPORT THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. 

THE SERVICE CATEGORIES THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH AND IN-HOME/RESPITE.  THE PROGRAM WILL USE PROJECT STAR WORK PLANS WITH PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT TOOLS SUCH AS CLIENT AND CAREGIVER INTERVIEWS AND COMMUNITY PARTNER SURVEYS.  THE PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE:

* EIGHTY PERCENT OF CLIENTS RECEIVING SERVICES FROM A VOLUNTEER WILL REMAIN LIVING IN THEIR HOME.

* CAREGIVERS WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE PROVIDING CARE TO HOMEBOUND LOVED ONES, IN PART, DUE TO THE RESPITE SERVICES OF SENIOR COMPANIONS.

THE COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH WORK PLAN ADDRESSES COMMUNITY NEEDS AND THE CORPORATION'S STRATEGIC PLAN; HEALTHY FUTURES, BY ASSISTING CLIENTS TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES, PROVIDING INFORMATION AND ACCESS TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES, AND PROVIDING OR ARRANGING TRANSPORTATION TO PRIMARY AND PREVENTATIVE HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS.

THE TAOS COUNTY SENIOR PROGRAM IS A LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITY WHICH COMPRISES FOUR SENIOR CENTERS IN TAOS COUNTY WITH ACTIVITIES AND SUPPORT SERVICES THAT CATER TO THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF SENIORS. THESE CENTERS ADDRESS THE HEALTH, SOCIAL, RECREATIONAL, AND LOGISTICAL NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY POPULATION IN FOUR LOCATIONS. OUR SENIOR CENTERS SERVE APPROXIMATELY 400 OLDER ADULTS EACH DAY THROUGH A WIDE VARIETY OF PROGRAMS. OUR MISSION IS TO HELP SENIORS IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN A HEALTHY AND INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLE AND TO MAXIMIZE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROVIDES COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES TO FRAIL HOMEBOUND ELDERLY WHICH IS OUR TARGET POPULATION, THEREFORE COMPLIMENTING THE SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION. SENIOR COMPANION SERVICES WILL GIVE SENIORS THE ABILITY TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AT HOME. BASED ON HOME VISITS AND SPEAKING WITH FAMILY MEMBERS OF CLIENTS IT HAS BEEN PERCEIVED THAT THERE HAS BEEN A DECLINE IN DOCTOR VISITS, FALLS AND LESS ISOLATION. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS 7 CORPORATION FUNDED VSY'S AND 12 NON-CORPORATION FUNDED VSY'S FOR A TOTAL OF 19 VSY'S.

SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: PERSONAL CARE SUCH AS FEEDING, DRESSING, GROOMING, ASSISTING THE CLIENT IN WALKING, GETTING OUT OF BED, AND GOING TO THE BATHROOM. ASSISTING WITH MEDICAL AND PHYSICAL THERAPY, AND OR MONITORING MEDICATION. ACCOMPANYING THE CLIENT TO DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENTS. ENCOURAGE EXERCISE, TAKING WALKS WITH THE CLIENT. PREPARING FOOD, PLANNING MEALS, GROCERY SHOPPING, LABELING AND ORGANIZING FOOD. PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TALKING, LISTENING, CHEERING UP, AND PLAYING GAMES OR CARDS. FOSTERING CLIENT CONTACT WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS. ACCOMPANYING CLIENT TO RECREATIONAL OR SOCIAL EVENTS. WRITING LETTERS, READING, FILLING OUT FORMS. ASSISTING WITH MONEY MANAGEMENT. LITE HOUSEKEEPING. INFORMATION AND ADVOCACY FOR ELIGIBILITY OF SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME WILL BE TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE, NUTRITIONAL AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO THE ELDERLY FOR THE PURPOSE OF ENHANCING THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE AND AS A DETERRENT TO INSTITUTIONALIZATION. THE GOALS OF OUR ORGANIZATION WILL BE TO ENSURE THAT ALL ELIGIBLE PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY TO ACCESS THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCY. WE WILL STRIVE TO OFFER ON-GOING SERVICES AS INTENDED BY USING EXISTING HUMAN AND FACILITY RESOURCES AND AFFIRMS THAT WE WILL NOT DISCRIMINATE AGAINST ANY ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL WHO DESIRES TO UTILIZE ITS SERVICE, BECAUSE OF SEX, RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL ORIGIN, RELIGION, DISABILITY, SOCIAL AND OR, ECONOMIC STATUS.

THE VISITING NURSE ASSOCIATION OF SOUTHEAST MISSOURI, INC. (VNA) IS THE SPONSOR OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS (SCP).  VNA IS A HOME HEALTH AGENCY PROVIDING THE FOLLOW SERVICES:  HOME HEALTH. HOSPICE, PRIVATE DUTY NURSING, PERSONAL CARE/HOMEMAKER, CONSUMER DIRECTED SERVICE, SCP AND UNIFORM RETAIL SHOP. THE MISSION STATEMENT OF THE VNA IS TO SET THE STANDARD FOR EXCELLENCE IN THE DELIVERY OF HOME CARE SERVICES TO THE CITIZENS OF SOUTHEAST MISSOURI THROUGH COOPERATIVE AND SEAMLESS SYSTEM, UTILIZING INNOVATION, DIVERSIFICATION AND COST EFFECTIVE METHODS IN AN ENVIRONMENT THAT FOSTERS LEARNING AND DEMONSTRATES POSITIVE OUTCOMES. THE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED WITHOUT REGARD TO AGE, RACE, CREED, DISABILITY OR ECONOMIC STATUS.  THIS MISSION WILL BE CARRIED OUT USING THE NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION FORM OF DOING BUSINESS AS DEFINED IN CHAPTER 355 OF THE REVISED STATUES OF MISSOURI.
VNA IS REQUESTING $168,783 TO SUPPORT 30 VOLUNTEER VSY SERVICES HOURS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF CLIENTS LIVING AT HOME BY HELPING TO REDUCE PREMATURE INSTITUTION AND HELP COMBAT THE FEELING OF ISOLATION.  IN ADDITION, THE RESPITE SERVICES FROM SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS ALLOW CAREGIVERS TIMES AWAY FROM THEIR LOVED ONES WITHOUT THE FEAR OR QUILT OF LEAVING THEM ALONE. SENIOR COMPANION VISITS WILL BE MADE FOR THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES: 1. HEALTHY FUTURES/INDEPENDENT LIVING 2. RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FOR THIS GRANT PERIOD ARE: 1. CLIENTS WILL REMAIN IN THE OWN HOME 2. CLIENTS WILL FEEL LESS ISOLATED. 3. RESPITE SERVICE FOR CAREGIVER TO HAVE MUCH NEEDED TIME AWAY FROM LOVE ONE. COMPANION VOLUNTEERS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR CHECKING ON THE GENERAL WELL-BEING OF SCP CLIENTS. SHEPHERD'S CENTER OF KC CENTRAL (SCC) EMPOWERS MID-LIFE AND OLDER ADULTS TO LIVE HEALTHY, ENGAGED, AND INDEPENDENT LIVES. IT HAS ADMINISTERED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IN THE KANSAS CITY, MISSOURI AREA FIRST AS THE WESTPORT COOPERATIVE CENTER AND LATER AS THE SCC SINCE 1981. SCC IS REQUESTING FUNDING TO CONTINUE ITS MISSION AND SPONSORSHIP OF THE SCP. AN ESTIMATED 69 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE HOMEBOUND SENIOR AND DISABLED CLIENTS. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL WOULD BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE NOT ONLY COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE, BUT ALSO ASSISTING SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN THE ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING IN ORDER FOR THEM TO CONTINUE TO STAY IN THEIR OWN HOMES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES AND AGING IN PLACE, ACHIEVING SCC'S GOAL OF EMPOWERING SENIORS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. SCC SEES OUR SENIOR COMPANIONS AS FIRST ALERT ACTIVISTS WHEN THE POPULATION THEY SERVE MAY NEED HELP OR SERVICES SCC CANNOT SUPPLY BUT MAY BE AVAILABLE IN OUR COMMUNITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT SCC ANTICIPATES FULFILLING ITS MISSION LISTED ABOVE 100%. THE PROPOSED CNCS INVESTMENT OF $316,435 WOULD BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $35,164 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SENIOR RESOURCES, INCORPORATED (SRI), THE LEGAL APPLICANT, HAS BEEN ESTABLISHED NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION IN THE SC MIDLANDS COMMUNITY SINCE 1967.   THE SCP PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED   BY SENIOR RESOURCES SINCE 1988, THUS IT IS WELL-ESTABLISHED IN THE COMMUNITY. THE MISSION OF SENIOR RESOURCES IS TO PROVIDE COORDINATED SERVICES, RESOURCES AND PERSONAL CHOICES TO PROMOTE HEALTHY, INDEPENDENT LIVING THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS.  RESEARCH SHOWS THAT VOLUNTEERING PROMOTES A PERSONAL SENSE OF PURPOSE AND ACCOMPLISHMENT, WITH HIGHER LEVELS OF HAPPINESS, SELF-ESTEEM AND LIFE SATISFACTION. THE LONGITUDINAL STUDY PUBLISHED BY CNCS IN 2018 INDICATED THAT SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEERS WERE HEALTHIER, LESS DEPRESSED, AND LESS SOCIALLY ISOLATED THAN THOSE WHO DID NOT SERVE. SCP OF THE MIDLANDS IS ALSO UNIQUELY POSITIONED AND QUALIFIED DUE TO BEING HOUSED IN AN ORGANIZATION THAT OFFERS COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES ALONG WITH ESTABLISHED RELATIONSHIPS WITH EXISTING AGING SERVICE PROVIDERS, STATE AND LOCAL OFFICES ON AGING, AND CURRENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS.

SENIOR SERVICES INC. OF CHESTER COUNTY (SSICC) IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED IN 1973 WITH A MISSION OF DEVELOPING, FOSTERING, AND ENCOURAGING SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES OF HEALTH, WELLNESS, EDUCATION, AND FELLOWSHIP AMONG OLDER CITIZENS THROUGHOUT CHESTER COUNTY. SSICC'S ULTIMATE GOAL IS TO HELP ALL SENIORS REMAIN HEALTHY, INDEPENDENT, AND SAFE WITHIN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. THROUGH PROGRAMMING, PARTNERSHIPS, AND COLLABORATIONS, SSICC MAKES EVERY EFFORT TO MAXIMIZE AND/OR IMPROVE THE LIVES OF SENIORS AND/OR THEIR CAREGIVERS THROUGH COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES IN THE HOME. IN AN EFFORT TO ACHIEVE ITS GOAL THROUGH THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, THE AGENCY FOSTERS POSITIVE PUBLIC RELATIONS, RECRUITMENT AND VISIBILITY IN THE COMMUNITY AT EVERY OPPORTUNITY POSSIBLE BY MARKETING ITSELF AT THE SPECIAL EVENTS OF OTHER HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL COMMUNITY EXPOS AND HEALTH FAIRS. 
THE STANDING MISSION OF THE VOLUNTEERS IN THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP), IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICES THROUGH ASSIGNMENTS MADE BY SCP VOLUNTEER STATIONS BY PERFORMING SERVICE ACTIVITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS WHO HAVE EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, IN-HOME CARE NEEDS, AND CARETAKER RESPITE SERVICES. THESE GOALS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING FOCUS AREA- HEALTHY FUTURES AND WILL ALLOW AGING IN PLACE UTILIZING TWO SERVICE AREAS: (1) INDEPENDENT LIVING AND (2) RESPITE SERVICES. THE SCP WILL UTILIZE 1 SCP VOLUNTEER STATION TO ACCOMPLISH SCP PROJECT GOALS: (1) SENIOR SERVICES INC. OF CHESTER COUNTY. WHILE WORKING WITH THE 1 SCP VOLUNTEER STATIONS, THE SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL COMPLETE THEIR ASSIGNMENTS IN HOMES BY PROVIDING SERVICE ACTIVITIES WHICH FACILITATE PERSONAL CARE, RESPITE SERVICES, NUTRITION, SOCIAL/RECREATION, HOME MANAGEMENT AND INFORMATION/ADVOCACY. FOR FISCAL YEAR 2020-2021, SENIOR SERVICES IS SEEKING FOR THE SCP TO MAINTAIN AN AVERAGE OF 24 FEDERALLY FUNDED VSY'S FOR A TOTAL OF 25,056 HOURS. THE TOTAL FUNDING LEVEL FOR THE 24 VSY'S AT A FIXED RATE OF $6500 PER VSY'S IS ANTICIPATED AT $75,168 FOR STIPENDS AND A TOTAL FY 20 SCP PROGRAM FUNDING LEVEL OF $156,095. 
AS A RESULT OF SCP IN CHESTER COUNTY, IT IS DETERMINED THAT THE SCP WILL ADDRESS THE IN-HOME NEEDS OF THE MANY OLDER INDIVIDUALS LIVING ALONE DETERMINED TO HAVE SELF-CARE LIMITATIONS AND PROVIDE RESPITE CARE IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THOSE WHO SERVE AS CAREGIVERS FOR AN AGED SPOUSE OR FAMILY MEMBER. ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THESE TWO PLACEMENTS PRESENTLY RECEIVE LIMITED CARE. BY USING SCP VOLUNTEERS WITHIN THIS FRAMEWORK, THE ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO RECEIVE ANCILLARY RESOURCES AND MORE INDIVIDUALIZED ATTENTION WHICH CREATES GROWTH IN THEIR PERSONAL FUNCTIONING AND LIFE SKILLS NECESSARY TO MAINTAIN DAY TO DAY LIVING WHICH FACILITATES 'AGING IN PLACE.' IN ADDITION TO THE PERSONAL AND EMOTIONAL ASPECTS OF AGING, OTHER ANTICIPATED SCP OUTCOMES ARE THAT IN-HOME ELDERLY CLIENTS WILL BE ABLE TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES INDEPENDENTLY VERSUS BEING PLACED IN GROUP OR INSTITUTIONAL SETTINGS AND CAREGIVERS WILL BECOME LESS RESTRAINED, ENJOY LIFE, AND BE ENERGIZED IN ORDER TO POSITIVELY CARE FOR THEIR HOMEBOUND ELDERLY.

LAND OF SKY REGIONAL COUNCIL (LOSRC) IS A MULTI-COUNTY, LOCAL GOVERNMENT PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION IN NORTH CAROLINA. IT IS ONE OF 17 SUCH ORGANIZATIONS IN THE STATE AND SERVES REGION B, WHICH INCLUDES BUNCOMBE, HENDERSON, MADISON AND TRANSYLVANIA COUNTIES. THE PROFESSIONAL STAFF CARRIES OUT APPROVED PROGRAMS AND PROVIDES LOCAL GOVERNMENTS WITH GRANT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH THE DEPARTMENTS OF AREA AGENCY ON AGING, MOUNTAIN MOBILITY, ECONOMIC & COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, AND MOUNTAIN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.

LOSRC BOARD OF DELEGATES IS MADE UP OF ELECTED OFFICIALS -- MAYORS, COUNTY COMMISSION CHAIRPERSONS, TOWN COUNCIL MEMBERS AND ALTERNATES -- FROM MEMBER GOVERNMENTS. MEMBERS MEET MONTHLY TO PLAN PROGRAMS AND SET POLICIES AND GOALS TO BENEFIT THE ENTIRE REGION. IN ADDITION TO THE FOUR COUNTIES, MEMBER GOVERNMENTS INCLUDE THE MUNICIPALITIES OF ASHEVILLE, BILTMORE FOREST, BLACK MOUNTAIN, MONTREAT,WEAVERVILLE, WOODFIN, FLETCHER, FLAT ROCK,HENDERSONVILLE, LAUREL PARK, HOT SPRINGS, MARS HILL,MARSHALL, BREVARD AND ROSMAN. 

LOSRC'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE CREATIVE REGIONAL SOLUTIONS TO RELEVANT AND EMERGING ISSUES IN BUNCOMBE, HENDERSON, MADISON AND TRANSYLVANIA COUNTIES WHILE PROVIDING A STANDARD OF EXCELLENCE IN THE DELIVERY OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND REGIONAL SERVICES FOR OUR MEMBER COMMUNITIES.

THE APPALACHIAN SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES THAT FOCUS ON MAINTAINING INDEPENDENT LIVING AMONG AT-RISK OLDER ADULTS IN WESTERN NORTH CAROLINA SINCE 1988. OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE SENIOR COMPANION SERVICES THAT ENHANCE THE LIVES OF OLDER ADULTS WHO ARE AT RISK OF INSTITUTIONALIZATION WHILE ALSO PROVIDING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR  OTHER SENIOR CITIZENS. THE NEED FOR OUR SERVICES HAS BEEN WELL DOCUMENTED AND SUPPORTED BY LOCAL PHYSICIANS, SOCIAL WORKERS, AND CAREGIVERS. FIFTY-TWO SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FRAIL ELDERLY RESIDENTS WITH FOOD ACQUISITION AND PREPARATION, PROPER NUTRITION, ERRANDS, TRANSPORTATION, AND DAILY LIVING TASKS' THAT WILL ASSIST THE INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES.  RESPITE SERVICES WILL ALSO BENEFIT FAMILY CAREGIVERS WHO ARE IN THE WORKFORCE AND THOSE WHO ARE FRAIL THEMSELVES AND STRUGGLING TO KEEP THEIR LOVED ONE AT HOME. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ON AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURES IN HEALTHY FUTURES THAT ARE AIMED AT AGING IN PLACE USING INDEPENDENT LIVING OUTCOMES AND/OR COMPLEMENTARY PROGRAM MEASURES WHICH ALIGN WITH NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES.  OUR SERVICES SPECIFICALLY TARGET VETERANS ,THEIR FAMILIES AND UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS IN OUR FIVE COUNTY SERVICE AREA. SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH A NETWORK OF STATIONS INCLUDING SOCIAL SERVICES,  AGENCIES ON AGING, HOSPITALS, ADULT DAY CARE PROGRAMS, AND FOOD PANTRIES.  NINETY-SIX PERCENT OF OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, IT IS EXPECTED THAT 85% OF THE ESTIMATED 250 INDIVIDUALS SERVED WILL REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND IN THEIR OWN HOMES. 
THE APPALACHIAN SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS SPONSORED BY APPALACHIAN STATE UNIVERSITY LOCATED IN BOONE, NORTH CAROLINA.  APPALACHIAN STATE UNIVERSITY HAS BECOME A NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED REGIONAL UNIVERSITY. AS A CONSTITUENT MEMBER OF THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA SYSTEM. THE MISSISSIPPI DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES (MDHS), DIVISION OF AGING AND ADULT SERVICES (DAAS), JACKSON COUNTY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (JCSCP) DIVISION'S MISSION STATEMENT, "ASSIST AGING AND VULNERABLE ADULTS, THEIR FAMILIES, AND CAREGIVERS IN ACHIEVING HEALTHY, SAFE AND INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLES THROUGH ADVOCACY, PROTECTION, EDUCATION AND STEWARDSHIP OF PUBLIC RESOURCES.  THE JACKSON COUNTY SCP HELPS TO BUILD AND STRENGTHEN THE LOCAL COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING SCP VOLUNTEER SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS THAT ARE FRAIL AND/OR DISABLED THEREBY ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES. THE PROGRAM ALSO ENHANCES THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE SCP VOLUNTEERS, WHO ARE 55 YEARS AND OLDER, BY PROMOTING A SENSE OF SELF-WORTH BY MEANINGFUL SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY BUILDING NEW SKILLS AND PERSONAL RELATIONSHIPS.  

THE CNCS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 41 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE: SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO TWO HUNDRED FIFTY (250) FRAIL AND CHRONICALLY ILL ELDERLY TO PREVENT AND DELAY INSTITUTIONALIZATION.  THEY WILL VISIT AND SOCIALIZE WITH THE CLIENTS IN THEIR HOME, ENCOURAGE AND ASSIST WITH WALKING/EXERCISING, PREPARE LIGHT MEALS, ACCOMPANY CLIENT TO/FROM MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND ASSIST WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING (ADL); AND SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO ASSIST WITH TWO HUNDRED  (200) FRAIL AND CHRONICALLY ILL ELDERLY BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, ENGAGING IN CONVERSATION WITH CLIENTS, CONGREGATE MEALS AND ENCOURAGE DAILY PARTICIPATION IN ACTIVITIES SUCH AS CRAFTS, PLAYING BOARD GAMES, EXERCISE AND ACCOMPANY CLIENTS ON RECREATION OUTINGS.

THE HARRISON COUNTY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) WAS ESTABLISHED IN 2011, THE PROGRAM PROVIDES CRUCIAL ASSISTANCE TO ADULT CLIENTS IN THE COMMUNITY THAT NEED HELP TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES.  IT ALSO PROVIDES RESPITE CARE TO RELIEVE LIVE-IN CARETAKERS FOR SHORT PERIODS.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM BRINGS TOGETHER VOLUNTEERS AGE 55 AND OVER WITH OLDER ADULTS IN THE COMMUNITY WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY WITH THE SIMPLE TASKS OF DAY-TO-DAY LIVING.  STUDIES INDICATE THAT SENIORS WHO VOLUNTEER FREQUENTLY LIVE LONGER AND REPORT BETTER HEALTH.  VOLUNTEERING ALSO LEADS TO MORE FRIENDSHIPS AND A MORE POSITIVE ATTITUDE.  AN ESTIMATED FORTY (40) SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE HARRISON COUNTY AREA AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE HELPING SENIORS AGE IN PLACE BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO AT RISK AND FRAIL ELDERLY; RESPITE CARE FOR FAMILIES OF BEDRIDDEN SENIORS; MEAL PREPARATION FOR CLIENTS; RIDES TO AND FROM DOCTOR'S VISITS FOR CLIENTS AND HELP WITH THE HARRISON COUNTY ADULT DAY CARE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES, CONCENTRATED ON THE AT-RISK, FRAIL, ELDERLY COMMUNITY OF HARRISON COUNTY WHILE HELPING LOW-INCOME SENIORS FULFILL A VITAL ROLE OF VOLUNTEERISM IN OUR COMMUNITY.  THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT CYCLE RESULTS IN FORTY (40) SENIOR COMPANIONS HELPING TWO HUNDRED AND FORTY (240) AT RISK, FRAIL, ELDERLY AGE IN PLACE AND PROVIDING RESPITE CARE TO FAMILIES IN NEED FOR OUR PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) INVESTMENT OF $203,373.00 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $38,117.00 FROM THE HARRISON COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF SENIOR CITIZENS, INC. WILL PLACE AN ESTIMATED 66 VOLUNTEERS INTO SERVICE WORK PLANS THAT PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO CAREGIVERS, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN CHATHAM COUNTY.  THROUGH A NETWORK OF 24 VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUCH AS HOSPICE ORGANIZATIONS, HOME CARE AGENCIES, INDEPENDENT SENIOR HIGH RISE APARTMENT BUILDINGS, ADULT DAY CARE CENTERS, AND SENIOR CENTERS, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL WORK WITHIN CNCS AGENCY WIDE PRIORITY MEASURES.  PROGRAM ASSIGNMENTS WILL FOCUS ON THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVE AGING IN PLACE; PROVIDING RESPITE SERVICES FOR CAREGIVERS, AND SERVICES THAT ASSIST INDEPENDENT LIVING. THE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES PROVIDED BY SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE SPECIFIC TO THE NEEDS OF EACH CLIENT. THOSE NEEDS AND SERVICES WILL BE OUTLINED ON AN INDIVIDUAL ASSIGNMENT PLAN FOR EVERY CLIENT RECEIVING SERVICE, AND MAY INCLUDE ASSISTANCE WITH PERSONAL CARE, SOCIAL/RECREATION, HOME MANAGEMENT, AND THE PROVISION OF INFORMATION AND ADVOCACY FOR THE CLIENT OR CAREGIVER. SPECIFIC SERVICES PROVIDED WILL INCLUDE LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, ASSISTANCE WITH FOOD INTAKE, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, PEER SOCIALIZATION, ASSISTANCE WITH EXERCISE AND MOVEMENT, READING, THERAPEUTIC ACTIVITIES, ASSISTING WITH SHOPPING AND RUNNING ERRANDS.   SERVICES TO THE CLIENTS AND FAMILY MEMBERS OF CAREGIVERS WILL PROVIDE THOSE CAREGIVERS SCHEDULED OPPORTUNITIES FOR RESPITE WHILE ALSO PROVIDING TIME TO ATTEND TO THEIR NEEDS RESULTING IN QUALITY OF LIFE IMPROVEMENTS FOR BOTH CAREGIVERS AND CLIENTS.  AT THE END OF YEAR ONE OF THE GRANT, 148 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE RECEIVED INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF 103 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.   DURING THE SAME PERIOD 20 CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL HAVE RECEIVED RESPITE CARE WITH AN ANTICIPATED OUTCOME OF 14 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. SERVICE HOURS PER CLIENT ARE TRACKED DAILY ON TIME RECORD FORMS BY SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS, AND PERFORMANCE MEASURE SURVEY TOOLS WILL BE UTILIZED TO DETERMINE OUTCOME. SENIORS IN SERVICE OF TAMPA BAY, INC. WAS INCORPORATED IN HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY IN 1984 AS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION.   THE MISSION OF SENIORS IN SERVICE IS TO PROVIDE SOLUTIONS TO COMMUNITY CHALLENGES BY ENGAGING VOLUNTEERS AGED 55+.  WE HELP DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN, FRAIL ELDERS, ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES, OVERWHELMED CAREGIVERS, STRUGGLING VETERANS AND HUNGRY FAMILIES IN HILLSBOROUGH, PINELLAS AND PASCO COUNTIES.  OUR SENIOR-AGED VOLUNTEERS ALSO BENEFIT FROM STAYING ACTIVE AND PURPOSEFUL.  FISCALLY SOUND AND INNOVATIVE, WE ARE RECOGNIZED FOR OUR IMPACT AND SAVINGS TO OUR COMMUNITY.  OUR PURPOSE FOR THIS PROPOSAL IS TO PROLONG INDEPENDENCE FOR ELDERS IN HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY THROUGH THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.  

AN ESTIMATED 46 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.   OF THIS NUMBER 46 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS TO HELP LOW-INCOME FRAIL ELDERS AND DISABLED ADULTS AGE IN PLACE.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: 1) COMPANIONSHIP (READING, WRITING LETTERS, MENTAL STIMULATION, COMPLETING PUZZLES, PHYSICAL EXERCISE, FILLING OUT FORMS OR TALKING AND LISTENING); 2) HOMEMAKER SERVICES (HOUSEHOLD ASSISTANCE SUCH AS MEAL PREPARATION, HELP WITH LAUNDRY, HOUSEKEEPING, ERRANDS, GROCERY SHOPPING, NON-MEDICAL SERVICES, CLOTHING SELECTION); AND 3) RESPITE SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES - AGING IN PLACE.   AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PROJECT 80% OF CLIENTS SERVED WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $299,412 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $29,076 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

FOR MANY LOW-INCOME SENIORS, A SENIOR COMPANION IS THE ONLY BRIDGE TO THE OUTSIDE WORLD. HELPING FRAIL ISOLATED ELDERS WITH COMPANIONSHIP AND ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING CAN HELP THEM STAY IN THEIR HOME.  THIS AVOIDS COSTLY INSTITUTIONALIZATION, WHICH SHOULD BE RESERVED ONLY FOR THOSE WHO ARE UNABLE TO CARE FOR THEMSELVES EVEN WITH ASSISTANCE.  PROVIDING CAREGIVERS WITH RESPITE PROLONGS THEIR HEALTH AND ABILITY TO CARE FOR THEIR LOVED ONE. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS THEIR SAFETY NET, PROVIDING THE NECESSARY HOMEMAKER, COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE COMPONENTS THROUGH REGULAR AND CONSISTENT VISITS.  WHAT SETS US APART IS OUR PROVEN ABILITY TO NOT ONLY MANAGE BUT TO TRULY ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS -- WITH TRAINING, PEER SUPPORT AND ONGOING APPRECIATION EVENTS.  OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE ALSO LOW-INCOME SENIORS WHO BENEFIT BY STAYING ACTIVE AND PURPOSEFUL, DELAYING THEIR OWN NEED FOR SERVICES.

POSITIVE MATURITY WAS CREATED BY THE INDEPENDENT PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH IN 1971 WITH A MISSION OF ENHANCING THE LIVES OF OLDER ADULTS THROUGH SOCIAL SERVICES AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT. IN 1972 THE AGENCY BECAME INCORPORATED, RECEIVED ITS NON-PROFIT 501(C) 3 STATUS. ALSO IN 1972, POSITIVE MATURITY APPLIED FOR AND RECEIVED THE OPPORTUNITY TO BECOME A SPONSOR FOR THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE AND BEGAN TO OFFER JEFFERSON COUNTY ALABAMA THE RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (RSVP), WITHIN THREE YEARS OF STARTING THE PROGRAM, POSITIVE MATURITY EXPANDED INTO BLOUNT, SHELBY AND WALKER COUNTIES WITH THE RSVP PROGRAM AND APPLIED FOR AND RECEIVED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SPONSORSHIP.
THE NEED FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM CONTINUES TO GROW IN JEFFERSON COUNTY AS WELL AS ALABAMA. THE NUMBER OF AMERICANS AGES 65 AND OLDER IS PROJECTED TO MORE THAN DOUBLE FROM 46 MILLION TO OVER 98 MILLION BY 2060, AND THE 65-AND-OLDER AGE GROUP?S SHARE OF THE TOTAL POPULATION WILL RISE TO NEARLY 24 PERCENT FROM 15 PERCENT. JEFFERSON COUNTY ALABAMA PROJECTED POPULATION FOR 2018, WERE ESTIMATED AT 658, 466, (53.8% CAUCASIAN, 43.1% AFRICAN AMERICAN AND 4% HISPANIC, WITH 10% OF ADULTS 65 AND OLDER LIVING ALONE.  NON-INSTITUTIONALIZED ADULTS WITH ONE OR MORE DISABILITIES MAKE UP 16.8% OF JEFFERSON COUNTY'S POPULATION (43% OF THAT TOTAL ARE ADULTS OVER THE AGE OF 65) ACCORDING TO THE US CENSUS PROJECTIONS FOR 2018.  THIS PROJECTED NUMBER WILL MAKE IT INCREASINGLY URGENT TO IDENTIFY WAYS TO SUPPORT AGING WITH INDEPENDENCE. AMERICANS WANT TO AGE IN PLACE WITHIN THEIR OWN COMMUNITY, HOWEVER, HEALTH, THE ABILITY TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IS OFTEN SHAPED IN PART BY THEIR NEIGHBORHOODS AND SUPPORT SYSTEMS ACCORDING TO AN ARTICLE FROM THE POPULATION REFERENCE BUREAU (2017),
AGING WITH INDEPENDENCE IS IMPORTANT TO OLDER ADULTS, AS IT AFFORDS A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THEM AND THEIR FAMILIES. IT IS ALSO A FOUNDATIONAL AMERICAN VALUE THAT, WHEN ACHIEVED SAVES RESOURCES FOR SOCIETY TO USE IN OTHER WAYS. (US NATIONAL LIBRARY OF MEDICINE) 
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM CAN PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES THAT ADAPT TO THE NEEDS OF SENIORS, ALLOWING THEM TO REMAIN AT HOME AND CONTINUE TO ENGAGE WITH THEIR COMMUNITIES. VOLUNTEERS CAN ASSIST BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, HOUSEKEEPING AND MEAL PREPARATION TO SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, WHICH WILL ALLOW THEM TO CONTINUE TO AGE IN PLACE IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING SUPPORT, EDUCATION AND A SMALL STIPEND TO OFFSET THE COSTS OF VOLUNTEERING TO LOW-INCOME ADULTS AGES 55 AND OLDER IN THE JEFFERSON COUNTY AREA.
THE SUCCESS OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF JEFFERSON COUNTY IS ATTRIBUTED TO THE HARD WORK OF STAFF, A DEDICATED BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND ADVISORY COUNCIL. THE FUNDING FOR THE PROGRAM AND AGENCY IS VERY DIVERSE AND COMPRISED OF VARIOUS LOCAL, STATE AND COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS IN ADDITION TO FUNDRAISING EFFORTS.  EACH YEAR POSITIVE MATURITY ASSESSES THE NEEDS OF THE AGING COMMUNITY THROUGH RESEARCH, SURVEYS, AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS. THIS INFORMATION IS COMPARED TO AND INCORPORATED INTO A STRATEGIC PROCESS THAT GIVES OUR STAFF CLEAR GOALS AND OBJECTIVES TO REACH AS MANY GOALS AND PARTICIPANTS AS POSSIBLE WITH FUNDING THAT IS AVAILABLE.  POSITIVE MATURITY ALSO PARTNERS WITH SEVERAL COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TO ENSURE PARTICIPANTS HAVE ACCESS TO RESOURCES NEEDED TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT, ACTIVE AND ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE AGENCY SERVES AS AN ADVOCATE FOR ISSUES THAT PERTAIN TO THE AGING COMMUNITY AND ARE LOOKED TO AS LEADERS IN THE COMMUNITY.
POSITIVE MATURITY IS RESPECTFULLY REQUESTING $297,347 FROM CNCS FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM ($892,041 OVER THE COURSE OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT PERIOD). IN ADDITION TO THE CNCS FUNDING, POSITIVE MATURITY, INC. WILL SECURE SUPPLEMENTAL FUNDING FROM THE UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL ALABAMA, OTHER LOCAL, COUNTY AND STATE (NON-FEDERAL) RESOURCES AND THROUGH GENEROUS GRANTS/ DONATIONS MADE BY THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE. THE GOAL OF THE SENIORS COUNCIL SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IS TO RECRUIT, TRAIN AND PLACE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS INTO HOMES OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. PRIMARILY WE WILL BE SERVING CLIENTS WHO ARE HOMEBOUND, LIVING ALONE AND DISABLED. IN ADDITION, RESPITE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE THE PRIMARY CAREGIVERS HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES. SERVING IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES DESIGNED TO ENABLE THIS GROUP OF CLIENTS TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. SPECIFICALLY, SERVICES PROVIDED BY OUR SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL RESULT IN OUR CLIENTS HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AS WELL AS A PERCEPTION OF IMPROVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. IN ADDITION, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE RESPITE CARE SERVICES TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY RELIEF FROM THE STRESSES OF CARE GIVING BY PROVIDING SHORT-TERM ASSISTANCE TO AN ADULT WHO IS THE PRIMARY CAREGIVER FOR A PERSON WITH CHRONIC DISABILITIES, ALZHEIMER'S, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, ETC.  SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE ACTIVITIES THAT ENCOURAGE SOCIAL INTERACTION, INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, PROMOTE SELF-ESTEEM, IMPROVE MORAL, PROVIDE PEER SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE SOCIALLY APPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR. WE WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM THROUGH THE USE OF A SENIOR COMPANION LEADER. THE GRANT RENEWAL PERIOD FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS 2020-2023 FOR WHICH CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS REQUESTING $32,846 TO SUPPORT 6 VSYS AND AND MINIMUM OF 8 VOLUNTEERS.  THE AGENCY WIDE PRIORITY OUTCOME AND FOCUS FOR THE PROJECT WILL BE AGING IN PLACE AND CAREGIVER RESPITE TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR BOTH THE FRAIL SENIOR AND THEIR PRIMARY CAREGIVER.    
SERVICES WILL TARGET FRAIL SENIORS WHO HAVE ALZHEIMER'S AND OTHER CHRONIC DISEASES, AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. SUPPORTING THE SENIORS WISH TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, AND AT HOME, IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING RESTORATIVE TIME FOR THE PRIMARY CAREGIVER WILL BE THE PROJECTS' TARGET FOCUS.  ACTIVITIES FOR THE FAMILY MEMBER WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, PROTECTIVE SUPERVISION, ASSISTANCE WITH LIMITED ADLS AND ESCORT TO VITAL SERVICES, SUCH AS DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS WHEN APPROPRIATE AND LUNCH AT SENIOR CONGREGATE SITES FOR SOCIALIZATION ALSO AS APPROPRIATE.  
PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES HAVE SHOWN THAT THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE SENIOR COMPANIONS HAVE SUPPORTED THE SENIOR'S ABILITY TO REMAIN AT HOME WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY PROVIDING THE MUCH NEEDED RESPITE FOR THEIR CAREGIVER; A WIN-WIN OUTCOME FOR BOTH RECIPIENTS AND THE GRATIFICATION OF MAKING A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE THROUGH SERVICE FOR THE SCP.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE PREDICTION IS THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL HAVE SERVED APPROXIMATELY 96 FRAIL SENIORS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS FOR A TOTAL OF 192 INDIVIDUALS. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT A MINIMUM OF 80% OF THE CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT LESS STRESS, INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND ENHANCED QUALITY OF LIFE. HENRY STREET SETTLEMENT HAS BEEN PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE, INTEGRATED, AND HIGH-QUALITY SERVICES IN HEALTH CARE, SOCIAL SERVICES, AND THE ARTS SINCE 1893. THROUGH OUR SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION, HENRY STREET HAS CONTINUED TO PROVIDE LIFE-SAVING INTERVENTIONS FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGHOUT THE NEW YORK CITY AREA, INCLUDING AS THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE CITY-WIDE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP), THE LARGEST MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM IN NYC, OUR HENRY STREET SETTLEMENT SENIOR CENTER, AND OUR VLADECK CARES/NATURALLY OCCURRING RETIREMENT COMMUNITY (NORC). THE CURRENT CORONAVIRUS PANDEMIC HAS SHOWN THE NECESSITY OF OUR SERVICES TO SENIORS, AND OUR PROGRAMS HAVE CONTINUED TO OPERATE AT A HIGH LEVEL, PROVIDING MEALS, CONDUCTING WELLNESS CHECKS, NURSING VISITS, AND COMPANIONSHIP PHONE CALLS TO MORE THAN 2,000 SENIORS.  

NOW, MORE THAN EVER, IT IS CRITICAL TO HAVE PROGRAMS LIKE SCP THAT CAN ASSIST SENIORS AND ENSURE THEY DON'T BECOME ISOLATED AND RECEIVE VITAL SERVICES. HENRY STREET IS PROUD TO OPERATE OUR SCP PROGRAM AND TO SUBMIT THIS RENEWAL APPLICATION. OVER THE GRANT PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2020 TO JUNE 30, 2023, HENRY STREET WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR 105 SCP VOLUNTEERS. ALL OF OUR SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN THE SCP PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE. SCP ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, ESCORTING SENIORS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES, AND ASSISTING THEM WITH TASKS OF DAILY LIVING. IF SOCIAL DISTANCING REQUIREMENTS ARE STILL IN EFFECT LATER IN 2020, OUR SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL CONDUCT PHONE CALLS RATHER THAN IN-PERSON VISITS, WHICH WE HAVE DONE SUCCESSFULLY OVER THE PAST MONTH. SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE TRAINED TO IDENTIFY CLIENT NEEDS, TO PROVIDE SOCIAL STIMULATION, TO BE FAMILIAR WITH LOCAL RESOURCES, AND TO CONNECT CLIENTS WITH THEIR SUPERVISORS IF AND WHEN CLIENTS ARE IN NEED OF IMMEDIATE INTERVENTION OR CASE MANAGEMENT. AT THE END OF OUR CONTINUED GRANT, HENRY STREET ANTICIPATES THAT 90% OF OUR SENIOR COMPANION CLIENTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SCP PERFORMANCE MEASURE H9A. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $537,832 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $77,625 FROM IN-KIND AND PRIVATE SOURCES.

THE MISSION OF THE NYS OFFICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES (OPWDD) IS TO HELP PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES TO LIVE RICHER LIVES.  THE VISION SUPPORTS ENJOYMENT OF MEANINGFUL RELATIONSHIPS IN THE LIVES OF PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WITH FRIENDS, FAMILY AND OTHERS, EXPERIENCING PERSONAL HEALTH AND GROWTH, LIVING IN THE HOME OF THEIR CHOICE, HAVING A JOB IN THE COMMUNITY AND FULLY PARTICIPATION IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.  GUIDING PRINCIPLES ON HOW THE OPWDD CONDUCTS ITS BUSINESS INCLUDE "PUTTING PEOPLE FIRST" BY MAXIMIZING OPPORTUNITIES AS NEEDED WITH SUPPORTS AND SERVICES.  OPWDD PROMOTES EXCELLENCE IN SERVICES, WHILE REQUIRING ACCOUNTABILITY AND RESPONSIBILITY  AND BY NURTURING PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS.  AS A SUPPORT TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED WITHIN OPWDD TO THE NYS POPULATION OF PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, THE FEDERAL GRANT WILL PROVIDE 60 VSY'S AND AN OVERALL GRANT BUDGET OF $ $267,604 WITHIN THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR 2020-2021. THE STIPEND WILL BE INCREASED TO $3.00 PER HOUR AND $4000 EXTRA WILL BE GIVE EACH YEAR BY CNCS FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF THE PROGRAM. NYS OPWDD WILL SUPPLEMENT OVER $1.5 MILLION.   SERVICE CATEGORIES TO BE ADDRESSED INCLUDE PROMOTING HEALTH AND INDEPENDENCE VIA ASSISTANCE WITH "ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING", PROMOTING INDIVIDUALIZATION VIA RECREATION AND LEISURE ACTIVITIES AND STRIVING FOR PREPAREDNESS AND INDEPENDENCE IN "COMMUNITY INCLUSION" WHICH ADDRESSES LIVING IN THE GENERAL COMMUNITY AND GETTING INVOLVED IN VOLUNTEERING, EMPLOYMENT, DEVELOPING RELATIONSHIPS, AND PARTICIPATING IN PROGRAMS WITH THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AS THEY MOVE IN TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.  THE SCP WILL ASSIST IN EDUCATING THE PUBLIC ON THE BENEFIT OF INCLUDING PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES INTO COMMUNITY NEIGHBORHOODS, JOB SITES AND ACTIVITIES.  IT WILL ALSO BENEFIT THE SENIOR COMMUNITY POPULATION BY OFFERING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THEIR INVOLVEMENT WHILE PROMOTING A BETTER LIFESTYLE WITH THE STIPEND SUPPORT OF THIS PROGRAM. IN THE 2020-2023 PROJECT GRANT PERIOD, THE FOCUS TO FURTHER INVOLVE SC'S IN COMMUNITY INNOVATIONS VIA VOLUNTEERING/EMPLOYMENT, COMMUNITY, ARTS, SENIOR CENTERS, AND OPENING MANY MORE SC SITES WITHIN OPWDD  AND  THE VOLUNTARY SECTOR SERVING PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.  OVER 3 YEARS OF THIS GRANT, AN ESTIMATED 600 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE MORE THAN 1200 INDIVIDUALS.  FURTHER EFFORTS TO UTILIZE SC'S IN OPPORTUNITIES LIKE EMPLOYMENT SUPPORT, FAITH BASED ACTIVITIES, RETIREMENT AND OTHER COMMUNITY BASED OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE PRIORITIZED TO SUPPORT FURTHER INCLUSION AND INDEPENDENCE TO PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $802,812 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY OPWDD WITH MORE THAN $4 MILLION IN THE MONTHS APRIL 1, 2020- MARCH 31, 2023.

CPAC WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 58 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE 58 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY) AS SENIOR COMPANIONS. OF THIS NUMBER, 100% OF SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
* PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES TO HOME-BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS 
* ASSISTING INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH SCP VOLUNTEERS ASSISTING SENIORS IN INDEPENDENT LIVING (AGING IN PLACE) BY SUPPORTING THE ABILITY OF HOME-BOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OUR PROGRAM EXPECTS TO HAVE SUPPORTED 52 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS OF COMPANIONSHIP TO RESIDENTS IN CAMDEN, BURLINGTON, AND GLOUCESTER COUNTIES ANNUALLY, RESULTING IN INCREASED NUMBERS OF SENIORS LIVING INDEPENDENTLY, SOCIALLY AND SAFELY.  AN ADDITIONAL 6 INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL BE SERVED ALLOWING THEM TO CONTINUE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ $374,633 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $39,951 IN PRIVATE, LOCAL, STATE AND IN-KIND CONTRIBUTION.

IF AWARDED A SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM GRANT THROUGH CNCS, SENIOR CITIZENS LIVING IN CAMDEN, BURLINGTON, AND GLOUCESTER COUNTIES, NEW JERSEY WILL RECEIVE OVER 60,000 HOURS OF SENIOR COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES ANNUALLY THROUGH THE COMMUNITY PLANNING AND ADVOCACY COUNCIL'S (CPAC) SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. 

CPAC UTILIZES A FRAMEWORK FOR FAMILY SUCCESS REFERRED TO AS "THE COVENANT FOR CHILDREN, YOUTH AND FAMILIES". THE COVENANT ACKNOWLEDGES THAT DEVELOPMENTALLY APPROPRIATE RESOURCES AND SERVICES ARE REQUIRED FOR FAMILIES TO SUCCESSFULLY SUPPORT THEIR CHILDREN'S DEVELOPMENTAL JOURNEYS TO ADULTHOOD,
BEGINNING BEFORE BIRTH. THE "JOURNEYS OF FAMILY SUCCESS" GUIDING FRAMEWORK PROVIDES A UNIFYING VISION FOR GOALS AROUND CHILD AND FAMILY DEVELOPMENT, UNDER THE COVENANT, IN CAMDEN COUNTY. 

THE DEVELOPMENTAL STAGES OF THE LIFE REPRESENT THE JOURNEY, AND ITS GOALS:
EARLY CHILDHOOD SUCCESS (0-8 YEARS OLD); POSITIVE YOUTH DEVELOPMENT (9-17 YEARS OLD); STRONG TRANSITIONS TO ADULTHOOD (18-26 YEARS OLD); AND STRONG FAMILIES, STRONG COMMUNITIES (INCLUSIVE OF PRODUCTIVE ADULTHOOD AND SUCCESSFUL AGING).  ADDITIONALLY, THE JOURNEY OF FAMILY SUCCESS IS SUPPORTED ACROSS FOUR GENERAL LIFE DOMAINS, OR "PILLARS": 1) GOOD HEALTH AND WELL-BEING, 2) PERSONAL SAFETY, EQUAL OPPORTUNITY, AND FINANCIAL SECURITY, 3) STRONG FAMILY RELATIONSHIPS AND COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS AND 4) HIGH-QUALITY LEARNING AND EDUCATION.

THROUGH THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FOR CAMDEN, GLOUCESTER AND BURLINGTON COUNTIES, CPAC WILL ADDRESS THE LIFE JOURNEY OF PRODUCTIVE ADULTHOOD AND SUCCESSFUL AGING. THE PILLARS OF GOOD HEALTH AND WELL-BEING, PERSONAL SAFETY AND COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS WILL BE ACTUALIZED THROUGH THE SERVICES OF VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE AS COMPANIONS TO SUPPORT OTHER ADULTS IN NEED OF EXTRA ASSISTANCE TO REMAIN AT HOME OR IN THE COMMUNITY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. THESE EFFORTS ALIGN WITH THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA IDENTIFIED BY THE NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE ACT OF 1990, AS AMENDED BY THE SERVE AMERICA ACT.

AN ESTIMATED 55 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND THE CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $286,860 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $74,549 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM THE AGE STRONG COMMISSION (FORMALLY KNOWN AS THE COMMISSION ON AFFAIRS OF THE ELDERLY). 

ADDITIONALLY, SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BENEFIT FROM BEING CONNECTED THROUGH THE SCP TO THE CITY'S MANY PROGRAMS AND SERVICES, INCLUDING CIVIC ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES, COMMUNITY EVENTS, AND RESOURCES.

ALL OF THE ESTIMATED 70 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE A TOTAL OF 62 VSY'S IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF BUILDING A "HEALTHY FUTURE" FOR THE MOST VULNERABLE IN OUR COMMUNITY.    100% OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN PROVIDING COMPANION AND RESPITE SERVICES TO FRAIL OLDER ADULTS AGE 65 AND OLDER AND/OR TO ADULTS UNDER AGE 65 WHO HAVE ONE OR MORE PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL HEALTH LIMITATIONS.   ALL SERVICES WILL BE BASED IN-HOME TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY.  SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION; ESCORT TO MEDICAL, BUSINESS OR SOCIAL APPOINTMENTS; ASSISTANCE WITH INSTRUMENTAL ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING, INFORMATION AND ACCESS TO OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES.   THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NETWORK OF 11 VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN THE GREATER WATERBURY AREA. 
AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT:
 1)    85 (94%) OF 90 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO RECEIVE A MINIMUM OF 24 HOURS OF COMPANION SERVICES  WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND,
 2)   25 (83%) OF 30 CAREGIVERS WHO RECEIVE A MINIMUM OF 24 HOURS OF RESPITE SERVICE FOR THEIR FRAIL FAMILY MEMBER WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.   
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $340,578 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $62,422 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FOR A TOTAL OF $403,000.

THE SENIOR COMPANIONS PROGRAM OF HARRIS COUNTY (SCP) SERVING IN HOUSTON, HARRIS COUNTY TEXAS WILL PLACE AN ESTIMATED 43 VOLUNTEERS IN THE NEXT TWELVE MONTHS WITH APPROXIMATELY 10 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, (PUBLIC, NON-PROFITS AND PROPRIETARY HEALTH CARE AGENCIES) TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP, ESCORTS TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, SHOPPING, AND LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION THAT SUPPORTS INDEPENDENT LIVING AND PROVIDES RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS. 

VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE HOUSTON, HARRIS COUNTY COMMUNITY.  THE ESTIMATED POPULATION IN HOUSTON, TEXAS, BASED ON US CENSUS BUREAU DATA REPORTED IN JULY, 2018 IS 2,325,502 WITH 10.1% OVER THE AGE OF 65 YEARS OF AGE AND IN HARRIS COUNTY THE 2016 ESTIMATED POPULATION OF 4,698, 619 WITH 10.2% OVER THE AGE OF 65 YEARS OF AGE.

AT THE END OF 12 MONTHS, AN ESTIMATED 15 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT OR IMPROVED CAPACITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER AND 25 CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER.  

THE AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDING REQUESTED FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE IS $260,106, SUPPLEMENTED BY $6,476 FROM THE STATE OF TEXAS AND $164,064 IN CASH AND IN-KIND SUPPORT FROM FOUNDATIONS, VOLUNTEER STATIONS AND OTHER COMMUNITY SUPPORTERS.

THE CITY OF CORPUS CHRISTI HAS SPONSORED THE LOCAL SENIOR COMPANION (SCP) FOR OVER 25 YEARS. THE CITY DELIVERS MUNICIPAL SERVICES WHICH MEET THE VITAL HEALTH, SAFETY AND GENERAL WELFARE NEEDS OF ITS RESIDENTS. AS IN PAST YEARS, THE CITY OF CORPUS CHRISTI IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE HEALTH NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AIMED AT AGING IN PLACE. WE WILL HONOR THIS COMMITMENT BY WORKING TO PROVIDE HEALTHY FUTURES TO OUR SENOR POPULATION 55 AND UP AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES. THROUGH OUR PARTNERSHIP WITH CNCS, WE WILL PLACE A MINIMUM OF 68 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS TO MEET THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES. A MINIMUM OF 35 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE GENERAL COMPANIONSHIP TO 50 HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS, AND/OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. THESE INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE SERVICES SUCH AS GENERAL COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION THAT ALLOWS THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED ACCORDING TO CLIENT?S NEEDS. VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE A MINIMUM OF 15 HOURS UP TO THE MAXIMUM OF 40 HOURS ALLOWED PER SERVICE PER WEEK. THE HOURS MAY BE ACCUMULATED WITH MORE THAN 1 CLIENT, BUT NOT MORE THAN 4 CLIENTS PER WEEK. THE PROJECTED OUTCOME IS 85% OF CLIENTS SURVEYED WILL INDICATE THEY FEEL LESS LONELY AND HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT. IN ADDITION, A MINIMUM OF 33 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO A MINIMUM OF 40 CAREGIVERS WHO ARE CARING FOR INDIVIDUALS UNABLE TO LEAVE THEIR RESIDENCE DUE TO DISABILITY, INJURY, OR AGE. THE VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE A MINIMUM OF 5 HOURS OF SERVICE TO THE MAXIMUM ALLOWED 40 HOURS TO 1 OR MORE CAREGIVERS PER WEEK. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS THAT 85% OF CLIENTS SURVEYED WILL INDICATED THEY ARE EXPERIENCING LESS STRESS AND HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT THAT WILL HELP THEM CONTINUE CARING FOR THEIR LOVED ONE AT HOME. WE ANTICIPATE A TOTAL OF 68 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS SERVING THROUGHOUT THE YEAR TO MEET THE 68 VSYS (75,592 HOURS OF SERVICE PER YEAR) WE ARE FUNDED FOR. SCP STAFF WILL WORK WITH 15 ACTIVE VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WHICH INCLUDE THE AREA AGENCY OF AGING OF THE COASTAL BEND, NUECES COUNTY VETERAN AGENCY AFFAIRS DEPARTMENT, LOCAL HEALTH, AND HUMAN AND NON-PROFIT/GOVERNMENT AGENCIES TO IDENTIFIED CLIENT NEEDS AND CREATE WORK PLANS THAT ADDRESS THE OVERALL PROGRAM GOALS AND OBJECTIONS. WE WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH NUECES COUNTY AND LOCAL VETERAN?S AFFAIRS GROUPS IN ORDER TO RECRUIT VETERANS AS SENIOR COMPANIONS. THROUGH OUR VETERANS-HELPING-VETERANS, PRIORITY WILL BE PLACED ON SCHEDULING VETERANS WITH OTHER VETERANS NEEDING SCP PROGRAMMING. THE AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDS REQUESTED IN THIS PROPOSAL IS $340,270. THE CITY OF CORPUS CHRISTI WILL PROVIDE 18.9% MATCHING FUNDS (IN-KIND/STATE FUNDING NOT INCLUDED). SOFTWARE DESIGNED SPECIFICALLY FOR SCP WILL BE USED TO TRACK AND REPORT VOLUNTEER HOURS, VOLUNTEER STIPENDS, VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS, CLIENT INFORMATION, VOLUNTEER STATION INFORMATION AND VOLUNTEER ENROLLMENT INFORMATION. THE DATABASE WILL RECORD WORK PLANS IN ORDER TO DETERMINE PROGRAM OUTCOMES.

THE CONCHO VALLEY COUNCIL OF GOVERNMENTS (CVCOG) IS APPLYING FOR A RENEWAL OF A THREE-YEAR CNCS GRANT IN THE AMOUNT OF $231,417 PER YEAR FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) FOR THE PERIOD OF JULY 2019 - JUNE 2022.  THE CVCOG HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN ITS FOURTEEN COUNTY SERVICE AREA SINCE THE EARLY 1990'S AND HAS THE EXPERTISE AND ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT SYSTEM REQUIRED TO ADMINISTER THE PROGRAM IN COMPLIANCE WITH FEDERAL FINANCIAL AND PROGRAMMATIC REQUIREMENTS WHILE PROVIDING A HIGH LEVEL OF SERVICE TO THE CLIENTS SERVED BY OUR SENIOR COMPANIONS.   

AN ESTIMATED 42 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PROGRAM AND WE PLAN TO PLACE ALL 42 VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: (1) PROVIDING IN-HOME COMPANIONSHIP FOR ELDERLY HOMEBOUND INDIVIDUALS, (2) ENCOURAGING GOOD NUTRITIONAL HABITS, (3) PROVIDING RESPITE CARE SERVICES TO ALLOW FULL-TIME CAREGIVER THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEAVE THE HOME TO GO TO WORK OR TO HAVE PERSONAL TIME AWAY FROM THE STRESSES OF BEING A CAREGIVER, (4) ENGAGING THE CLIENT WITH ACTIVITIES THAT WILL HELP STIMULATE COGNITIVE AND PHYSICAL FUNCTIONS, AND (5) HELPING TO PROVIDE A SAFE LIVING ENVIRONMENT FOR THE CLIENT.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE PROJECT THAT WE WILL BE SERVING ANNUALLY 20 CLIENTS WITH RESPITE CARE SERVICES AND 45 CLIENTS WITH INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES. OUR OUTCOME GOAL IS THAT 90% OF THOSE CLIENTS RECEIVING RESPITE CARE SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING A FEELING OF INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND THAT 90% OF THOSE CLIENTS RECEIVING COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING AN INCREASED SENSE OF SELF-ESTEEM AND INDEPENDENCE.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $231,417 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A $6,475 GRANT FROM THE STATE OF TEXAS THROUGH THE DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICE AS WELL AS AN ESTIMATED $19,200 IN IN-KIND DONATIONS FROM LOCAL AGENCIES.  THE PRIMARY SOURCE OF LOCAL IN-KIND DONATIONS WILL COME FROM THE CONCHO VALLEY TRANSIT WHICH PROVIDES BUS TRANSPORTATION SERVICES TO OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS AT A REDUCED RATE AS A SHOW OF SUPPORT FOR OUR PROGRAM.

SUNBEAM FAMILY SERVICES IS SEEKING CONTINUED FUNDING FOR ITS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, WHICH EXPECTS TO HAVE AN ESTIMATED 105 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS NEXT YEAR. SUNBEAM?S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROVIDES QUALITY, IN-HOME SUPPORT TO NEARLY 250 OKLAHOMA SENIORS EACH YEAR THROUGH COMPANIONSHIP AND STIPEND VOLUNTEERISM. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FOCUSES ON AGING IN PLACE OUTCOMES AS DOCUMENTED IN OUR WORK PLANS.  WE CONNECT SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WITH SENIOR CLIENTS WHO ARE HOMEBOUND, DUE TO ILLNESS OR AGE, AND IN NEED OF SUPPORT TO LIVE IN THEIR OWN HOME LONGER. SUPPORTIVE SERVICES PROVIDED BY SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS CAN INCLUDE LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, PLAYING GAMES, AND TALKING WITH THE CLIENT. THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF THIS DUAL-PURPOSE PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE HEALTH OUTCOMES FOR SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS, BY KEEPING THEM ACTIVE AND ENGAGED IN THEIR OWN COMMUNITY, AND FOR THE SENIOR CLIENT, BY DECREASING ISOLATION AND DELAYING A MOVE TO COSTLY INSTITUTIONALIZED LIVING.

SUNBEAM IS DEDICATED TO PROVIDING THE HIGHEST QUALITY OF CARE FOR THOSE THAT PAVED A WAY FOR CURRENT GENERATIONS. OUR NATIONALLY ACCREDITED PROGRAM HAS A STRONG TRADITION OF BEING ON THE LEADING EDGE OF INNOVATION FOR SENIOR SERVICES. SUNBEAM'S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM BEGAN IN 1974 AS ONE OF CNCS?S 18 PILOT PROGRAMS ACROSS THE COUNTRY. THE PROGRAM REMAINS AN INTEGRAL PART OF SUNBEAM'S PROGRAMMING AND PLAYS A CRUCIAL ROLE IN THE CONTINUUM OF CARE AVAILABLE TO SENIORS IN THE OKLAHOMA CITY AREA. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM CONTINUES TO STAY ON THE CUTTING EDGE OF BEST PRACTICES FOR KEEPING SENIORS IN THEIR HOMES AND STAFF SERVE ON VARIOUS ADVISORY PANELS AND COMMITTEES AS A RESOURCE FOR LOCAL PROFESSIONAL AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS LOOKING TO IMPACT SENIORS.

WE GRATEFULLY REQUEST $416,143 FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FOR OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. THIS FEDERAL INVESTMENT FROM CNCS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $235,999 FROM OTHER PRIVATE AND PUBLIC FUNDERS.
