*	CITY OF TUCUMCARI/ QUAY COUNTY, COUNTY/REGION HAS A SENIOR POPULATION OF 1750.  SOCIAL ISOLATION IN THE ELDERLY IS A COMMON OCCURRENCE FREQUENTLY BROUGHT ABOUT DUE TO DISABILITIES, ILLNESSES AND LOSS OF "SOCIAL SUPPORT SYSTEMS DUE TO THE DEATH OF A SPOUSE, SIBLINGS, RETIREMENT AND/OR RELOCATION OF RESIDENCE."   ACCORDING TO WWW.PUBMED.GOV, A SERVICE OF THE LIBRARY OF MEDICINE AND THE NATIONAL INSTITUTES OF HEALTH, IN AN ARTICLE PUBLISHED BY MARTIN-DU-PAN R. AND COLLART E. SIMEONE I. (HTTP://WWW.NCBI.NLM.NIH.GOV/ENTREZ/QUERY.FCGI?CMD=SEARCH&DB=PUBMED, ABSTRACT OF ARTICLE ORIGINALLY PUBLISHED IN FRENCH IN SCHWEIZ RUNDSCH MED PRAX. 1991 NOV 12;80(46):1287-90), "FOR THE AGED, SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS ARE AMONG THE MOST FREQUENT CAUSES OF HOSPITALIZATION OR PLACEMENT IN HOMES."  RESEARCHERS FOUND THAT COHABITATION OF THOSE AGED 65 AND OLDER IS LESS FREQUENT WITH ADVANCING AGE.  SOCIAL ISOLATION IS CHARACTERIZED BY "EXTREMELY INFREQUENT CONTACTS WITH OTHER PEOPLE, AFFECTS APPROXIMATELY ONE OUT OF TEN ELDERLY PEOPLE."  THOSE AT HIGHEST RISK FOR SOCIAL ISOLATION INCLUDE THOSE WHO ARE IN LOWER SOCIO-ECONOMIC BRACKETS, DIVORCED PEOPLE AND WIDOWERS.  FURTHERMORE, A STUDY CONDUCTED BY UNITED NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSES IN NEW YORK CITY (SPECIAL REPORT DATED SPRING 2005, HTTP://WWW.UNHNY.ORG/ADVOCACY/PDF/AGING%20IN%20THE%20SHADOWS.PDF),  FOUND THAT "BABY BOOMERS, WHO WILL COMPOSE THE LARGEST COHORT GROUP OF SENIORS EVER, ARE MORE AT-RISK FOR SOCIAL ISOLATION THAN THEIR PARENTS."  A STUDY REPORTED IN USA TODAY ON JUNE 23, 2006 FOUND THAT 25% OF AMERICANS HAVE NO ONE TO CONFIDE IN AND HAS LINKED SOCIAL ISOLATION "TO MENTAL AND PHYSICAL ILLNESS."

RESEARCH --BASED METHODS:
*	VOLUNTEER RECORD/ ACTIVITY LOG
*	SELF ASSESSMENT

PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES:
*	CLIENTS WILL REPORT THAT THEY ARE MORE ENGAGED IN SOCIAL OR RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES DUE TO VISITS FROM THE SCP VOLUNTEER.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF SAN JUAN COUNTY IS NORTHWEST NEW MEXICO SENIORS, INC. (NNMSI). THIS IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION DEDICATED TO IMPROVING THE HEALTH, WELFARE AND INDEPENDENCE OF SENIOR CITIZENS. THIS PROGRAM ADMINISTERS TO 5 AREA SENIOR CENTERS INCLUDING:  AZTEC, BLANCO, BLOOMFIELD, KIRTLAND AND LOWER VALLEY FRUITLAND, AND FARMINGTON.  THE SENIOR PROGRAMS FACILITATED BY NNMSI INCLUDE FUNDING FOR:  CONGREGATE MEALS AND MEALS-ON-WHEELS, A TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AND SUPPORT FOR THESE PROGRAMS WITH PARTIAL STAFFING AT ALL OF THE SENIOR CENTERS.  THIS ORGANIZATION ALSO FUNDS A HOMEMAKER AND RESPITE PROGRAM FOR SENIORS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS CORPORATION SHALL BE TO PROMOTE THE WELFARE OF OLDER CITIZENS WITHIN SAN JUAN COUNTY, NEW MEXICO BY PROVIDING MEANS FOR NUTRITIONAL, SOCIAL, RECREATIONAL, EDUCATIONAL, CULTURAL, AND HEALTH SUPPORT, AND BY PROMOTING PROJECTS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THESE PEOPLE.

NORTHWEST NEW MEXICO SENIORS, INC. ALSO ADMINISTERS THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.  THIS INCORPORATES MANY OF THE VALUES AND DIRECTIVES THAT NORTHWEST NEW MEXICO SENIORS REPRESENTS.  

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF SAN JUAN COUNTY CALLS FOR 8 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY?S) FROM FEDERAL AND 2 VSY?S FROM THE STATE.  TO FUND THESE VOLUNTEERS WE ARE ASKING FOR $33,454.00.  THIS IS AN ADDITION OF $1,593.00 FROM OUR PREVIOUS REQUESTS.

THE SERVICE CATEGORIES OUR PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE MAINLY UNDER THE FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, THEY INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:  CONGREGATE MEALS, INDEPENDENT LIVING, IN-HOME CARE, RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS, AND TRANSPORTATION FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.

THE COMMUNITY NEEDS OUR PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS ARE THE SENIOR POPULATION OF SAN JUAN COUNTY, WHICH IS 126,926, AS OF 2017, WITH A MEDIAN INCOME OF ESTIMATED $22,927 A YEAR AS SHOWN IN THE 2016 CENSUS. SAN JUAN COUNTY, NEW MEXICO HAS A SERIOUS TRANSPORTATION PROBLEM, ESPECIALLY IN BLOOMFIELD AND KIRTLAND, NM. THESE TOWNS HAVE NO RELIABLE FORMS OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR THE SENIORS TO GET TO APPOINTMENTS OR EVEN SHOP FOR THEIR HOUSEHOLDS NEEDS TO FUNCTION ON A NORMAL LEVEL.

WE HOLD PUBLIC HEARINGS AT OUR FIVE SENIOR CENTERS TO HEAR ABOUT THE NEEDS OF OUR SENIOR POPULATION IN SAN JUAN COUNTY.  WE WORK TO PUT TO USE SUGGESTIONS MADE BY THE SENIORS FROM THESE SURVEYS, TO HELP US ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE SENIOR COMMUNITY.  THESE HEARINGS HELP SHAPE  THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF HELPING THIS SPECIFIC POPULATION MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE LONGER, WHILE SUPPORTING INDEPENDENT LIVING, NUTRITION, TRANSPORTATION FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING, RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, AND IN-HOME CARE.  WE STRIVE TO HELP AS MANY SENIORS IN NEED AS IS FISCALLY POSSIBLE.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:

THE SPONSOR (PHELPS COUNTY COMMISSION) HAS BEEN A PART OF PHELPS COUNTY MISSOURI SINCE 1857.  THEY HAVE BEEN THE SPONSOR OF THE PHELPS COUNTY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SINCE JULY 1, 1976.  THE COMMISSION OVERSEES ALL ASPECT OF COUNTY MANAGEMENT SUCH AS THE MAINTENANCE OF ROADS, BRIDGES AND HIGHWAYS AS WELL AS BUDGETING ISSUES FOR ALL OFFICES LOCATED IN THE PHELPS COUNTY COURTHOUSE.  

PURPOSE:  THE PURPOSE OF THE PROGRAM FUNDED UNDER THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE IS TO HELP INDIVIDUALS 21 AND OVER IN THE COMMUNITY LIVE FULLER MORE INDEPENDENT LIVES.  THEY ENABLE AT RISK ADULTS LIVING IN RURAL AND OFTENTIMES ISOLATED AREAS TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES LONGER, AND HELP PREVENT FEELINGS OF LONELINESS AND ISOLATION WHILE IMPROVING SELF ESTEEM AND ALSO GIVE TIME OFF TO FAMILIES OR FAMILY CAREGIVERS BY PROVIDING RESPITE CARE. HAVING A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER TO HELP SOMEONE REMAIN INDEPENDENT LONGER MAY HELP SOME DELAY USE OF MEDICAID FUNDS FOR NURSING HOME PLACEMENTS. 

MAJOR ACTIVITIES:  THE PROGRAM IS FUNDED FOR 73 VOLUNTEERS AGES 55 AND OVER TO SERVE OVER 125 ADULTS AGES 21 AND OVER WITH PARTICULAR NEEDS THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE COUNTY OF PHELPS IN THE CITIES OF:   ROLLA, ST. JAMES, NEWBURG, EDGAR SPRINGS AS WELL AS THE UNINCORPORATED VILLAGE OF JEROME.   SUCH NEEDS CAN INCLUDE:  LACK OF TRANSPORTATION, RESPITE, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING AND COMPANIONSHIP.  

THE VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL SERVE AS SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE LIMITED INCOME INDIVIDUALS WHO MUST QUALIFY AS BEING AT OR UNDER 200% NATIONAL POVERTY GUIDELINES.  THESE INDIVIDUALS ARE THEN ELIGIBLE FOR PROGRAM BENEFITS SUCH AS A STIPEND OF $2.65 PER SERVICE HOUR, MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT AND ACCIDENT INSURANCE AND A YEARLY PHYSICAL.  

THE VOLUNTEERS RECEIVE DIRECT SUPERVISION OUT IN THE FIELD FROM VOLUNTEER STATIONS.  SOME EXAMPLES OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN PHELPS COUNTY WOULD BE: THE ROLLA APARTMENTS AND THE MISSOURI VETERANS HOME LOCATED IN ST. JAMES MISSOURI; THESE STATIONS HELP MAKE AND SUPERVISE ASSIGNMENTS WHERE THEY ARE NEEDED.

VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE RECEIVED 40 HOURS PRE-SERVICE TRAINING, A PHYSICAL FROM A LICENSED PHYSICIAN, A BACKGROUND SCREENING, AND BACKGROUND PROFILE BEFORE BEING GIVEN AN ASSIGNMENT WHICH WILL HELP THE PROGRAM COORDINATOR IN DETERMINING THE CORRECT VOLUNTEER FOR THE ASSIGNMENT.   VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO RECEIVE ON-GOING MONTHLY TRAINING WHICH WILL FOCUS ON PREPARATION, CONTINUED GUIDANCE AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT.  VOLUNTEER APPRECIATION AND RECOGNITION EVENTS WILL AID IN RETENTION OF VOLUNTEERS.  

FUNDING FROM THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT A FULL TIME DIRECTOR (100%)  A FULL TIME COORDINATOR (100%) AND A PART TIME ADMINISTRATIVE ASSISTANT (100%).  THE PROGRAM IS REQUIRED TO FUND THE PROJECT IN PART THROUGH LOCAL, NON-FEDERAL CONTRIBUTIONS.  THE REQUIRED LOCAL CONTRIBUTION AMOUNT MUST BE AT LEAST 10% AND CAN BE CASH OR IN-KIND MATCHING FUNDS.  THE ANNUAL FEDERAL AMOUNT, ($356,841.0) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY OVER 10 % ($71,212.00) NON-FEDERAL MATCH FUNDS.

ST. MARY?S MEDICAL CENTER WAS FOUNDED IN 1896 WITH A MISSION OF SERVING OTHERS, ESPECIALLY THOSE WHO ARE POOR OR VULNERABLE. CELEBRATING 29 YEARS OF SERVICE IN MESA COUNTY, COLORADO, THE ST. MARY?S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) SUPPORTS THIS MISSION, BY SERVING NON-DRIVING ELDERS WHO HAVE UNMET NEEDS FOR TRANSPORTATION FOR HEALTH AND DENTAL CARE, GROCERY SHOPPING, ERRANDS, AND OTHER ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING. AN ESTIMATED 24 UNDUPLICATED SC VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE HOMEBOUND ELDERS PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTH FUTURES WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 250 HOMEBOUND ELDERS WILL HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $131,788 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $50,180 OF NON-FEDERAL MATCH AND $39,865 OF EXCESS.

AN ESTIMATED 87 SCP'S (SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS) VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENROLLED IN THE PROGRAM. SENIOR COMPANIONS ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, MEAL PREPARATION, LIGHT HOUSEWORK, TRANSPORTATION, SCHEDULING APPOINTMENTS, RESPITE FOR CARE-GIVERS, VETERAN'S IN-HOME SUPPORT AND REFERRALS TO OTHER SERVICES AVAILABLE TO IN THE COMMUNITIES SERVED . THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS INDEPENDENT LIVING WHICH IS A FEDERALLY RECOGNIZED ACTIVITY. AT THE END OF EACH YEAR A PROJECTED 300 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVED SERVICE THROUGH PEER SUPPORT FROM 87 SCP VOLUNTEERS. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 10 % MATCH RAISED THROUGH CASH CONTRIBUTIONS AND IN-KIND MATCH BY LOCAL SUPPORTERS OF THE GOALS AND OBJECTIVES OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.

     SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CLIENTS WITH COMPANIONSHIP AND ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING (ADLS) AND INSTRUMENTAL ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING (IADL'S), ALLOWING THEM TO LIVE MORE INDEPENDENTLY AND PROVIDING FOR CAREGIVER RESPITE.  SCP VOLUNTEERS VISIT CLIENTS ONE TO FIVE DAYS PER WEEK FOR A MINIMUM OF FOUR HOURS PER DAY OVER 52 WEEKS PER YEAR. 
     SENIOR SERVICES CURRENTLY SPONSORS 14 VOLUNTEER STATIONS THROUGHOUT OUR EIGHT SERVICE JURISDICTIONS. WE DIRECTLY OPERATE EIGHT (8) OF THESE VOLUNTEER STATIONS WITHIN OUR LOCAL OFFICES AND/OR WELLNESS CENTERS, AND PARTNER WITH AN ADDITIONAL SIX (6) COMMUNITY PROVIDERS, HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, DEPARTMENTS OF SOCIAL SERVICES, AND HOUSING AUTHORITIES THAT SERVE OUR TARGET POPULATION OF SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES 60 YEARS AND OLDER. OUR VOLUNTEER STATION ROSTER HAS CHANGED SINCE LAST YEAR'S CONTINUATION GRANT SUBMISSION.  WE WERE UNABLE TO MAKE A SCP VOLUNTEER MATCH AT JEWISH FAMILY SERVICES - EVEN AFTER MULTIPLE ATTEMPTS. THIS STATION IS CURRENTLY INACTIVE.  WE ARE WORKING TO ESTABLISH VOLUNTEER STATIONS THROUGHOUT OUR SERVICE AREA AND TO EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS OUTSIDE OF THOSE WE NORMALLY CULTIVATE. FOR INSTANCE, OUR OBJECTIVE IS TO MAINTAIN CURRENT COLLABORATIONS AMONG OUR TRADITIONAL PARTNERS WHILE CULTIVATING RELATIONSHIPS WITH PRIVATE SENIOR HOUSING COMPLEXES (THOSE NOT OPERATED BY LOCAL HOUSING AUTHORITIES) AND LOCAL CHURCHES IN LOW-INCOME NEIGHBORHOODS. OUR GOAL IS TO INCREASE OUR VOLUNTEER STATIONS FROM 14 TO 17 OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS.  THESE PARTNERSHIPS ARE CRITICAL TO PROGRAM DELIVERY TO CLIENTS.

WAYNE ACTION GROUP FOR ECONOMIC SOLVENCY (WAGES) IS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE WAGES SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. WAGES IS A LOCAL NON-PROFIT COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, WHICH PLANS, DEVELOPS AND ADMINISTERS HUMAN SERVICE PROGRAMS DESIGNED TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY. WAGES WAS CHARTERED BY A RESOLUTION OF THE WAYNE COUNTY COMMISSIONERS ON NOVEMBER 15, 1965.

WAGES IS DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE AND HEALTH, AND GAIN INDEPENDENCE. WAGES ADVOCATES FOR THE DISADVANTAGED; ENCOURAGES PEOPLE TO RAISE THEIR SELF-ESTEEM THROUGH EDUCATION; PROVIDES SERVICE AND OPPORTUNITIES FOR SERVICE; AND MOBILIZES COMMUNITY, PUBLIC AND PRIVATE RESOURCES.

THE WAGES SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS REQUESTING 75 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) AND $330,235 FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THE PROJECT. THE WAGES SCP WILL ENGAGE 55 OF OUR VOLUNTEERS IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES AREA BY FOCUSING ON AGING IN PLACE, BY ADDRESSING INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE CARE, WHILE 7 OF OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE TO INDIVIDUALS WITH PHYSICAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES IN A NEURO THERAPY MEDICAL FACILITY WHERE WAGES SENIOR COMPANIONS HAVE HISTORICALLY SERVED. 

WAGES PROVIDES HIGH QUALITY SERVICES TO SENIOR CITIZENS AND OLDER ADULTS; A GROWING POPULATION.  ACCORDING TO  THE LATEST CENSUS FIGURES (2016), THERE ARE 19,156 INDIVIDUALS AGE 65 AND OVER IN WAYNE COUNTY.  THE TWO LARGEST RACIAL GROUPS IN WAYNE COUNTY AMONG THIS POPULATION ARE CAUCASIANS (68.3%) AND AFRICAN-AMERICANS (29.2%). 
 
THE PROFILE SHOWS THAT 68.5% OF NORTH CAROLINIANS AGE 65 AND OLDER ARE WOMEN AND 31.5% ARE MEN.  SIMILAR FIGURES HOLD TRUE IN WAYNE COUNTY WHERE WOMEN REPRESENT 51% AND MEN 49% OF THIS POPULATION.  IN WAYNE COUNTY, AN ESTIMATED 23% OF THESE WOMEN ARE NOT MARRIED.  ON THE OTHER HAND, 32% OF MEN ARE NOT MARRIED. 10.4% OF THE 65 AND OLDER POPULATION LIVE ALONE.
 
THOUGH THIS POPULATION IS ONE OF THE NATION?S FASTEST GROWING, IT IS ALSO ONE OF THE MOST UNDERSERVED. 9.7% PERCENT OF NORTH CAROLINA CITIZENS AGE 65 AND OLDER LIVE IN POVERTY, WHEREAS IN WAYNE COUNTY 10.1% LIVE BELOW 100% OF THE POVERTY LEVEL (AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY, US CENSUS FACT FINDER 2016). THOUGH THE AVERAGE IS HIGHER FOR WAYNE COUNTY, IT IS NONETHELESS ALARMING.

IN 2015, 41.7 % OF THE NON-INSTITUTIONALIZED CIVILIAN POPULATION AGE 65 AND OLDER IN WAYNE COUNTY REPORTED TO HAVE AT LEAST ONE DISABILITY.  DISABILITY IS DEFINED BY THE CENSUS AS ?A LONG LASTING PHYSICAL, MENTAL, OR EMOTIONAL CONDITION.  THIS CONDITION CAN MAKE IT DIFFICULT FOR A PERSON TO DO ACTIVITIES SUCH AS WALKING, CLIMBING STAIRS, DRESSING, BATHING, LEARNING, OR REMEMBERING. THIS CONDITION CAN ALSO IMPEDE A PERSON FROM BEING ABLE TO GO OUTSIDE THE HOME ALONE OR TO WORK AT A JOB OR BUSINESS? (U.S. CENSUS BUREAU, 2010).  IN 2015, 58.3% OF THE NON-INSTITUTIONALIZED CIVILIAN POPULATION AGE 65 AND OLDER REPORTED TO HAVE AT LEAST ONE DISABILITY (U.S CENSUS 2015 AMERICAN COMMUNITY SURVEY). 

HAVING A SENIOR COMPANION TO ASSIST WITH SUCH TASKS WILL ENABLE THAT DISABLED INDIVIDUAL TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AT HOME FOR A LONGER LENGTH OF TIME. A GROWING NEED AS SHOWN BY REQUESTS FOR SERVICES IS RESPITE CARE. WAYNE COUNTY DSS, SERVICES ON AGING, ALZHEIMERS NC INC., AND LOCAL HOME HEALTH AGENCIES CONTINUE TO HAVE REQUESTS AND WAITING LISTS FOR RESPITE SERVICES. WITH PEOPLE LIVING LONGER, OLDER ADULT CAREGIVERS ARE EXPECTED TO CARE FOR OLDER AND CHRONICALLY ILL FAMILY MEMBERS. HAVING A TIME OF RESPITE FROM THOSE CAREGIVING DUTIES HELPS RELIEVE STRESS AND ALLOWS FOR THEM TO CONTINUE THEIR CAREGIVING FOR LONGER PERIODS OF TIME. WAYNE COUNTY IS HOME TO A REGIONAL ICF/IID NEURO-MEDICAL TREATMENT FACILITY THAT IS HOME TO INDIVIDUALS WITH PHYSICAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.

THE SENIOR CITIZENS COUNCIL OF GREATER AUGUSTA AND THE CSRA, GEORGIA, INC., (SCC) IS A PRIVATE, NOT FOR PROFIT, COMMUNITY ?BASED 501 (C) 3 ORGANIZATION SERVING THE 13-COUNTY CENTRAL SAVANNAH RIVER AREA (CSRA) GEORGIA. THE MISSION OF THE SCC IS TWO-FOLD?TO PROVIDE A DIVERSITY OF SERVICES TO SENIOR ADULTS AND TO ENABLE THEM TO APPLY THEIR EXPERIENCE AS A RESOURCE FOR MEETING IDENTIFIABLE COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE SCC HAS BEEN A LEADING PROVIDER OF AGING SERVICES IN THIS COMMUNITY SINCE 1968 AND HAS EFFECTIVELY SPONSORED SCP SINCE 1985. THE SCC IS REQUESTING $50,156 FROM CNCS TO ENGAGE AN ESTIMATED 18 UNDUPLICATED SCP VOLUNTEERS IN PERSON TO PERSON, OUTCOME-BASED ASSIGNMENTS DESIGNED TO FOSTER INDEPENDENCE AND DELAY OR PREVENT INSTITUTIONALIZATION FOR SENIORS. WE HAVE APPLIED FOR APPROXIMATELY $80,000 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDS FROM THE UNITED WAY OF THE CSRA AND AUGUSTA-RICHMOND COUNTY TO AUGMENT THE AMOUNT WE ARE REQUESTING FROM CNCS.                                                                                                      
THIS PROJECT PLANS TO PLACE A MINIMUM OF 9 UNDUPLICATED FEDERALLY-FUNDED VOLUNTEERS INTO THE CNCS FOCUS AREA: HEALTHY FUTURES ? AGING IN PLACE. WITH ADDITIONAL LOCAL FUNDING, WE ANTICIPATE THAT 13 SCP?S WILL BE PLACED AS REFERRALS FOR SCP ASSISTANCE INCREASE THROUGHOUT THE YEAR. THROUGH THE SCC AND ST. JOHN TOWER?S, A FAITH-BASED SENIOR HOUSING COMMUNITY, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FRAIL ELDERLY  HOME-BOUND, INDIVIDUALS MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCE AND CONTINUE TO  LIVE AT HOME  IN THE LEAST RESTRICTIVE ENVIRONMENT POSSIBLE. SCP?S MAY ASSIST WITH PERSONAL CARE, HELP WITH PHYSICAL THERAPY OR ENCOURAGE EXERCISE, ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION IN RECREATIONAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES, PREPARE LIGHT MEALS, AND PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP. FOR THOSE FAMILIES REQUIRING A BREAK FROM CARE-GIVING, SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS TO LESSEN STRESS-RELATED ISSUES ASSOCIATED WITH PROVIDING CONTINUAL CARE FOR A LOVED ONE. AT THE END OF EACH GRANT CYCLE, OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED AND REPORTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH H9A AND H14 GUIDELINES RESPECTIVELY.
FOR OVER 25 YEARS, THIS PROJECT HAS PARTNERED WITH TWO NON-RESIDENTIAL, SHELTERED WORKSHOPS WHERE PERSONS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO PROMOTE INCLUSION SO THEY MAY BE ABLE TO INTEGRATE SMOOTHLY INTO THE COMMUNITY. A MINIMUM OF 5 UNDUPLICATED SCP?S WILL SERVE IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA ? ACCESS TO CARE AT LYNNDALE, INC. AND SERENITY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ? GEORGIA TASC WHERE THEY WILL PROVIDE PERSON TO PERSON SUPPORT TO INDIVIDUALS AS THEY PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES DESIGNED TO FOSTER INDEPENDENCE AND  INCLUSION. VOLUNTEERS WILL ENCOURAGE PARTICIPATION IN FITNESS ACTIVITIES, ACCOMPANY INDIVIDUALS ON SOCIAL OUTINGS, RE-DIRECT INAPPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR TO REDUCE FREQUENCY AND INCREASE APPROPRIATE SOCIAL SKILLS, ASSIST WITH PERSONAL HYGIENE, AND ASSIST AS NEEDED DURING MEAL TIME TO MAINTAIN OR IMPROVE NUTRITION AND HYDRATION. AT THE END OF EACH GRANT CYCLE, OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED AND REPORTED IN ACCORDANCE WITH H15A GUIDELINES.

AN ESTIMATED FORTY-TWO VSYS, INCLUDING FULL AND PART-TIME SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS, WILL PROVIDE SERVICE TO THE FRAIL ELDERLY AGE 60 AND OVER. FORTY-TWO SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE THE SOCIALLY ISOLATED ELDERLY A MINIMUM OF 15 HOURS OF COMPANIONSHIP PER WEEK.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CAREGIVERS WITH 15 OR MORE HOURS OF CARE SERVICE WEEKLY. SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE DIRECT NON-MEDICAL SERVICES TO THEIR CLIENT/CARE RECIPIENTS IN A HOME-BASED SETTING. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE CLIENTS/CARE RECIPIENTS IN READING, REMINISCING, SHARE A MEAL, ASSISTANCE WITH LIGHT CHORES, TAKING A WALK, PLAYING CARDS OR BOARD GAMES; ACCOMPANYING AND ESCORTING OR TRANSPORTING TO APPOINTMENTS. 
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURE WITH THE WORK PLAN FOCUSING ON COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE CARE. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND TIME OF TEMPORARY RELIEF FOR THE CAREGIVER THROUGH A NETWORK OF THE CURRENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS/PLACEMENT SITES, AND THE ANTICIPATION OF ADDITIONAL SITES, WHICH PROVIDES REFERRALS TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOME ENVIRONMENT AND PROVIDE A TIME OF TEMPORARY RELIEF FOR THE CAREGIVER.  THIS WILL ALLOW THE CAREGIVER TIME TO ATTEND TO THEIR NEEDS THUS IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF BOTH THE CAREGIVER AND CARE RECIPIENT. THE VOLUNTEER STATIONS WILL IDENTIFY THE NEED, TIME AND FREQUENCY OF THE VISITS ON THE REFERRAL FORMS.  
THE OUTCOME FOR COMPANIONSHIP IS FOR THE CLIENT TO FEEL LESS LONELY WHILE RECEIVING VISITS FROM THE SCP VOLUNTEER.  AT THE END OF THE SERVICE PERIOD, AN ASSESSMENT OR TELEPHONE SURVEY WILL BE COMPLETED BY THE CLIENT OR SOMEONE CLOSE ENOUGH TO INDICATE MEASURES. THE DESIRE IS FOR CLIENTS TO REPORT THAT THEY ARE MORE ENGAGED IN SOCIAL OR RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES DUE TO VISITS FROM THE SCP VOLUNTEER. THE HOME-BOUND (FRAIL/DISABLED) ELDERLY WILL BE ALLOWED TO CONTINUE TO RESIDE IN THEIR HOME ENVIRONMENT WHILE MAINTAINING MAXIMUM MOBILITY AND SELF-CARE. CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE WEEKLY, SCHEDULED RESPITE FROM THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS TO HELP WITH CARING FOR AT-HOME ELDERS. THE OUTCOME FOR CAREGIVERS IS TO EXPERIENCE LESS STRESS AND AN IMPROVED SENSE OF WELL-BEING AS THE RESULT OF SENIOR COMPANION SERVICES.
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A 10% MINIMUM GRANTEE SHARE.

SPONSOR:      SOUTH FLORIDA INSTITUTE ON AGING 
VISION:         A WORLD WHERE EVERYONE THRIVES AS THEY AGE. 
MISSION:     TO IMPROVE THE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC INSIGHTS THAT EMPOWER PEOPLE AS THEY AGE. 

AN ESTIMATED 88 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OUR COMMUNITY. OF THIS NUMBER 78 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS ARE ENGAGED IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA WITHIN THE AGING IN PLACE OBJECTIVE UTILIZING AGENCY WIDE PERFORMANCE MEASURES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS. 
VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE-ON-ONE COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO HOMEBOUND AND ISOLATED OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND VETERANS. SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE RESPITE SERVICE TO CAREGIVERS OFFERING THEM THE OPPORTUNITY TO TAKE CARE OF THEIR OWN NEEDS. RESPITE SERVICES ENABLE THE CAREGIVER TO REDUCE THEIR STRESS LEVELS BY PROVIDING THEM A BREAK FROM THE 24 HOUR RESPONSIBILITY OF CARING FOR THEIR LOVED ONE WHO ARE OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH A DISABILITY OR ARE INDIVIDUALS DIAGNOSED WITH DEMENTIA. 
IN ADDITION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP FOR FRAIL SENIORS PARTICIPATING IN SENIOR CENTERS WITH A DISABILITY OR DECLINING HEALTH CONDITION WHO ARE NOT ABLE TO SAFELY STAY AT HOME DURING THE DAY.
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT A TOTAL OF 300 INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING: 240 ISOLATED OR HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS OR INDIVIDUALS WITH A DISABILITY AND 60 CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $343,395 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $261,636 FROM GRANTS, DONATIONS, IN-KIND REVENUE AND LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES.

MIAMI-DADE COUNTY (MDC), FLORIDA'S ESTIMATED POPULATION IS OVER 2.7 MILLION WITH A GROWTH RATE OF 0.56% IN THE PAST YEAR (ON-LINE HTTP://WORLDPOPULATIONREVIEW.COM/FLORIDA-COUNTIES/MIAMI-DADE-COUNTY/2017). MDC IS THE LARGEST COUNTY IN FLORIDA  THE ETHNIC COMPOSITION OF THE POPULATION OF MDC IS  1.84 MILLION HISPANIC RESIDENTS (67.7%), 437,181 BLACK RESIDENTS (16.1%), 368,048 WHITE RESIDENTS (13.6%), 42,015 ASIAN RESIDENTS (1.55%) AND TWO + RESIDENTS 16,368 (0.6%). WHEN COMPARED TO OTHER PLACES MDC HAS THE LARGEST CONCENTRATION OF THE FOLLOWING LANGUAGES FRENCH CREOLE (112,030 SPEAKERS), SPANISH (1.59 MILLION SPEAKERS) AND HEBREWS (6,122 SPEAKERS) OF THE STATE OF FLORIDA. THE DEPARTMENT?S MISSION IS TO ?EMPOWER ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, RESOURCE MOBILIZATION, AND SERVICE DELIVERY. THE DEPARTMENT EXEMPLIFIES ITS MISSION TO THE RESIDENTS OF MDC THROUGH EXCELLENT SERVICE PROVISION AND PUBLIC ASSISTANCE. THE SCP PROVIDES OPPORTUNITIES FOR INDIVIDUALS 55 YEARS AND OLDER AND IS SEEKING TO CONTINUE TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME ELDERLY BY PROVIDING GRATIFYING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES. THE OBJECTIVES OF THE VOLUNTEER PROGRAM ARE TO ENGAGE VOLUNTEERS IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA USING THE AGENCY WIDE PRIORITY MEASURES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WHO WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORT TO ELDERLY CLIENTS IN OUR COMMUNITY ?SENIORS HELPING SENIORS.? 
AN ESTIMATED 107 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE, OF THIS NUMBER 107 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE SERVICE TO FRAIL ELDERS AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE PROGRAM EXPECTS TO HAVE ENGAGED A MINIMUM OF 107 VOLUNTEERS TO ASSIST IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $484,600 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY MDC MATCHING AND IN-KIND FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $259,240 IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE MDC ELDERLY RESIDENTS.

THE DR. PIPER CENTER FOR SOCIAL SERVICES, INC. IS A NOT FOR PROFIT 501 [C] (3) SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY. IT WAS ORIGINALLY FOUNDED AS A NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER CARRYING ON THE IDEALS OF COMMUNITY SERVICE EXEMPLIFIED BY DR. ELLA PIPER, A DISTINGUISHED PHYSICIAN AND COMMUNITY LEADER IN FORT MYERS DURING THE FIRST HALF OF THE TWENTIETH CENTURY.  THE CENTER HAS EXPANDED FROM A NEIGHBORHOOD CENTER TO A MAJOR FIVE COUNTYWIDE PROVIDER OF SERVICES WHILE MAINTAINING ITS NEIGHBORHOOD BASE. A BOARD OF DIRECTORS FROM THE COMMUNITY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR POLICIES AND OVER-ALL SUPERVISION OF THE CENTER. OUR MISSION IS TO ENHANCE THE SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC WELL BEING OF THOSE 55 AND OLDER AND MAKE A POSITIVE IMPACT IN THE LIVES OF CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS AND FRAIL ELDERLY CLIENTS. 

THE DR. PIPER CENTER FOR SOCIAL SERVICES HAS BEEN THE LOCAL SPONSOR OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SINCE 1993 AND OUR GOAL IS TO CONTINUE TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF LOW-INCOME IN LEE, COLLIER, HENDRY, SARASOTA AND CHARLOTTE COUNTIES. THE PROGRAM PROVIDES GRATIFYING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW INCOME SENIORS AND HELP FRAIL ELDERLY RESIDENTS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, MAINTAIN THEIR DIGNITY AND ENHANCE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE WHILE AT THE SAME TIME STRENGTHENING THE VOLUNTEER'S CAPACITY TO REMAIN ACTIVE AND SELF-SUFFICIENT.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS THE MOST COST EFFECTIVE PROGRAM FOR FRAIL ELDERLY SENIORS TO INCREASE THEIR ACCESS TO SERVICES AND BE SUCCESSFULLY MAINTAINED IN THEIR OWN HOME.

THE DEPARTMENT OF ELDER AFFAIRS 2015 COUNTY PROFILES DECLARED THAT 35% OF LEE, COLLIER, HENDRY, CHARLOTTE AND SARASOTA COUNTIES' POPULATION IS 60 AND OLDER WITH 63,022 LIVING BELOW 125% OF POVERTY LEVEL; 21.4% ARE LIVING ALONE WHILE 25.88% HAVE SOME TYPE OF DISABILITIES, INCLUDING SENSORY, PHYSICAL AND MENTAL DISABILITIES. 61,767 SUFFER FROM SOME FORM OF DEMENTIA OR ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE. ACCORDING TO THE DEPARTMENT OF AGING AND MENTAL HEALTH, DEPRESSION GOES UNTREATED IN 80% OF THE SENIOR POPULATION. STUDIES SHOW THAT AT LEAST 10-25 % OF ALL ELDERLY PEOPLE SHOW CLEAR SYMPTOMS OF DEPRESSION. 1-5 % HAS SO-CALLED SERIOUS DEPRESSIVE EPISODES, AND 2-8 % SUFFERS FROM LONELINESS AND MELANCHOLY. THROUGH THE NATURE OF THE AGING PROCESS, CHRONIC ILLNESSES AND CONDITIONS SUCH AS DEBILITATING ARTHRITIS, OSTEOPOROSIS, DEMENTIA, DIABETES, RESPIRATORY PROBLEMS, BLINDNESS, ETC. SUBSTANTIALLY LIMIT MOBILITY THUS QUALITY OF LIFE IS DETERIORATING, WHICH ACCELERATES THEIR PHYSICAL PROBLEMS AND MOST OF THE TIME MENTAL PROBLEMS SUCH AS DEPRESSION. THE DEMAND FOR CARE OF THE ELDERLY WILL GROW DRAMATICALLY IF THEY ARE TO REMAIN AT HOME AND AVOID PREMATURE AND COSTLY INSTITUTIONALIZATION. WITH SEVERAL SERVICE PROVIDERS IN LEE, COLLIER, HENDRY, CHARLOTTE AND SARASOTA COUNTIES SHOWING A WAITING LIST FOR SERVICES OF FRAIL ELDERLY CLIENTS, FUNDING DOES NOT EXIST TO ALLEVIATE THIS CRISIS. AS PART OF A COMMUNITY ALTERNATIVE TO INSTITUTIONAL LONG-TERM CARE, SENIOR COMPANIONS HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED AS A VERY COST EFFECTIVE COMPONENT IN THE SERVICE PLANS TO ADDRESS THIS CHALLENGE.  

HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE FOCUS AREA OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF SW FLORIDA. SEVENTY-FIVE (75) SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE IN PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO FOUR HUNDRED (400) FRAIL ELDERLY CLIENTS.  BY HELPING FRAIL ELDERLY CLIENTS WITH MEAL PREPARATION, TRANSPORTATION, ADVOCACY AND SIMPLE HOUSEKEEPING, SENIOR COMPANIONS HELP EASE LONELINESS AND ILLNESS WHILE BOOSTING SELF-ESTEEM OF THEIR ASSIGNED CLIENTS. 

AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE IMPACT WILL SHOW AN INCREASE IN THE NUMBER OF FRAIL ELDERLY CLIENTS THAT WERE SUCCESSFULLY MAINTAINED IN THEIR OWN HOMES.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $293,820 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $99,839 OF FUNDING FROM THE COUNTY AND CITY GOVERNMENT, COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS, UNITED WAY OF LEE COUNTY AND PROCEEDS FROM FUNDRAISING EVENTS.

ELDER CARE SERVICES' SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS PROJECTING THAT AT LEAST 66 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGHOUT OUR 15-COUNTY SERVICE AREA OF FLORIDA (BAY, CALHOUN, FRANKLIN, GADSDEN, GULF, HOLMES, JACKSON, JEFFERSON, LEON, LIBERTY, MADISON, TAYLOR, WALTON, WAKULLA, AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES) TO INCREASE THE PROBABILITY THAT SENIORS' WILL REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE WITH THE SAME OR AN IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE. THEIR SERVICE TIME WILL BE SPENT ASSISTING SENIORS AS THEY AGE IN PLACE. SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AS WELL AS TRANSPORTING FRAIL SENIORS ON ESSENTIAL ERRANDS SUCH AS TRIPS TO THE GROCERY STORE, THE PHARMACY, OR THE DOCTOR'S OFFICE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE ASSISTING 120 HOME-BOUND SENIORS AS THEY AGE IN PLACE BY PROVIDING THEM COMPANIONSHIP AND ESSENTIAL TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE. WE EXPECT AT LEAST 75 OF THESE SENIORS TO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $340,688.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $66,407 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

COMMUNITY ACTION PARTNERSHIP OF NORTH ALABAMA (THE PARTNERSHIP) HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FOR NEARLY 30YEARS. THE PARTNERSHIP HAS BUILT A CORE OF PARTNERSHIPS WITH AGENCIES LIKE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, LOCAL COUNTY AND CITY GOVERNMENTS, HOSPITALS AND SENIOR CENTERS. ALL 52 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN MORGAN, CULLMAN AND LAWRENCE, ALL OF WHICH ARE CONSIDERED RURAL COUNTIES WITH GROWING AGING AND DISABLED POPULATIONS.

BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM LOOKS FOR PARTNERSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES WITH MEASURABLE OUTCOMES IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. IDENTIFYING COMMUNITY NEEDS ALLOWS SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITIES, PROVIDING ACTIVE OLDER ADULTS A WAY TO COMBAT UNMET NEEDS AND TO HELP BUILD THE CAPACITY OF PARTNERS IN PROVIDING THE ABILITY FOR OLDER ADULTS AND THE DISABLED TO AGE IN PLACE OR RECEIVE RESPITE.

AN ESTIMATED 52 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE EACH YEAR IN THE PROGRAM. THROUGH A NETWORK OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL: ASSIST OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES IN RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO CONTINUE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES. PARTNERING VOLUNTEER STATIONS WILL INCLUDE PUBLIC HOSPITALS, SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES, LOCAL HEALTH CARE PROVIDERS IN MORGAN, LAWRENCE, AND CULLMAN COUNTIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT HEALTH FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE (H8, H13). 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ $223,419 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $42,229 OF LOCAL NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

WYOMING SENIOR CITIZENS, INC.(WSCI), FOUNDED IN 1975, IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION WHOSE PURPOSE IS TO MEET THE NEEDS WYOMING'S OLDER RESIDENTS AND HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE. WYOMING SENIOR CITIZENS, INC. SERVES THE ENTIRE STATE OF WYOMING WITH THE SENIOR COMPANION, LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN, WYOMING HEALTH INSURANCE INFORMATION, HEALTH INSURANCE MARKETPLACE, SENIOR MEDICARE PATROL, FOSTER GRANDPARENT, AND NATIONAL FAMILY CAREGIVER SUPPORT PROGRAMS. WE ARE REQUESTING $310,049 FOR THIS PROJECT PERIOD IN ORDER TO SUPPORT 61 FEDERAL VSYS. WE WILL SERVE THOSE WITH THE GREATEST ECONOMIC NEED WHICH INCLUDES FRAIL AND ISOLATED ELDERLY, PERSONS FIGHTING ALCOHOL OR DRUG ABUSE OR EMOTIONAL IMPAIRMENTS, DIABETES, ALZHEIMER'S OR OTHER DEMENTIA, VETERANS, HOME-BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS WHO MAY BE SOCIALLY DEPRIVED, HEARING OR VISUALLY IMPAIRED, TERMINALLY ILL OR HOSPICE CLIENTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DD AND CHRONIC OR SHORT-TERM DISABILITIES, AND THEIR CAREGIVERS WITH COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, ADVOCACY, PERSONAL WELLNESS, HOME MANAGEMENT, NUTRITIONAL SUPPORT, RESPITE AND OTHER SERVICES WHICH WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. WE WILL RECEIVE $51,200 STATE FUNDING AND AN ESTIMATED $32,080 FROM OTHER SOURCES. THE FOCUS OF THIS APPLICATION WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND AGING IN PLACE FOR THE 13.8% OF WYOMING CITIZENS OVER 65, 29% OF THOSE PERSONS OVER 65 WHO LIVE ALONE, THE 50% WITH DISABILITIES, AND THE 9.8% LIVING IN POVERTY ACCORDING TO COMPREHENSIVE NEEDS ASSESSMENT BY WYOMING MATTERS.ORG, WORLD HEALTH ORGANIZATION AND US CENSUS DATA. SCP WILL SERVE 21 OF 23 COUNTIES IN WYOMING AND UTILIZE 26 VOLUNTEER STATIONS WITH PLANS TO EXPAND TO 1 MORE COUNTY AND 3 STATIONS IN THE NEXT THREE YEARS. WE EXPECT THAT A MINIMUM OF 61 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 320 CLIENTS THROUGHOUT THE STATE WITH AT LEAST ONE VISIT PER WEEK. COMPANION WILL VOLUNTEER 15-20 HOURS PER WEEK. OUR TARGET ESTIMATE OF COMPANION PERFORMING INDEPENDENT LIVING ASSISTANCE WILL BE 68.

LUTHERAN COMMUNITY SERVICES NORTHWEST (LCSNW) MISSION READS: "LUTHERAN COMMUNITY SERVICES NORTHWEST PARTNERS WITH INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES FOR HEALTH, JUSTICE AND HOPE". THE PREMISE IS TO BUILD COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY SERVICES TO OPERATE NON-SECULAR PROGRAMS TO ASSIST PEOPLE IN NEED. LCSNW, A NOT-FOR-PROFIT, HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN PIERCE AND KITSAP COUNTIES IN WASHINGTON STATE SINCE 1996. 

WE ARE REQUESTING 39 VSY'S AND A BUDGET AMOUNT OF $211,901.55. WE WILL ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) AGING IN PLACE OUTCOMES: TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP.

THE COMMUNITY NEEDS AS IDENTIFIED IN LOCAL AGING LONG TERM STRATEGIC PLANS ARE FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES. THEY MUST HAVE ACCESSIBLE TRANSPORTATION TO FOOD, MEDICAL, AND COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND BE ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITIES TO FEEL LESS ISOLATED AND LONELY.

OUR INTENDED OUTCOME IS THAT SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES WILL AGE IN PLACE AND REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. THE INDICATORS FOR MEETING THIS OUTCOME ARE THAT SENIORS AVOID PERSONAL RISK AND ARE SOCIALLY ENGAGED IN THE COMMUNITY.  SENIOR COMPANIONS MAKE THESE OUTCOMES POSSIBLE BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ESSENTIAL SHOPPING, AND SOCIAL OUTINGS. 

OUR PROGRAM IS ANNUALLY ASSESSED BY OUR FUNDERS INCLUDING PIERCE COUNTY, MILGARD FOUNDATION, AND MULTICARE HEALTH SYSTEM.

FOR THE TIME PERIOD OF 2019-2021, AN ESTIMATED 46 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF LANE COUNTY. OF THIS NUMBER, 45 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME- BASED WORK PLANS. ANOTHER VOLUNTEER WILL SERVE OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES. THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES OF THE SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL FOCUS ON COMPANIONSHIP AND COMPANIONSHIP THROUGH THE VETERANS ADMINISTRATION. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM OF 83 HOME-BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT ON THEIR ANNUAL SURVEY. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $261,169 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $138,251 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 20 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  OF THIS NUMBER 20 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL BE COMPANIONSHIP.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS AGING IN PLACE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 42 INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND 7 CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $120,000 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $12,000 IN MATCH. 

CLACKAMAS COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICES (CCSS) IS DEDICATED TO HELPING PEOPLE IN NEED LIVE WITH SELF-RELIANCE AND INDEPENDENCE, OFFERING MANY OPPORTUNITIES FOR ALL COUNTY RESIDENTS TO BE SOCIALLY ENGAGED. FOR SENIORS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, LOW INCOME RESIDENTS, AND VETERANS, WE OFFER MANY PROGRAMS THAT HELP SUPPORT OUR COMMUNITY AND PROVIDE PEOPLE WITH INFORMATION AND RESOURCES THEY NEED TO BE HEALTHY AND SAFE.  CCSS IS A DIVISION WITHIN HEALTH, HOUSING, AND HUMAN SERVICES.  CCSS STRONGLY BELIEVES THAT VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS HAVE A TREMENDOUS IMPACT ON THE AGENCY'S ABILITY TO ENHANCE AND DELIVER ALL OF THE SERVICES WHICH THEY OFFER.  

SCP IN CLACKAMAS COUNTY WILL HAVE A MINIMUM OF 20 VOLUNTEER SENIOR COMPANIONS WHO WILL SERVE BETWEEN 60-80 HOMEBOUND SENIORS OR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES THROUGHOUT CLACKAMAS COUNTY IN AN EFFORT TO PROVIDE THE VITAL COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION AND ASSISTANCE NEEDED TO SAFELY AND EFFECTIVELY REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS IS SAFELY POSSIBLE.

THE SPONSOR FOR THE EASTERN OREGON SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (EO SCP) IS COMMUNITY COUNSELING SOLUTIONS (CCS), A 501(C)(3) CORPORATION PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH AND RELATED SERVICES.  CCS HAS 150 EMPLOYEES AND ITS MISSION IS TO PROVIDE DYNAMIC, PROGRESSIVE, AND DIVERSE SUPPORTS TO IMPROVE THE WELL-BEING OF OUR COMMUNITIES.  CCS IS REQUESTING $142,896.60 IN FEDERAL FUNDING FOR THE EO SCP PROGRAM AND PROPOSES TO SUPPLEMENT THESE FEDERAL FUNDS WITH AN ADDITIONAL $15,844 IN NON-FEDERAL CASH AND IN-KIND SUPPORT.

THE EO SCP PROGRAM OF CCS IS CURRENTLY BUDGETED FOR 30 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS (33 VSYS), BUT FACING ABRUPT AND UNEXPECTED CHANGES HAS SEEN A DECLINE IN VOLUNTEERS. JOHN BRENNE, LONG-TIME FGP AND SCP PROJECT DIRECTOR FROM 1975 TO 2018, PASSED AWAY SUDDENLY ON JANUARY 22, 2018.  HE HAS SINCE BEEN REPLACED BY TERESA E. O?HALLORAN, WHO BRINGS NEW PERSPECTIVE AND ORGANIZATION TO THE PROGRAM.  ROBERT BURDETT REMAINS THE PROJECT ASSISTANT AND A VITAL PART OF THE PROGRAM PROVIDING ORIENTATION TO THE NEW PROJECT DIRECTOR.

IN THE UPCOMING PROGRAM YEAR, WE PROPOSE A REDUCTION IN VSYS DUE TO THESE UNEXPECTED CHANGES. BY REDUCING OUR VSYS TO 24 IT WILL ALLOW THE FLEXIBILITY NEEDED TO REORGANIZE AND SOLIDIFY THE PROGRAM 25,056 HOURS DURING THE 2019-20 PROGRAM YEAR.  CCS CURRENTLY HAS 24 EO SCP VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN MORROW, MALHEUR, UMATILLA, AND BAKER COUNTIES. VOLUNTEER STATION TYPES INCLUDE MULTI-PURPOSE CENTERS (INCLUDING SENIOR CENTERS), CONVALESCENT CENTERS/HOSPICES, AND PUBLIC/CONGREGATE HOUSING, AND HOSPITAL OUTREACH PROGRAMS.  THE SCP PROGRAM OF CCS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE TO 240 CLIENTS WITH AN ESTIMATED 25 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS (24 VSYS).

THE EO SCP PROGRAM OF CCS IS BECOMING WELL ESTABLISHED IN THE AREA IT SERVES.  WE CONTINUE TO REACH OUT TO ESTABLISH MORE MEMORANDUMS OF UNDERSTANDING WITH SOCIAL SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS AND HOSPITALS IN OUR SERVICE AREA WHILE AT THE SAME TIME STRENGTHEN EXISTING ONES.  WE EXPECT TO RECRUIT MORE SCP VOLUNTEERS IN THE EASTERN OREGON AREAS IN ORDER TO STABILIZE AND ACHIEVE OUR VSY GOAL.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE.  THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP / TRANSPORTATION / RESPITE SERVICES.

COMMUNITY NEED TO BE ADDRESSED:
OUR GOAL IS TO ADDRESS THE LONELINESS AND ISOLATION OF HUNDREDS OF FRAIL AND ISOLATED SENIORS WHO COULD USE COMPANIONSHIP AND/OR TRANSPORTATION TO GROCERY SHOP.  HUNDREDS OF SENIORS IN EASTERN OREGON HAVE BEEN IDENTIFIED (BY SENIOR-SERVING AGENCIES) WHO NEED HELP WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIFE AND ACHIEVING INDEPENDENT SKILLS SO THEY CAN DO MORE FOR THEMSELVES, AS DOCUMENTED BY OREGON STATE AGING AND DISABILITY SERVICES (2013).  THE NEED FOR FAMILY RESPITE SERVICES IS ALSO ON THE RISE.  MANY FAMILIES CANNOT AFFORD PROFESSIONAL CAREGIVERS OR INSTITUTIONAL ASSISTANCE, AND/OR PREFER TO CARE FOR THEIR OWN FAMILY MEMBERS.

THE HAWAI'I SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IS PROPOSING TO ENGAGE 75 VOLUNTEERS.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PAIRED WITH FRAIL, LONELY AND/OR ISOLATED SENIORS, 55 YEARS AND OLDER, LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY.  SERVICES PROVIDED WILL BE NON-PROFESSIONAL IN NATURE AND WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, SOCIALIZATION, SIMPLE MEAL PREPARATION, MEDICATION REMINDERS, RUNNING AND ASSISTANCE WITH READING MAIL AND CORRESPONDENCE.  ALSO, TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO HOMEBOUND SENIORS FOR ERRANDS, SHOPPING, SOCIALIZATION, AND MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS.  IN ADDITION, VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE VITAL SUPPORTIVE SERVICES FOR CAREGIVERS ALLOWING THEM MUCH NEEDED TIME OFF FROM CAREGIVING RESPONSIBILITIES.  

HEALTHY FUTURES WILL BE THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THIS SCP WITH PRIORITIES FOCUSED ON COMPANIONSHIP, SOCIALIZATION, TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE RELIEF FOR CAREGIVERS. THE INTENT WILL BE TO ALLOW SENIORS TO PRESERVE AN INDIVIDUAL'S INDEPENDENT LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY.  SENIORS WHO NEED LONG-TERM CARE PREFER TO RECEIVE CARE AT HOME RATHER THAN MOVE TO A MORE RESTRICTIVE/CONTROLLED ENVIRONMENT, SUCH AS AN ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY OR NURSING HOME. 

ASSIGNMENTS AND CARE PLANS FOR EACH CLIENT WILL BE COMPLETED BY VOLUNTEER STATION (VS) MANAGERS OR CASE MANAGERS.  THE CARE PLANS WILL IDENTIFY THE NEEDS OF THE FRAIL SENIOR WITH THE GOAL OF INCREASING SOCIAL TIES AND MAINTAINING INDEPENDENT LIVING.  SERVICE PROVISION WILL TAKE PLACE WITHIN THE CLIENT HOMES.  THE PROGRAM WILL EXTEND ACROSS THE STATE OF HAWAI'I.

IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 190 SENIORS WILL RECEIVE THE SERVICES OF SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS. ADDITIONALLY, 40 CAREGIVERS WILL BE PROVIDED WITH RESPITE CARE RELIEF WITH THE SUPPORTIVE VISITS OF SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS.  DEVELOPING AND EXPANDING PARTNERSHIPS WITH 14 NON-PROFIT PROVIDERS AND AGENCIES WHO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO FRAIL AND ISOLATED SENIORS WILL ALLOW THE PROGRAM TO MEET ITS WORK PLAN GOALS.  THE PARTNER AGENCIES WILL PAIR THE VOLUNTEERS WITH CLIENTS IN NEED OF SUPPORTIVE COMPANIONSHIP, ASSISTANCE AND TRANSPORTATION. 

THE SCP IS REQUESTING $400,089 IN FEDERAL FUNDS FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES (CNCS). THE STATE OF HAWAII, DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICE (DHS), WILL PROVIDE $247,205 TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM.

THE DEPARTMENT OF DEVELOPMENTAL SERVICES (DDS) IS THE AGENCY THROUGH WHICH THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA PROVIDES SERVICES AND SUPPORTS TO INDIVIDUALS WITH INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES (CONSUMERS.)
 
WITH THE CLOSURE OF THREE DEVELOPMENTAL CENTERS, THREE REGIONAL CENTERS (RC) HAVE TAKEN ON THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP), AND ARE CONTINUING EFFORTS TO RECRUIT NEW VOLUNTEERS AND EXPAND THE SCP IN THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. UNDER THIS REVISION, ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT CONTINUES TO BE PROVIDED BY EIGHT PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT CALIFORNIA AT EIGHT RCS.
 
THE DDS CURRENTLY HAS 232 VOLUNTEERS, 450 CONSUMERS, AND 333 VSYS IN THE SCP, AND AIMS TO FURTHER INCREASE THE NUMBER OF VOLUNTEERS IN OUTPUT-ONLY WORK PLAN OBJECTIVES WHERE CONSUMERS OVER THE AGE OF 22 WILL BENEFIT FROM THEIR SERVICES AND SUPPORT. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE SERVICE ACTIVITY OF SUPPORTING INTEGRATION. ALL OF THE SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN WORK PLAN ASSIGNMENTS WHICH WILL PROMOTE SELF-DETERMINATION, INDEPENDENCE, PRODUCTIVITY, INTEGRATION, AND INCLUSION IN COMMUNITY-BASED SETTINGS. OUR CONSUMERS WILL BENEFIT BY RECEIVING THE SERVICE ACTIVITY OF COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORTING INTEGRATION. IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THESE SUPPORTS WILL ENABLE CONSUMERS TO MORE FULLY PARTICIPATE IN VARIOUS INTEGRATED SETTINGS SUCH AS PUBLIC SCHOOL SITES, EMPLOYMENT TRAINING CENTERS FOR STUDENT INTERNS, AND OTHER INTEGRATED AND ALTERNATIVE PROGRAM SETTINGS. 

FOR FISCAL YEAR 19/20, THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA HAS DEDICATED APPROXIMATELY $2,282,463 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE SCP.

AN APPROXIMATELY 37 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE VISITING CLIENTS, PROVIDING INFORMATION ABOUT RESOURCES IN THE COMMUNITY, PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO CRITICAL SERVICES AND RESPITE FOR SOME CLIENT'S PRIMARY CAREGIVERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES/ AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 164 FRAIL ADULTS AND CAREGIVERS WILL BE SERVED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 106,969 WILL SUPPORT 18 VOLUNTEERS AND BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $ 225,096 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES SUPPORTING 19 VOLUNTEERS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

ESTABLISHED IN 1973, THE NORTH STAR COUNCIL ON AGING (NSCOA), AKA THE FAIRBANK SENIOR CENTER, STRIVES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OLDER ADULTS BY PROVIDING SERVICES WHICH ENHANCE AND PROMOTE QUALITY OF LIFE, SELF-DETERMINATION, INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND DIGNITY.   NSCOA SERVES THE FAIRBANKS NORTH STAR BOROUGH (FNSB), WHICH COVERS SOME 7,444 SQ. MI., AN AREA SLIGHTLY SMALLER THAN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY, AND HAS A POPULATION OF APPROXIMATELY 100,000 RESIDENTS.  OF THOSE 100,000, 18 % (18,000) ARE SENIOR AGED 60 OR OLDER.  NSCOA ALSO SERVES THE RURAL AREAS OUTSIDE THE FAIRBANKS CITY LIMITS.  AS A RECIPIENT OF THIS GRANT, NSCOA PLANS TO ESTABLISH VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO SERVE THE OUTLYING COMMUNITIES OF NORTH POLE, SALCHA, WHILE MAINTAINING OUR CURRENT SATELLITE STATION IN DELTA JUNCTION, WHICH RECRUITS VOLUNTEERS IN DELTA JUNCTION AND TOK. 
ALASKA HAS ONE THE FASTEST GROWING SENIOR POPULATIONS IN THE COUNTRY AND WITHIN THE NEXT FIVE YEARS, THE SENIOR POPULATION WITHIN THE FNSB ALONE IS PROJECTED TO INCREASE BY 22%.  THIS INCREASE WILL PLACE A FURTHER DEMAND ON THE SERVICES ALREADY PROVIDED BY THE NSCOA, WHICH ENHANCES THE LIVES OF OUR SENIORS WHO RECEIVE NUTRITION, BOTH IN THEIR OWN HOMES AND THROUGH CONGREGATE MEALS, TRANSPORTATION, HOME CHORE SERVICES, EXERCISE AND EDUCATIONAL CLASSES, OUTREACH AND INFORMATION, AND COMPANIONSHIP.  
NSCOA VOLUNTEERS PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND AGING IN PLACE.  NSCOA CURRENTLY WORKS TOWARDS THESE OBJECTIVES BY PROVIDING SUPPORT TO OVER 270 HOME-BOUND SENIORS THROUGH OUR MEALS ON WHEELS AND WELLNESS CHECK PROGRAMS.  ANNUALLY, OUR MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM SERVES OVER 52,000 MEALS WITH OUR CONGREGATE MEAL PROGRAM SERVING 10,000 MEALS AT THE THREE SEPARATE LOCATIONS, AND OUR TRANSPORTATION SERVICE PROVIDES UP TO 2,500 DOOR-TO-DOOR RIDES.    IN ADDITION TO HOME CHORE SERVICES, OUR VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP, AND THE FAIRBANKS SENIOR CENTER PROVIDES AN IMPORTANT HUB FOR OUTREACH AND INFORMATION WITH EXERCISE AND SENIOR BENEFIT CLASSES.  ALL OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE TRAINED TO LOOK FOR AND RECOGNIZE THE SIGNS OF ELDER ABUSE, NEGLECT, AND FINANCIAL FRAUD.  OUR GOAL IS TO CONTINUE TO EXPAND THESE PROGRAMS WITH 40 SCP TRAINED SENIOR VOLUNTEERS OVER THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD.  THESE COMBINED 40 VOLUNTEERS MEET THE 38 VSYS REQUIRED TO MEET SCP GRANT PERFORMANCE LEVELS.  
THE ESTIMATED 40 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CLIENTS BEGINNING IN FNSB, DELTA, AND TOK AND EVENTUALLY STATEWIDE.   OF THIS NUMBER, 40 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN THE COMMUNITY.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PROVIDING WILL INCLUDE HOME CHORE SERVICES, NUTRITIONAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH MEAL PREPARATION, TRANSPORTATION, WELLNESS CHECKS, RESPITE CARE, PREVENTION AND AWARENESS OF ELDER ABUSE, AND OUTREACH AND INFORMATION.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE PROGRAM WILL BE TO SUPPORT AGING IN PLACE, AND PROVIDING SUPPORT TO OLDER ADULTS AND/OR THEIR CAREGIVERS.  AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE, WE ANTICIPATE THAT 96% OF OUR CLIENTS WILL REPORT THEY HAVE RECEIVED SERVICES THAT HELP THEM CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL TIES.  THE CNCS INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY A MATCH OF $37,880 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE COMMUNITY-RELATIONS SOCIAL DEVELOPMENT COMMISSION (SDC) INVITES RENEWED INVESTMENT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR THE SDC SENIOR COMPANIONS PROGRAM. A FIXED AMOUNT GRANT OF $291,200 WILL FUND THE CONTINUATION OF 64 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY) FROM 59 TO 64 INDIVIDUALS. AN ADDITIONAL $14,560 WILL SUPPORT THE COSTS OF ADMINISTRATIVE AND BACKGROUND CHECKS USING TRUSCREEN. THIS WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY FUNDS FROM THE WISCONSIN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES TO SUPPORT THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. SINCE 1974, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS EMPOWERED OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS, AGED 55 AND OLDER, TO CARE FOR MILWAUKEE COUNTY'S FRAIL AND HOMEBOUND ELDERLY. SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND FRIENDSHIP TO OLDER ADULT CLIENTS AT RISK OF ISOLATION AND INSTITUTIONALIZATION AND ASSIST WITH DAILY ACTIVITIES. THE PROGRAM'S FOCUS AREA AND ACTIVITIES CONCENTRATE ON HEALTHY FUTURES AND PROVIDES SUPPORT TO MEET THE OBJECTIVE OF ALLOWING ELDERLY RESIDENTS TO AGE PLACE. 

SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL COMMIT THEIR SUPPORT TO SERVE AS COMPANIONS TO ADDRESS THE COMMUNITY NEED OF COMPANIONSHIP AND ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING FOR OLDER ADULTS AT RISK OF ISOLATION, BASED ON ASSESSMENTS CONDUCTED BY THE STATE OF WISCONSIN HEALTH SERVICES AND THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY DEPARTMENT ON AGING. THE PROJECT WILL HELP 320 OLDER AND DISABLED ADULTS MAINTAIN A MAXIMUM FEASIBLE LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE AND QUALITY OF LIFE.

CATHOLIC SOCIAL SERVICES IS AN ANTI-POVERTY AGENCY WHOSE GOAL IS TO EMPOWER PEOPLE IN NEED?REGARDLESS OF BACKGROUND?WITH THE TOOLS, THEY NEED TO REACH THEIR FULL POTENTIAL.

ACCORDING TO THE 2018 CENSUS, 31 PERCENT OF PEOPLE AGED 65 AND OLDER LIVED ALONE, WITH NUMBERS ESTIMATED TO BE MUCH HIGHER BY 2022 (U.S. CENSUS BUREAU, 2018). STUDIES SHOW SENIORS WHO LIVE ALONE OFTEN EXPERIENCE SOCIAL ISOLATION AND CHRONIC FEELINGS OF LONELINESS, WHICH CAUSE DEPRESSION, ILLNESS, AND EVEN DEATH.
AN ESTIMATED 111 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ANNUALLY SERVE 500 CLIENTS. OF THESE COMPANIONS AND CLIENTS IN THE PROGRAM, 111 COMPANIONS AND 500 CLIENTS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO INCREASE SOCIAL SUPPORT IN THE COMMUNITY AND TO REDUCE ISOLATION BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, CONVERSATION, RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES, TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENTS, PHYSICAL EXERCISE, AS WELL AS ENCOURAGING EXCURSIONS OUT OF THE HOME SUCH AS SHOPPING OR GOING OUT FOR LUNCH.  

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT ARE OTHER HEALTHY FUTURES AND AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 155 SENIOR COMPANIONS AND 635 CLIENTS WILL BE LESS ISOLATED AND HAVE AN IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $378,782 HAS A MATCH OF $167,657 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDING. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE A SELF-REPORTING SURVEY TO DETERMINE WHETHER SENIOR COMPANIONS AND CLIENTS HAVE AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES AND CAN LIVE INDEPENDENTLY DUE IN PART TO THE SERVICES OF THE PROGRAM.

VOLUNTEERING IS GOOD FOR THE COMMUNITY AND FOR VOLUNTEERS.  HOWEVER, OLDER AMERICANS WHO HAVE LOW-INCOMES AND LEVELS OF EDUCATION OFTEN HAVE BARRIERS TO VOLUNTEERING, INCLUDING VULNERABILITY TO POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES.  ACCORDING TO A 2019 INDEPENDENT REPORT SPONSORED BY CNCS, ?SENIOR CORPS PROVIDES THE ACCESS, STRUCTURE, AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR LOW-INCOME, AT-RISK AMERICANS 55 AND OLDER TO LIVE HAPPIER, HEALTHIER LIVES WHILE MAKING A DIFFERENCE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES? (SENIOR CORPS.GOV/HEALTHY VOLUNTEERS.)
FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. (F&CS) IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY HEADQUARTERED IN RAVENNA, OHIO IN PORTAGE COUNTY. WITH 71 PROGRAMS IN 21 COUNTIES IN OHIO AND 2 COUNTIES IN MICHIGAN AND THE WORK OF OVER 600 EMPLOYEES, MORE THAN 100,000 CHILDREN AND ADULTS WERE ASSISTED IN 2017. SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 1941, FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. HAS SOUGHT TO STRENGTHEN, EMPOWER, AND ENRICH INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES THROUGH A BROAD CONTINUUM OF SERVICES. THE AGENCY IS GUIDED BY A COMMITMENT TO INDIVIDUAL DIGNITY, SERVICE EXCELLENCE, ACCOUNTABILITY, VOLUNTEERISM, AND BELIEF IN THE SOLIDARITY OF THE HUMAN FAMILY. 
FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. PROPOSES TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SENIOR CORPS OPPORTUNITIES IN OHIO COMMUNITIES BY REQUESTING RENEWAL OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM GRANT FOR THE THREE-COUNTY AREA OF STARK, SUMMIT, AND PORTAGE IN OHIO.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN THIS REGION CURRENTLY HAS 30 VOLUNTEERS SERVING AN AVERAGE OF 25 HOURS PER WEEK, WITH RECRUITMENT INCREASING THROUGH CONTINUOUS COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT. IN 2019-2020 THE EXPECTATION IS THAT THERE WILL BE UP TO 40 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN TRAINING OR ACTIVELY SERVING. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT ADDRESSES HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREAS, SPECIFICALLY WITH FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING PERFORMANCE MEASURES: H4 NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS SERVED, H9A INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND H14 RESPITE SERVICES. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL SENIOR HOUSING FACILITIES AND THE LOCAL CHAPTERS OF UNITED WAY, AREA AGENCY ON AGING, HOSPICE, SENIOR HOUSING BUILDINGS, AND LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS, THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN STARK, SUMMIT, AND PORTAGE COUNTIES IN OHIO WILL PROVIDE RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS OR COMPANIONSHIP TO CLIENTS THAT WILL INCLUDE SOCIALIZATION AND ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING. THE EXPECTED RESULTS ARE THAT 40 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN AND CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITY SO THAT 50+ BENEFICIARIES WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND THAT BOTH CLIENTS AND CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND/OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. 
FOR THIS PURPOSE, F&CS IS REQUESTING 39 VSY'S WITH A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $233,726, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $23,372 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE MISSION OF THE CORPORATION FOR OHIO APPALACHIAN DEVELOPMENT (COAD), IS TO PROVIDE A UNIFIED VOICE AND REPRESENTATION FOR ITS MEMBER AGENCIES AND THE CONSTITUENTS THAT THEY SERVE, PRIMARILY LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, CHILDREN, AND THE ELDERLY. SINCE 1971, COAD HAS WORKED TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ALL RESIDENTS OF APPALACHIAN OHIO. TO THIS END, WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDING FOR 80 VSYS FOR SENIOR COMPANIONS. 
THIS PROPOSAL WILL ADDRESS THE CATEGORY OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND SPECIFICALLY INDEPENDENT LIVING IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THE COMMUNITY NEED OF ASSISTING OLDER ADULTS STAY IN THEIR HOMES AS THEY AGE. MANY OLDER OHIOANS LIVING IN THE APPALACHIAN REGION OF OHIO SUFFER FROM SOCIAL ISOLATION DUE TO THE RURAL NATURE OF THE AREA. ACCORDING TO AN ARTICLE IN THE JOURNAL OF SOCIAL BEHAVIOR (CORNWELL AND WAITE, 2009), INDIVIDUALS WHO LACK SOCIAL CONNECTIONS OR REPORT FREQUENT FEELINGS OF LONELINESS TEND TO SUFFER HIGHER RATES OF MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY, AS WELL AS INFECTION DEPRESSION, AND COGNITIVE DECLINE.
THE ISSUE OF SOCIAL ISOLATION IS AMPLIFIED BY THE LACK OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION AND REDUCED OPTIONS IN HEALTH CARE SERVICE DELIVERY WHICH PLACES THEM AT GREAT RISK FOR EVENTUAL INSTITUTIONALIZED LIVING. UNFORTUNATELY, AS THE COST OF NURSING HOME CARE CONTINUES TO BURDEN THE FEDERAL MEDICAID SYSTEM, KEEPING SENIORS IN THEIR HOMES IS NOT ONLY A COST SAVING FOR THE GOVERNMENT, BUT ALSO NECESSARY FOR THE SENIORS WITH LIMITED BUDGETS.   PROVIDING IN-HOME SERVICES TO ELDERLY POPULATIONS IN THE COUNTIES SERVED BY THE PROGRAM IS LESS COSTLY AND ALLOWS THE INDIVIDUAL GREATER INDEPENDENCE. 
COAD'S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM EVALUATES OUR PROGRAM FOR EFFECTIVENESS. OUR EVALUATION OF SERVICES WILL BE DONE VIA SURVEYS THAT ARE CONDUCTED WITH CLIENTS, VOLUNTEER STATIONS, COAD STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS. THE COMBINED DATA WILL PROVIDE AN ANALYSIS OF THE VALUE OF SERVICES AND PERFORMANCE OF VOLUNTEERS. THE OUTCOMES GENERATED BY THE PROGRAM WILL BE THAT CLIENTS SERVED WILL RECEIVE IN-HOME ASSISTANCE AS IDENTIFIED IN THE CLIENT'S CARE PLAN. THIS CARE MEANS THE CLIENTS WILL REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES. WE ESTIMATE THAT THE 120 CLIENTS RECEIVING SERVICES WILL REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES DURING THE GRANT PERIOD AND HAVE AN INCREASE SENSE OF INDEPENDENCE AND SELF-ESTEEM.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES SOUTHWESTERN OHIO SEEKS RENEWAL FUNDING FOR A LONG-STANDING SCP PROGRAM IN GREATER CINCINNATI.  CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS A SOCIAL SERVICE ORGANIZATION WHOSE MISSION IS ENLIGHTEN PEOPLE SO THEY MIGHT SEE THE LOVE OF GOD, SERVE THEM AND EMPOWER THEM TO RISE OUT OF POVERTY AND TO ADVANCE THE HUMAN DIGNITY AND WELFARE OF PEOPLE IN NEED, PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE SOCIAL SERVICES IN RESPONSE TO THE TEACHINGS OF CHRIST AND THE CATHOLIC CHURCH.  WE ARE COMMITTED TO EXTENDING GOD'S LOVE FOR THE HUMAN FAMILY BY ASSISTING PEOPLE TO LIVE MORE FULLY AND FREELY, TO ACCEPT  THAT LOVE FOR THEMSELVES AND TO SHARE IT WITH OTHERS. 

OVER THE COURSE OF THE PROGRAM PERIOD, 67 VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO FRAIL ELDERLY MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THEIR CLIENTS WITH AGING IN PLACE, PROVIDING HEALTH FUTURES, AND INCREASED SOCIAL NETWORKS AND SUPPORTS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION, ASSISTANCE WITH LIGHT GROCERY SHOPPING, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND TRANSPORTATION, AS WELL AS OTHER SERVICES.  THESE ACTIVITIES WILL TAKE PLACE IN PRIVATE HOMES AND SHELTERED WORKSHOP SETTINGS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE THAT INDIVIDUALS WILL REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES LONGER, DELAYING OR AVOIDING INSTITUTIONALIZATION. INDIVIDUALS' LIVES WILL BE ENHANCED, CREATING GREATER SELF-ESTEEM AND OVERALL SATISFACTION.  FOUR STATIONS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE THE SERVICES.

THE BENJAMIN ROSE INSTITUTE ON AGING ESTABLISHED IN 1908 AS A NON-PROFIT, NON-SECTARIAN COMMUNITY-BASED HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES AGENCY IS REGARDED AS A LEADER IN ASSISTING OLDER ADULTS' AGE WITH SELF-RESPECT.  THE AGENCY MISSION IS TO ADVANCE THE HEALTH, INDEPENDENCE, AND DIGNITY OF OLDER ADULTS BY RAISING THE STANDARDS FOR QUALITY CARE.  THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH ITS COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES, RESEARCH, RESIDENTIAL CARE, EDUCATION AND ADVOCACY THROUGHOUT CUYAHOGA COUNTY. THE INSTITUTE BEGAN SPONSORING SCP IN 1981 AS AN INTEGRAL COMPONENT OF THE COMMUNITY SERVICES DIVISION NOW KNOWN AS ELDERCARE SERVICES INSTITUTE. IN 2018, BENJAMIN ROSE INSTITUTE ON AGING CELEBRATED ITS 110TH ANNIVERSARY.  MOVING FORWARD, THE ORGANIZATION IS POSITIONED TO REMAIN A THOUGHT LEADER, TO LEAD INNOVATION IN SERVICE DELIVERY FOR OLDER ADULTS AND FAMILIES, AND TO EXPAND ITS POSITIVE IMPACT IN NORTHEAST OHIO AND THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY.

HEALTHCARE COSTS ARE GROWING ? THREATING TO CONSUME AN ENORMOUS PORTION OF DISCRETIONARY SPENDING IN STATE AND FEDERAL BUDGETS. THE CENTERS FOR MEDICAID AND MEDICARE SERVICES (CMS) ESTIMATES THAT HEALTH SPENDING WILL GROW 1.1% FASTER THAN OUR NATION?S GROSS DOMESTIC PRODUCT (GDP). AMAZINGLY, MUCH OF THE GROWTH CAN BE TRACED BACK TO A FEW VERY ILL INDIVIDUALS. A 2012 US DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES STUDY FOUND THAT 5% OF PATIENTS DRIVE 50% OF COSTS IN HEALTHCARE.  THESE INDIVIDUALS ARE LIKELY THE SAME PEOPLE WHO CONSUME A GREAT DEAL OF SOCIAL SERVICE SPENDING AS WELL ? THOUGH WE DON?T KNOW FOR SURE BECAUSE THE HEALTHCARE AND SOCIAL SERVICES SYSTEMS HAVE NO FORMAL MECHANISMS TO SHARE PATIENT/CLIENT INFORMATION. 

THESE SUPER UTILIZERS ARE DISPROPORTIONATELY WOMEN OVER THE AGE OF 65. THEY LIVE ALONE (MALE LIFE EXPECTANCY IS LOWER THAN WOMEN) AND MANY SUFFER FROM CHRONIC DISEASE AS THEY GROW OLDER. AS THEIR PHYSICAL HEALTH DETERIORATES, THEIR MINDS BEGIN TO GO AS WELL. THEY BECOME LONELY. MANY BEGIN TO VIEW HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS AS A PART OF THEIR SOCIAL CIRCLE. THEY CALL FOR EMERGENCY SERVICES (AMBULANCE) AND VISIT THE EMERGENCY DEPARTMENTS OF THEIR LOCAL HOSPITALS ? DRIVING UP SYSTEM COSTS. THEY TELL THEIR DOCTORS THEY SUFFER FROM HEADACHES, COLDS, AND UPSET STOMACH ? CONDITIONS THAT DO NOT REQUIRE EMERGENCY SERVICES. THESE DOCTORS KNOW THAT WHAT THESE PATIENTS TRULY NEED IS A FRIEND. THIS IS WHERE SENIOR COMPANIONS CAN OFFER GREAT VALUE BY CONTINUING TO DO WHAT WE HAVE DONE FOR THE PAST 45 YEARS: OFFER FRIENDLY SUPPORT TO PEOPLE WHO NEED OUR HELP. THE KEY DIFFERENCE TODAY IS THAT THE MEDICAL COMMUNITY IN MINNESOTA (BOTH PAYERS AND PROVIDERS) ARE BEGINNING TO UNDERSTAND WHAT WE HAVE ALWAYS KNOWN: SENIOR COMPANIONS HELP PEOPLE STAY HEALTHY. 

WE REMAIN COMMITTED TO OUR LONG STANDING PARTNERS ACROSS MINNESOTA. HOWEVER, THIS NEW GRANT CYCLE PRESENTS AN EVER GROWING OPPORTUNITY TO EXPAND OUR WORK AND CONTINUE MEASURING THE HEALTH IMPACTS OF COMPANIONSHIP ON OUR CLIENT POPULATION. INVESTMENTS MADE BY CNCS AND LUTHERAN SOCIAL SERVICE OF MINNESOTA OVER THE NEXT THREE YEARS WILL GIVE US NEW OPPORTUNITIES TO TALK ABOUT THE VALUE SENIOR COMPANIONS CREATE IN COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.

COMMUNITY SOCIAL SERVICES OF WAYNE COUNTY (CSSWC) PROVIDES VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR ADULTS AGES 55 AND OLDER THROUGH ITS THREE SENIOR CORPS VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS.  VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES ARE AVAILABLE TO INCOME ELIGIBLE ADULTS TO SERVE IN THE AREAS OF HEALTH CARE, CAREGIVER SUPPORT, MENTAL HEALTH AND END OF LIFE SUPPORT. 

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) WILL UTILIZE THE VOLUNTEER EFFORTS OF APPROXIMATELY 69 VOLUNTEERS PER YEAR IN A THREE-YEAR PERIOD. SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN STATIONS THROUGHOUT WAYNE COUNTY WITH SENIORS THAT ARE IN POOR HEALTH, OFFERING SOCIALIZATION AND COMPANIONSHIP FOR THEM AND RESPITE TO THEIR CAREGIVERS. VOLUNTEERS ARE ENGAGED IN VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS THAT ARE DESIGNED TO INCREASE THE SUPPORT SYSTEM OF CAREGIVERS AND AGENCIES THAT ARE HELPING ADULTS WHO HAVE MENTAL AND/OR PHYSICAL CHALLENGES TO SUPPORT AN IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE AND ALLOW SENIORS AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES. 

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF COMMUNITY SOCIAL SERVICES OF WAYNE COUNTY IS APPLYING FOR FUNDS FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TOTALING  $325,550. THESE FEDERAL FUNDS WILL BE APPLIED DURING THE PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2019 THROUGH JUNE 30, 2022. THIS AMOUNT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $107,466 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDS FROM THE STATE AGING & ADULT SERVICES AGENCY (AASA) FOR THE SAME TIME PERIOD. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS APPLYING FOR FUNDS FROM THE CORPORATION AND AASA BASED ON THE CONTINUED NEED TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER SUPPORT IN OUR COMMUNITY. 

SOME OF THE ADVANTAGES OF PLACING SCP VOLUNTEERS IN THE COMMUNITY TO SERVE OTHER SENIORS ARE: INCREASED CAREGIVER SUPPORT AS WELL AS INCREASED SOCIALIZATION FOR THOSE HOME-BOUND SENIORS WHO MAY BE EXPERIENCING ISOLATION AND OFTEN THE VOLUNTEER AND THE CLIENT BECOME FRIENDS WHO TRULY CARE FOR ONE ANOTHER.  SCP CLIENTS WHO ARE LINKED TO A VOLUNTEER WHO DRIVES MAY ALSO BE TAKEN TO THE GROCERY STORE OR TO THE BARBER/BEAUTY SHOP OR OTHER OUTINGS.  SCP REPORT THAT THEIR SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY IS A WAY TO GIVE BACK AND THAT BEING AN SCP VOLUNTEER AND HELPING OTHER SENIORS ALSO HELPS THEM STAY ACTIVE AND FEEL VALUED.

THE MISSION OF SOUTHWESTERN ILLINOIS COLLEGE (SWIC), THE GRANT APPLICANT, IS TO UPHOLD THE DIGNITY AND WORTH OF ALL PEOPLE AND HOLDS THE BELIEF THAT LEARNING IS A LIFE-LONG PROCESS WHICH ENHANCES THE QUALITY OF LIFE.  SWIC SEEKS TO CONTINUE SUPPORTING THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES BY APPLYING FOR THE RENEWAL GRANT (YEAR 1 OF 3) FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2019-2020 FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) GRANT PROVIDED BY THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS).  IF GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY TO BE AWARDED THIS RENEWAL GRANT, SWIC SCP WILL EXCEED THE REQUESTED 82 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY), AND PLACE 110 VOLUNTEERS IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ASSIST OLDER ADULTS, THOSE WITH DISABILITIES AND VETERANS NEEDING SUPPORTIVE SERVICES, TO CONTINUE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY.  CAREGIVERS WILL ALSO RECEIVE RESPITE FROM THE COMPANIONS' SUPPORT, IMPROVING THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE WITH VALUABLE SOCIAL RESOURCES AND EDUCATION.

IN ALIGNMENT WITH THE CNCS STRATEGIC PLAN, SWIC SCP HAS PRIORITIZED THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA BECAUSE OF THE DEMONSTRATED COMMUNITY NEED FROM THE IL DEPARTMENT ON AGING (IDOA) AND LOCAL AREA AGENCY ON AGING, AGESMART COMMUNITY RESOURCES, FOR SUPPORT OF INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE IN THE COUNTIES IT SERVES: MADISON, MONROE, RANDOLPH AND ST. CLAIR.  THROUGH A SUPPORTIVE PARTNERSHIP OF 9 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL CARRY OUT SERVICE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS SOCIALIZATION AND IN HOME SUPPORTS BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO APPOINTMENTS, MAKING A MEAL AND REMINDING THE CLIENT TO TAKE THEIR MEDICATIONS.  FOR THE FIRST YEAR OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE TARGET OUTCOME IS TO SUPPORT 230 OR MORE AT RISK HOME-BOUND AND ISOLATED SENIORS, DISABLED PERSONS, VETERANS AND CAREGIVERS.  SWIC IS REQUESTING THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $393,160.00 WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $137,925.00 OF LOCAL FUNDING AND $92,299.00 FROM THE STATE OF IL.  THIS GRANT APPLICATION WILL SHOW EVIDENCE THAT SUPPORTS WHY SWIC HAS BEEN SUCCESSFUL AS A SPONSOR FOR THE SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS OVER THE PAST 46 YEARS AND WILL CONTINUE TO DO SO IN THE FUTURE.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

SINCE 1978, THE CENTER OF CONCERN HAS BEEN SERVING SUBURBAN COOK COUNTY RESIDENTS WITH A FOCUS ON LOW-INCOME SENIORS, THE DISABLED, AND OTHERS IN NEED.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS FLOURISHED WHEN COMBINED WITH THE CENTER OF CONCERN'S LONG-STANDING COLLABORATION WITH SUBURBAN COOK COUNTY SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCIES, MUNICIPALITIES, FAITH-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, HOSPITALS, AND NURSING FACILITIES, ETC., THAT ENABLE OUR AGENCY TO EFFECTIVELY IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF SENIOR RESIDENTS AND IS A CONDUIT FOR SECURING VALUABLE VOLUNTEER RESOURCES.

THIS APPLICATION BEGINS OUR SECOND 3-YEAR GRANT CYCLE FOR THE CENTER OF CONCERN SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. WE PROPOSE TO HAVE A MINIMUM OF 56 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING AT A MINIMUM OF 56 VSYS BY THE END OF YEAR 3. OUR SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE VITAL SERVICES THAT ALLOW SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE.  SENIOR COMPANIONS SERVE ONE-ON-ONE WITH THE FRAIL OLDER ADULTS AND OTHER HOMEBOUND ADULTS.  SOME OF THE SERVICES PROVIDED WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, MEDICAL SERVICES, OPIOID/DRUG INTERVENTION, ELDER JUSTICE, AND RESPITE SERVICES FOR CAREGIVERS. THESE SERVICES WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS, REDUCE ISOLATION AND DEPRESSION, AND PREVENT AND IDENTIFY ELDER ABUSE. 

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS HEALTHY FUTURES AND AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, OVER 100 OLDER ADULTS, WILL HAVE BEEN PROVIDED SERVICES.

HAWKEYE COMMUNITY COLLEGE PROPOSES AN ESTIMATED ANNUAL SERVICE OF 62 SCP VOLUNTEERS. ALL 62 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. COMPANIONS' ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, RESPITE CARE, ASSISTANCE WITH LIGHT MEALS AND LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, SUPPORT IN COMPLETING ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING, AND ADDRESSING OTHER NEEDS IDENTIFIED IN THE CLIENT'S CARE PLAN AND LETTER OF AGREEMENT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, HAWKEYE'S SCP ANTICIPATES THAT AT LEAST 85% OF SENIORS SERVED BY SCP VOLUNTEERS, AND 85% OF CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $371,551 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $109,207 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

SIXTY (60) VOLUNTEERS ARE PART OF THE PROGRAM AND THEY OFFER THEIR SERVICES TO ADULTS WITH DELICATE HEALTH. THE MAIN FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AMONG THE SERVICES THAT THE VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE ARE: COMPANY, MEAL PREPARATION, PERSONAL HYGIENE, AND LIGHT HOME CHORES. THESE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED AT HOME AND FALL UNDER THE CATEGORIES OF INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE CARE. THE EXPECTED RESULT IS FOR 85% PEOPLE WITH DISABILITY TO ACHIEVE KEEPING THEIR INDEPENDENCE THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF OUR VOLUNTEERS. ALSO, FOR CAREGIVERS TO SHOW LESS STRESS AS THEY ARE BETTER ABLE TO PAY ATTENTION TO THEIR OWN HEALTH AND OTHER AREAS THAT MAY HAVE BEEN NEGLECTED. THE PROGRAM HAS FIVE (5) SERVICE STATIONS, OFICINA ASUNTOS FEDERALES, OFICINA ASUNTOS AL CIUDADANO, CENTRO ENVEJECIENTES RENACER, CASMPEA AND CENTRO ENVEJECIENTES CELIA T. DE MONDRIGUEZ  LOCATED IN THE MUNICIPALITIES OF JUNCOS, GURABO AND LAS PIEDRAS. THESE STATIONS ARE PUBLIC AGENCY AND HOUSING PROJECT THAT PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY.THE AMOUNT OF FEDERAL FUNDS ASSIGNED TO THE PROGRAM IS $284,947.95 FOR TWELVE MONTHS. THE AMOUNT OF FUNDS ASSIGNED TO THE PROGRAM WHERE THE SOURCE IS NOT THE FEDERAL GOVERNMENT IS $35,690. OUR ORGANIZATION HAS ELECTED  TO USE THE DE MINIMIS RATE OF10% OF  THAT AMOUNTS UP TO $7,168.35.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY:

INTRODUCTION

IN 1973, AMENDMENTS TO THE FEDERAL OLDER AMERICANS ACT MANDATED STATES TO ESTABLISH AREA AGENCIES ON AGING BASED ON UNITS KNOWN AS PLANNING AND SERVICE AREAS.  PENNSYLVANIA CHOSE TO DESIGNATE COUNTIES AS THESE PLANNING AND SERVICE AREAS.  IN 1974, BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES, INC. WAS FOUNDED AS THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING FOR BLAIR COUNTY.  SINCE ITS INCEPTION, THE PURPOSES OF THE AGENCY HAS BEEN TO DETERMINE AND ADDRESS THE LOCAL NEEDS OF THE COUNTY'S OLDER POPULATION BY PROVIDING A RESPONSIVE CONTINUUM OF SERVICES TO MEET THE LEVEL OF ASSISTANCE NEEDED.  IN THIS EFFORT, BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES, INC., WITH INPUT FROM A NUMBER OF RESOURCES, CREATE AND ADMINISTER A MULTI-YEAR PLAN TO ADDRESS THE CURRENT IDENTIFIED NEEDS OF THE COUNTY?S OLDER POPULATION.

BLAIR COUNTY'S AREA AGING ON AGING, BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES, INC., SERVES OVER 10,000 CONSUMERS 60 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER AND OTHERS IN NEED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS.  BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES, INC. IS A PRIVATE NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION GOVERNED BY A FIFTEEN-MEMBER BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND CURRENTLY HAS A STAFF OF 145 EMPLOYEES.  WITH 28 DIFFERENT SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE AGENCY, CONSUMERS RECEIVE SERVICES FOR A VARIETY OF NEEDS.  ALTHOUGH A MAJORITY OF SERVICES ARE PROVIDED DIRECTLY BY BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES, INC., A NUMBER OF ORGANIZATIONS ALSO PROVIDE SERVICES THROUGH SUBCONTRACTS.

BLAIR COUNTY'S TRENDS

WHILE THE COUNTY LOST 1.2% OF ITS TOTAL POPULATION FROM 2010 TO 2015, THE 60+ AGE GROUP GREW BY 13.6%.

APPROXIMATELY 39.2% OF THE COUNTY?S 65+ POPULATION HAS A DISABILITY.

WHILE 42.3% OF PENNSYLVANIA?S 60+ RESIDE ALONE, 43.8% OF BLAIR COUNTY?S 60+ LIVE ALONE.

THE DEMOGRAPHIC MAKEUP OF THE 60+ POPULATION IN BLAIR COUNTY SHOWS THAT 98.7% ARE WHITE AND 97.8% SPEAK ENGLISH ONLY.

WHILE 84% OF INDIVIDUALS OVER THE AGE OF 60 RECEIVE SOCIAL SECURITY INCOME, 19.7% ARE AT OR BELOW 150% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL.

NEEDS ASSESSMENT

IN GATHERING INPUT FOR THE AGENCY?S FOUR YEAR PLAN, A NUMBER OF SURVEYS WERE CONDUCTED WHICH TARGETED SPECIFIC GROUPS WITHIN BLAIR COUNTY.  SURVEYS FROM AGENCY CONSUMERS AND PROVIDERS, POTENTIAL CONSUMERS, AGENCY COUNCIL MEMBERS, AND AGENCY STAFF WERE RECEIVED ALONG WITH SOLICITATION OF INPUT FROM THE GENERAL POPULATION.  THE MESSAGES FROM ALL RESPONDENTS WERE SIMILAR IN NATURE.  CITED WERE NEEDED IMPROVEMENT IN ACCESS TO TRANSPORTATION, NUTRITION, HOME CARE, HEALTH CARE ISSUES, FINANCIAL CONCERNS AND HEALTH, WELLNESS AND SOCIALIZATION ACTIVITIES.

THE AGENCY'S FUTURE FOCUS

UPON REVIEW OF ALL PHASES OF THE AGENCY?S NEEDS ASSESSMENT PROCESS AND THE PENNSYLVANIA DEPARTMENT OF AGING?S POLICY THEMES, FOUR FOCUS AREAS HAVE BEEN ESTABLISHED FOR THE NEXT FOUR-YEAR PERIOD.  HOWEVER, AS THE AGENCY LOOKS AHEAD TO THESE FOUR YEARS, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT FLAT, EXTREMELY LIMITED GOVERNMENT FUNDING OR CUTS IN FUNDING WILL BE A REALITY.  TO ENSURE POSITIVE OUTCOMES, THE PREPARATION OF OBJECTIVES INCLUDE PROMOTING EXISTING SERVICES SUCH AS SENIOR CENTERS, CHOICES, AND TRANSPORTATION; PROTECTIVE SERVICES, OPTIONS AND DOMICILIARY CARE HOMES; ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF SERVICE PROVIDED BY MAINTAINING A ROBUST QUALITY ASSURANCE PROGRAM; AND EMPOWERING THE WORKFORCE BY SUPPORTING PAID AND UNPAID CAREGIVERS, VOLUNTEERS, AND AGENCY STAFF.  FOUR GOALS AND ASSOCIATED ACTIVITIES HAVE BEEN PLANNED, WHICH INCLUDE:

1.	PROMOTE EXISTING SERVICES
2.	IMPROVE ACCESS TO SERVICES
3.	ENHANCE QUALITY OF SERVICES
4.	EMPOWER THE WORKFORCE

BLAIR SENIOR SERVICES RECOGNIZES THE BENEFIT OF SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS TO MEETING THE NEEDS AND INTERESTS OF CONSUMERS IN ALL FOUR AREAS OF THE AGENCY'S FOUR-YEAR PLAN.
OVER THE COURSE OF A YEAR, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT 60 UNDUPLICATED SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 50 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS OF HOURS TO CLIENTS THROUGH IN-HOME AND RESPITE CARE ASSIGNMENT PLANS.  SENIOR COMPANIONS WITH IN-HOME ASSIGNMENTS WILL HELP WITH DAILY TASKS, INCLUDING ACCOMPANYING CLIENTS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, THE PHARMAC

PEOPLE INC. REQUESTS 70 VSYS TO SERVE 80  SENIOR CITIZENS, ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES OR THEIR CAREGIVERS LIVING IN ERIE COUNTY, NY. THEY WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION THROUGH A NETWORK OF 9 STATIONS SUCH AS COMMUNITY CENTERS, LOW-INCOME SENIOR HOUSING SITES, RESPITE CENTERS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO HELP SENIOR CITIZENS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO AGE IN PLACE. AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HELP 80 CLIENTS TO STRENGTHEN TIES WITH THE COMMUNITY AND REDUCE THEIR SOCIAL ISOLATION. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $357389 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $38,079 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

IN 1997 THE SALVATION ARMY BEGAN ITS INITIATIVE WITH THE CNCS SENIOR COMPANIONS PROGRAM (SCP) TO PROVIDE A GAP SERVICE GOVERNED BY THE SALVATION ARMY TO ASSIST OLDER HOME BOUND ADULTS IN ESSEX AND HUDSON COUNTY.  AN ESTIMATED 79 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE WITH THE OBJECTIVE TO TRAIN AND PLACE THESE VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS THAT WILL ENABLE 119 OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES INDEPENDENTLY.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE 
?	ASSISTING WITH MEAL PREPARATION AND OTHER INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES
?	ASSISTING WITH MEDICATION COMPLIANCE
?	PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND SOCIAL SUPPORT TO ADDRESS COGNITIVE DISORDERS, DEPRESSION, AND HOME SAFETY
?	ATTENDING APPOINTMENTS AND PROVIDING ADVOCACY SUCH AS DOCTOR VISITS, NUTRITION SITES, AND ERRANDS
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE WILL HAVE RETAINED 79 VOLUNTEERS AGES 55 AND OLDER.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL UTILIZE THEIR EXPERIENCES TO IMPROVE THE ABILITY OF 30 HOME BOUND SENIORS TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES INDEPENDENTLY, AS MEASURED BY THE INDEPENDENT LIVING IMPACT SCALE. IN ADDITION, THE SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL IMPROVE SOCIAL SUPPORT TO 89 HOME BOUND OLDER ADULTS BY PROVIDING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES, AS MEASURED BY THE COMPANIONSHIP OUTREACH ASSESSMENT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $312,412 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH A MATCH OF $42,102.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS BEEN IN NEW HAMPSHIRE SINCE 1976 WITH THE COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM BELKNAP-MERRIMACK COUNTIES, INC. (CAPBMCI) SERVING AS THE ADMINISTRATIVE AND FISCAL AGENT SINCE THAT TIME.  THE CAPBMCI AGENCY WAS ESTABLISHED IN 1965 UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE EQUAL OPPORTUNITY ACT OF 1964.  THE ELDER SERVICES DEPARTMENT WITHIN THE COMMUNITY ACTION PROGRAM BELKNAP-MERRIMACK COUNTIES, INC., HAS THE OVERSIGHT OF SEVERAL PROGRAMS THAT SERVE SENIORS, INCLUDING THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.  THE PRIMARY MISSION OF THE ELDER SERVICES DEPARTMENT IS TO PROMOTE INDEPENDENCE, EMOTIONAL AND PHYSICAL WELLNESS, A HIGHER QUALITY OF LIFE AND FOR THE MORE FRAIL POPULATION, TO PREVENT PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION.  THE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES OFFERED BY THE ELDER SERVICE DEPARTMENT PLAY A CRITICAL ROLE IN THE HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED SYSTEM OF NEW HAMPSHIRE.  THE SERVICES PROVIDED DEMONSTRATE A CONSISTENT EFFORT TO DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN PROGRAMS, ACCORDING TO NEEDS ASSESSED THROUGH LOCAL COMMUNITIES, RESOURCES AND CONSUMER CHOICES, FOR THOSE SENIORS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES WHO ARE AT THE HIGHEST RISK OF ISOLATION AND HEALTH DECLINE.
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF NEW HAMPSHIRE IS REQUESTING 68 VSYS FOR YEAR 1 OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT CYCLE AND $377,079 TO SUPPORT THE PROJECT FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE AND A CONTINUED NON-FEDERAL FUNDING LEVEL OF $118,226 THROUGH THE MARY GALE FOUNDATION, COUNTY, STATE FUNDING AND FUNDRAISING.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF NH'S (SCPNH) TWO ESSENTIAL FOCUS AREAS, HEALTHY FUTURES-INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, ARE CRITICAL TO THE PROGRAM AND CONTINUED PROJECT FUNDING WILL ENSURE THEIR ONGOING SUCCESS AND COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE.

THE SCPNH HAS ESTABLISHED EXTREMELY SUCCESSFUL PARTNERSHIPS WITH EIGHTEEN (18) ACTIVE SENIOR AND ADULT AFFILIATED AGENCIES THROUGHOUT THE STATE.  THESE PARTNERSHIPS SUPPORT AND STRENGTHEN OUR PROGRAM'S MISSION AND INCLUDE SENIOR CENTERS, VISITING NURSE ASSOCIATIONS AND FAMILY HEALTH CENTERS.  WE HAVE PARTNERED WITH TWO AGENCIES WITHIN HILLSBOROUGH COUNTY, PROVIDING SERVICES TO VETERANS AND OTHER FRAIL ELDERS. THE PROGRAM PRESENTLY COVERS SEVEN (7) OF NEW HAMPSHIRE'S TEN (10) COUNTIES;  BELKNAP, GRAFTON, HILLSBOROUGH, MERRIMACK, ROCKINGHAM, SULLIVAN AND STRAFFORD.  SCPNH IS LOOKING TO EXPAND INTO THE OTHER THREE (3) COUNTIES WITHIN THIS THREE YEAR GRANT; COOS, GRAFTON AND CHESHIRE. THIS REPRESENTS A SIGNIFICANT PORTION OF THE STATE IN WHICH THE PROGRAM IS THRIVING.

THE FIRST OF SCPNH'S TWO FOCUS AREAS, AN AGENCY-WIDE PRIORITY MEASURE ENTITLED "HEALTHY FUTURES INDEPENDENT LIVING," HAS AN ESTABLISHED GOAL OF HELPING FRAIL ELDERS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO AGE IN PLACE WITH THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY.  THE SENIOR COMPANIONS WITH WHOM THEY ARE PAIRED, HELP TO MEET THIS GOAL ON A WEEKLY BASIS BY PROVIDING ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING.  SCPNH WILL ADMINISTER AN ANNUAL SURVEY WHICH MEASURES THE NUMBERS OF OLDER ADULTS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORTS IN ORDER TO MONITOR THE OUTCOME OF THIS FOCUS AREA.  THE SCPNH'S SECOND FOCUS AREA, RESPITE FOR CAREGIVER, IS A PROGRAM IN WHICH SCPNH BOTH SPECIALIZES AND EXCELS.  THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES CAREGIVERS OF FRAIL ELDERS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO RECEIVE RESPITE ONE TO TWO TIMES A WEEK, GIVING THEM A MUCH NEEDED BREAK AND RENEWAL IN ENERGY, ALSO BENEFITTING THEIR LOVED ONE.  SCPNH WILL MEASURE THE OUTCOME OF THIS FOCUS AREA BY ANNUAL SURVEY OF THE CAREGIVERS WHO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR THEIR LOVED ONES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT FOR THEMSELVES SO THEY ARE ABLE TO PROVIDE ESSENTIAL SELF-CARE ON A WEEKLY BASIS.

SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE PLACED WITH VISITEES WITH WHOM THEY ARE LIKELY TO ESTABLISH LONG-LASTING RELATIONSHIPS BASED ON PERSONALITY, INTERESTS AND LOCATION.   OUR STATISTICS VALIDATE THIS TO BE AN EFFECTIVE STRATEGY BECAUSE RELATIONSHIPS LAST AN AVERAGE OF 3-5 YEARS AND HELP TO COMBAT THE LONEL

WITH THIS APPLICATION THE OPPORTUNITY ALLIANCE IS REQUESTING $114,154 FOR ITS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH AN EMPHASIS ON SUPPORTING AGING IN PLACE THROUGH THE PROVISION OF COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO ISOLATED ADULTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. 
INDEPENDENT LIVING: THE OLD, LIVING ALONE, FACE CONSIDERABLE CHALLENGES, BOTH PHYSICAL AND EMOTIONALLY, IN MAINTAINING THEIR INDEPENDENCE DUE TO INCREASING ISOLATION WHILE AGING IN PLACE.   36% OF OLDER MAINERS SURVEYED SAID THEY SOMETIMES OR OFTEN FELT LONELY AND ISOLATED. FOR THOSE RESPONDENTS USING MAINE STATE FUNDED HOME CARE SERVICES, HALF REPORTED NOT PARTICIPATING IN ANY TYPE OF SOCIAL ACTIVITY OUTSIDE OF THEIR HOME IN THE LAST 30 DAYS. THE VAST MAJORITY OF PEOPLE SAY GETTING OUT MORE OFTEN OR HAVING VISITORS WOULD HELP EASE THEIR FEELINGS OF ISOLATION. (MAINE'S STATE PLAN ON AGING 2012-2016)
FOR THOSE LIVING IN POVERTY, AND IN RURAL/SUBURBAN MAINE, A MAJOR BARRIER IS A LACK OF TRANSPORTATION. FOR SOME, THERE IS A LACK OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION, OTHERS AN INABILITY TO ACCESS AVAILABLE PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION DUE TO DISABILITY (I.E. WALK THE FOUR BLOCKS TO THE PUBLIC BUS STOP), OTHERS CANNOT AFFORD THE UPKEEP OF A VEHICLE, NOR HAVE FAMILY OR FRIENDS AVAILABLE DURING THE DAY TO TRANSPORT. THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MAINE'S MUSKIE INSTITUTE RESEARCHERS DOCUMENTED THE IMPACT OF THIS LACK OF ACCESS IN THE REPORT TRANSPORTATION 2006, A TREND THAT COMMUNITIES CONTINUE TO STRUGGLE WITH TODAY DUE TO THE ELIMINATION OF PUBLIC TRANSPORTATION FOR THE POOR AND ELDERLY INSTEAD OF WHAT WAS HOPED FOR -- AN INCREASE IN SUPPORT SERVICES.
SCP WILL PARTNER WITH MULTIPLE COMMUNITY PARTNERS ADDRESSING THESE BARRIERS TO AGING IN PLACE IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE NATIONAL MISSION-- MAKING INDEPENDENCE A REALITY.

 VOC HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) SINCE 1988. THE SCP SERVES CHICOPEE, HOLYOKE AND HOLLAND WITHIN HAMPDEN COUNTY.  VOC IS PROPOSING TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS OPPORTUNITIES FOR 26 SENIOR COMPANIONS DURING THE GRANT TIMEFRAME OF 7/1/2019 ? 6/30/1922.  THE FUNDING REQUEST IS $158,544.

ANTICIPATED RESULTS INCLUDE DECREASED ISOLATION AND LONELINESS AND IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE.
