THE STATE OF TEXAS, COUNTY OF HIDALGO-RIO GRANDE VALLEY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (RGV-SCP) PROJECT WILL BE SPONSORED BY THE HIDALGO COUNTY COMMUNITY SERVICE AGENCY LOCATED IN EDINBURG, TEXAS. THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY IS AN AREA LOCATED IN THE SOUTHERNMOST TIP OF SOUTH TEXAS. IT LIES ALONG THE NORTHERN BANK OF THE RIO GRANDE RIVER, WHICH SEPARATES MEXICO FROM THE UNITED STATES. THE REGION CONSISTS OF HIDALGO, CAMERON AND WILLACY COUNTIES. IT IS ONE OF THE FASTEST GROWING REGIONS IN THE UNITED STATES. COUNTY PROJECTIONS INDICATE A SIGNIFICANT GROWTH IN THE SENIOR POPULATION OF WHICH 23% ARE OF LOW-INCOME. MAJOR HEALTH ISSUES FOR THE SENIORS IN THE VALLEY ARE DIABETES, OBESITY, KIDNEY DISEASE AND HEART DISEASE. THE CNCS PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE RGV-SCP PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND THE OBJECTIVE ADDRESSED WITH BE AGING IN PLACE. THE PROJECT WILL ENGAGE 71 VOLUNTEERS 55 AND OLDER, ESPECIALLY THOSE WITH LIMITED INCOMES, IN PERSON-TO-PERSON SUPPORTIVE COMPANIONSHIP SERVICE TO SENIORS IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENT LIVING.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL CUMULATIVELY SERVE APPROXIMATELY 74,000 HOURS ANNUALLY.  EACH VOLUNTEER WILL SERVE A MINIMUM OF 15 AND MAXIMUM OF 40 HOURS WEEKLY AT $2.65 AN HOUR. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO EARN LEAVE FOR PERFECT ATTENDANCE AND ACCURE UP TO 8 HOURS OF LEAVE PER MONTH.  EACH VOLUNTEER STATION WILL SELECT ONE OF THE VOLUNTEERS AS THE LEADER AND WILL RECEIVE UP TO 8 STIPEND HOURS A MONTH IN ADDITION TO THEIR WEEKLY STIPEND. THE RGV-SCP PROJECT STAFF WILL ENSURE THE VOLUNTEERS DO NOT EXCEED THE REQUIRED STIPEND HOURS PER YEAR. 
100% OF THE 71 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED MEASURES IN SENIOR COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP, COMMUNICATING CLIENT NEEDS TO PROGRAM STAFF, EXERCISING, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREPARATION, AND PROVIDE INFORMATION ON GOOD HEALTH PRACTICES AND PREVENTION. BY DOING THIS, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION, SUPPORT CARE, PERSONAL CARE AND HOME MANAGEMENT ASSISTANCE TO THE ELDERLY, THE DISABLED AND VETERANS SO THEY CAN REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND OUT OF NURSING HOMES.  THE VOLUNTEERS WILL ENGAGE OVER 140 SENIORS IN SERVICE ACTIVITIES TO REDUCE SOCIAL ISOLATION BY VOLUNTEERING A MINIMUM OF 15 AND A MAXIMUM OF 40 HOURS A WEEK. THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN SENIOR RESIDENTIAL COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE GEOGRAPHIC SERVICE AREA. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $427,478 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH $47,022 OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM THE COUNTY OF HIDALGO, TEXAS.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS IN THE UNIQUE POSITION OF 
BEING UNDER THE AUSPICES OF SENIOR LINK MIDLAND SINCE 2003. 
SENIOR LINK HAS A PROVEN TRACK RECORD OF ITS CAPABILITY TO BE ONE 
OF TWO STATE AGENCIES THAT HOUSES ALL THREE SENIOR CORPS 
PROGRAMS. SENIOR LINK'S MISSION STATEMENT IN PART READS "TO 
ADDRESS THE CHALLENGES RELATED TO AGING AND DEVELOP EFFICIENT, 
FLEXIBLE, AND COMPASSIONATE WAYS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF OUR 
COMMUNITY". THE PURPOSE IS TO PLACE VOLUNTEERS WHO ARE 55 
YEARS OLD AND LOW INCOME TO ASSIST FRAIL SENIORS WHO WANT TO 
REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES. THIS ALLOWS 
DISENFRANCHISED SENIORS THE ABILITY TO RECONNECT, TO REINTEGRATE 
BACK INTO THE COMMUNITY AND MAKE USE OF RESOURCES THAT CAN 
IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. THIS IN EXCHANGE STRENGTHENS 
COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS. SENIORS WHO ARE STILL ABLE TO DO FOR 
THEMSELVES AND ASSIST DISABLED SENIORS CAN PROVIDE SERVICES 
FROM FIFTEEN TO FORTY HOURS PER WEEK AND RECEIVE A NON-TAXABLE 
STIPEND TO SUPPLEMENT THEIR ALREADY LOW INCOME.  THE SENIOR 
COMPANION FEELS THEY STILL HAVE A PURPOSE, A GIFT TO SHARE WITH 
THOSE MOST UNFORTUNATE. THE CLIENT HAS A SENIOR COMPANION TO 
VISIT WITH, TO BE TRANSPORTED TO A DOCTORS APPOINTMENT, PICK UP 
MEDICATIONS, RUN ERRANDS WITH OR VISITING A SENIOR MEAL CENTER TO 
PARTAKE IN ACTIVITIES OR JUST TO SOCIALIZE. IF THE CLIENT HAS FAMILY IT 
GIVES THE CARETAKER A SENSE OF RELIEF BY HAVING A SENIOR 
COMPANION ASSIST THEIR LOVED ONE. THIS MEETS THE HUMAN 
REQUIREMENT OF COMPANIONSHIP. THIS MEANINGFUL RELATIONSHIP IS 
CONDUCIVE TO IMPROVED HEALTH BENEFITS AND FINANCIAL GAINS WHICH 
GIVES VIABILITY AND SUSTAINABILITY TO THE SENIOR COMPANION 
PROGRAM.
TO ACHIEVE THIS OPPORTUNITY AN ESTIMATED NUMBER OF 31
UNDUPLICATED SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO PROVIDE 
SERVICES TO FRAIL SENIORS. OF THIS NUMBER 31 SENIOR COMPANIONS 
WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN THE FOCUS AREA OF 
HEALTHY FUTURES. THEIR SERVICE ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, 
TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE. AT THE COMPLETION OF THE THREE-YEAR 
GRANT, 31 WILL BE IN ANTICIPATED AGING IN PLACE OUTCOMES. THE 
CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $182,139 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY 
SENIOR LINK'S GRANTEE CONTRIBUTION OF TEN PER-CENT OF NON-FEDERAL 
MONIES.

AN ESTIMATED 76 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THROUGH THE DALLAS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.  ALL 76 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: COMPANIONSHIP, MEAL PREPARATION, TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE, AND RESPITE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH PRIORITY MEASURES IN RESPITE AND INDEPENDENT LIVING.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 45 INDIVIDUALS WILL RECEIVE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES AND 50 CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $341,064 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $104,528 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION FOUNDATION, INC. IS A PRIVATE, NON-PROFIT CORPORATION ORGANIZED FOR THE PURPOSE OF PLANNING, COORDINATING, AND EXECUTING PROGRAMS AUTHORIZED BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL ENTITIES TO ALLEVIATE AND ATTEMPT TO ERADICATE POVERTY IN SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA.  THE MISSION OF DELTA COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY IS TO PROMOTE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AMONG OUR CITIZENS, TO SECURE OPPORTUNITIES TO WORK, TO LIVE IN DECENCY, AND WITH DIGNITY.

WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDING FOR THE DELTA SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN THE AMOUNT OF $225,121 TO BE USED FOR 38 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSYS) TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER WORK IN CARTER, COMANCHE, GARVIN, MCCLAIN, MURRAY, AND STEPHENS COUNTIES, LOCATED IN SOUTHERN OKLAHOMA.  DELTA SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE APPROXIMATELY 51 ELDERLY ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, OR MENTAL HEALTH LIMITATIONS.  EVERY VOLUNTEER WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.

SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST FRAIL SENIORS IDENTIFIED BY LOCAL HOME HEALTH-CARE AGENCIES, REFERRALS, AND OTHER COLLABORATIONS.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CLIENTS BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, HELPING CLIENTS WITH CHORES SUCH AS LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, BUYING GROCERIES, AND FINDING TRANSPORTATION TO AND FROM MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS.  THE VOLUNTEER WILL MEET WITH EACH CLIENT 3-5 DAYS A WEEK AND SERVE 15-40 HOURS PER WEEK ASSISTING CLIENTS IN MAINTAINING AN INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLE.

SC VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE NON-PROFESSIONAL SERVICES TO ASSIST PRIMARY CAREGIVERS IN TAKING CARE OF SENIORS WHO ARE HOMEBOUND.  SPECIAL DUTIES WILL BE ASSIGNED AT PLACEMENT BASED ON THE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF THE CAREGIVER/CLIENT.  THE VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE RESPITE SERVICES AT A MINIMUM OF 2 TIMES PER WEEK AND MUST NOT SERVE MORE THAN 40 HOURS PER WEEK OR 8 HOURS IN ONE SINGLE DAY.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE DELTA SCP IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST IN PREVENTING OR DELAYING INSTITUTIONALIZATION OF ADULTS, PRIMARILY OLDER ADULTS, WITH MENTAL, EMOTIONAL, AND/OR PHYSICAL IMPAIRMENTS WHO NEED OUTSIDE ASSISTANCE TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR FULLEST POTENTIAL TO MANAGE THEIR LIVES.  VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO PROVIDE CARE TO HOUSEHOLDS IN WHICH THE BURDEN OF CARE RESTS WITH HOUSEHOLD MEMBERS WHO FIND IT DIFFICULT TO PROVIDE THE LEVEL OF SUPPORT NEEDED TO PREVENT INSTITUTIONALIZATION.
THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME AT THE END OF THE GRANT WILL BE THAT AGING ADULTS AND CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE CARE AND SERVICES ALLOWING THEM TO HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $225,121 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY ANTICIPATED FUNDING OF IN-KIND DONATIONS TOTALING MORE THAN $22,512.

THE SCP IN SOCORRO COUNTY IS A LONG-STANDING PROGRAM THAT FOCUSES ON PLACING VOLUNTEERS WHO CAN PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO ELDERLY ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL HEALTH LIMITATIONS, IN AN EFFORT TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENT LIVING.

THE SOCORRO SCP PROGRAM HAS A DUAL PURPOSE: FIRST, TO ENGAGE IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE PERSONS AGED 55 YEARS AND OLDER, PARTICULARLY THOSE WITH LIMITED INCOME; SECOND, TO MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS AND TO PROVIDE A HIGH-QUALITY EXPERIENCE THAT WILL ENRICH THE LIVES OF THE VOLUNTEERS AND THOSE THEY SERVE. 

AN ESTIMATED SEVEN SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN OUR PROGRAM, AND SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ASSISTING HOME BOUND CLIENTS WITH CHORES, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, PAYING BILLS, GROCERY SHOPPING, AND TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL AND OTHER APPOINTMENTS. VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE EMOTIONAL SUPPORT AND A STABLE, LOVING PRESENCE FOR SENIORS WITH LEARNING CHALLENGES. OUR VOLUNTEERS IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF FELLOW SENIORS WHO REQUIRE THE LOVE, PERSONAL CARE AND ATTENTION WHICH AN ELDER CAN SO EFFECTIVELY PROVIDE.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS SOCORRO COUNTY. THIS IS THE FIRST YEAR OF OUR MULTI-YEAR GRANT, AND THERE ARE NO FEDERAL DOLLARS SUPPLEMENTING THIS PROJECT.

THE NATCHITOCHES PARISH GOVERNMENT OFFICE OF COMMUNITY SERVICES (OCS) IS SUBMITTING THIS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) GRANT RENEWAL APPLICATION TO THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE.  THIS GRANT WILL PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS WITH PHYSICAL LIMITATIONS IN AN EFFORT TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENT.
     AN ESTIMATED 48 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.  SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE:
        1.	COMPANIONSHIP/SUPPORT
                 A) ACCOMPANYING A CLIENT TO A DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENT
                 B) ENCOURAGING EXERCISE, TAKING WALKS 
                 C)  MONITORING MEDICATION (NOT DISTRIBUTING)
                 D)  ASSIST WITH LIGHT GROOMING
        2.	NUTRITION
                 A)  ASSISTING WITH SIMPLE MEAL PREPARATION 
                 B)  ACCOMPANYING A CLIENT TO A NUTRITION SITE
       3.	SOCIAL/RECREATION
                A)  PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TALKING, LISTENING
                B)  PROMOTING A CLIENT CONTACT WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS
                C)  ACCOMPANYING A CLIENT TO A RECREATIONAL, SOCIAL OR EDUCATIONAL EVENT
       4.	HOME MANAGEMENT
                 A)  SHOPPING, DOING ERRANDS
                 B)  WRITING LETTERS, READING, SORTING BILLS
                 C)  LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING WITH THE CLIENT

     THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.
     AT THE END OF THIS PROJECT PERIOD, JUNE 30, 2019, THE FOLLOWING ANTICIPATED OUT COMES WE WILL ACHIEVED:
      1.	CLIENTS WHO REPORT  MAINTAINING AN INDEPENDENT LIFE STYLE FOR A LONGER PERIOD OF TIME BECAUSE OF  ASSISTANCE FROM SENIOR COMPANION
       2.	CAREGIVERS OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT. 
     THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $210,081 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $30,789.

FORT HAYS STATE UNIVERSITY (FHSU), ESTABLISHED IN 1902, IS A LIBERAL ARTS UNIVERSITY IN THE KANSAS REGENTS SYSTEM.  IN 1974, FHSU WAS THE FIRST INSTITUTION OF HIGHER EDUCATION IN THE NATION TO BE AWARDED A SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP). IN 1997 THE UNIVERSITY WAS AWARDED THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM (FGP) TO ENGAGE SENIORS IN SERVICE TO CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS IN WESTERN KANSAS.  SCP IS CURRENTLY ADMINISTERED BY THE COLLEGE OF HEALTH & BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES AND IS ALIGNED WITH THE FHSU MISSION TO MEET THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF WESTERN KANSAS AND PROVIDE PUBLIC SERVICE. THE SCP SERVICE AREA ENCOMPASSES FOURTEEN COUNTIES IN WESTERN KANSAS.  

FHSU REQUESTS $460,235 IN FEDERAL RESOURCES TO BE MATCHED WITH REQUIRED NON-FEDERAL AND IN-KIND RESOURCES TO SUPPORT 88 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS.  SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ADDRESS THE FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES:  H8:  AGING IN PLACE: SERVING OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES THAT INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT, ALLOWING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ALSO ADDRESS THE FOCUS AREA H13: AGING IN PLACE:  PROVIDING RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHICH RESULT IN INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT; AND H9: HOMEBOUND, FRAIL AND DISABLED ADULTS RECEIVING COMPANIONSHIP, FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  H14: - CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. 

SEMI-ANNUAL SURVEYS WILL BE CONDUCTED TO DEMONSTRATE THE IMPACT AND OUTCOMES OF THE SERVICES PROVIDED.

THE METRO VOLUNTEERS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) ADDRESSES CNCS "HEALTHY FUTURES" BY PROVIDING VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOW-INCOME SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS TO SERVE OTHER OLDER ADULT INDIVIDUALS TO HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR ABILITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES -- AND WITH EITHER IMPROVED OR EQUAL QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE -- IN ADAMS, ARAPAHOE, DENVER, JEFFERSON, AND DOUGLAS COUNTIES IN COLORADO. CITIES TO BE SERVED REPRESENT A MIX OF URBAN AND SUBURBAN NEIGHBORHOODS IN DENVER, AURORA, WHEAT RIDGE, WESTMINSTER, THORNTON, LAKEWOOD, LITTLETON, ENGLEWOOD, AND GLENDALE. INDIVIDUALS SERVED AND SCP VOLUNTEERS ARE LOW-INCOME AND WILL BENEFIT FROM ONE-TO-ONE VISITS AND TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE. SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS BENEFIT BY REMAINING ACTIVE, MEETING A SOCIAL OR DAILY NEED, AND FEELING VALUED. IN THIS WAY, SCP MEETS THE FOCUS AREAS OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR PARTICIPANTS. 
AN ESTIMATED 81 UNDUPLICATED SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN COLORADO. METRO VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE LOW-INCOME OLDER COLORADANS, WHOSE NEEDS QUALIFY THEM FOR NURSING HOME CARE. THE CASE MANAGEMENT PROGRAM HELPS THESE FRAIL OLDER ADULTS MANAGE AN ARRAY OF FUNDING AND SERVICE OPTIONS WHICH ALLOW THEM TO LIVE IN THEIR OWN HOMES OR APARTMENTS. WITHOUT THESE NEEDED SERVICES, CLIENTS WILL BE AT SIGNIFICANTLY GREATER RISK FOR PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION. SENIOR COMPANIONS CAN ASSIST CLIENTS WITH BUILDING OR MAINTAINING THEIR INDEPENDENT LIVING SKILLS BY PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND VISITING SERVICES, THEREBY FORESTALLING INSTITUTIONALIZATION. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, ERRANDS, ASSISTANCE WITH DAILY ACTIVITIES, AND ENGAGEMENT IN COMMUNITY AND OTHER AGENCY ACTIVITIES TO HELP FRAIL, ELDERLY CLIENTS AGE IN PLACE AND HAVE HEALTHY FUTURES. DURING THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, METRO VOLUNTEERS WILL REACH A PROJECTED 1,000 TO 1,500 LOW-INCOME, FRAIL, OLDER ADULTS WHO WILL RECEIVE INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT (PM 1.2 AND 2.2); WILL RECEIVE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES (PM 2.2); AND ONE TO ONE TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE PM 1.1 AND 2.1). THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $428,133 PER YEAR ($1,284,399 OVER THREE YEARS) WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $60,856 PER YEAR ($182,568 OVER THREE YEARS).

PIMA COUNCIL ON AGING (PCOA) REQUESTS 35 VSYS (36,540 HOURS) PER YEAR FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) SERVING PIMA COUNTY, ARIZONA. WE REQUEST $210,232 IN FEDERAL FUNDS, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY AT LEAST $60,000 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES. THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS SERVICE CATEGORIES.

AS A REPLACEMENT GRANTEE, PIMA COUNCIL ON AGING PROPOSES TO HONOR THE FUNDAMENTAL PROGRAM MODEL THAT HAS ASSISTED SO MANY OLDER PEOPLE IN OUR COMMUNITY SINCE 2001, WHILE INCORPORATING ELEMENTS TO MAXIMIZE LIMITED RESOURCES AND FOCUS ON THE GREATEST NEEDS OF PIMA COUNTY'S OLDER ADULTS. THROUGH SCP, WE WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND IN-HOME ASSISTANCE WITH DAILY LIVING TO HELP HOME-BOUND OLDER ADULTS MAINTAIN THE HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE POSSIBLE WHILE LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES. RESPITE SERVICES PROVIDED BY SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL HELP CAREGIVERS TAKE PERSONAL TIME TO ATTEND TO THEIR OWN NEEDS AND AVOID BURNOUT. RESEARCH SHOWS THAT RESPITE CARE REDUCES ABUSE AND NEGLECT AND IMPROVES OVERALL QUALITY OF CARE, AND EXTENDS THE TIME OLDER ADULTS CAN LIVE IN THEIR HOME OF CHOICE. 

BASED ON LONGSTANDING RESULTS FROM THE SCP IN PIMA COUNTY, WE ANTICIPATE THE FOLLOWING PROJECT OUTCOMES:	
OUTCOME 1: 90% OF OLDER ADULTS WE SERVE WILL REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY, OUT OF INSTITUTIONALIZED CARE; AND OUTCOME 2: 90% OF CAREGIVERS WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE IN-HOME CARE FOR OUR OLDER CLIENTS AS A RESULT OF RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO ASSIST THE ELDERLY AND DISABLED ADULTS IN OUR COMMUNITIES LIVE MEANINGFUL, DIGNIFIED, AND INDEPENDENT LIVES IN THEIR HOMES. WE DO THIS BY DOING THINGS THAT A GOOD NEIGHBOR WOULD DO; WE VISIT WITH THEM, WE CHECK ON THEM, WE HUG THEM, WE TAKE THEM TO THE GROCERY STORE AND PHARMACY, WE TAKE THEIR TRASH OUT, WE PLAY CARD GAMES WITH THEM, AND WE SIT WITH THEM WHILE THEIR PRIMARY CAREGIVERS REST OR RUN ERRANDS. OUR PROGRAM IS VITAL TO THE SUCCESS OF THESE INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN LIVING AT HOME, WHERE THEY WANT TO SPEND THE REST OF THEIR GOLDEN YEARS. WE HAVE SUCCESSFULLY ASSISTED HUNDREDS OF INDIVIDUALS BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE SERVICES. BY USING ASSIGNMENT PLANS, TASK SHEETS, AND OUR MONTHLY REPORTING SYSTEM, WE ARE ABLE TO SUCCESSFULLY TRACK THE SERVICES WE OFFER OUR CLIENTS. ALL OF OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE TRAINED TO PROVIDE SERVICES IN THESE AREAS; HOWEVER EACH VOLUNTEER IS ONLY COUNTED 1 TIME IN EACH OUTPUT. WITH AGING IN PLACE AS OUR OBJECTIVE, WE HAVE CHOSEN TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP AS OUR ACTIVITIES FOR H8. USING LAST YEAR'S REPORTS, WE HAVE ESTIMATED THAT WE CAN PLACE 30 VOLUNTEERS IN OUR TRANSPORTATION CATEGORY SERVING 100 CLIENTS WITH A TARGET OUTCOME OF 75. WE HAVE PLACED 64 CLIENTS IN H8 UNDER COMPANIONSHIP TO SERVE 220 CLIENTS WITH 165 OF THEM REPORTING A 3 OR A 4 ON THE FIRST 2 QUESTIONS OF THE SURVEY THAT INDICATES PERCEIVED ISOLATION AND LONELINESS. IN H13, OUR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP WHILE PROVIDING RESPITE FOR A PRIMARY CAREGIVER OF A CLIENT. WE HAVE PROJECTED 30 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 30 CLIENTS IN THIS CAPACITY, WITH 22 CAREGIVERS REPORTING AN INCREASED PERCEPTION OF SOCIAL SUPPORT. OUR PROGRAM WILL STRIVE TO ACHIEVE THESE NUMBERS WHILE CONTINUING TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE IN OUR COMMUNITIES.

THE CENTRAL ARKANSAS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY CARELINK FOR 32 YEARS, AND HAS BEEN THE CENTRAL ARKANSAS AREA AGENCY ON AGING FOR 39 YEARS. CARELINK SERVES SIX COUNTIES; FAULKNER, LONOKE, MONROE, PRAIRIE, PULASKI AND SALINE. IN 2017 CARELINK SERVED A TOTAL OF 13,225 OLDER PEOPLE AND THEIR FAMILIES. 

CARELINK SERVES THREE TYPES OF OLDER PEOPLE: HOMEBOUND ADULTS, ACTIVE ELDERLY, AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS. WITH THE HELP OF CARELINK, HOMEBOUND ADULTS ARE ABLE TO STAY IN THEIR HOMES AS LONG AS POSSIBLE, AVOIDING THE NEED FOR COSTLY LONG-TERM CARE FACILITY. CARELINK ALSO PROVIDES INFORMATION TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS AND ASSISTS THEM IN NAVIGATING THROUGH THE MAZE OF AVAILABLE SERVICES. THROUGH WELLNESS PROGRAMS, SENIOR CENTERS AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES, THE ACTIVE ELDERLY ARE ABLE TO CONTINUE TO STAY FIT AND HEALTHY.

CARELINK IS COMMITTED TO SPONSORING THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE CHANGING ELDERLY DEMOGRAPHICS IN OUR REGIONS. AS THE BABY BOOMER POPULATION RETIRES, THE NEED FOR ELDERLY PROGRAMS WILL GREATLY INCREASE. CARELINK HAS THE ABILITY TO MANAGE THESE SERVICES THROUGH ITS PROFESSIONAL STAFF THAT OVERSEE THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. THE SENIOR COMPANION SERVICES ARE CRUCIAL TO OLDER PEOPLE IN THE CENTRAL ARKANSAS COMMUNITY. WITH THE HIGH COST OF PRIVATELY PAYING FOR HOME CARE SERVICES AND THE CHANGE IN MEDICAID ELIGIBILITY, OLDER PEOPLE ARE RELYING ON SENIOR COMPANIONS TO HELP THEM STAY INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.
 
THE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE THE SR. COMPANION VOLUNTEER WITH A REWARDING EXPERIENCE TO ENGAGE THEM IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE, PROVIDE AN HOURLY STIPEND AND MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT, AND FULFILLING RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHERS. THE PROGRAM TARGETS HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND PROVIDES RESPITE TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM'S TOTAL COST FOR 2018/2019 WILL BE $167,867. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES INVESTMENT OF $116,632 AND THE INVESTMENT OF $38,617 FROM CARELINK, WILL PROVIDE THE FUNDING TO FULLY EXECUTE THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.

AN ESTIMATED 65 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL SERVE DURING THE GRANT PERIOD.  OF THIS NUMBER, 65 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS, WHERE THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORT, LIGHT CHORES, LIGHT MEAL PREP, ASSISTANCE WITH SHOPPING, AND RUNNING ERRANDS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE IN-HOME SERVICES TO MAKE DAILY TASKS EASIER AND HELP RESIDENTS STAY IN THEIR HOMES LONGER. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, WE ANTICIPATE THAT WE WILL ACCOMPLISH OUR GOAL OF HELPING 100% OF THE ADULTS SERVED TO MAINTAIN THEIR DIGNITY AND REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOMES, RATHER THAN MOVING INTO COSTLY INSTITUTIONAL CARE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $302,659 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $135,059.

THE ORANGEBURG-CALHOUN-ALLENDALE-BAMBERG (OCAB) COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. IS APPLYING FOR A THREE-YEAR FUNDING FOR THE OCAB SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, JULY 1, 2018 -JUNE 30, 2021. OCAB COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY, INC. IS A PRIVATE, NONPROFIT AGENCY WITH A MISSION TO ELIMINATE THE CAUSES AND CONDITIONS OF POVERTY IN ORANGEBURG, CALHOUN, ALLENDALE, AND BAMBERG COUNTIES, SOUTH CAROLINA BY DEVELOPING STRATEGIES TO ENSURE A BETTER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR DISADVANTAGED AND UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS. SINCE 1966, OCAB HAS OPERATED A VARIETY OF PROGRAMS AND SERVICES DESIGNED TO ASSIST AND PROMOTE ECONOMIC SELF-SUFFICIENCY AND FOSTER SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT IN ITS SERVICE AREA. 72 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS AT A TOTAL FEDERAL COST OF $380,488 ANNUALLY ARE REQUESTED, WITH A NONFEDERAL MATCH OF $42,276 CONTRIBUTED FROM THE APPLICANT AND OTHER LOCAL SOURCES. 64 WILL BE UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS IN OUTCOMES-BASED PLACEMENTS FOR A COST PER OUTCOMES-BASED VSY OF $5,945. THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA OBJECTIVE IS AGING IN PLACE IN BAMBERG, CALHOUN, AND ORANGEBURG COUNTIES. THE OCAB SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROPOSES TO MEET THE IDENTIFIED COMMUNITY NEEDS OF INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR ELDERLY RESIDENTS, RESPITE FOR FAMILY CAREGIVERS, BOTH OUTCOMES BASED, AND OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES (ASSISTING ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIORS IN ADULT DAY CARE). VOLUNTEER STATIONS SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING BY PLACING SENIOR COMPANIONS IN HOMES TO HELP MEET VITAL DAILY NEEDS OF ELDERLY AND DISABLED SENIORS, SUCH AS ASSISTANCE WITH EATING AND MEAL PREPARATION, PERSONAL CARE, PHYSICAL EXERCISE, AND LIMITED TRANSPORTATION FOR APPOINTMENTS AND OTHER NECESSITIES. CAREGIVER RESPITE SERVICES FOR FAMILIES OF HOMEBOUND ELDERLY AND THOSE WITH DEMENTIA AND ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE INCLUDE LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREPARATION, ESCORTING, TRANSPORTATION, AND MEDICINE REMINDERS. AT THE CONCLUSION OF THE PROJECT, A MINIMUM OF 72% OF 36 INDEPENDENT LIVING CLIENTS AND 71% OF 28 RESPITE SERVICE RECIPIENTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AS OUTCOMES, AS MEASURED BY THE INDEPENDENT LIVING PERFORMANCE MEASURE AND RESPITE PERFORMANCE MEASURE SURVEYS, RESPECTIVELY.  TO MEET OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES, 4 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE ONE-TO-ONE SUPPORT FOR PERSONAL SKILLS DEVELOPMENT AND TRAINING, AND ASSIST WITH NUTRITION, PERSONAL CARE, SOCIAL, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES WITH INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND SPECIAL NEEDS AT THE DISABILITIES AND SPECIAL NEEDS CENTERS. AT THE (ORANGEBURG) OAKS PACE CENTER ADULT DAY CARE, 4 COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE INDIVIDUAL AIDE TO ENSURE PARTICIPANTS FULLY UTILIZE PROGRAM ACTIVITIES OFFERED, INCLUDING CRAFTS, EXERCISE, SOCIALIZATION ENCOURAGEMENT, AND OTHER RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES.

FOR THE PAST 51 YEARS MOUNTAIN PROJECTS, INC A COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY HAS BEEN PROVIDING VITAL SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY, DISADVANTAGED AND GENERAL PUBLIC IN WESTERN NC. AS THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, MOUNTAIN PROJECTS INC. CHANGES PEOPLE'S LIVES, EMBODIES THE SPIRIT OF HOPE, IMPROVES COMMUNITIES, AND ENHANCES THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR SENIORS WHO RESIDE IN THE WESTERN COUNTIES OF NORTH CAROLINA. SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT THE ESTABLISHED NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENTS AS OUTLINED IN THE FOCUS AREA OUTPUT OF H8 AND H13. THESE SERVICES WILL INCLUDE: TRANSPORTATION, RESPITE, AND COMPANIONSHIP. AS OUR SCP VOLUNTEERS SERVE OUR SENIORS BY IMPROVING THEIR ABILITY TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY A QUANTIFIABLE INSTRUMENT WILL DEMONSTRATE OUTCOMES CONSISTENT WITH THE NATIONAL STANDARDS. SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL ENCOURAGE AND ASSIST SENIORS TO AGE IN PLACE. HOME MANAGEMENT TASKS, AS WELL AS COMPANIONSHIP WILL PROVIDE THE VOLUNTEERS OPPORTUNITIES TO HELP THEIR SENIOR CLIENTS MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCE IN THEIR HOMES. SCP VOLUNTEERS WORKING IN THE RESPITE CATEGORY WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO THEIR CLIENTS ALLOWING FAMILY MEMBERS TIME TO COMPLETE ACTIVITIES OF THEIR LIFE.  THIS RESPITE PROVIDES THE FAMILY CAREGIVERS A MUCH NEEDED BREAK FROM THEIR VERY DEMANDING CAREGIVING ROLE.  SENIOR CENTERS WILL RECEIVE OTHER VOLUNTEERS, WHO WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO CLIENTS WHO NEED HELP TO PARTICIPATE IN ACTIVITIES.
BY UTILIZING THE MEASUREMENT INSTRUMENTS CREATED BY CNCS, PERFORMANCE ASSESSMENTS WILL RECORD THE DOSAGE RECEIVED BY THE SENIORS AT THEIR VOLUNTEER STATIONS. THE ADVISORY COUNCIL MEMBERS, VOLUNTEERS, SCP CLIENTS, AND THE COMMUNITY, AS WELL AS THE PROJECT STAFF WILL HAVE ACCESS TO DATA THAT WILL MEASURE THE IMPACT AND DETERMINE IF THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY ARE BEING MET. THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE 65 CLIENTS WHO WILL RECEIVE IN-HOME CARE TO HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE.

CENTRAL KENTUCKY COMMUNITY ACTION COUNCIL PROPOSES TO BE THE SPONSOR OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.  CKCAC'S MISSION IS TO BE INNOVATIVE, ENTHUSIASTIC, AND DILIGENT IN THEIR SEARCH AND ADVOCACY FOR PROGRAMS THAT BRING SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC CHANGE AND GROWTH FOR THE CITIZENS THEY SERVE.

AN ESTIMATED 44 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PROJECT. THEY WILL PROVIDE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES AND RESPITE CARE THROUGH A NETWORK OF 7 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, SUCH AS SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS AND PUBLIC HOUSING SITES ACROSS A 6 COUNTY SERVICE AREA, CONSISTING OF BRECKINRIDGE, GRAYSON, HARDIN, MARION, NELSON, AND WASHINGTON COUNTIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS, WHICH INCLUDE, BEING ABLE TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT ALLOWS INDIVIDUALS TO REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT, FOR THE FRAIL ELDERLY/DISABLED TO RESIDE INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES, RECEIVING A HIGHER QUALITY OF LIFE, WHILE ALLEVIATING STRESSFUL LIVING CONDITIONS FOR FAMILY CAREGIVERS.  AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, OUR GOAL IS TO ALLOW AT LEAST 80% OF THE CLIENTS WE SERVE TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR OWN HOMES, WHILE INCREASING THEIR SOCIAL SUPPORT.  WE ALSO HOPE TO REPORT THAT 13 OF THE 15 PRIMARY CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO HAVING A COMPANION. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $210,529.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $39,318.00.

THE FLORIDA DEPARTMENT OF ELDER AFFAIRS (DOEA) IS DESIGNATED TO "SERVE AS THE PRIMARY STATE AGENCY RESPONSIBLE FOR ADMINISTERING HUMAN SERVICES PROGRAMS FOR THE ELDERLY" (SECTION 430.03, FLORIDA STATUTES). BY WORKING TOGETHER WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS ACROSS THE STATE, DOEA ASSISTS ELDERS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS TO LIVE HEALTHY LIVES. THE GOAL OF DOEA'S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IS TO ASSIST ELDERS TO IMPROVE THEIR LIVES, STRENGTHEN THEIR COMMUNITIES, FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING, AND ASSIST SENIORS TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. 

THE DOEA SCP IS ACTIVE IN FIVE FLORIDA COUNTIES: CITRUS, DUVAL, MARION, OSCEOLA, AND PALM BEACH. AN ESTIMATED 206,221 ELDERS AGE 60 AND OLDER LIVE ALONE IN THE FIVE-COUNTY SERVICE AREA AND AN ESTIMATED 88,648 INDIVIDUALS ARE AFFLICTED WITH ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE OR RELATED DEMENTIA. SCP PEER-VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION AND ASSISTANCE TO ELDERS AGE 60 AND OLDER AT RISK OF INSTITUTIONALIZATION DUE TO CHRONIC ILLNESSES, DISABILITIES, OR SOCIAL ISOLATION. AS A DIRECT RESULT OF PROGRAM SERVICES, CLIENTS CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND AVOID OR DELAY FORMAL CARE SETTINGS SUCH AS ADULT DAY CARE, ASSISTED LIVING FACILITIES, OR NURSING HOMES.

AN ESTIMATED 61 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL CONTINUE TO SERVE IN DUVAL, CITRUS, MARION, OSCEOLA AND PALM BEACH COUNTIES, PROVIDING SERVICES TO OVER 300 CLIENTS ANNUALLY.  SCP ACTIVITIES INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, CAREGIVER RESPITE, TRANSPORTATION, AND SOCIALIZATION ACTIVITIES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ?HEALTHY FUTURES,? WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE.   AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, AT LEAST 80 PERCENT OF OLDER ADULTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE (CNCS) FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $342,607 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $58,328 IN STATE GENERAL REVENUE FUNDS ALLOCATED TO SUPPORT THE DOEA SCP.

THE MOBILE COUNTY COMMISSION (MCC), WHICH HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) OF MOBILE COUNTY SINCE 1980, IS SUBMITTING A GRANT APPLICATION FOR THE FISCAL YEAR 2018 RENEWAL (YEAR 1 OF 3) FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. FUNDING WILL ALLOW A MONTHLY AVERAGE OF 76 SENIOR COMPANIONS (SCS) TO SERVE WITHIN THE GEOGRAPHICAL AREA OF MOBILE COUNTY WHICH INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING CITIES: MOBILE, PRICHARD, SARALAND, SATSUMA, SEMMES, CHICKASAW, CITRONELLE, BAYOU LA BATRE, CREOLA, DAUPHIN ISLAND, AND MT. VERNON.  SCP HAS BUILT A CORE OF PARTNERSHIPS WITH AGENCIES SUCH AS THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING, PROVIDENCE HOSPITAL OUTREACH SERVICES, MOBILE HOUSING BOARD, AHEPA, U.J. ROBINSON ADULT CARE AND VIA COMMUNITY CENTER TO CREATE A NETWORK OF SERVICES NEEDED BY THE CITIZENS OF MOBILE COUNTY.
BASED ON COMMUNITY NEEDS, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF MOBILE COUNTY LOOKS FOR PARTNERSHIPS AND OPPORTUNITIES THAT ALLOW SENIOR VOLUNTEERS TO GIVE BACK TO THEIR COMMUNITIES; PROVIDE ACTIVE OLDER ADULTS THE OPPORTUNITY TO ASSIST IN MEETING COMMUNITY NEEDS; AND SUPPORT THE ROLE OF PARTNERS TO PROVIDE BASIC SERVICES FOR THOSE RESIDENTS IN NEED OF ASSISTANCE. WHILE SERVING, SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL OFFER ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING SUCH AS MEAL PREPARATION, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEDICATION COMPLIANCE, ESCORTS TO DOCTORS' APPOINTMENTS, AND RESPITES FOR CAREGIVERS.  ALL OF THESE ACTIVITIES WILL MEET HEALTH NEEDS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY AIMED AT PROVIDING SENIORS THE OPPORTUNITY TO "AGE IN PLACE,? THUS INCREASING THEIR ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  THESE ACTIVITIES FALL INTO MOBILE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM'S PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES AND WILL PROVIDE MEASURABLE RESULT FOR FEDERAL ACCOUNTABILITY. 
DURING THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL DEPLOY 68-69 SCP VOLUNTEERS (90% OF TOTAL VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEAR (VSY)) IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES PRIMARY FOCUS AREA WITH ACTIVITIES THAT HAVE NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURE OUTCOMES SUCH AS INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE CARE.  THE REMAINING 7-8 SCP VOLUNTEERS (10% OF THE TOTAL VSY) WILL SERVE IN ADULT DAYCARES, COMMUNITY OUTREACH CENTERS AND SENIOR CENTER.  AT THESE SITES, VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST THE E ELDERLY, SENIOR MILITARY VETERANS, DISABLED ADULTS WITH DAY-TO-DAY ACTIVITIES WITHIN THE SITES.

AN ESTIMATED 53 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND ACCOMPANIMENT TO  HELP ACCESS MEDICAL CARE, INCREASE FOOD SECURITY AND ASSIST IN MAINTAINING OR ESTABLISHING SOCIAL CONNECTIONS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE- YEAR GRANT, 52+ VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED NECESSARY COMPANIONSHIP , TRANSPORTATION AND OR RESPITE SERVICES TO 250 OR MORE COMMUNITY MEMBERS IN NEED ALLOWING THEM TO CONTINUED INDEPENDENTS IN THEIR OWN HOMES.   THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $313,774  WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY LOCAL GRANTS AND INKIND DONATIONS. (LEGENDS, RAFFLE, WORLDVISION)

UPON BRINGING ON THE SENIOR COMPANION GRANT FROM VOLUNTEERS OF AMERICA (VOA) IN 2015, HOMAGE SENIOR SERVICES OF SNOHOMISH COUNTY CONTINUED TO RECRUIT AND DEVELOP THE PROGRAM AND COMMUNICATED WITH VOA TO ENSURE A SMOOTH TRANSITION. AS EVIDENCE OF THAT, WE WERE ABLE TO RETAIN MOST OF THE VOLUNTEERS WHO WERE SERVING AS SENIOR COMPANIONS WITH VOA?ALL IN KING COUNTY. WE HAVE CONTINUED TO IMPLEMENT THE VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT PROCESS AND MATCH VOLUNTEERS WITH POTENTIAL CLIENTS AFTER CONSIDERING THE GEOGRAPHIC LOCATION OF BOTH AND THE SERVICE ACTIVITIES THAT ARE NEEDED. 
WHEN A POTENTIAL MATCH IS MADE, SCP STAFF, THE VOLUNTEER, AND THE CLIENT MEET AT THE CLIENT'S HOME TO DISCUSS THE PROGRAM AND ASSESS FOR A GOOD VOLUNTEER AND CLIENT MATCH. WE ALSO HAVE NEW VOLUNTEERS ?SHADOW? OTHER ACTIVE VOLUNTEERS WHEN POSSIBLE AS PART OF THEIR INITIAL TRAINING. THIS ALLOWS NEW VOLUNTEERS TO SEE FIRST-HAND THE TYPES OF COMPANIONSHIP ACTIVITIES ENGAGED IN BY ANOTHER SENIOR COMPANION. OUR HOMAGE SENIOR COMPANION STAFF PROVIDE VOLUNTEERS WITH 20 HOURS OF ORIENTATION AND TRAINING PRIOR TO BEING MATCHED WITH A POTENTIAL CLIENT. TO CLARIFY VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES AND CLIENT NEEDS, HOMAGE DOCUMENTS INDIVIDUALIZED VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENT PLANS TO HELP ENSURE QUALITY VOLUNTEER ASSIGNMENTS. 
MONTHLY VOLUNTEER STATION TRAININGS PROVIDE ONGOING TRAINING FOR ALL VOLUNTEERS. DURING THE MEETINGS (TWO TO FOUR HOURS IN DURATION) THE VOLUNTEERS PARTICIPATE IN TRAININGS BY GUEST SPEAKERS AS WELL AS PROGRAM STAFF. THE TRAININGS HAVE GIVEN VOLUNTEERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO ACQUIRE NEW SKILLS AND INFORMATION RELEVANT TO THEIR VOLUNTEER WORK. TYPICAL TRAININGS HAVE INCLUDED: DEMENTIA AND OLDER ADULTS, TRANSPORTATION RESOURCES FOR SENIORS, CREATIVITY AND THE OLDER ADULT, TO NAME BUT A FEW. IF THE TRAINING IS TWO HOURS, VOLUNTEERS ARE EXPECTED TO ATTEND OTHER COMMUNITY WORKSHOPS OR CLASSES, OR INDEPENDENTLY EITHER READ A BOOK OR ATTEND A WEBINAR ON A SENIOR ISSUE FOR AN AVERAGE OF TWO HOURS PER MONTH. AS PART OF THE PROCESS AT OUR MONTHLY MEETINGS, VOLUNTEERS ARE GIVEN THE OPPORTUNITY (WHILE MAINTAINING CONFIDENTIALITY) TO SHARE THEIR SENIOR COMPANION EXPERIENCES AS IT RELATES TO THE TRAINING OR TOPIC. THE MONTHLY MEETING ALSO GIVES VOLUNTEERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO GET FEEDBACK CONCERNING ANY CHALLENGES THAT ARISE WITH THEIR CLIENTS, AS WELL AS GIVING THEM A CHANCE TO SHARE THEIR SUCCESSES AND TO BE CELEBRATED BY STAFF AND THEIR COLLEAGUES FOR ALL OF THEIR GREAT WORK.  THE MONTHLY MEETINGS END WITH INFORMATION ON NEW RESOURCES OR COMMUNITY EVENTS THAT COULD BE USEFUL TO THE VOLUNTEER OR THEIR CLIENTS. 
STATIONS (PAST AND CURRENT)
DURING THE PAST THREE YEARS WE HAVE WORKED TO CONTINUE STATION RELATIONSHIPS AND PARTNER WITH NEW STATIONS AS THE PROGRAM GROWS. THE VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN KING COUNTY REPRESENT THE CULTURAL DIVERSITY WITHIN SEATTLE'S URBAN ENVIRONMENT AND INCLUDE THE FILIPINO, LAOTIAN, VIETNAMESE, KOREAN, AND ENGLISH SPEAKING COMMUNITIES. WE CURRENTLY HAVE ONE ACTIVE STATION IN SOUTH SEATTLE AND HAVE SIGNED MOU'S WITH TWO OTHER KING COUNTY AGENCIES RECENTLY TO EXPAND OUR VOLUNTEER SUPPORT THERE. WE ARE WORKING TO REPLACE THE KHMER STATION THAT SUPPORTED THE VIETNAMESE VOLUNTEERS, BUT UNFORTUNATELY CLOSED IN AUGUST 2017 AND ACRS WHICH WAS UNABLE TO CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM IN DECEMBER 2017. 
OUR NEW KING COUNTY MOUS ARE WITH MULTICULTURAL SELF-SUFFICIENCY MOVEMENT (MSM) AND NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSE. MSM PREDOMINANTLY SERVES THE KOREAN POPULATION IN THE FEDERAL WAY AREA . THEIR MISSION IS IN LINE WITH THE WORK WE DO AS THEIR GOAL IS TO PROVIDE CRITICAL INTEGRATION AND EMPOWERMENT SERVICES THAT WILL LEAD TO A PATH OF SELF-SUFFICIENCY FOR CULTURALLY, LINGUISTICALLY, AND ECONOMIC DISENFRANCHISED MEMBER OF OUR SOCIETY, INCLUDING LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS, LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENT PERSONS, IMMIGRANTS, REFUGEES, AND PERSONS WITH DIVERSE RACIAL AND ETHNIC BACKGROUNDS. 
NEIGHBORHOOD HOUSE SERVES SENIORS AND OTHERS IN SOUTH SEATTLE AND SOUTHERN KING COUNTY. THEY  PARTNER WITH DIVERSE

SALT LAKE COUNTY AGING & ADULT SERVICES SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 66 VOLUNTEERS PLACED IN PRIORITY OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN SALT LAKE COUNTY. THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP FOR ISOLATED ADULTS AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS. THEY MAY DO OTHER ACTIVITIES, SUCH AS PROVIDE TRANSPORTATION OR ASSIST WITH BILLS AND OTHER HOUSEHOLD ISSUES, BUT THE PRIMARY FUNCTION OF THE PARTNERSHIPS WILL BE CENTERED ON COMPANIONSHIP FOR OLDER ADULTS AND CAREGIVERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE, CONNECTING OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, A REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLING OF CLIENTS AND CAREGIVERS WILL PARTICIPATE IN A SURVEY TO DETERMINE IF THEY HAVE INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. SURVEYED CLIENTS WILL BE A REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLING OF A TOTAL OF 175 CLIENTS AND 56 CAREGIVERS WHO HAVE RECEIVED SENIOR COMPANION SERVICES. AT LEAST 50 CLIENTS AND 16 CAREGIVERS WHO HAVE RECEIVED THE SERVICES FOR AT LEAST FOUR HOURS PER WEEK FOR A MINIMUM OF 12 WEEKS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. THE ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $337,552 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $154,457.

AN ESTIMATED 36 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE SERVICE AREA OF UTAH & WASATCH COUNTIES WHICH ARE LOCATED IN THE NORTH-CENTRAL PART OF THE STATE OF UTAH.  THESE VOLUNTEERS WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING NEEDS IDENTIFIED IN OUR SERVICE AREA:  TRANSPORTATION ASSISTANCE, COMPANIONSHIP/SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND RESPITE CARE.  

THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES, WITH THE UTILIZATION OF OUR 36 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS, AND COLLABORATION FROM OUR 6 VOLUNTEER STATIONS, IS TO BE A DETERRENT IN DECLINING PHYSICAL, SOCIAL, AND EMOTIONAL HEALTH, AND HELP INDIVIDUALS REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY RELIEF FROM THE STRESSES OF CAREGIVING BY PROVIDING SHORT TERM ASSISTANCE, TO AN ADULT WHO IS THE PRIMARY CAREGIVER, FOR A PERSON WITH CHRONIC DISABILITIES, ALZHEIMER'S, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, ETC., AND PREVENT PRE-MATURE PLACEMENT IN LONG TERM CARE FACILITIES. THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IN CALIFORNIA UTILIZES LOW-INCOME SENIORS TO ASSIST SOCIALLY ISOLATED, DISABLED ADULTS IN FONTANA, RIALTO, COLTON, LOMA LINDA, GRAND TERRACE, SAN BERNARDINO, AND REDLANDS.  AN ESTIMATED 50 VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE TO AFFORD DISABLED ADULTS THE ABILITY TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOMES AND FAMILY CAREGIVERS RESPITE TO AVOID CAREGIVER BURNOUT. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WITH INDEPENDENT CLIENTS WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, ASSISTANCE WITH MEAL PREP/NUTRITION, TRANSPORTATION AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES.  VISUALLY IMPAIRED CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE ASSISTANCE WITH READING AND WRITING AND CLIENTS WHO ARE A FALL RISK WILL RECEIVE ASSISTANCE AMBULATING. HOWEVER, THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS TRANSPORTATION TO AFFORD CLIENTS TRIPS TO THE GROCERY STORE, DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, THE BANK, AND OTHER ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS, INCLUDING TRIPS TO THE GYM/POOL, SENIOR CENTERS, PARKS, AND OTHER INDIVIDUAL INTERESTS TO KEEP THEM ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THESE LOW COST ACTIVITIES ARE EXPECTED TO REDUCE THE NEED OF LONG-TERM CARE SERVICES AND MEDICAL COSTS (VALTORTA & HANRATTY, 2012). AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, ALL INDEPENDENT IN-HOME CLIENTS ARE EXPECTED TO BE LESS SOCIALLY ISOLATED AND ABLE TO REMAIN LIVING AT HOME; ALL RESPITE CLIENTS ARE EXPECTED TO HAVE AFFORDED FAMILY CAREGIVERS WITH THE ABILITY TO GO TO WORK/ATTEND TO PERSONAL AFFAIRS.  THE ANNUAL $287,788 FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $78,581 FROM THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO GENERAL FUND WITH AN EXCESS AMOUNT OF $2,593.  
THE REQUESTED INCREASE IN FUNDING REFLECTS THE EMPLOYEE COLA, STANDARDIZATION IN THE FEDERAL/CITY SHARED COST RATE, CHANGE IN MEAL REIMBURSEMENT RATE TO MATCH THE COUNTY NUTRITION PROGRAM REQUESTED DONATION AMOUNT, AND A 4? INCREASE IN MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT TO MATCH THE INLAND CAREGIVER RESOURCE CENTER VOLUNTEER MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT.  OVER THE PAST SEVERAL YEARS, THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO WAS UNABLE TO PROVIDE THE ANNUAL 2% COLA FOR STAFF.  THE INCREASE INCLUDES THE ADJUSTMENT FOR THE LAST GRANT PERIOD AND FY18.  THE CITY OF SAN BERNARDINO CONTRIBUTES 60% OF STAFF SALARY FOR THE PROGRAM MANAGER AND 50% FOR THE COORDINATOR OF VOLUNTEERS AND HAS BUDGETED FOR AN EXCESS AMOUNT FROM THEIR GENERAL FUND TO AFFORD THE PROGRAM MANAGER TWO WEEKS TO WRITE THE GRANT APPLICATION.  SALARIES REMAIN BELOW MARKET COMPARISON AND THE GENERAL SCHEDULE FOR THE LOCALITY PAY AREA OF LOS ANGELES-LONG BEACH, CALIFORNIA: $44,158 FOR THE SCP MANAGER AND $30,140 FOR THE COORDINATOR OF VOLUNTEERS.  IN ADDITION, THE FRINGE BENEFITS BUDGET SECTION NOW REFLECTS THE 40/60 FEDERAL/LOCAL FUND SPLIT TO MATCH THE RATE OF SHARED COSTS OF STAFF SALARIES.  SCP VOLUNTEER MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT WILL BE INCREASED FROM $0.30 PER MILE TO $0.34 PER MILE TO REFLECT THE INCREASE IN FUEL COSTS AND REMAIN CONSISTENT WITH OTHER LOCAL CHARITY'S VOLUNTEER MILEAGE REIMBURSEMENT (I.E. INLAND CAREGIVER RESOURCE CENTER REIMBURSES MILEAGE AT $0.32/MI.).  AN INCREASE IN MEAL REIMBURSEMENT WAS CALCULATED TO EQUATE THE $3.75 COUNTY NUTRITION PROGRAM MEAL COST, WHICH IS UTILIZED BY VOLUNTEERS AND THEIR CLIENTS AT LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS.  PHYSICAL EXAM REIMBURSEMENT WAS BUDGETED AT $30 PER VOLUNTEER AS AN AVERAGE AMOUNT THEY ARE CHARGED AS A CO-PAY.  THIS WAS ADDED IN RESPONSE TO PROGRAM OFFICER FEEDBACK FROM THE FY17 COMPLIANCE VISIT.

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, LSS ANTICIPATES THAT SENIORS' ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. ADDRESSING HEALTHY FUTURES NEEDS WITHIN OUR COMMUNITIES BY FOCUSING SPECIFICALLY ON INDEPENDENT LIVING (AGING IN PLACE).  ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, TO BUY GROCERIES, VISITATION OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW SENIORS TO LIVE MORE INDEPENDENTLY. 
 ACCORDING TO THE 2012 SURVEY OF OLDER AMERICANS PREPARED BY SAN DIEGO COUNTY AGING & INDEPENDENCE SERVICES, HALF OF THE SURVEY RESPONDENTS (46%) EITHER STRONGLY OR SOMEWHAT AGREED THAT ISOLATION AND/OR LONELINESS AFFECTS THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.  FOURTEEN PERCENT REPORTED NEEDING TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND TWELVE PERCENT REPORTED NEEDING TRANSPORTATION FOR GROCERY SHOPPING OR RUN ERRANDS, DUE TO NOT BEING ABLE TO DRIVE THEMSELVES.  WEEKLY VISITS TO IN-HOME CLIENTS BY SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ALLOW ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND SENIORS AGE 65 TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOME AND MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE.   SENIOR COMPANIONS PROVIDE VITAL HUMAN CONTACT AND COMPANIONSHIP TO SENIORS CLIENTS, SOME OF WHOM HAVE LITTLE OTHER CONTACT FROM THE OUTSIDE. 
THE SURVEY RESULTS ALSO SHOWED THAT A SMALL PORTION OF RESPONDENTS NEEDED ASSISTANCE WITH CARE FOR OTHER FAMILY MEMBERS. FIFTY-SIX PERCENT REPORTED NEEDING ASSISTANCE WITH RELIEF CARE.  MANY CAREGIVERS, WHOM ARE OLDER PEOPLE THEMSELVES, ARE PARTICULARLY VULNERABLE TO NEGLECTING THEIR OWN HEALTH AND WELL BEING.    PROVIDING RELIEF TO CAREGIVERS BY GIVING RESPITE CARE ON A WEEKLY BASIS ALLOWS THE CAREGIVER TIME TO ATTEND TO THEIR NEEDS AND HAVE A FEW HOURS OF QUITE TIME EVERY WEEK.  
THE NUMBER OF HOMEBOUND ADULTS OR INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES RECEIVING TRANSPORTATION OR OTHER SERVICES THAT WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE MORE INDEPENDENTLY.   BY PROVIDING WEEKLY VISITS, WE ALSO ANTICIPATE SENIORS WILL FEEL LESS LIKELY TO BECOME DEPRESSED CAUSED BY ISOLATION AND LONELINESS, RESULTING IN IMPROVED HEALTHIER LIFE STYLE.

POMONA VALLEY COMMUNITY SENIOR SERVICES 
DUNS NUMBER (126436013) (EIN 95-3100466) 

POMONA VALLEY COMMUNITY SENIOR SERVICES, DBA COMMUNITY SENIOR SERVICES, IS A NONPROFIT WITH EIGHT VITAL PROGRAMS SUPPORTING OLDER ADULTS IN 16 CITIES. CELEBRATING OVER 40 YEARS OF SERVICE, THE AGENCY'S MISSION STATEMENT IS, "TO SUPPORT AND EDUCATE ADULTS AND THEIR FAMILIES TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENCE AND TO AGE WELL AT HOME AND IN THE COMMUNITY." 

THE SPONSORING AGENCY IS APPLYING FOR A SENIOR COMPANION GRANT AND REQUESTING 40 VSYS. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $195,296 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY COMMUNITY SENIOR SERVICES INVESTMENT OF $52,759. 

AN ESTIMATED 33 TO 40 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING OUTCOMES. VOLUNTEER ACTIVITIES WILL BE CONCENTRATED ON COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION, AND THROUGH THESE ACTIVITIES, VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE AND CONNECT SENIORS WITH SERVICES NEEDED, ALLEVIATE SOCIAL ISOLATION, HELP TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND PROVIDE TEMPORARY RELIEF FROM THE STRESSES OF CAREGIVING.  

THE PROJECT WILL ATTAIN THESE GOALS THROUGH THE RECRUITMENT OF QUALIFIED VOLUNTEERS, PROVIDING VALUABLE ONGOING EDUCATION TO THE VOLUNTEERS, MAINTAINING STRONG RELATIONSHIPS WITH VOLUNTEER STATIONS, AND UNDERSTANDING THE NEEDS OF CURRENT AND PROSPECTIVE CLIENTS.

AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THOSE RECEIVING VOLUNTEER SERVICES ARE EXPECTED TO HAVE DELAYED PLACEMENT AT LIMITED ASSISTED LIVING SETTINGS, EXPENDED FEWER HEALTH CARE DOLLARS AS A RESULT OF DELAYED PLACEMENT, INCREASED SOCIALIZATION, AND REDUCED DEPENDENCE ON FAMILY MEMBERS AND CAREGIVERS.

NAME OF LEGAL APPLICANT:
CENTRAL COUNTY UNITED WAY

BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF APPLICANT'S ORGANIZATION AND ITS MISSION:
CENTRAL COUNTY UNITED WAY (CCUW) IS A PROVEN LEADER IN IDENTIFYING COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH ITS EXTENSIVE CONTACT WITH LOCAL BUSINESSES, LOCAL NONPROFITS, AND LOCAL CITIZEN GROUPS. CCUW'S MISSION FOR MANY YEARS HAS BEEN TO RAISE FUNDS AND ALLOCATE THOSE FUNDS TO A VARIETY OF AGENCIES THAT THEN PROVIDE DIRECT SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY. RECENTLY, UNITED WAY'S MISSION IS TO FOCUS ON EDUCATION AND HEALTH AND WELL-BEING AS WELL AS FUNDING HANDS ON PROGRAMS THAT OFFER DIRECT SERVICES TO THE COMMUNITY WITHIN THESE THREE FOCUS AREAS. THIS ALLOWS CCUW TO USE ITS CONTACTS, RESOURCES, AND STAFF IN A MANNER THAT ENSURES POSITIVE OUTCOMES IN THE COMMUNITY. THIS HANDS ON DIRECTION PLAYS WELL INTO ITS SPONSORSHIP OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM BECAUSE IT ALLOWS CCUW MORE RESOURCES FOR THE SUPPORT OF THE PROGRAM.

AN ESTIMATED 15 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER, ALL 15 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION TO DOCTORS OR PHARMACY, GROCERY SHOPPING, LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, COMMUNICATION WITH CARETAKER, FAMILY OR SOCIAL WORKERS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF OUR PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP THAT HELPS ELIMINATE FEELINGS OF ISOLATION AND LONELINESS TO THE SENIORS OF OUR COMMUNITIES.  THESE SERVICES WE PROVIDE WILL ENCOURAGE THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES AND WILL IMPROVE THEIR SOCIAL ENVIRONMENT.

THE SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA-BASED SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) HAS BEEN SERVING SAN FRANCISCANS SINCE 1984. SPONSORED BY THE FELTON INSTITUTE/FAMILY SERVICE AGENCY OF SAN FRANCISCO (FSA) SINCE ITS INCEPTION, THE PROGRAM IS COMMITTED TO MEETING THE CRITICAL NEEDS OF OUR COMMUNITY BY PLACING SCP VOLUNTEERS, AGE 55 AND OLDER, IN COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS TO INCREASE PROGRAM CAPACITY AND OFFER MEANINGFUL VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO ACTIVE, LOW-INCOME SENIORS. OUR VOLUNTEERS DEVELOP SUPPORTIVE RELATIONSHIPS WITH OTHER SENIORS AND DISABLED ADULTS IN ORDER TO ASSIST THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY IN THEIR COMMUNITY. OUR SCP PROGRAM'S GOALS ARE FOCUSED ON REDUCING THE EFFECTS OF SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS WHILE INCREASING SOCIAL CONNECTIVITY FOR CLIENTS, AS WELL AS RESPITE SERVICES FOR UNPAID FAMILY CAREGIVERS OF CLIENTS.
FSA IS REQUESTING A GRANT OF $27,339 TO FUND 7 VSY (VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS) TO VOLUNTEER AT 4 DIFFERENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WITH A GRANTEE SHARE OF $6,575 FOR A TOTAL AMOUNT OF $33,914.
BECAUSE THE NEED IS GREAT, FSA WAS SUCCESSFUL SEVERAL YEARS AGO IN OBTAINING TWO LOCAL FUNDING SOURCES FOR A CURRENT 22 ADDITIONAL VSYS PER YEAR, WITH 15 VSYS FROM THE SAN FRANCISCO DEPARTMENT OF AGING AND ADULT SERVICES (DAAS), AND 7 VSYS FROM THE SAN FRANCISCO MUNICIPAL AGENCY (SFMTA), SERVING 15 VOLUNTEER STATIONS. OUR CNCS PROGRAM COLLABORATES WITH THESE VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WITH VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING IMPORTANT SUPPORT TO OLDER ADULTS IN CASE MANAGEMENT, SOCIAL, AND HEALTH-RELATED PROGRAMS AND SUPPORTIVE SENIOR HOUSING. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION CAN BE PROVIDED AS REQUESTED BY CNCS. FOR THIS APPLICATION, WE WILL FOCUS ON THE WORKPLAN FUNDED BY CNCS. 
WORKPLAN#1: FOCUS AREA: HEALTHY FUTURES, SERVICE ACTIVITIES: COMPANIONSHIP: SENIOR PEER COUNSELOR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE PEER- TO- PEER SUPPORT WITH FRAIL HOMEBOUND CLIENTS IN SUPPORTIVE SENIOR HOUSING AND IN THE COMMUNITY BY PROVIDING WEEKLY HOME VISITS TO THREE TO FOUR HOMEBOUND CLIENTS, TRANSLATION ASSISTANCE, AND ESCORTING TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS IN ORDER TO MITIGATE THE EFFECTS OF SOCIAL ISOLATION AND LONELINESS. IN THIS WORKPLAN, 7 VOLUNTEERS WILL SUPPORT UP TO 24 CLIENTS AT 4 SITES.

THE EVANGELICAL LUTHERAN GOOD SAMARITAN SOCIETY HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN SOUTH DAKOTA SINCE 1978. SENIOR COMPANIONS OF SD'S PRIMARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES ? AGING IN PLACE, PROMOTING INDEPENDENT LIVING AND PROVIDING RESPITE CARE.
  SENIOR COMPANIONS ASSIST THEIR CLIENTS WITH ACTIVITIES INCLUDING MEAL PREPARATION, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, AND TRANSPORTATION FOR GROCERY SHOPPING AND HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS. THIS SUPPORT HELPS OLDER ADULTS AND ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. ALSO, THE WEEKLY CONTACT WITH THE SENIOR COMPANION HELPS REDUCE ISOLATION AND INCREASE SOCIALIZATION.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES DIOCESE OF GARY HAS BEEN THE SPONSORING AGENCY FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FOR TWENTY-NINE YEARS.  CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS A MULTI-PROGRAM NOT-FOR-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY SERVING THE COMMUNITY IN NORTHWEST INDIANA. THE MISSION OF CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS TO PROVIDE AND ADVOCATE FOR THE PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, AND SOCIAL NEEDS OF THE POOR AND VULNERABLE IN THE FOUR COUNTIES OF THE DIOCESE OF GARY.  ONCE AGAIN CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS REQUESTING STEWARDSHIP OF THIS PROGRAM FOR THE PERIOD OF 1/1/2018 THROUGH 12/31/2021.

FIFTY-ONE VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE CLIENTS IN LAKE COUNTY INDIANA.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS HEALTHY FUTURES WITH A GOAL TO ALLOW SENIORS TO REMAIN AT HOME WHILE LIVING IN THEIR COMMUNITY INDEPENDENTLY AND RESPITE SERVICES FOR CAREGIVERS.   VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST WITH ERRANDS, TRANSPORTATION; PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND OTHER SUPPORTIVE NEEDS TO INDIVIDUALS IN THE HOME AND RESPITE SUPPORT TO FAMILIES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING IS TWO HUNDRED SEVENTY CLIENTS; 90 CLIENTS TOTAL - 70 CLIENTS (INDIVIDUALS) AND 20 FAMILIES RESPITE CARE PER YEAR FROM A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER.

THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $253,719 ANNUALLY WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY CATHOLIC CHARITIES FOR $29,474.00.

THE CITY OF CHICAGO, DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND SUPPORT SERVICES (DFSS) WORKS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS TO CONNECT CHICAGO RESIDENTS AND FAMILIES TO RESOURCES THAT BUILD STABILITY, SUPPORT THEIR WELL-BEING, AND EMPOWER THEM TO THRIVE. DFSS INCLUDES THE FOLLOWING DIVISIONS: CHILDREN SERVICES, YOUTH SERVICES, HUMAN SERVICES, HOMELESS SERVICES, SENIOR SERVICES (AREA AGENCY ON AGING), DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, AND WORKFORCE SERVICES.

THE CENTRAL PURPOSE OF DFSS IS TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE, CLIENT-ORIENTED HUMAN SERVICE DELIVERY SYSTEM EMPLOYING A HOLISTIC APPROACH TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OUR MOST VULNERABLE RESIDENTS, AND TO ADMINISTER RESOURCES AND PROVIDE DIRECT ASSISTANCE TO A NETWORK OF OVER 300 COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS THAT PROMOTE THE INDEPENDENCE AND WELL-BEING OF INDIVIDUALS AND SUPPORTS FAMILIES THEREBY STRENGTHENING CITY NEIGHBORHOODS. 

THE DFSS-SENIOR SERVICES (DFSS-SS) DIVISION WAS AWARDED SPONSORSHIPS OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IN 1993. SINCE THEN DFSS HAS ANNUALLY PROVIDED ASSISTANCE TO APPROXIMATELY 150 SENIORS WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL AND HEALTH LIMITATIONS AND HELPED THEM TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOMES AND IMPROVE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. CHICAGO'S SCP BRINGS OLDER ADULTS DIRECTLY INTO THE LIVES OF CLIENTS WHO NEED CARE AND ATTENTION IN THEIR OWN HOMES, WHILE PROVIDING MEANINGFUL PART-TIME VOLUNTEER SERVICE OPPORTUNITIES TO LOW-INCOME ELDERLY, AGE 55 AND OLDER. IN 2017, SCP PROVIDED 73,269 HOURS TO 142 CLIENTS.

SCP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE INDIVIDUAL ATTENTION, UNHURRIED HELP, COMPANIONSHIP, RESPITE CARE, PERSONAL CARE AND PHYSICAL AND EMOTIONAL SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGEMENT TO THEIR CLIENTS. SCP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE SUPPLEMENTAL SERVICES FOR CLIENTS WITHIN THE LIMITS SET FORTH BY THE VOLUNTEER STATION, SUCH AS SUPPORTING CLIENTS IN THERAPY AND ASSISTING IN SOCIAL INTERACTION WITH OTHERS. UNDER THE PROPOSED GRANT APPLICATION, THE SCP WILL MAINTAIN ITS CURRENT NUMBER OF FEDERAL VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS OF 57 AND THE NUMBER OF NON-FEDERAL VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS AT 28. THE DOLLAR AMOUNT REQUESTED FOR FY 2018 IS $285,053 AND THE TOTAL DOLLAR AMOUNT OF NON-FEDERAL DOLLARS IS $169,464.  UNDER THIS PROPOSED GRANT APPLICATION, OUR PROJECT WILL ADDRESS INDEPENDENT LIVING AND HEALTHY FUTURES. 

THIS PROPOSED GRANT APPLICATION WILL ADDRESSES COMMUNITY NEEDS RANGING FROM SENIORS ABLE TO REMAIN LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES AND COMMUNITIES AND SENIORS HAVING ACCESS TO INFORMATION REGARDING FOOD PANTRIES, FOOD MOBILES, FARMERS MARKETS, ADULT MARKETS, HOME DELIVERED MEALS AND CONGREGATE DINING TO HELP PROMOTE HEALTHY FUTURES.

CURRENTLY, SENIOR COMPANIONS SERVE IN 36 OF CHICAGO'S 77 COMMUNITY AREAS. MORE THAN 60% OF THE CITY'S ENTIRE POVERTY POPULATION RESIDES WITHIN THESE 36 NEIGHBORHOODS. TWENTY-THREE OF THE 36 COMMUNITY AREAS HAVE POVERTY RATES ABOVE THE CITYWIDE AVERAGE. CLOSE TO 1 OUT OF 5 HOUSEHOLDS HAVE A SENIOR 65 YEARS AND ABOVE WHO LIVES ALONE WITHIN THESE 36 COMMUNITY AREAS AND 24 OF THE AREAS HAVE A HIGHER PERCENTAGE OF SENIORS 65 YEARS OR OLDER LIVING ALONE THAN THE CITYWIDE AVERAGE (U.S. CENSUS BUREAU: ACS 5 YEAR ESTIMATE 2016). APPROXIMATELY ONE THIRD OF THESE COMMUNITIES CONTAIN "FOOD DESSERTS", AREAS WHERE THERE ARE NO MAJOR SUPERMARKETS OFFERING NUTRITIOUS FOOD. UNDER THIS PROPOSAL CHICAGO WILL CONTINUE TO HAVE VOLUNTEERS SERVE THESE COMMUNITIES AND WILL EXPAND TO OTHER COMMUNITIES WHERE THE NEEDS ARE GREAT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES, DIVISION OF ELDERLY AFFAIRS (DEA), WHICH IS THE STATE UNIT ON AGING, IS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OF RHODE ISLAND?S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP).

DEA?S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE OPPORTUNITIES FOR MEN AND WOMEN, AGE 55 YEARS AND OLDER, INTERESTED IN VOLUNTEERING TO SUPPORT AND PRESERVE THE INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY OF ELDERS, ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES, FAMILIES AND CAREGIVERS.

AN ESTIMATED 83 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE UTILIZED AS PART OF THIS PROPOSAL. ALL SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE DOING SERVICES DIRECTLY RELATED TO ACHIEVING LISTED OUTCOMES. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, FOOD DELIVERY, RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, AND PREVENTION EDUCATION REGARDING SCAMS AND ELDER ABUSE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, INDIVIDUALS BEING SERVED WILL ENJOY AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL SUPPORTS AND ENGAGEMENT, WITH THE INTENT OF REMAINING IN THEIR HOME A LONGER PERIOD OF TIME. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $378,071 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $92,112 IN STATE MATCH.

 DEA IS REQUESTING 83 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY) AND FUNDING OF $378,071.

DEA?S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL IMPROVE A RECIPIENT?S QUALITY OF LIFE BY SUPPORTING THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO WOULD OTHERWISE BE ISOLATED AND WITHOUT SOCIALIZATION. IN ADDITION, THE SCP WILL PROMOTE HEALTH EDUCATION IN AN EFFORT TO ENABLE RECIPIENTS TO REMAIN IN THE COMMUNITY.   ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: SUPPORT WITH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ISSUES, PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE THE IMPORTANCE OF EXERCISE FOR A HEALTHY LIFESTYLE, ENCOURAGING SOCIAL INTERACTIONS, PROVIDING RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, AND TRAINING SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS TO EDUCATE RECIPIENTS ABOUT EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS.

DEA WILL STRENGTHEN SCP VOLUNTEERISM IN RHODE ISLAND COMMUNITIES AND BUILD UPON ITS COLLABORATIONS WITH OTHER COMMUNITY AGENCIES. RHODE ISLAND?S SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL OPERATE WITH THE COLLABORATION OF VOLUNTEER STATIONS AT LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS AND CASE MANAGEMENT AGENCIES THAT ARE CATCHMENT AREAS FOR SERVICING ELDERS.

DEA COLLABORATES WITH THE RHODE ISLAND DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH IN THE AREAS OF FALLS PREVENTION AND CHRONIC DISEASE SELF-MANAGEMENT.  TRAINING WILL BE PROVIDED FOR SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS ABOUT THESE TOPICS SO THAT THEY WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE IMPORTANT INFORMATION TO RECIPIENTS WHILE ENCOURAGING PARTICIPATION IN ANY RELEVANT ACTIVITIES.

THE OUTCOME WILL BE A MARKED INCREASE IN RECREATIONAL AND SOCIAL ACTIVITIES AND GATHERED TIME WILL MEASURE ACCOMPLISHMENTS.   SCP PARTICIPATION WILL INCREASE IN ALL SOCIAL SETTINGS.   SOCIALLY ISOLATED CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE SUPPORT SERVICES TO DELAY THE ONSET OF STRESS-RELATED ILLNESSES. FAMILIES WILL HAVE A PLAN FOR CONSISTENT RESPITE CARE. THERE WILL BE AN INCREASE IN FRAIL AND ISOLATED CLIENTS WHO WILL RECEIVE SERVICES TO STRENGTHEN AND PRESERVE INDEPENDENCE AND IMPROVE HEALTH.   IN THE EVENT OF A STATE EMERGENCY, SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE PREPAREDNESS TRAINING TO SHARE WITH OTHER COMPANIONS AND RECIPIENTS.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS ADMINISTERED BY THE PUERTO RICO OFFICE OF THE OMBUDSMAN FOR THE ELDERLY (OPPEA, SPANISH ACRONYM), FOR ALMOST 30 YEARS, SINCE 1988. AN ESTIMATE OF NINETY-THREE (93) SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS (83 CNCS FUNDED AND 10 OPPEA SPONSORED) WILL SERVE IN THE PROGRAM.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING DIRECT NON-MEDICAL SERVICES TO THE ALZHEIMER DISEASE PATIENTS IN A HOME ENVIRONMENT. SOME OF THESE SERVICES INCLUDE: ASSISTING PATIENTS WITH PERSONAL CARE (HYGIENE), HELPING PATIENTS TO EAT NUTRITIONAL FOODS, MONITORING THE PATIENT'S PRESCRIBED MEDICATION, ENGAGING THE PATIENTS IN RECREATIONAL AND EXERCISING ACTIVITIES, HELPING WITH LIGHT CHORES, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP INCLUDING COMPANIONSHIP TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE RESPITE CARE SERVICES TO PRIMARY CAREGIVERS OF DEMENTIA PATIENTS, ALZHEIMER'S TYPE.  THE OPPEA HAS ESTABLISHED VOLUNTEERS STATION IN THE MUNICIPALITIES OF: ARECIBO, BAYAMON, CAROLINA, CAYEY, ISABELA, MAYAGUEZ, PONCE, RIO GRANDE, SAN JUAN AND NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS SUCH ALZHEIMER ASSOCIATION AND ALZHEIMER FEDERATION.     
AT THE END OF THE ONE-YEAR GRANT, WE EXPECT TO OFFER A MINIMUM OF EIGHT HOURS PER WEEK OF RESPITE CARE SERVICES TO ONE HUNDRED EIGHTY (180) CAREGIVERS BY NINETY THREE (93) SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS. THIS SERVICE WOULD PROVIDE CAREGIVERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO TAKE CARE OF THEIR OWN AFFAIRS, RELIEF THE CAREGIVING STRESS, HAVE TIME TO REST AND ATTEND THEIR PERSONAL AND HEALTH CARE NEEDS.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $384,476 (82%) TO CONTINUE PROVIDING THIS SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY, WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $82,336(18%)

THE CENTRAL REGION BOARD ON ELDERLY AFFAIRS INC.(  JUNTA CENTRAL PARA ASUNTOS DE LA VEJEZ INC. AS IN SPANISH), IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION  ESTABLISHED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE COMMONWEALTH OF PUERTO RICO SINCE AUGUST 1992. 
THE CENTRAL REGION BOARD HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER PROGRAM IN CAGUAS AREA FOR THE PAST  TWENTY FIVE YEARS (25). IT HAS ALSO PROVIDE A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES TO MEET THE ELDERLY POPULATION NEEDS.
OUR MISSION THIS THREE YEAR GRANT IS TO GIVE PEOPLES AGE 55 YEARS AND OVER THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONTINUE TO BE VALUABLE AND PRODUCTIVE MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY. 
DURING THIS GRANT 45 SC VOLUNTEERS, DISTRIBUTED IN FOUR VOLUNTEER STATIONS, WILL PROVIDE PERSON TO PERSON SERVICES TO 80 OLDER ADULTS AND INCREASE THEIR ABILITY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES ALLOWING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AS LONG AS POSSIBLE AND IMPROVED THE QUALITY OF THEIR CURRENT LIFE. 
THE VOLUNTEERS ALSO WILL PROVIDE A TIME OF TEMPORARY RELIEF TO CAREGIVERS, ALLOWING THEM TO HANDLE THEIR OWN NEEDS KNOWING THAT THEIR FAMILY IS IN GOOD HANDS. THIS WILL IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF BOTH THE CAREGIVER AND THE CARE RECIPIENT.
EACH VOLUNTEER WILL PROVIDE AT LEAST 20 HOURS A WEEK OF SERVICE. SOME OF THE SCV ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES SUCH AS PREPARING MEALS, PERSONAL CARE, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING AND ACCOMPANY TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. 
OUR GOAL AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT IS THAT OLDER ADULTS RECEIVING OUR SERVICES HAVE IMPROVED THE QUALITY OF THEIR LIVES, INCREASE AND PERCEIVE THEIR SOCIAL TIES AND HAVE BEEN ABLE TO LIVE AN INDEPENDENT LIFE AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.
IN MOMENTS IN WHICH PUERTO RICO IS GOING THROUGH MANY ECONOMIC DIFFICULTIES AND AFTER A DISASTER LIKE HURRICANE MARIA, PUERTO RICO NEEDS MORE HELP THAN EVER. THESE GRANT WILL HELP TO ENSURE THAT OLDER ADULTS IN CAGUAS AREA WILL CONTINUE TO RECEIVE THE  IN HOME CARE SERVICES  THAT SO MUCH THEY NEED. 
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $202,378 WILL BE SUPPLEMENT BY $36,081.00 OF NON FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION IS SPIRITRUST LUTHERAN.  SPIRITRUST LUTHERAN IS ONE OF THE LEADING NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN THE REGION AND SERVED MORE THAN 25,000 PEOPLE IN 2016. THE AGENCY'S SERVICE AREA NOW INCLUDES 23 COUNTIES ACROSS PENNSYLVANIA AND MARYLAND.  MISSION STATEMENT:  SPIRITRUST LUTHERAN, WITNESSING TO THE GOSPEL OF JESUS CHRIST, PROVIDES EXCEPTIONAL HEALTH, HUMAN AND SENIOR LIVING SERVICES BY SUPPORTING PERSONS IN ACHIEVING AN OPTIMAL QUALITY OF LIFE.

WE ARE REQUESTING 36 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS FOR THE NEW APPLICATION AT A FUNDING LEVEL OF $163,853.  AN ESTIMATED 40 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE.

THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES/INDEPENDENT LIVING FOCUS AREA.  THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE TWO SERVICE CATEGORIES OF COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS.  SOCIALIZATION WILL BE PROVIDED TO THOSE INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE LONELY/ISOLATED IN THE COMMUNITY TO ALLOW THEM TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES THROUGH COMPANIONSHIP, ENCOURAGEMENT AND SUPPORT.  THE OTHER NEED THAT WILL BE ADDRESSED IS TO PROVIDE RESPITE TO FAMILY CAREGIVERS FROM THEIR CONSTANT DUTIES SO THEY WILL BE ABLE TO MAINTAIN THEIR OWN HEALTH AND WELL BEING, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME PROVIDING SOCIALIZATION AND COMPANIONSHIP TO THE INDIVIDUALS BEING CARED FOR.  MANY INDIVIDUALS ARE PROVIDING 24- HOUR CARE TO OLDER FAMILY MEMBERS WITH SOME FORM OF DEMENTIA OR OTHER CHRONIC ILLNESS SUCH AS CANCER, PARKINSON'S DISEASE OR STROKE.  THROUGH REGULAR CLIENT SURVEYS, BOTH AFTER THE FIRST 3 MONTHS IN THE PROGRAM AND ANNUALLY THEREAFTER, THE PROJECT WILL CONTINUE TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS ONGOING CLIENT NEEDS FOR COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS.

THE PROJECT ANTICIPATES THAT 150 ISOLATED OR HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS WILL RECEIVE IN-HOME COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORT FOR A MINIMUM OF 4 HOURS PER WEEK AND 20 FAMILY CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE REGULAR BREAKS FROM THEIR CAREGIVING RESPONSIBILITIES FOR A MINIMUM OF 4 HOURS A WEEK.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF ALLEGHENY COUNTY WILL PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE IN-HOME SERVICES TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS TO ALLOW THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  THIS ALIGNS WITH THE OVERALL MISSION AND VISION OF THE ALLEGHENY COUNTY AREA AGENCY ON AGING, WHICH IS TO HELP ALLEGHENY COUNTY RESIDENTS WHO ARE 60 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER LIVE INDEPENDENT LIVES.

THE TOTAL NUMBER OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS (VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS) FOR THIS PROJECT IS 90.  OF THESE, 76 WILL BE PLACED IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES/INDEPENDENT LIVING FOCUS AREA.
APPROXIMATELY 25% OF PARTICIPANTS BEING SERVED IN THE INDEPENDENT LIVING CATEGORY WILL ALSO HAVE A FAMILY CAREGIVER WHO WILL BENEFIT IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES/RESPITE FOCUS AREA.

THE EXPECTED OUTCOME OF THESE SERVICES IS THAT 85% OF PARTICIPANTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AS A RESULT OF HAVING A SENIOR COMPANION. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF LACKAWANNA COUNTY , PA IS REQUESTING $335,740 OF FEDERAL SUPPORT TO MANAGE 94 VOLUNTEERS AT FOURTEEN VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING  AND RESPITE CARE. PHILADELPHIA CORPORATION FOR AGING (PCA) HAS SPONSORED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) FOR THE PAST 28 YEARS. PCA IS THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING FOR PHILADELPHIA COUNTY. IT IS A NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED IN 1973 TO COORDINATE HOME AND COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES FOR OLDER ADULTS, AND DISABLED CONSUMERS 18 YEARS OF AGE AND OLDER. PCA'S MISSION IS TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR OLDER PHILADELPHIANS OR PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES, AND TO ASSIST THEM IN ACHIEVING THEIR MAXIMUM LEVEL OF HEALTH, INDEPENDENCE AND PRODUCTIVITY. 
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM CURRENTLY HAS 77 SENIOR COMPANIONS WORKING DILIGENTLY TOWARD THE GOAL OF SERVING 50 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS AS PER THE MANDATE FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS TO ALLOW SENIORS TO SAFELY AND INDEPENDENTLY AGE IN PLACE. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE PRIMARY ACTIVITIES OF SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL INCLUDE SOCIALIZING, PROVIDING RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS, ESCORTING CONSUMERS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS AND ON ERRANDS, ASSISTING WITH TASKS OF DAILY LIVING SUCH AS LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, REMINDERS TO TAKE MEDICATION AND ASSISTANCE WITH MINOR HOUSEHOLD MANAGEMENT. 
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE THE HEALTHY FUTURES SERVICE CATEGORY. SPECIFICALLY, WORK PLANS AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES WILL EXAMINE HOW EFFECTIVE SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE IN ASSISTING THEIR CONSUMERS IN MAINTAINING INDEPENDENT LIVING, PROVIDING RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS AND INCREASING THE LEVEL OF PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT THAT CONSUMERS AND CAREGIVERS EXPERIENCE. RESEARCH-BASED METHODS USED WILL INCLUDE WRITTEN SURVEYS TO ASSESS AND MEASURE THESE SERVICE AREAS AND THE IMPACT THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS IN THE PHILADELPHIA COMMUNITY. THE OUTCOMES WILL DEMONSTRATE AN INCREASE IN SOCIALIZATION AMONG ISOLATED SENIORS AND A DECREASE IN STRESS IN CAREGIVERS RELATED TO CARE-GIVING DUTIES. SENIORS WHO SUFFER FROM CHRONIC HEALTH CONDITIONS WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO MANAGE ONE OR MORE ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING AND REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES WITH THE ASSISTANCE OF THE SENIOR COMPANION. 
IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THESE GOALS, PCA REQUESTS $297,080 TO COVER GRANT EXPENDITURES TO OPERATE THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. PCA WILL ACT AS THE SPONSOR AND PROVIDE $107,345 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

AN ESTIMATED 72 UNDUPLICATED SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN NIAGARA COUNTY, NEW YORK. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES, INCLUDING OUTCOME: INDEPENDENT LIVING WITH THE OBJECTIVE OF AGING IN PLACE. THE SERVICE ACTIVITY WILL BE COMPANIONSHIP, WHICH MAY INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, FRIENDLY VISITATION, ACCOMPANIMENT TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ESSENTIAL SHOPPING, AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT AN ESTIMATED 300 CLIENTS WILL REPORT ON BEING LESS LONELY AND HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT DUE TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY SENIOR COMPANIONS. SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ALSO PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION FOR VETERANS AND NON-VETERANS WHO ATTEND TWO NIAGARA COUNTY ADULT DAY CARE CENTERS. 

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $309,384 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $61,261 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

THE COMMUNITY PLACE OF GREATER ROCHESTER, INC. (CPGR) DELIVERS HIGH-QUALITY, COST EFFECTIVE PROGRAMS THROUGHOUT THE GREATER ROCHESTER AREA.  CPGR HAS SETTLEMENT HOUSE ROOTS THAT SPAN 100 YEARS AND HOLDS STRONG TO ITS MISSION "TO PROVIDE NEIGHBORHOOD-BASED PROGRAMS, SERVICES, AND RESOURCES WHICH STRENGTHEN THE GREATER ROCHESTER COMMUNITY, ONE PERSON, ONE FAMILY AT A TIME".  
AS BABY BOOMERS AGE, THE "GRAYING OF AMERICA" IS PROGRESSING AT A PHENOMENAL RATE. IN "A PROFILE OF OLDER AMERICANS: 2016," THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES REPORTS THAT THE NATION IS PROJECTED TO AGE SIGNIFICANTLY. BY 2040 THERE WILL BE ABOUT 82.3 MILLION OLDER PERSONS, OVER TWICE THE NUMBER IN 2000.
CPGR IS REQUESTING 75 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS (VSY'S) TO PROVIDE HOMEBOUND, DISABLED, AND OLDER ADULTS SERVICES THAT WILL ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. 82 VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOMES BASED ASSIGNMENTS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OF THIS PROJECT IS AGING IN PLACE.  ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES, SUCH AS COMFORT, ASSISTANCE WITH MEAL PREP, SOCIALIZATION, ETC. TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL INCLUDE ACCOMPANYING CLIENTS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, PRESCRIPTION DROP-OFF AND PICK-UP, RUNNING LIGHT ERRANDS, ETC. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 80% OF CLIENTS RECEIVING COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. CPGR IS REQUESTING A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $447,944.

THE ONONDAGA SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF INTERFAITH WORKS OF CENTRAL NEW YORK PROVIDES COMPANION SERVICES TO OLDER ADULTS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS IN ONONDAGA, MADISON AND CAYUGA COUNTIES.  APPROXIMATELY 56 VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE COMPANION SERVICES - INCLUDING FRIENDLY VISITS, HELP WITH LIGHT MEAL PREP OR HOUSEWORK, TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE - TO AN ESTIMATED 120 CLIENTS.  OUR VOLUNTEERS INCREASE THE ABILITY OF OLDER ADULTS TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOME WITH THE SAME OR IMPROVED QUALITY OF LIFE FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.

SPONSOR ORGANIZATION:  UNIVERSITY OF MAINE CENTER ON AGING
THE MISSION OF THE CENTER ON AGING (COA) IS TO PROMOTE AND FACILITATE ACTIVITIES ON AGING IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATION, RESEARCH AND EVALUATION, AND COMMUNITY SERVICE TO MAXIMIZE THE QUALITY OF LIFE OF OLDER CITIZENS AND THEIR FAMILIES IN MAINE AND BEYOND.
THE UMAINE CENTER ON AGING SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL PLACE AN ANTICIPATED 75 SCP VOLUNTEERS INTO SERVICE, WITH ALL 75 PLACED IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, CAREGIVER RESPITE, AND OCCASIONAL TRANSPORTATION.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE UMAINE CENTER ON AGING SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS HEALTHY FUTURES -- AGING IN PLACE.  

SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE HOMEBOUND SENIORS WITH SUPPORTIVE SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO MAINTAIN INDEPENDENT LIVING STATUS IN THEIR OWN HOMES FOR AS LONG AS IN PRACTICABLE, AS WELL AS RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND SENIORS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, WE ANTICIPATE THAT 25 OF 35 (71%) CAREGIVERS AND 150 OF 225 (67%) HOMEBOUND AND ISOLATED SENIORS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORTS.  

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $337,164 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $29,307 IN SPONSOR SUPPORT, $14,340 IN SUPPORT FROM THE STATE OF MAINE, $30,000 LOCAL FOUNDATION SUPPORT, AND $9,500 IN IN-KIND SUPPORT.  THE TOTAL NON-FEDERAL SUPPORT EQUALS $83,147.

BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT'S MISSION IS TO ADVOCATE, LEAD, AND PROVIDE SERVICES OF THE HIGHEST QUALITY IN ORDER TO PROMOTE AND PROTECT THE HEALTH OF THE RESIDENTS OF BALTIMORE CITY. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) OPERATES UNDER BALTIMORE CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENT'S DIVISION OF AGING AND CARE SERVICES UNDER THE FEDERAL GUIDELINES OF THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES SENIOR CORPS PROGRAM. 
A 2017 RESEARCH STUDY BY THE KENAN INSTITUTE CALLED "OLDER ADULTS AND THE CHALLENGES OF AGING IN PLACE", REPORTED ON THE MOST VULNERABLE OLDER ADULTS LIVING INDEPENDENTLY WITH MOBILITY CONSTRAINTS IN 2011-2015. THE REPORTED INDICATED THAT THE VULNERABLE OLDER ADULTS WOULD HAVE MAJOR OBSTACLES TO AGING IN PLACES IN REGARDS TO ACCOMPLISHING THEIR ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING (ADLS) TO INCLUDE DIFFICULTY DRESSING, VISION DIFFICULTY, DIFFICULTY GOING OUT, PHYSICAL DIFFICULTY AND DIFFICULTY REMEMBERING. THE STUDY CONCLUDED STATING, " AGING IN PLACE AND COMMUNITY WILL BE EXTREMELY DIFFICULT IF NOT IMPOSSIBLE, UNLESS INNOVATIVE STRATEGIES AND TARGETED AND POLICIES ARE IMPLEMENTED TO HELP THEM".
BALTIMORE CITY SCP PROVIDES AN OPPORTUNITY FOR 55 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO HOME-BOUND SENIORS. THE CLIENTS SERVED UNDER THE PROGRAM ARE IDENTIFIED AS OR MAY BE FRAIL, HAVE PHYSICAL, COGNITIVE, FUNCTIONAL, OR INTELLECTUAL DISABILITIES. THE PROGRAM ENCOURAGES INDEPENDENCE AND FOSTERS MAINSTREAM INVOLVEMENT AND SOCIAL INTERACTION BETWEEN THE SENIOR COMPANION AND THE CLIENT.
THE SCP OFFERS VOLUNTEERS AGES 55 AND OLDER, AN OPPORTUNITY TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELIGIBLE PERSONS AND RECEIVES A BI-WEEKLY STIPEND. AN ESTIMATED 55 BALTIMORE CITY SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CLIENTS WITH IN-HOME ASSISTANCE (MEAL PREPARATION AND CHORE SERVICES), SOCIALIZATION AND RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS.
 THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT FOCUSES ON HEALTHY FUTURES OBJECTIVE (1) STATES:  OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES, FOCUSING ON INDEPENDENT LIVING, RESPITE CARE AND COMMUNITY PRIORITIES THROUGH ADULT DAY. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS TO PROVIDE COMPANION SERVICES TO 160 CLIENTS. 60 CLIENTS WILL BE LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AND 20 WILL BE CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES, AND THE REMAINING 80 CLIENTS WILL BE IN AN ADULT MEDICAL DAY SETTING WITH ASSISTANCE FROM A SENIOR COMPANION. THE CNCS GRANT WILL PROVIDE $296,031 AND, $104,489 IN LOCAL FUNDING MATCH.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

THIS SUPPORT WILL ALSO ENABLE CAREGIVERS THE OPPORTUNITY TO CONTINUE CARE AND REDUCE PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION IN NURSING CARE FOR VULNERABLE SENIORS LIVING IN OUR SERVICE AREA.

SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE AN ARRAY OF SERVICES IN-HOME OR AT SENIOR CENTERS THROUGHOUT THE COMMUNITY. CEDAR LANE SENIOR LIVING COMMUNITY, FRIENDLY HEALTH SERVICES, GENESIS HEALTH CARE, LA PLATA CENTER, NEW TOWNE VILLAGE, ST, MARY?S ADULT MEDICAL DAY CARE CENTER, VICTORY BROOKSIDE, VICTORY LA PLATA, VICTORY WOODS, WALDORF ASTOR, AND CHESAPEAKE SHORES NURSING & REHABILITATION NEW APRIL 5, 2018).

THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE PROGRAM YEAR, APPROXIMATELY 118 SENIORS WILL HAVE RECEIVED A SENIOR COMPANION ASSIGNED TO ASSIST THEM AND OFFER, IN-HOME CARE, TRANSPORTATION, MEAL ASSISTANCE, RESPITE CARE, OR OTHER NEEDED SERVICES GEARED TOWARD HELPING THESE SENIORS TO REMAIN STABLE AND LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AND INTEGRATED IN COMMUNITY SETTINGS. OUR GOAL IS TO SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE OLDER ADULTS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES, AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS TO HAVE QUALITY SERVICES AND ACCESS TO HELP WHILE THEY REMAIN IN THEIR HOME OR COMMUNITY. AN ESTIMATED 36 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE FOR THIS PROPOSED PROJECT DURING THE 7/1/2018-6/30/2021 GRANT PERIOD. ALL 36 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. THERE WILL BE THREE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN. THESE FOCUS AREAS WILL INCLUDE: COMPANIONSHIP INDEPENDENT LIVING, RESPITE SERVICES, COMPANIONSHIP WITHIN ADH FACILITIES. THE FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS THE HEALTHY FUTURES PERFORMANCE MEASURE.

ALSO, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP WITHIN ADULT DAY HEALTH PROGRAMS TO AID WITH CONTINUED COGNITIVE ABILITIES AND ACTIVELY PARTICIPATING TO KEEP UP THEIR ENDURANCE AND STRENGTH, TO CONTINUE LIVING WITHIN THEIR OWN HOMES. ADDITIONALLY, THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE   PROVIDED MUCH NEED RESPITE RELIEF FOR FAMILY MEMBERS, THEREBY LIMITING INCREASED STRESS AND ANXIETY FOR FAMILIES. IT IS PROJECTED WITH THE INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICE (CLIENTS WITHIN THEIR OWN HOMES) THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED 240 HOURS WEEKLY, FOR A TOTAL OF 12,528 VOLUNTEER HOURS PER YEAR AND FOR THOSE VOLUNTEERS PLACED WITHIN THE ADH FACILITIES THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED 425 WEEKLY HOURS OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE FOR A TOTAL OF   22,185 VOLUNTEER HOURS PER YR.  ALSO, FOR THOSE VOLUNTEERS PROVIDING RESPITE SERVICE IT IS PROJECTED THE VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDE 60 VOLUNTEER HOURS OF WEEKLY FOR A TOTAL OF A TOTAL OF  3,125 VOLUNTEER HOURS PER YEAR FOR RESPITE RELIEF FOR FAMILY MEMBERS, AND COMPANIONSHIP FOR THE CLIENTS.

THE UNIVERSITY OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, INSTITUTE OF GERONTOLOGY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF WASHINGTON, DC.
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FUNDED BY THE CORPORATION FOR  NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE CONTINUES TO RECRUIT, RETAIN, AND TRAIN THOUSANDS OF SENIOR VOLUNTEERS 55 YEARS AND OLDER LIVING IN THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA TO SERVE OTHER DISTRICT CITIZENS (APPROXIMATELY 6,000 ANNUALLY) IN THEIR PLACES OF RESIDENCE OR AT GROUP FACILITIES SUCH AS: SENIOR HOUSING BUILDINGS, SENIOR CENTERS AND HOSPITALS. THE RESPITE SERVICE PROVIDED BY THE PROGRAM HAS SERVED TO EASE THE LOAD OF FAMILY CAREGIVERS BY PROVIDING SHORT-TERM RELIEF TO THEM. THESE DEDICATED VOLUNTEERS ASSIST MANY FRAIL ELDERLY PERSONS WITH ERRANDS, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREPARATION, AND MANY OTHER ACTIVITIES SO THAT THEY MAY REMAIN IN THEIR HOME RATHER THAN BE INSTITUTIONALIZED. MANY CAREGIVERS FIND THIS SERVICE EXTREMELY VALUABLE IN SUPPORTING THEIR FAMILY'S QUALITY OF LIFE WHEN CARING FOR AN AGED LOVED ONE. TRANSLATION SERVICES ARE PROVIDED AT ALL IN-SERVICE TRAININGS FOR THE VIDA PARTICIPANTS.

THE SOUTH PLAINS SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PRESENTLY USES 38 FEDERALLY FUNDED VSY'S AND 1 STATE FUNDED VSY TO MEET THE NEEDS OF THE 7 COUNTY RURAL AREA.  A COMBINATION OF COMPANIONS WORK FROM 15 HOURS PER WEEK TO 40 HOURS PER WEEK TO MEET THE VSYS THAT ARE FUNDED. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $227,362 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $39006.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE PROVIDING ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO THE CLIENTS, REMINDING CLIENTS TO TAKE MEDICATION, PREPARING A LIGHT MEAL AND PARTICIPATING IN MONTHLY IN-SERVICE TRAINING SESSIONS.  THE HOURS ASSIGNED TO THE CLIENT VARY DEPENDING ON THE CLIENT NEED AND AVAILABILITY OF COMPANIONS IN THAT PARTICULAR COMMUNITY. 225 CLIENTS WILL HAVE RECEIVED SERVICES.

CITIZENS FOR THE DEVELOPMENTALLY DISABLED, INC. (CDD) PROVIDES DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH CONTRACT SERVICES THROUGH THE FAMILY, INFANT & TODDLER PROGRAM FOR CHILDREN BIRTH -- THREE YEARS OF AGE, A DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WAIVER PROGRAM FOR HANDICAPPED ADULTS FROM THE AGE OF 21 THROUGH ADULTHOOD, AND SPONSORS THE COLFAX COUNTY  SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAMS. CDD IS APPLYING FOR FIFTEEN VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS AND $62,387 IN FEDERAL FUNDING AND FIVE VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEAR AND $43,200 IN STATE FUNDING, TO SUPPORT THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. 
THE SERVICE CATEGORIES THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS ARE COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH AND IN-HOME/RESPITE.  THE PROGRAM WILL USE PROJECT STAR WORK PLANS WITH PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT TOOLS SUCH AS CLIENT AND CAREGIVER INTERVIEWS AND COMMUNITY PARTNER SURVEYS.  THE PROJECT'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES ARE:
* EIGHTY PERCENT OF CLIENTS RECEIVING SERVICES FROM A VOLUNTEER WILL REMAIN LIVING IN THEIR HOME.
* CAREGIVERS WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE PROVIDING CARE TO HOMEBOUND LOVED ONES, IN PART, DUE TO THE RESPITE SERVICES OF SENIOR COMPANIONS.
THE COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH WORK PLAN ADDRESSES COMMUNITY NEEDS AND THE CORPORATION'S STRATEGIC PLAN; HEALTHY FUTURES, BY ASSISTING CLIENTS TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES, PROVIDING INFORMATION AND ACCESS TO COMMUNITY RESOURCES, AND PROVIDING OR ARRANGING TRANSPORTATION TO PRIMARY AND PREVENTATIVE HEALTH CARE APPOINTMENTS.

AT THE END OF THE ONE YEAR GRANT CYCLE, APPROXIMATELY 107 OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE ASSISTANCE WITH ACCESS TO FOOD, TRANSPORTATION AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.
