WHETHER YOU ARE PADDLING DOWN THE PECOS RIVER OR WALKING THE TRAILS IN CARLSBAD CAVERNS OR THE LINCOLN NATIONAL FOREST, YOU ARE EXPERIENCING THE MANY NATURAL WONDERS IN EDDY COUNTY, NEW MEXICO.  EDDY COUNTY, WITH A POPULATION OF 57,578  IS LOCATED IN THE SOUTHEASTERN SECTION OF THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO.  THE COUNTY INCLUDES CARLSBAD, ARTESIA, AND THE VILLAGES OF LOVING AND HOPE.  IN 2015, FOURTEEN PERCENT (14%) OF THE POPULATION WAS 65 YEARS AND OLDER; AND OF THESE, 12% WERE LIVING BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL.   
SOUTHEAST NEW MEXICO COMMUNITY ACTION CORPORATION HAS SUCCESSFULLY SERVED OLDER ADULTS RESIDING IN EDDY COUNTY VIA THE SENIOR SERVICE PROGRAMS AND THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, SINCE 1965. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE 2017-2018 - GRANT PERIOD IS: HEALTHY FUTURES.  THE OBJECTIVE IS: AGING IN PLACE.  SIXTEEN (16) SENIOR COMPANIONS (INPUTS) WILL PROVIDE 31 OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES IN ADULT DAY CARE CENTER AND PRIVATE HOMES (TARGETS) WITH COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES. (SERVICE ACTIVITIES)  THE ANTICIPATED OUTPUT IS THE NUMBER OF HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES: RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES [INCLUDING COMPANIONSHIP] THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS THE NUMBER OF HOME BOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $24,996 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED OF NM STATE FUNDS BY $63,000.

THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION IS THE DEMING LUNA COUNTY COMMISSION ON AGING, INC. (COA).  THE COA IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) CORPORATION OPERATING AS A SERVICE ORGANIZATION IN LUNA COUNTY, NEW MEXICO SINCE 1976.  THE COA HAS BEEN THE LEADER IN IMPLEMENTING SERVICES AND PROGRAMS IN LUNA COUNTY WITH A STRONG MISSION OF PROMOTING INDEPENDENCE, PRESERVING DIGNITY, AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR A DIVERSE POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS AND PEOPLE WITH DISABILITIES IN OUR COUNTY.  OUR ORGANIZATION ADVOCATES AND PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICES TO OLDER, LOW-INCOME ADULTS WHO HAVE HEALTH AND FUNCTIONAL LIMITATIONS, ENABLING THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE IN A DIGNIFIED MANNER WITHIN OUR COMMUNITY.  THE COA CURRENTLY OFFERS OPPORTUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGH PROGRAMS LIKE THE SENIOR EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM, THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT, SENIOR COMPANION AND RETIRED SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAMS.

FOR THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION'S SCP PROJECT, AN ESTIMATED TEN (10) VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SERVICE WITHIN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF "HEALTHY FUTURES" IN THE COMMUNITY.  SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE TO INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE IN NEED OF SOCIALIZATION TO PREVENT ISOLATION AND LONELINESS.  

AT THE END OF A TWELVE MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES OF THE TWO STATIONS WILL BE THAT BOTH CLIENTS AND SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL REMAIN ACTIVE WHICH WILL LOWER THE ONSET OF CHRONIC DISEASE OR FURTHER ADVANCEMENT OF DISEASES, DEPRESSION, ISOLATION AND LONELINESS BY CREATING A POSITIVE OUTLOOK.  THE PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN CLIENT AND COMPANION WILL ALSO PROVIDE IMPROVEMENTS IN PHYSICAL, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL WELL-BEING.

THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT TO OUR SCP PROJECT IS ZERO DOLLARS.  THE PROJECT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED WITH STATE, LOCAL AND IN-KIND FUNDS IN THE AMOUNT OF $64,739 (NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES).

CONCILIO CAMPESINO DEL SUDOESTE INC. IS A 501(C)3 PRIVATE COMMUNITY-BASED NOT-FOR-PROFIT ORGANIZATION THAT HAS BEEN IN EXISTENCE SINCE 1972 IN SOUTHERN NM.  ORGANIZATION HAS A SERVICE HISTORY IN ADDRESSING NEEDS IN SENIOR ISSUES, HEALTH ISSUES, SOCIAL JUSTICE, AND SOCIAL SERVICES.  WE SERVE STATE-WIDE IN NM AND ITS SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.  THE COMMUNITIES BEING SERVED BY ORGANIZATION INCLUDE AREAS THAT ARE FEDERALLY DESIGNATED AS A MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS.  THE POPULATION THAT WE SERVE INCLUDES: SENIORS, YOUTH, FAMILIES, MIGRANT/SEASONAL FARM WORKERS & THEIR FAMILIES, IMMIGRANTS, AND A LARGE PERCENT OF PEOPLE WHO ARE MONOLINGUAL SPANISH OR BILINGUAL.  ORGANIZATION ADDRESSES HEALTH DISPARITIES, ECONOMIC CRISIS, POVERTY, EDUCATION, HUNGER, AND OTHER AREAS THROUGH COMMUNITY VOLUNTARISM. OUR MISSION: TO ELIMINATE POVERTY THROUGH THE PROVISION OF MULTI-GENERATIONAL CIVIC ENGAGEMENT OPPORTUNITIES AND TO SERVE OUR COMMUNITY WITH PASSION AND COMMITMENT.

INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE CARE/HEALTHY FUTURES, OBJECTIVE: AGING IN PLACE
COMMUNITY NEEDS:
NEW MEXICO IS A GEOGRAPHICALLY LARGE, PREDOMINANTLY RURAL STATE. IT IS THE 5TH LARGEST, AND THE 6TH MOST SPARSELY POPULATED STATE IN THE NATION. NEW MEXICO?S POPULATION IS ETHNICALLY AND CULTURALLY DIVERSE, WITH LARGE HISPANIC, ANGLO AND NATIVE AMERICAN INDIAN POPULATIONS. OVER A THIRD OF THE STATE POPULATION IS NON-ENGLISH SPEAKING; THE PREDOMINANT OTHER LANGUAGES ARE SPANISH, DINE (NAVAJO) AND PUEBLO DIALECTS. NEW MEXICO?S AGING POPULATION IS GROWING RAPIDLY. BY THE YEAR 2030, NEW MEXICO?S POPULATION OF PERSONS AGE 60 AND OLDER IS PROJECTED TO INCREASE BY 70%. BY THE YEAR 2030, 32.5% OF NEW MEXICO POPULATION WILL RANK 3RD IN THE NATION IN PERCENTAGE OF POPULATION AGE 60 OR OLDER. THE 85+ POPULATION WILL BE MORE THAN TRIPLE FROM 23,306 IN 2000 TO 75,629 IN 2030. IN NEW MEXICO 15% OF THE POPULATION 60 OR OLDER LIVE AT OR BELOW THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL; 17% LIVE AT 125% OF THE FEDERAL POVERTY LEVEL.  NEW MEXICO?S GROWING POPULATION OF OLDER ADULTS REFLECTS THE AGING OF ITS BABY BOOMERS, AS WELL AS THE CONTINUING MIGRATION OF RETIREES AND OTHERS TO WESTERN STATES. THIS STATE CONTINUES TO EXPERIENCE INCREASING DEMANDS FOR SERVICES FROM PERSONS WITH LOW INCOMES. ACCORDING TO THE NATIONAL FOUNDATION TO END SENIOR HUNGER, MORE THAN 42,300 NEW MEXICANS AGE 60 OR OLDER ARE FOOD INSECURE. THESE SENIORS ARE NOT SURE THEY HAVE ENOUGH MONEY TO BUY FOOD; AND MANY DO NOT HAVE ENOUGH TO EAT. THUS, THE PROBLEMS OF HUNGER AND FOOD INSECURITY IN NEW MEXICO ARE MAJOR. IN NEW MEXICO OVER 40.3% OF COMMUNITY-LIVING POPULATION AGE 65 AND OLDER HAVE DISABILITIES; MANY HAVE MORE THAN ONE DISABILITY; AND A GREAT NUMBER SUFFER FROM ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE OR RELATED DISORDER. IN ELABORATION, IT HAS BEEN REPORTED THAT SENIORS ISOLATED IN THEIR HOMES, THE LACK OF COMPANIONSHIP CAN CONTRIBUTE TO A WIDE VARIETY OF PROBLEMS (DETERIORATION IN MENTAL WELL-BEING, INCREASED SUSCEPTIBILITY TO CON ARTISTS WHO PREY ON THE ELDERLY, ETC.) THAT IN TURN CAN HASTEN DEPENDENCY AND LEAD TO INSTITUTIONALIZATION.  REGULAR SUPPORTIVE VISITS FROM CARING PEERS CAN HELP DECREASE FEELINGS OF ISOLATION (NMALTSD 2017-2021 STATE PLAN). CONCILIO CDS INC. IS FOCUSING ON ADDRESSING THESE COMMUNITY NEEDS AND IS ANTICIPATING THAT COMPANIONSHIP WILL CONTRIBUTE TO POSITIVE OUTCOMES FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING.

AN ESTIMATED 24 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN ROOSEVELT AND CURRY COUNTY.  OF THIS NUMBER 24 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE ADDRESSED THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY BY MEETING OR EXCEEDING THE OUTCOMES;NUMBER OF INDIVIDUALS WITH INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND THE NUMBER OF CAREGIVERS WHO REPORTED HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $0.  NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT (NMALTSD) INVESTMENT IS $138,000 AND WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC) THE SPONSORING AGENCY IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,126.  COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER IS A NON-PROFIT MULTI-SERVICE CENTER THAT HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES IN ROOSEVELT COUNTY SINCE 1965, HOSTING THE SCP SINCE 1974.  THE CENTER PROVIDES SERVICES THAT INCLUDE: INFORMATION AND REFERRAL, COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, COMMUNITY REVITALIZATION, CLIENT ADVOCACY, CITIZEN PARTICIPATION, VOLUNTEER INFORMATION AND SPECIAL PROJECTS.
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM AT COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER PROVIDES SERVICES TO ROOSEVELT AND CURRY COUNTY.  THE GOAL OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP AND OUTREACH SERVICES TO THE ELDERLY, DISABLED AND/OR HOMEBOUND CITIZENS OF ROOSEVELT AND CURRY COUNTY.  VOLUNTEERS ARE PLACED IN SENIOR CENTERS (ON A TEMPORARY BASIS), ASSISTED-LIVING HOMES AND HOMES OF THE ELDERLY.  THE VOLUNTEERS HELP ALLEVIATE LONELINESS AND PREVENT ISOLATION BY INCREASING MANY SENIORS ABILITY TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AND LIVING IN THEIR OWN HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM TARGETS LOW- INCOME SENIORS WHEN RECRUITING VOLUNTEERS AND FOCUSES ON PROVIDING SERVICES TO THE LOW-INCOME/DISADVANTAGED SENIORS IN THE COMMUNITY.  THIS ALLOWS THE LOW-INCOME SENIORS TO SUPPLEMENT THEIR INCOME AND AT THE SAME TIME CONTRIBUTE TO THE NEEDS OF OTHER SENIORS. 
THE MISSION OF COMMUNITY SERVICES CENTER (CSC) IS TO PROVIDE ON-GOING OPPORTUNITIES TO EMPOWER ALL OF THE PEOPLE OF ROOSEVELT AND CURRY COUNTY TO COLLABORATE IN REDUCING COMMUNITY PROBLEMS.  THIS ENLIGHTENED CONCEPT WILL BECOME THE NORM OF THE COMMUNITY.

THE LEGAL APPLICANT IS THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE (COA) DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR AFFAIRS (DSA).  DSA OFFERS SENIORS AGE 50 AND BETTER A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES AND PROGRAMS FOR ACTIVE TO FRAIL ADULTS.  PROGRAMS PROMOTE BOTH HEALTHY AGING AND INDEPENDENT LIVING THAT MEET THE INDIVIDUAL NEEDS OF SENIORS IN THE ALBUQUERQUE/BERNALILLO COUNTY AREA.  DSA OPERATES SENIOR CENTERS, MULTIGENERATIONAL CENTERS, SPORTS/FITNESS CENTERS, MEAL SITES, HOME SERVICES, CARE COORDINATION, INFORMATION & ASSISTANCE SERVICES, AND A CENTRAL KITCHEN. THE MISSION OF DSA IS TO BE A COMMUNITY LEADER, WHO IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS, INVOLVES SENIORS AND PEOPLE OF ALL AGES IN CREATING A COMMUNITY THAT ENHANCES EVERYONE'S QUALITY OF LIFE BY PROVIDING OPPORTUNITIES TO ACHIEVE THEIR POTENTIAL, SHARE THEIR WISDOM, MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE, AND LIVE WITH DIGNITY.  
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT AMOUNT OF $99,827 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $88,440 FROM THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG-TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT AND $98,031 FROM THE CITY OF ALBUQUERQUE DEPARTMENT OF SENIOR AFFAIRS.  THIS FUNDING WILL SUPPORT 24 FEDERAL VOLUNTEERS AND & FOUR STATE VSYS TO THE ALBUQUERQUE AND BERNALILLO COUNTY METROPOLITAN AREA AND NATIVE INDIAN COMMUNITIES OF CIBOLA & SANDOVAL COUNTIES.  IN PARTNERSHIP WITH FIVE VOLUNTEER STATIONS, 22 VOLUNTEERS WILL  FOCUS ON OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS AND WILL ADDRESS THE FOCUS AREA OF "HEALTHY FUTURES" PROMOTING INDEPENDENT LIVING. ACTIVITIES TO PROMOTE INDEPENDENT LIVING WILL INCLUDE: 1) ASSISTANCE WITH LIGHT HOUSEHOLD CHORES 2) GROCERY SHOPPING 3) NUTRITION EDUCATION 4) PREPARATION OF LIGHT MEALS 5) PROMOTING EXERCISE AND 6) INCREASED SOCIALIZATION. SERVICES ASSIST IN DECREASING CLIENTS' ISOLATION, MAINTAIN A CONNECTION TO RESPECTIVE COMMUNITIES & CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. VOLUNTEERS REMAIN ACTIVE BY PARTICIPATING IN VOLUNTEER SERVICE. THE PRIMARY FOCUS IS TO KEEP SENIORS LIVING IN THEIR HOMES WHERE THEIR MEMORIES OF FAMILIES, CHILDREN, AND FRIENDSHIPS ARE PRECIOUS TO THEM AND THEY ARE INDEPENDENT AND MAKE SOUND CHOICES FOR THEIR LIVES.  HELPING SENIORS KEEP THAT INDEPENDENCE AND SECURITY HELPS THEM TO CONTINUE LIVING IN HARMONY WITH THEMSELVES.  AN ADDITIONAL SIX VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE OTHER COMMUNITY PRIORITIES AND NEEDS.  ONE SCP VOLUNTEER LIMITED BY HER OWN CHRONIC DISABILITIES CONTINUES A DESIRE TO REMAIN USEFUL AND PRODUCTIVE WHILE PROVIDING SERVICE TO OTHERS IN A NURSING HOME.  THIS VOLUNTEER HAS BEEN IN PLACE FOR 4 ? YEARS AND HAS BEEN ALLOWED TO CONTINUE TO AVOID DISRUPTION OF SERVICE; THIS PLACEMENT ALLOWS THE PROGRAM TO MEET FEDERAL ADA ACCOMMODATIONS.  THIS POSITION WILL BE ELIMINATED THROUGH ATTRITION.

THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS REQUESTING FROM THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL & COMMUNITY SERVICE FOR FOURTEEN (14) VSY'S FOR THE AMOUNT OF $84.010.00. SUPPLEMENTAL ASSISTANCE WILL BE PROVIDED FROM THE STATE OF NEW MEXICO, AGING & LONG TERM SERVICES  BUREAU OF $21,676.0.00 AND TRIBAL GENERAL FUND OF 10,237.00. 
     THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANIONS CONTINUES TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELDERS TO ELIMINATE ISOLATION AND DEPRESSION.  SENIOR COMPANIONS CONTINUE TO GO VISIT WITH THEIR ASSIGNED FRAIL ELDERS IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY ON A DAILY BASIS. THE PROGRAM CONTINUES TO RECRUIT POTENTIAL ELDERS THAT ARE 55 AND OLDER IN SERVING AS A SENIOR COMPANION.  WE ANTICIPATE CONTINUING TO PROVIDE A MUCH-NEEDED SERVICE TO OUR FRAIL ELDERS IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY. 
     THE MISSION OF THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL FOLLOW THE CORPORATION MISSION TO IMPROVE LIVES, STRENGTHEN COMMUNITIES AND FOSTER CIVIC ENGAGEMENT THROUGH SERVICE AND VOLUNTEERING.  SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL MEET THE COMMUNITY HUMAN NEEDS.  TWENTY FOURTEEN (14) SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING:  1. ASSISTANCE AND FRIENDSHIP TO ELDER ADULTS WHO HAVE DIFFICULTY WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING TASKS.  2. INDIVIDUALS ARE 55 YEARS AND OLDER MAY SERVE AS A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER.  3. ELIGIBLE ELDER MAY SERVE 15 TO 40 HOURS A WEEK OF VOLUNTEER SERVICE; 4. THE ELIGIBLE ELDER MUST BE INCOME ELIGIBLE TO RECEIVE A STIPEND. 
     THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SCOPE OF SERVICE HAS ALLOWED ELDERS IN THE PROGRAM AS VOLUNTEERS TO REMAIN PHYSICALLY AND MENTALLY ACTIVE, A GROWTH OF THEIR SELF-ESTEEM THROUGH CONTINUED PARTICIPATION IN NEEDED COMMUNITY SERVICES.  SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE CONFIDENT IN PROVIDING SUPPORTIVE SERVICE TO ADULTS WITH PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, OR MENTAL HEALTH LIMITATIONS, ESPECIALLY OLDER PERSONS, IN AN EFFORT TO ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN THEIR HIGHEST LEVEL OF INDEPENDENT LIVING AND AGING WITH DIGNITY.  THE SENIOR VOLUNTEERS EARN A STIPEND AND OTHER BENEFITS WHICH ENABLE ELIGIBLE PERSONS TO PARTICIPATE AS A SENIOR COMPANION WITHOUT ENDURING COST TO THEMSELVES.  ALL SENIOR VOLUNTEERS MEETING THE ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENT WILL BE PAID A STIPEND OF $2.65 PER HOUR AND NOT EXCEED 2767 PER YEAR.  THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PAID A STIPEND FOLLOWING THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, PAYROLL SCHEDULE EVERY TWO WEEKS. 
      THE PUEBLO OF ZUNI, SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SCOPE OF SERVICES PROVIDED ARE THE FOLLOWING 
1.  INDEPENDENT LIVING, 
2.  IN- HOME CARE 
3.  RESPITE CARE FOR CAREGIVERS. 
INDEPENDENT LIVING:  SENIOR COMPANION SUPPORTS TO OUR FRAIL ELDERS IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY PROVIDES SERVICES TO INDIVIDUALS LIVING IN THEIR OWN PRIVATE RESIDENCE.  THE GROWING NEED FOR INDIVIDUALIZED SOCIAL SUPPORT SERVICES FOR ELDERS IS NEEDED IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY.  RESPITE CARE:   FOR FAMILY MEMBERS MOST OFTEN EXPERIENCE A VARIETY OF HARDSHIPS WHEN CARING FOR AN ELDER RELATIVE.  MOST FAMILY MEMBERS CONSTANTLY CARE FOR THE ELDER SUFFER FROM A HIGH LEVEL OF STRESS, LACK OF ADEQUATE TIME AWAY FROM THEIR CAREGIVER ROLE OR PROBLEMS RELATED TO EMPLOYMENT AND INCREASED FAMILY PROBLEMS.   THIS NOT ONLY AFFECTS THE CAREGIVER'S ABILITY TO PROVIDE ADEQUATE CARE TO THEIR ELDER FAMILY MEMBER, THIS MAKES AN ELDER AT GREATER RISK FOR INSTITUTIONALIZED PLACEMENT.  CLOSE FAMILY INVOLVEMENT IS NO LONGER PREVALENT IN THE ZUNI COMMUNITY WHEN IT COMES TO ELDERS; DUE TO FAMILY MEMBERS WORKING OFF THE RESERVATION.  DURING THE TIME WHEN THE ELDER IS HOME ALONE RESULTS TO LONELINESS, DEPRESSION, AND ISOLATION.  WITH THE SENIOR COMPANIONS, OUR ELDERS EXPERIENCE SOCIALIZATION AND COMMUNICATION WITH INCREASED INTERACTION WITH THE ELDER TO BE MORE RESPONSIVE AND INTERACT WITH A SENIOR COMPANION. 
RESPITE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED TO FAMILY MEMBERS.   SENIOR COMPANION WILL PROVIDE SUPPORTS OF COMPANIONSHIP BY FRIENDLY VISITING, LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING OF GETTING DRESSED FOR THE DAY, MEAL PREPARATION, NUTRITION INFORMATION, MINO

THE TAOS COUNTY SENIOR PROGRAM IS A LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITY WHICH COMPRISES FOUR SENIOR CENTERS IN TAOS COUNTY WITH ACTIVITIES AND SUPPORT SERVICES THAT CATER TO THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF SENIORS. THESE CENTERS ADDRESS THE HEALTH, SOCIAL, RECREATIONAL, AND LOGISTICAL NEEDS OF THE ELDERLY POPULATION IN FOUR LOCATIONS. OUR SENIOR CENTERS SERVE APPROXIMATELY 400 OLDER ADULTS EACH DAY THROUGH A WIDE VARIETY OF PROGRAMS. OUR MISSION IS TO HELP SENIORS IMPROVE AND MAINTAIN A HEALTHY AND INDEPENDENT LIFESTYLE AND TO MAXIMIZE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROVIDES COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES TO FRAIL HOMEBOUND ELDERLY WHICH IS OUR TARGET POPULATION, THEREFORE COMPLIMENTING THE SERVICES PROVIDED THROUGH THE SPONSORING ORGANIZATION. SENIOR COMPANION SERVICES WILL GIVE SENIORS THE ABILITY TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT AT HOME. BASED ON HOME VISITS AND SPEAKING WITH FAMILY MEMBERS OF CLIENTS IT HAS BEEN PERCEIVED THAT THERE HAS BEEN A DECLINE IN DOCTOR VISITS, FALLS AND LESS ISOLATION. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS 7 CORPORATION FUNDED VSY'S AND 12 NON-CORPORATION FUNDED VSY'S FOR A TOTAL OF 19 VSY'S.
SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: PERSONAL CARE SUCH AS FEEDING, DRESSING, GROOMING, ASSISTING THE CLIENT IN WALKING, GETTING OUT OF BED, AND GOING TO THE BATHROOM. ASSISTING WITH MEDICAL AND PHYSICAL THERAPY, AND OR MONITORING MEDICATION. ACCOMPANYING THE CLIENT TO DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENTS. ENCOURAGE EXERCISE, TAKING WALKS WITH THE CLIENT. PREPARING FOOD, PLANNING MEALS, GROCERY SHOPPING, LABELING AND ORGANIZING FOOD. PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, TALKING, LISTENING, CHEERING UP, AND PLAYING GAMES OR CARDS. FOSTERING CLIENT CONTACT WITH FAMILY AND FRIENDS. ACCOMPANYING CLIENT TO RECREATIONAL OR SOCIAL EVENTS. WRITING LETTERS, READING, FILLING OUT FORMS. ASSISTING WITH MONEY MANAGEMENT. LITE HOUSEKEEPING. INFORMATION AND ADVOCACY FOR ELIGIBILITY OF SERVICES. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE. AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOME WILL BE TO CONTINUE TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE, NUTRITIONAL AND VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES TO THE ELDERLY FOR THE PURPOSE OF ENHANCING THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE AND AS A DETERRENT TO INSTITUTIONALIZATION. THE GOALS OF OUR ORGANIZATION WILL BE TO ENSURE THAT ALL ELIGIBLE PARTICIPANTS WILL HAVE AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY TO ACCESS THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE LOCAL GOVERNMENT AGENCY. WE WILL STRIVE TO OFFER ON-GOING SERVICES AS INTENDED BY USING EXISTING HUMAN AND FACILITY RESOURCES AND AFFIRMS THAT WE WILL NOT DISCRIMINATE AGAINST ANY ELIGIBLE INDIVIDUAL WHO DESIRES TO UTILIZE ITS SERVICE, BECAUSE OF SEX, RACE, COLOR, NATIONAL ORIGIN, RELIGION, DISABILITY, SOCIAL AND OR, ECONOMIC STATUS.

HELP-NEW MEXICO, INC. (HELP-NM) HAS BEEN SERVING NEW MEXICO OVER 50 YEARS, STARTED IN 1965, AS THE LARGEST OF THE 6 COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCIES (CAA). SERVES 22 OF 33 COUNTIES WITH PLANS TO EXPAND 29 COUNTIES, HELP-NM FOCUS IS ON CREATING SELF-SUFFICIENCY, PROMOTING ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES, AND STRENGTHEN FAMILY AND COMMUNITY SUPPORTS ACROSS NM. HELP-NM PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS INCLUDE: LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, MIGRANTS, SEASONAL WORKERS, CHILDREN, DISABLED INDIVIDUALS, DISADVANTAGED YOUTH AND SENIOR CITIZENS. HELP-NM PROGRAMMING INCLUDES: YOUTH AND ADULT EDUCATION, LITERACY, JOB TRAINING, WORK EXPERIENCE, LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION; EARLY CHILDHOOD EDUCATION AND DEVELOPMENT; ADULT AND CHILD CARE NUTRITION; COUNSELING, CASE MANAGEMENT, AND AFFORDABLE HOUSING SUPPORTS. 
HELP-NM SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) PROVIDES SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO 50 SENIORS ACROSS THE 3 NORTHEAST COUNTIES OF GUADALUPE, MORA, AND SAN MIGUEL IN 3 YEAR FUNDING CYCLES.  HELP-NM THROUGH ITS EXISTING CAPACITY PROPOSES TO RENEW OUR PROGRAM FOR CONTINUED OPERATION USING 24 VSYS (STATE AND FEDERAL VSY S). THE FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $$18, 630 WHICH SUPPORTS 4 VSYS IS SUPPLEMENTED BY $119, 728 IN STATE AND LOCAL RESOURCES TO SUPPORT 21 VSY S IN THE THREE COUNTIES OF NORTHEAST NEW MEXICO. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREAS OR SERVICE CATEGORIES TO BE ADDRESSED BY SCP ARE THE PROVISION OF: 1) SUPPORTIVE SERVICES TO PROMOTE HEALTHY FUTURES, 2) EMPOWERMENT FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING / SELF-SUFFICIENCY, AND 3) BASIC HUMAN NEEDS FOR THE MAINTENANCE OF DIGNITY FOR BOTH SCP VOLUNTEERS AND SERVICE RECIPIENTS. SCP WILL PROVIDE A FRAIL ELDERLY A GREAT BENEFIT BY HAVING SENIOR COMPANIONS SOCIALIZE, WALK, READ, AND PLAY INTERACTIVE GAMES FOR 2 HOUR PERIODS, 5 DAYS PER WEEK IN HOME FOR A FULL YEAR.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY
SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (SCSVP),  LOCATED IN CENTRAL NEW MEXICO IS THE INCUMBENT PROJECT SPONSOR OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, THROUGH THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT AND RSVP PROGRAMS ARE ALSO SPONSORED BY SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM. SANDOVAL COUNTY ENCOMPASSES 3,716 SQUARE MILES OF GEOGRAPHICALLY DIVERSE GEOGRAPHY, CULTURES AND PEOPLE.  THE MAJORITY OF COMMUNITIES ARE LOCATED IN RURAL AND OFTENTIMES, CHALLENGING GEOGRAPHIC SETTINGS.  THE SENIOR POPULATION IS A MICROCOSM OF THE LARGER DIVERSE POPULATION, WITH THE MAJORITY BEING OF WHITE RACE, FOLLOWED BY NATIVE AMERICAN AND A MUCH SMALLER AFRICAN AMERICAN RACE, WITH APPROXIMATELY 35% OF HISPANIC ETHNICITY.  THE HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS LIVE IN BOTH RURAL COMMUNITIES AND THE LARGER, MORE URBAN CITIES OF RIO RANCHO AND BERNALILLO, ALL LOCATED WITHIN SANDOVAL COUNTY. EIGHT SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE THE TARGET POPULATION OF HOMEBOUND SENIORS WITH LIMITED FAMILY AND FRIEND SUPPORT DURING THE GRANT YEARS OF JULY, 2017- JUNE, 2020. THE SENIOR COMPANIONS' SERVICE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, SHARING MEALS AND PASTIMES PLUS TRANSPORTATION TO PICK UP GROCERIES, MEDICATIONS, ETC. IT IS THE PROVISION OF THE COMPANIONSHIP AND TRANSPORTATION SERVICES WHICH WILL ALLOW THE SENIOR CLIENTS TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND REDUCE THE CHANCE OF BEING INSTITUTIONALIZED.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL HAVE PROVIDED SERVICES TO APPROXIMATELY 24 HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS WHO WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, THUS ENABLING THEM TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY. THE SANDOVAL COUNTY SENIOR VOLUNTEER PROGRAM DOES NOT RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDING. THE PROGRAM IS FUNDED THROUGH THE NEW MEXICO AGING AND LONG TERM SERVICES DEPARTMENT FOR $65,075.00 AND IS SUPPLEMENTED BY $8,538.00 OF LOCAL FUNDING.

CITY OF ALAMOGORDO MISSION:    THE CITY OF ALAMOGORDO IS A MUNICIPAL CORPORATION THAT EXISTS SOLELY FOR THE PURPOSE OF PROVIDING THE BEST POSSIBLE SERVICES TO OUR CUSTOMERS - THE CITIZENS OF ALAMOGORDO.  WE ARE COMMITTED TO PROVIDING THESE SERVICES WITH HONESTY, INTEGRITY, COMPASSION, FAIRNESS AND A COMMITMENT TO EXCELLENCE.  PART OF OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR PERSONS 55 AND OVER, WHICH IN TURN HELPS US PROVIDE AN ENVIRONMENT OFFERING SUPPORT EDUCATION, RECREATION, NUTRITION AND ENTERTAINMENT FOR ELDERLY RESIDENTS IN ALAMOGORDO AND THE SURROUNDING AREA.  OUR GOAL IS TO HELP SENIORS ACHIEVE AND MAINTAIN A VITAL, PRODUCTIVE ROLE IN LIFE EITHER THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM OR AS A CLIENT RECEIVING THESE SERVICES.  

FUNDING SOURCES:    WE CURRENTLY DO NOT RECEIVE ANY FEDERAL FUNDING: HOWEVER, WE ARE REQUESTING $67,750 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDING FOR 11 VSY'S

SERVICE CATEGORIES:    AGING IN PLACE

COMMUNITY NEEDS:    TO PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELDERLY PERSONS WHO ARE FRAIL AND HOMEBOUND OR THOSE LIVING IN NURSING FACILITIES.  OTERO COUNTY IS LARGELY RURAL AND SOME ELDERLY RESIDENTS DO NOT HAVE REGULAR CONTACT WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY MEMBERS.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM PROVIDES HOMEBOUND RESIDENTS WITH A COMPANION ON A REGULAR BASIS.  THIS PROGRAM PROVIDES THAT MUCH NEEDED HUMAN CONTACT WHICH IMPROVES THE QUALITY LIFE THROUGH SOCIAL INTERACTION FOR THOSE WHO WOULD NOT HAVE IT IF THE PROGRAM DID NOT EXIST.  

RESEARCH-BASED METHODS:    TIME SHEETS AND SURVEYS

OUTCOMES:  COMPANIONS WILL REPORT THAT THEY ARE LESS LONELY, DECREASED ISOLATION AND MORE EMOTIONALLY STABLE WITHIN THEIR ENVIRONMENT.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY

CHAVES COUNTY, NEW MEXICO IS KNOWN FOR ITS SCENIC AND RECREATIONAL ATTRACTIONS - THE BOTTOMLESS LAKES AND LINCOLN NATIONAL FOREST; THE HISTORICAL SITES; ECONOMIC OPPORTUNITIES; AND THE INFAMOUS ROSWELL UFO FESTIVAL.  THE COUNTY, LOCATED IN THE SOUTHEASTERN QUARTER OF NEW MEXICO, STRIVES TO ENSURE A HIGHER QUALITY OF LIFE FOR ITS RESIDENTS, IN PARTICULAR, FOR OLDER ADULTS AND PERSON WITH DISABILITIES, WITH A DESIRE TO AGE IN PLACE. 
CHAVES COUNTY IS THE 4TH LARGEST COUNTY IN NEW MEXICO.  THE COUNTY INCLUDES ROSWELL, DEXTER, HAGERMAN, LAKE ARTHUR, MIDWAY AND GREENFIELD.  THE TOTAL POPULATION OF CHAVES COUNTY IS 66,000; OF THESE, THIRTY-NINE PERCENT (39%) ARE 45 YEARS AND ABOVE.    FOURTEEN PERCENT (14%) OF THOSE 65AND OLDER LIVE BELOW THE POVERTY LEVEL.  
FOR 27 YEARS, CHAVES COUNTY J.O.Y. CENTERS, INC. HAS SUCCESSFULLY SERVED OLDER ADULTS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES VIA THE TRADITIONAL SENIOR PROGRAMS AND THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE GRANT RENEWAL APPLICATION IS HEALTHY FUTURES.  THIRTEEN (13) SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE 21 OLDER ADULTS AND PERSONS WITH DISABILITIES (INPUTS) WITH SERVICE ACTIVITIES SUCH AS COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION TO MEDICAL AND RECREATIONAL ACTIVITIES, MEAL PREPARATION, AND CAREGIVER RESPITE; RESULTING IN HEALTHIER/SAFER LIVING ENVIRONMENTS (OUTPUTS), AND AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES, THUS INDUCING A DECREASE IN FEELINGS OF ISOLATION (OUTCOME). THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $76,800 IN STATE FUNDS AND $2,000 IN LOCAL FUNDS.

THE MISSION OF THE SIERRA JOINT OFFICE ON AGING IS TO ESTABLISH A CONTINUUM OF SOCIAL SUPPORT AND HEALTH SERVICES TO MEET THE NEEDS OF ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS AND MAXIMIZE THEIR INDEPENDENCE, ENABLING THEM TO LIVE SUCCESSFULLY ON THEIR OWN TERMS IN THEIR OWN COMMUNITIES.  THE GOAL IS TO ENSURE THE USE OF ALL AVAILABLE RESOURCES AND SERVE AS AN ADVOCATE FOR THE ELDERLY POPULATION.
AN ESTIMATED 7 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL SERVE.  THEY WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP TO ELDERLY SENIORS IN OUR COMMUNITY.  AREAS OF SERVICE WILL INCLUDE THE VA HOME (WHEN A CLIENT IS UNABLE TO BE IN THEIR HOME DUE TO ILLNESS OR INJURY) AND PRIVATE RESIDENCES.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENCOURAGE HEALTHY AGING BY PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING, THE ABILITY TO IDENTIFY INDIVIDUALS AT RISK AND TO INTERVENE TO PREVENT LONELINESS AND DEPRESSION WHICH AGGRAVATE CHRONIC HEALTH PROBLEMS.  AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD WE ANTICIPATE TO DECREASE THE INSTANCES OF LONELINESS AND DEPRESSION OF THOSE ELDERLY WHO ARE TODAY WITHOUT INTERVENTION OF WHICH COMPANIONSHIP PROVIDES.

KINGDOM HOUSE -FOUNDED IN 1902, PROVIDES SOCIAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES TO LOW-INCOME FAMILIES, CHILDREN AND INDIVIDUALS UNDER STRESS BY PROVIDING CHILD DAY CARE, EDUCATION, RECREATION, COUNSELING ASSISTANCE WITH VOCATIONAL TRAINING AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES, ELDERLY SERVICES, FAMILY SUPPORT AND DIRECT MATERIAL RELIEF. 
MISSION- TO HELP PEOPLE ACHIEVE BETTER LIVES. IN FULFILLING OUR MISSION, WE TEACH PEOPLE TO FISH, RATHER THAN JUST FEEDING THEM FISH. KINGDOM HOUSE STRIVES TO HELP PEOPLE MEET BASIC NEEDS, BROADEN PERSONAL VISIONS, DEVELOP SOCIAL AND ECONOMIC SKILLS AND MOVE TOWARD FINANCIAL SELF-SUFFICIENCY WITH THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF ENDING CYCLES OF POVERTY. 
AS THE SPONSOR AGENCY FOR THE CURRENT SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, KINGDOM HOUSE IS REQUESTING 14 VSYS IN ORDER TO PROVIDE RESPITE AND COMPANIONSHIP.
THE KINGDOM HOUSE SCP PROVIDES LOW-INCOME SENIORS VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH VISITS TO ISOLATED/HOME BOUND ELDERLY AND DISABLED INDIVIDUALS INCLUDING VETERANS IN NEED OF THIS SERVICE.  
THE PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE CORPORATION APPROVED BOOKKEEPING METHODS TO TRACK EXPENDITURES AND DISBURSEMENTS.  IT WILL INVESTIGATE NEW AND INNOVATIVE WAYS, INCLUDING CONTRIBUTION SCHEDULES TO INCREASE AND MAINTAIN FUNDING TO ENSURE IT REMAINS FISCALLY SOUND.   
SERVICE QUALITY WILL BE MONITORED THROUGH COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH SURVEYS (PRE- AND POST-ASSESSMENTS). SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS AND VOLUNTEER STATION STAFF WILL COMPLETE AN ANNUAL SURVEY THAT WILL PROVIDE FEEDBACK ON VOLUNTEER SERVICES AND ISSUES. INPUT  PROVIDED FROM THESE SURVEYS WILL HELP IMPROVE SUPPORT AND SERVICES.

VISITING NURSE ASSOCIATION (VNA), SPONSOR OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) OF SOUTHEAST MO, IS A HOME HEALTH AGENCY SERVING IN-HOME CLIENTS. VNA CONSIST OF SEVEN PROGRAMS THEY ARE: HOME HEALTH, HOSPICE, PRIVATE DUTY NURSING, PERSONAL CARE/HOMEMAKER, HOME MEDICAL EQUIPMENT, CONSUMER DIRECTED SERVICE, AND SCP. THE MISSION STATEMENT OF THE VISITING NURSE ASSOCIATION IS TO SET THE STATEMENT FOR EXCELLENCE IN THE DELIVERY OF HOME CARE SERVICE TO THE CITIZENS OF SOUTHEAST MISSOURI THROUGH THERAPEUTIC, CUSTODIAL, PALLIATIVE, AND PREVENTIVE CARE IN A COOPERATIVE AND SEAMLESS SYSTEM, UTILIZING INNOVATION, DIVERSIFICATION AND COST EFFECTIVE METHODS IN AN ENVIRONMENT THAT FOSTERS LEARNING AND DEMONSTRATES POSITIVE OUTCOMES. THE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED WITHOUT REGARD TO AGE, RACE, CREED, DISABILITY OR ECONOMIC STATUS. THIS MISSION WILL BE CARRIED OUT USING THE NOT-FOR-PROFIT CORPORATION FORM OF DOING BUSINESS AS DEFINED IN CHAPTER 355 OF THE REVISED STATUTES OF MISSOURI. VNA IS REQUESTING $146,496.00 TO SUPPORT 32 VOLUNTEER VHS SERVICE YEARS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE THE LIVES OF IN HOME CLIENTS BY HELPING TO REDUCE PREMATURE INSTITUTIONALIZATION AND HELP COMBAT THE FEELING OF ISOLATION. CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES FROM SENIOR COMPANIONS WHO HELP ASSIST THE CAREGIVERS WITH MUCH NEEDED TIME AWAY FROM THEIR LOVED ONE. SENIOR COMPANION VISITS WILL BE MADE FOR THE FOLLOWING SERVICE ACTIVITIES: 1. HEALTHY FUTURES/INDEPENDENT LIVING 2. RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES FROM FOR THIS GRANT PERIOD ARE: 1. CLIENTS WILL REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOME 2. CLIENT WILL FEEL LESS ISOLATED 3. CAREGIVER WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES FOR MUCH NEED TIME AWAY FROM LOVE ONE. COMPANIONS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR CHECKING ON THE GENERAL WELL-BEING OF SCP CLIENTS. CLIENT SURVEYS L INDICATE 80% OF THE CLIENTS FEEL THAT ASSISTANCE FROM COMPANIONS HELP COMBAT THE FEELINGS OF ISOLATION AND ALSO HELP THEM TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES.  SCP ALSO GIVES COMPANIONS A PURPOSE FOR LIVING AND HELP THEM MEET THEIR FINANCIAL NEEDS.

THE MENTAL HEALTH ASSOCIATION OF SOUTH CENTRAL KANSAS (MHA) IS THE SPONSORING AGENCY OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.  THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION IS TO EMPOWER AND ASSIST YOUTH, FAMILIES, AND ADULTS IN OUR COMMUNITY TO ACHIEVE OPTIMAL MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS THROUGH EDUCATION, ADVOCACY AND SERVICE.  THE VISION IS ACHIEVEMENT OF A JUST, HUMANE, AND HEALTHY SOCIETY WHERE ALL PEOPLE ARE TREATED WITH RESPECT, DIGNITY, AND THE OPPORTUNITY TO ACHIEVE THEIR FULL POTENTIAL FREE FROM STIGMA AND PREJUDICE.  
MHA IS REQUESTING $222,930 IN SUPPORT OF 37 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS.  THE ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES IS $105,998.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL USE THESE FUNDS IN ORDER TO ADDRESS THE PRIMARY HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT, AGING IN PLACE. SCP WILL MEET THE NEEDS OF HOMEBOUND AND DISABLED SENIORS, INCLUDING VETERANS, BY PROVIDING SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SERVICE ACTIVITIES.
THE METHODS USED FOR MEASURING OUTCOMES ARE THE OFFICIAL SURVEYS:  SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (CLIENT) INDEPENDENT LIVING PERFORMANCE MEASURE SURVEY; AND THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM RESPITE PERFORMANCE MEASURE SURVEY, AS DIRECTED IN OMB CONTROL NUMBER 3045-0146. 
MEETING THESE COMMUNITY NEEDS WILL ALLOW DISABLED SENIORS, INCLUDING VETERANS OF WAR AND AT-RISK VULNERABLE SENIORS WHO NEED HELP AT HOME TO EXPERIENCE INCREASED SELF-EFFICACY AND THE ABILITY TO REMAIN LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AT HOME.  RESPITE CARE WILL ALLOW UNPAID FAMILY CAREGIVERS TO HAVE THE SUPPORT AND SERVICES NEEDED SO THAT THEY CAN CONTINUE CARE GIVING IN ORDER TO ALLOW THEIR LOVED ONES TO REMAIN AT HOME LIVING INDEPENDENTLY AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.  
MHA SCP'S ANTICIPATED OUTCOME IS THAT CLIENTS, INCLUDING RETIRED VETERANS, CAREGIVERS, AND VOLUNTEERS IMPROVE THEIR PHYSICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH; RECEIVE COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE SERVICES; EXPERIENCE FREEDOM FROM ABUSE; AND REDUCE DEPRESSION AND ISOLATION BY THEIR INVOLVEMENT IN THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.
IN ADDITION, MHA IS REQUESTING AUGMENTATION FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $140,778 TO IMPLEMENT THE SENIOR REACH EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICE.

NORTHERN ARIZONA UNIVERSITY (NAU) PROVIDES AN OUTSTANDING UNDERGRADUATE RESIDENTIAL EDUCATION STRENGTHENED BY RESEARCH, GRADUATE AND PROFESSIONAL PROGRAMS, AND SOPHISTICATED METHODS OF DISTANCE DELIVERY AND VALUES EXCELLENCE IN EDUCATION, STUDENT SUCCESS, EDUCATIONAL ACCESS, DIVERSITY, INTEGRITY, AND CIVILITY. NAU ACHIEVES THIS THROUGH TEACHING, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND INNOVATIVE MANAGEMENT. THE CIVIC SERVICE INSTITUTE, HOUSED IN THE COLLEGE OF SOCIAL AND BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES, PROVIDES AN IMPORTANT LINK TO THE COMMUNITY BY ENGAGING VOLUNTEERS OF ALL AGES TO HELP MEET CRITICAL COMMUNITY NEEDS. THE CIVIC SERVICE INSTITUTE (CSI@NAU), WHICH ENGAGES VOLUNTEERS TO MEET THE NEEDS OF COMMUNITIES AND NEIGHBORHOODS THROUGHOUT ARIZONA, SPONSORS FOUR NATIONAL SERVICE PROGRAMS: AMERICORPS, FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAM, RSVP, AND SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM.
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SERVES A FIVE COUNTY AREA -- COCONINO, MARICOPA, MOHAVE, NAVAJO, AND YAVAPAI COUNTIES -- THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH 45 ORGANIZATIONS SUCH AS HOME HEALTH AGENCIES, AREA AGENCIES ON AGING, COUNTY SENIOR SERVICES DEPARTMENTS, HOSPITALS, AND HOSPICE AGENCIES. SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL VOLUNTEER WITH AND POSITIVELY IMPACT UP TO 500 OF ARIZONA'S OLDER ADULTS IN NEED. CSI@NAU REQUESTS $611,758 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO SUPPORT 110 VOLUNTEERS IN MEETING 102 VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS. THE CNCS INVESTMENT WILL BE MATCHED WITH A GRANTEE SHARE OF $67,973 AND $186,602 IN EXCESS FUNDING FOR A TOTAL BUDGET OF $866,333. 
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL BE ADDRESSING THE CNCS PRIORITY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES THROUGH THREE WORK PLANS: COMPANIONSHIP, TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE CARE. WE ANTICIPATE SERVING 500 INDIVIDUALS AND THAT 90% WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT/TIES AS A RESULT OF THE VISITS, TRANSPORTATION, AND RESPITE CARE PROVIDED BY THE VOLUNTEERS.

AN ESTIMATED 40 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 37 SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE IN-HOME SUPPORT (AGING IN PLACE) WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING (ADL'S), LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREPARATION, MEDICATION REMINDERS, TRANSPORTATION AND COMPANIONSHIP. COMPANIONS SERVING IN RESPITE WILL PROVIDE CAREGIVERS WITH MUCH NEEDED RELIEF FROM CAREGIVING RESPONSIBILITIES IN ORDER TO GO TO WORK, SCHOOL OR ATTEND TO PERSONAL AND HOUSEHOLD NEEDS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 80 CUSTOMERS WILL RECEIVE 33,414 HOURS OF INDEPENDENT LIVING IN-HOME SUPPORT SERVICES PROVIDED BY 32 VOLUNTEERS; 8 CAREGIVERS WILL HAVE RELIEF FROM CAREGIVING DUTIES TO ATTEND TO WORK, SCHOOL AND PERSONAL RESPONSIBILITIES WITH 5 COMPANIONS SERVING 5,220 HOURS; AND 8 ASSISTED LIVING RESIDENTS NEEDING SUPPORT WITH TRANSITIONAL CARE OR EXPERIENCING DEPRESSION AND SOCIAL ISOLATION, WILL BE PROVIDED WITH 3,132 HOURS OF COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES BY 3 COMPANIONS.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $ 187,110 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $36,977 IN NONFEDERAL RESOURCES.  $13,500 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES WILL BE RECEIVED FROM THE TAZEWELL COUNTY BOARD OF SUPERVISORS, $5,599 IN IN-KIND DONATIONS, AND $17,878 IN A COMBINATION OF FUNDING FROM DONATIONS, FUNDRAISING ACTIVITIES AND THE COMMUNITY BLOCK GRANT (AS NEEDED).

SENIOR RESOURCES, INCORPORATED (SRI), THE LEGAL APPLICANT, IS A WELL-ESTABLISHED NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION, ESTABLISHED AND ACTIVE IN THE SC MIDLANDS COMMUNITY SINCE 1967.   THE SCP PROGRAM HAS BEEN SPONSORED BY SENIOR RESOURCES SINCE 1988. THE MISSION OF SENIOR RESOURCES IS TO PROVIDE COORDINATED SERVICES, RESOURCES AND PERSONAL CHOICES TO PROMOTE HEALTHY, INDEPENDENT LIVING THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF STAFF AND VOLUNTEERS.  THE AARP FOUNDATION  (JULY 2014) STATES THAT A PURPOSE IN LIFE CAN PREVENT ISOLATION AMONG SENIORS AND VOLUNTEERING IS A GREAT WAY TO MAKE A DIFFERENCE AND BRING MEANING BACK TO LIFE. SCP OF THE MIDLANDS IS ALSO UNIQUELY POSITIONED AND QUALIFIED DUE TO BEING HOUSED IN AN ORGANIZATION THAT OFFERS COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAMS AND SERVICES ALONG WITH ESTABLISHED RELATIONSHIPS WITH EXISTING AGING SERVICE PROVIDERS, STATE AND LOCAL OFFICES ON AGING, AND CURRENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS.

SENIOR SERVICES INC. OF CHESTER COUNTY (SSICC) IS A NON-PROFIT 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION ESTABLISHED IN 1973 WITH A MISSION OF DEVELOPING, FOSTERING, AND ENCOURAGING SERVICES AND ACTIVITIES OF HEALTH, WELLNESS, EDUCATION, AND FELLOWSHIP AMONG OLDER CITIZENS THROUGHOUT CHESTER COUNTY. SSICC'S ULTIMATE GOAL IS TO HELP ALL SENIORS REMAIN HEALTHY, INDEPENDENT, AND SAFE WITHIN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. THROUGH PROGRAMMING, PARTNERSHIPS, AND COLLABORATIONS, SSICC MAKES EVERY EFFORT TO MAXIMIZE AND/OR IMPROVE THE LIVES OF SENIORS AND/OR THEIR CAREGIVERS THROUGH COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES IN THE HOME. IN AN EFFORT TO ACHIEVE ITS MISSION THROUGH THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, THE AGENCY FOSTERS, POSITIVE PUBLIC RELATIONS, RECRUITMENT AND VISIBILITY IN THE COMMUNITY AT EVERY OPPORTUNITY POSSIBLE BY MARKETING ITSELF AT THE SPECIAL EVENTS OF OTHER HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS AND LOCAL COMMUNITY EXPOS AND HEALTH FAIRS. 
THE MISSION OF THE VOLUNTEERS IN THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP), IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORTIVE PERSON-TO-PERSON SERVICES THROUGH ASSIGNMENTS MADE BY SCP VOLUNTEER STATIONS BY PERFORMING SERVICE ACTIVITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS WHO HAVE EXCEPTIONAL NEEDS, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, IN-HOME CARE NEEDS, AND CARETAKER RESPITE SERVICES. THESE GOALS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING TWO HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING IN PLACE FOCUS AREAS UTILIZING TWO SERVICE AREAS: (1) ADVANCING BETTER LIVING FOR ELDERS, AND (2) COMPANIONSHIP. THE SCP WILL UTILIZE 3 SCP VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO ACCOMPLISH SCP PROJECT GOALS: (1) SENIOR SERVICES INC. OF CHESTER COUNTY, (2) HOSPICE CARE OF SOUTH CAROLINA AND (3) CHESTER ACTIVE DAY CARE.  WHILE WORKING WITH THE 3 SCP VOLUNTEER STATIONS, THE SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL COMPLETE THEIR ASSIGNMENTS IN HOMES AND AT 1 FACILITY BY PROVIDING SERVICE ACTIVITIES WHICH FACILITATE PERSONAL CARE, NUTRITION, SOCIAL/RECREATION, HOME MANAGEMENT AND INFORMATION/ADVOCACY. FOR FISCAL YEAR 2017-2018, SENIOR SERVICES IS SEEKING FOR THE SCP TO MAINTAIN AN AVERAGE OF 23 VSY'S FOR A TOTAL OF 24,012 HOURS. THE FEDERAL FUNDING LEVEL FOR THE 23 VSY'S AT A FIXED RATE OF $6000 PER VSY'S IS ANTICIPATED AT $136,500. THE LOCAL FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE AGENCY IS ANTICIPATED AT $13,650.
AS A RESULT OF SCP IN CHESTER COUNTY, IT IS DETERMINED THAT THE SCP WILL ADDRESS THE IN-HOME NEEDS OF THE MANY OLDER INDIVIDUALS LIVING ALONE DETERMINED TO HAVE SELF-CARE LIMITATIONS AND PROVIDE RESPITE CARE IN ORDER TO SUPPORT THOSE WHO SERVE AS CAREGIVERS FOR AN AGED SPOUSE OR FAMILY MEMBER. ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THESE TWO PLACEMENTS PRESENTLY RECEIVE LIMITED CARE. BY USING SCP VOLUNTEERS WITHIN THIS FRAMEWORK THE ELDERLY INDIVIDUALS ARE ABLE TO RECEIVE ANCILLARY RESOURCES AND MORE INDIVIDUALIZED ATTENTION WHICH CREATES GROWTH IN THEIR PERSONAL FUNCTIONING AND LIFE SKILLS NECESSARY TO MAINTAIN DAY TO DAY LIVING WHICH FACILITATES 'AGING IN PLACE.' IN ADDITION TO THE PERSONAL AND EMOTIONAL ASPECTS OF AGING, OTHER ANTICIPATED SCP OUTCOMES ARE THAT IN-HOME ELDERLY CLIENTS WILL BE ABLE TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES INDEPENDENTLY VERSUS BEING PLACED IN GROUP OR INSTITUTIONAL SETTINGS AND CAREGIVERS WILL BECOME LESS RESTRAINED, ENJOY LIFE, AND BE ENERGIZED IN ORDER TO POSITIVELY CARE FOR THEIR HOMEBOUND ELDERLY.

CHARLESTON AREA SENIOR CITIZENS SERVICES, INC. (CASC) IS A 501(C)3 ORGANIZATION THAT SERVES SENIOR CITIZENS IN SOUTH CAROLINA, SPECIFICALLY BERKELEY, CHARLESTON, AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES. THE MISSION OF THE ORGANIZATION IS TO PROMOTE THE SOCIAL, MENTAL AND ECONOMIC WELL-BEING OF SENIORS. CASC IS REQUESTING $218,400 IN FEDERAL FUNDS TO SPONSOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IN A THREE COUNTY AREA. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS FOR ALL PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND NON-IMPACT AREA WILL BE 56.  AT LEASE ONE HUNDRED HOMEBOUND SENIORS WILL RECEIVE 50,112 HOURS OF SERVICE, 48 VSY'S DURING THE CONTRACT YEAR.
THE SCP WILL ADDRESS TWO PERFORMANCE MEASURES: IN-HOME CARE (H8) AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS (H13). IN-HOME CARE /COMPANIONSHIP (H8) WILL BE PROVIDED BY 30 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS ASSIGNED TO ONE OR ALL OF THE CURRENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS SERVING 60 CLIENTS IN THE HOME.  EACH VOLUNTEER WILL SERVE 1-5 HOMEBOUND SENIORS.   ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE SPECIFIC TRAINING DURING THE CONTRACT YEAR TO ENHANCE THEIR SKILL LEVELS; INCLUDING RECOGNIZING AND CARING FOR VICTIMS OF ALZHEIMER'S AND RELATED DEMENTIA, HEALTHY NUTRITION, AND WARNING SIGNS OF HEART ATTACK OR STROKE. VOLUNTEERS WILL VISIT EACH CLIENT AND, DEPENDING UPON THE CARE PLAN; PREPARE LIGHT MEALS, PERFORM LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING DUTIES, PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP.   OF THESE VOLUNTEERS, FOUR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ASSIGNED TO HOMEBOUND VETERAN CLIENTS AND FOUR VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE NEEDED TRANSPORTATION TO DIALYSIS CLINICS.
RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS (H13) WILL BE PROVIDED BY 24 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS ASSIGNED TO ONE OR ALL OF THE CURRENT VOLUNTEER STATIONS SERVING 40 CLIENTS IN THE HOME.  EACH VOLUNTEER WILL SERVE AT LEAST ONE CLIENT.  ALL VOLUNTEERS WILL RECEIVE SPECIFIC TRAINING DURING THE CONTRACT YEAR TO ENHANCE THEIR SKILL LEVELS; INCLUDING RECOGNIZING AND CARING FOR VICTIMS OF ALZHEIMER'S AND RELATED DEMENTIA, HEALTHY NUTRITION, AND WARNING SIGNS OF HEART ATTACK OR STROKE. VOLUNTEERS WILL VISIT EACH CLIENT AND, DEPENDING UPON THE CARE PLAN; PREPARE LIGHT MEALS, PERFORM LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING DUTIES, PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP, MONITORING AND RESPITE CARE ASSISTANCE.
AN ESTIMATED 90% OF IN-HOME CLIENTS WILL REPORT REDUCED FEELINGS OF LONELINESS DUE TO SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER VISITS. IT IS PROJECTED THAT 85% OF THOSE SERVED WILL REMAIN AT HOME, PREVENTING OR DELAYING INSTITUTIONALIZATION. RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS WILL BE PROVIDED TO OVERBURDENED CARE GIVERS. 70% OF CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT BY THE END OF THE CONTRACT YEAR AN IMPROVED SENSE OF WELLBEING DUE TO RESPITE SERVICE.  THE END OUTCOME FOR THIS PERFORMANCE MEASURE WILL BE TO ENSURE THAT CAREGIVERS CAN CONTINUE TO PROVIDE CARE AND THIS SERVICE WILL REDUCE THE NUMBER OF RELOCATIONS OF ELDERLY CLIENTS.

APPALACHIAN STATE UNIVERSITY HAS EVOLVED INTO A PREEMINENT UNIVERSITY LOCATED IN A UNIQUE, RURAL MOUNTAIN ENVIRONMENT. AS A MEMBER OF THE UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA, APPALACHIAN'S FUNDAMENTAL MISSION IS TO DISCOVER, CREATE, TRANSMIT, AND APPLY KNOWLEDGE TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS AND SOCIETY. THIS MISSION IS ACHIEVED BY PROVIDING UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS A RIGOROUS LIBERAL EDUCATION THAT EMPHASIZES TRANSFERABLE SKILLS AND PREPARATION FOR PROFESSIONAL CAREERS; OFFERING GRADUATE STUDENTS DISTINCTIVE, RELEVANT PROGRAMS; MAINTAINING A FACULTY WHOSE MEMBERS SERVE AS EXCELLENT TEACHERS AND SCHOLARLY MENTORS FOR THEIR STUDENTS AND WHO PRODUCE HIGH LEVELS OF SCHOLARSHIP AND CREATIVE ACTIVITIES.
APPALACHIAN SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM HAS BEEN PROVIDING SERVICES FOCUSING ON INDEPENDENT LIVING IN THE WESTERN MOUNTAINS OF NORTH CAROLINA SINCE 1988. OUR MISSION IS TO PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR SENIOR CITIZENS THAT WILL ENHANCE THEIR LIVES AND AT THE SAME TIME ENHANCE AND IMPROVE THE LIVES OF  THEIR PEERS.  THE NEED FOR OUR SERVICES HAS BEEN WELL DOCUMENTED AND SUPPORTED BY LOCAL PHYSICIANS, SOCIAL WORKERS AND CAREGIVERS THEMSELVES.    AN ESTIMATED  56 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST THE FRAIL ELDERLY WITH FOOD ACQUISITION AND PREPARATION, PROPER NUTRITION, ERRANDS, TRANSPORTATION AND DAILY LIVING TASKS' THAT WILL ALLOW THE INDIVIDUALS TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES.  RESPITE SERVICES WILL ALSO BE PROVIDED FOR FAMILY CAREGIVERS THAT ARE IN THE WORKFORCE OR FRAIL THEMSELVES AND STRUGGLING TO KEEP THEIR LOVED ONE AT HOME. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS ON AGENCY- WIDE PRIORITY MEASURES IN HEALTHY FUTURES AIMED AT AGING IN PLACE USING INDEPENDENT LIVING OUTCOMES AND/OR COMPLEMENTARY PROGRAM MEASURES -- RESPITE CARE OUTCOMES WHICH ALIGN WITH NATIONAL PERFORMANCE MEASURES.    THESE SERVICES ARE ALSO OFFERED TO VETERANS AND THEIR FAMILIES.  SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH A NETWORK OF STATIONS SUCH AS SOCIAL SERVICES,  AGENCIES ON AGING, HOSPITALS, ADULT DAY CARE AND THE FOOD PANTRY.   96% OF OUR VOLUNTEERS ARE IN OUTCOME BASED ASSIGNMENTS.  AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERFORMANCE PERIOD, 85% OF THOSE 250 INDIVIDUALS SERVED WILL REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR OWN HOMES, AND PRIMARY CAREGIVERS CAN CONTINUE PROVIDING CARE THAT WILL ENABLE CARE RECIPIENTS TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOMES LONGER THAN WOULD OTHERWISE BE POSSIBLE.     
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $248,985 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $60,370 IN THE ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

COASTAL COMMUNITY ACTION, INC. IS A PRIVATE CORPORATION WITH A VERY PUBLIC MISSION. INCORPORATED IN 1965, THE AGENCY CAME INTO BEING AS PART OF A NATIONWIDE, FEDERALLY FUNDED, COMMUNITY ACTION MOVEMENT WHOSE FOCUS IS TO INTIMATELY INVOLVE LOW IN-COME PEOPLE IN DEVELOPING THEIR OWN SOLUTIONS TO PERSISTENT POVERTY. A COMMON THREAD THROUGH ALL OF OUR SERVICES, FAMILY SERVICES, SENIOR SERVICES, OR HOUSING SERVICES, IS THAT WE HELP PEOPLE CHANGE LIVES BY PROVIDING NEEDED RESOURCES AND SUPPORT. THE AGENCIES MISSION IS, 'IS THROUGH ADVOCACY, EDUCATION, SUPPORT AND SERVICES, WE WILL EMPOWER INDIVIDUALS, FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES TOWARD A BETTER WAY OF LIFE.'
A MINIMUM OF 50 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE EACH PROJECT YEAR. THE PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF CAREGIVERS, AND OLDER OR DISABLED ADULTS IN A FIVE COUNTY SERVICE AREA. SOME OF THE ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, ASSISTING WITH DAILY LIVING TASKS, SUCH AS GROCERY SHOPPING, TRANSPORTATION FOR MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, BILL PAYING, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, ASSIST WITH MEAL PREPARATION AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROMOTE HEALTHY FUTURES WITH THE OUTCOME OF THE BENEFICIARIES RECEIVING THE SERVICE REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT, ADDING TO THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE.
AT THE END OF THE GRANT CYCLE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $179,120 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $70,000 IN NON CNCS FUNDING. THOSE MONEYS WILL COME FROM HOME CARE AND COMMUNITY BLOCK GRANT FUNDING, FAMILY CAREGIVER SUPPORT PROGRAM FUNDING, COUNTY FINANCIAL SUPPORT, CASH CONTRIBUTIONS  AND IN KIND CONTRIBUTIONS.
THE PROJECT WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH OTHER AGING SERVICE PROVIDERS, THE AREA AGENCY ON AGING AND THE SPONSOR AGENCY TO LOCATE CAREGIVERS IN NEED OF RESPITE, HOME-BOUND AND DISABLED IN THE NEED OF RECEIVING FOOD, TRANSPORTATION, OR OTHER SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY IN THE FIVE COUNTY SERVICE AREA.

LAND OF SKY REGIONAL COUNCIL (LOSRC) IS A MULTI-COUNTY, LOCAL GOVERNMENT PLANNING AND DEVELOPMENT ORGANIZATION IN NORTH CAROLINA. IT IS ONE OF 17 SUCH ORGANIZATIONS IN THE STATE AND SERVES REGION B, WHICH INCLUDES BUNCOMBE, HENDERSON, MADISON AND TRANSYLVANIA COUNTIES. THE PROFESSIONAL STAFF CARRIES OUT APPROVED PROGRAMS AND PROVIDES LOCAL GOVERNMENTS WITH GRANT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THROUGH THE DEPARTMENTS OF AREA AGENCY ON AGING, MOUNTAIN MOBILITY, ECONOMIC & COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT, AND MOUNTAIN WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.
LOSRC BOARD OF DELEGATES IS MADE UP OF ELECTED OFFICIALS -- MAYORS, COUNTY COMMISSION CHAIRPERSONS, TOWN COUNCIL MEMBERS AND ALTERNATES -- FROM MEMBER GOVERNMENTS. MEMBERS MEET MONTHLY TO PLAN PROGRAMS AND SET POLICIES AND GOALS TO BENEFIT THE ENTIRE REGION. IN ADDITION TO THE FOUR COUNTIES, MEMBER GOVERNMENTS INCLUDE THE MUNICIPALITIES OF ASHEVILLE, BILTMORE FOREST, BLACK MOUNTAIN, MONTREAT,WEAVERVILLE, WOODFIN, FLETCHER, FLAT ROCK,HENDERSONVILLE, LAUREL PARK, HOT SPRINGS, MARS HILL,MARSHALL, BREVARD AND ROSMAN. 
LOSRC'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE CREATIVE REGIONAL SOLUTIONS TO RELEVANT AND EMERGING ISSUES IN BUNCOMBE, HENDERSON, MADISON AND TRANSYLVANIA COUNTIES WHILE PROVIDING A STANDARD OF EXCELLENCE IN THE DELIVERY OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND REGIONAL SERVICES FOR OUR MEMBER COMMUNITIES. 
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IS REQUESTING $309,268, OR 60 VSYS, TO PROVIDE IN-HOME CARE AND/ OR RESPITE CARE TO CAREGIVERS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THIS THREE-YEAR GRANT, 127 CLIENTS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. ADDITIONALLY, 7 CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.

POSITIVE MATURITY WAS CREATED BY THE INDEPENDENT PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH IN 1971 TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE AGING COMMUNITY IN JEFFERSON COUNTY ALABAMA. IN 1972 THE AGENCY BECAME INCORPORATED, RECEIVED IT'S NON-PROFIT 501(C)3 STATUS, BECAME A SPONSOR FOR THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES (CNCS) AND A PARTNER FOR UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL ALABAMA. POSITIVE MATURITY'S MISSION IS TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF OLDER ADULTS THROUGH SOCIAL SERVICES AND CIVIC ENGAGEMENT.
AS A SPONSOR FOR SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS, POSITIVE MATURITY OFFERS ADULTS 50 AND OLDER A VARIETY OF VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH RSVP (SERVING BLOUNT, JEFFERSON, SHELBY AND WALKER COUNTIES), FOSTER GRANDPARENT VOLUNTEER PROGRAM (JEFFERSON COUNTY) AND THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER PROGRAM THAT ALSO SERVES JEFFERSON COUNTY.   IN ADDITION TO THE THREE (3) SENIOR CORPS PROGRAMS; POSITIVE MATURITY OFFERS AN EMPLOYMENT PROGRAM; AGING WORKERS ARE RELIABLE EMPLOYEES, A SENIOR CENTER; SHEPHERD CENTER EAST AND A GERIATRIC SOCIAL SERVICE DEPARTMENT WHOSE PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY IS TO ASSIST THOSE PARTICIPANTS ALREADY ENROLLED IN POSITIVE MATURITY PROGRAMS.  EACH PROGRAM IN ITSELF IS DESIGNED TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THE PARTICIPANTS, BUT MORE IMPORTANTLY ARE DESIGNED TO PROVIDE A COMPREHENSIVE MENU OF SERVICES AND THAT IS DESIGNED TO KEEP PARTICIPANTS ACTIVELY ENGAGED AND INDEPENDENT FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE.
POSITIVE MATURITY'S  MISSION IS CARRIED EACH YEAR THROUGH THE HARD WORK OF STAFF, A DEDICATED BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND FUNDING THAT IS COMPRISED OF OVER 10 DIFFERENT LOCAL, STATE AND COMMUNITY FOUNDATIONS AND FUNDRAISING EFFORTS.  EACH YEAR POSITIVE MATURITY ASSESSES THE NEEDS OF THE AGING COMMUNITY THROUGH RESEARCH, SURVEYS AND INFORMATION PROVIDED BY COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS. THIS INFORMATION IS COMPARED TO AND INCORPORATED INTO A STRATEGIC PROCESS THAT GIVES OUR STAFF CLEAR GOALS AND OBJECTIVES TO REACH AS MANY GOALS AND PARTICIPANTS AS POSSIBLE WITH FUNDING THAT IS AVAILABLE.  POSITIVE MATURITY ALSO PARTNERS WITH SEVERAL COMMUNITY PROGRAMS TO ENSURE PARTICIPANTS HAVE ACCESS TO RESOURCES NEEDED TO REMAIN INDEPENDENT, ACTIVE AND ENGAGED IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE AGENCY SERVES AS AN ADVOCATE FOR ISSUES THAT PERTAIN TO THE AGING COMMUNITY AND ARE LOOKED TO AS LEADERS IN THE COMMUNITY.
POSITIVE MATURITY IS RESPECTFULLY REQUESTING ANNUAL FUNDING OF $283,188 FROM CNCS TO SUPPORT THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM ($849,564 OVER THE COURSE OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT PERIOD).  IN ADDITION TO THE CNCS FUNDING, POSITIVE MATURITY, INC. WILL SECURE THE REQUIRED MATCH FROM VARIOUS FUNDING SOURCES SUCH AS UNITED WAY OF CENTRAL ALABAMA, LOCAL, COUNTY AND STATE (NON-FEDERAL) RESOURCES AND THROUGH GENEROUS DONATIONS MADE BY THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE EACH YEAR. 
THROUGH THIS GENEROUS FUNDING, PM WILL BE ABLE TO SUPPORT AN ANTICIPATED 66 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS EACH YEAR OVER THE COURSE OF THE NEXT THREE YEARS. OUR SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) VOLUNTEERS WILL ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS THROUGH "IMPACT VOLUNTEERING" WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES. VOLUNTEERS WILL ALSO FOCUS THEIR EFFORTS IN ADDRESSING COMMUNITY NEEDS IN AREAS SUCH AS IN-HOME CARE AND RESPITE. THROUGHOUT THE NEXT THREE YEARS, POSITIVE MATURITY, INC. AND SCP WILL ALSO ADDRESS VETERANS AND MILITARY FAMILIES THROUGH VOLUNTEER RECRUITMENT AND PROVIDING VOLUNTEERS TO ADDRESS THE NEEDS OF THIS VERY SPECIAL COMMUNITY.  SCP ANTICIPATES ACHIEVING OVER 76,000 VOLUNTEER HOURS PER YEAR FOR THE NEXT THREE YEARS WITH THE HARD WORK OF THE SCP DIRECTOR AND SCP VOLUNTEERS AND THE SUPPORT OF THE SPONSORING AGENCY.   IT WILL BE OUR GOAL TO ACHIEVE A SUCCESS RATE OF 85% OF ALL GOALS AND OBJECTIVE SET FORTH IN THIS APPLICATION.

AN ESTIMATED 68 SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE A THREE COUNTY AREA IN NORTHERN UTAH. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: COMPANIONSHIP, ASSISTED TRANSPORTATION AND RESPITE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA IS HEALTHY FUTURES: INDEPENDENT LIVING AND RESPITE CARE. AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, 80 COMPANIONSHIP CLIENTS, AND 50 TRANSPORTATION CLIENTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT, AND 40 RESPITE CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $340,413.00 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $88,412 OF NON-FEDERAL FUNDS.

SPONSORING ORGANIZATION: THE BEAR RIVER AREA AGENCY ON AGING IS A DIVISION WITHIN THE BEAR RIVER ASSOCIATION OF GOVERNMENTS WHICH SERVICES CACHE, BOX ELDER AND RICH COUNTIES IN NORTHERN UTAH. 
MISSION: THE MISSION OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN NORTHERN UTAH FOR OVER 16 YEARS HAS BEEN TO PAIR HEALTHY OLDER ADULTS WITH FRAIL SENIOR CITIZENS AND/OR DISABLED ADULTS TO DECREASE ISOLATION AND LONELINESS WITH WEEKLY VISITS FROM A CARING COMPANION. BEFORE THE SCP WAS ESTABLISHED, THE BEAR RIVER AREA AGENCY ON AGING HAD OVER 180 DOCUMENTED SENIORS IN THE THREE RURAL COUNTIES THAT LACKED FUNDS, FAMILY OR COMMUNITY SERVICES TO COVER THEIR BASIC SOCIAL/ EMOTIONAL NEEDS AND ASSISTANCE WITH DAILY LIVING TASKS. OUR GOAL EACH YEAR HAS BEEN TO MAINTAIN THE NUMBER OF SENIOR VOLUNTEERS ALONG WITH RECRUITMENT TO INCREASE THE SUCCESS OF SERVICES TO THE EVER RISING NUMBER OF HOME BOUND CLIENTS. THE RETENTION OF VOLUNTEERS AND CLIENTS SERVED IS A POSITIVE INDICATION OF THE STABILITY OF THE BEAR RIVER SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. THERE ARE THREE MAJOR AREAS THAT HAVE DIRECT IMPACT ON THE LIVES AND HEALTHY FUTURES OF THE VOLUNTEER AND CLIENT THAT CAN BE DEMONSTRATED. THESE ARE: ENHANCING INDEPENDENT LIVING, CAREGIVERS RECEIVING ASSISTANCE WITH THE BURDEN OF CARING FOR A LOVED ONE IN THE HOME AND TRANSPORTATION WHICH PROVIDES ACCESS TO NECESSARY SERVICES FOR CLIENTS.
REQUESTED VOLUNTEER VSY'S: 14 
REQUESTED DOLLAR AMOUNT: $69,888
SERVICES CATEGORIES: THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS HEALTHY FUTURES OF THE ELDER POPULATION THROUGH COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH, TRANSPORTATION, EDUCATION/INFORMATION, AND RESPITE.
COMMUNITY NEEDS: INDEPENDENT LIVING, RESPITE CARE, TRANSPORTATION AND VETERAN RURAL HEALTH OUTREACH ARE A PRIORITY FOR THE BEAR RIVER SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. THESE ISSUES WILL BE ADDRESSED THROUGH THE SUPPORT OF THE SCP VOLUNTEER EFFORTS TO DECREASE ISOLATION, INCREASE SOCIAL TIES, PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, MAINTAIN CLIENT INDEPENDENCE IN THE HOME AND REDUCE STRESS LEVELS FOR CAREGIVERS. 
RESEARCH BASED METHODS USED: ONE TELEPHONE SATISFACTION SURVEY WILL BE CONDUCTED TO EVALUATE THE CURRENT STATUS OF CAREGIVERS STRESS LEVEL AND CLIENT SATISFACTION WITH SCP VOLUNTEER ASSISTANCE. 
PROJECT ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES: A MINIMUM OF 80 FRAIL OLDER ADULTS WILL BENEFIT FROM COMPANIONSHIP/OUTREACH FROM 14 SCP VOLUNTEERS ON A WEEKLY BASIS. RESPITE FOR 2 CAREGIVERS PROVIDING CARE TO A LOVED ONE WILL RECEIVE OF 2-3 HOURS OF RESPITE PER WEEK.

AN ESTIMATED 16 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. OF THIS NUMBER 16 WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS.  SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, COMPANIONSHIP AND SUPPORTIVE SERVICES, SUCH AS: TRANSPORTATION, SHOPPING/ERRANDS, LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING, MEAL PREP, TO HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES.  RESPITE CARE TO PROVIDE FAMILY CAREGIVERS WITH A BREAK INCLUDING IN-HOME RESPITE AND RESPITE THROUGH LOCAL NON-PROFIT AGENCY, MEMORY MATTERS, PROVIDING SUPPORT TO CAREGIVERS OF INDIVIDUALS WITH ALZHEIMER'S OR RELATED DEMENTIAS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES-AGING IN PLACE, INDEPENDENT LIVING COMPANIONSHIP AND CAREGIVER RESPITE.  AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT, A MINIMUM OF 84 HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES THAT ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY WITH AT LEAST 54 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  AND, A MINIMUM OF 24 CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND, OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES WITH AT LEAST 15 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $92,562 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $37,847

THE GOAL OF THE SENIORS COUNCIL SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IS TO RECRUIT, TRAIN AND PLACE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS INTO HOMES OF OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES. PRIMARILY WE WILL BE SERVING CLIENTS WHO ARE HOMEBOUND, LIVING ALONE AND DISABLED. IN ADDITION RESPITE SERVICES WILL BE PROVIDED FOR INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE THE PRIMARY CAREGIVERS HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES. SERVING IN THE HEALTHY FUTURES FOCUS AREA, SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE COMPANIONSHIP SERVICES DESIGNED TO ENABLE THIS GROUP OF CLIENTS TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY. SPECIFICALLY SERVICES PROVIDED BY OUR SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL RESULT IN OUR CLIENTS HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AS WELL AS A PERCEPTION OF IMPROVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. IN ADDITION SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE RESPITE CARE SERVICES TO PROVIDE TEMPORARY RELIEF FROM THE STRESSES OF CARE GIVING BY PROVIDING SHORT-TERM ASSISTANCE TO AN ADULT WHO IS THE PRIMARY CAREGIVER FOR A PERSON WITH CHRONIC DISABILITIES, ALZHEIMER'S, DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, ETC.  SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PROVIDE ACTIVITIES THAT ENCOURAGE SOCIAL INTERACTION, INCREASE SOCIAL TIES AND PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, PROMOTE SELF-ESTEEM, IMPROVE MORAL, PROVIDE PEER SUPPORT AND ENCOURAGE SOCIALLY APPROPRIATE BEHAVIOR. BY THE END OF THE 3-YEAR GRANT WE ESTIMATE THAT A TOTAL OF 26 UNDUPLICATED SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL PARTICIPATE IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS AND SERVE AN ESTIMATED 45 HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS, DISABLED INDIVIDUALS AND CARE GIVERS.  
     THE CNCS INVESTMENT OF $158,299 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY NOT LESS THAN $17,589 NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

CATHOLIC CHARITIES, DIOCESE OF SAN DIEGO IS A RESPECTED LEADER IN THE ADMINISTRATION OF SOCIAL SERVICE PROGRAMS IN SAN DIEGO AND IMPERIAL COUNTIES.  WITH A COMMITMENT TO ADVOCACY, JUSTICE AND ENHANCING THE QUALITY OF LIFE FOR THE POOR, PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED TO PROMOTE SELF-DETERMINATION, A KEY QUALITY FOR INDEPENDENT LIVING AND STRONGER COMMUNITIES.  FOR THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM THE GRANT RENEWAL PERIOD IS 2017-2020 FOR WHICH CATHOLIC CHARITIES IS REQUESTING $25,385 TO FUND 6 VSYS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA FOR THE PROJECT WILL BE HEALTHY FUTURES AND CAREGIVER RESPITE TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING FOR BOTH THE FRAIL SENIOR AND THEIR PRIMARY CAREGIVER.    
SERVICES WILL TARGET FRAIL SENIORS WHO HAVE ALZHEIMER'S AND OTHER CHRONIC DISEASES, AND THEIR CAREGIVERS. SUPPORTING THE SENIORS WISH TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY, AND AT HOME, IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING RESTORATIVE TIME FOR THE PRIMARY CAREGIVER WILL BE THE PROJECTS' TARGET FOCUS.  ACTIVITIES FOR THE FAMILY MEMBER WILL INCLUDE COMPANIONSHIP, PROTECTIVE SUPERVISION, ASSISTANCE WITH LIMITED ADLS AND ESCORT TO VITAL SERVICES, SUCH AS DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS WHEN APPROPRIATE.  
TO ENSURE POSITIVE OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS, CATHOLIC CHARITIES WILL ALIGN WITH, AND SUPPORT CNCS INITIATIVES INCLUDING STANDARDIZED PERFORMANCE MEASURES, SURVEYS AND DATA COLLECTION PROCESSES.  IN THE PAST THE PROJECT HAS DEMONSTRATED IMPACT THROUGH VOLUNTEER, STATION ADMINISTRATION AND CAREGIVER SURVEYS.  PERFORMANCE OUTCOMES HAVE SHOWN THAT THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE SENIOR COMPANIONS HAVE SUPPORTED THE SENIOR'S ABILITY TO REMAIN AT HOME WHILE SIMULTANEOUSLY PROVIDING THE MUCH NEEDED RESPITE FOR THEIR CAREGIVER; A WIN-WIN OUTCOME FOR BOTH RECIPIENTS AND THE GRATIFICATION OF MAKING A POSITIVE DIFFERENCE THROUGH SERVICE FOR THE SCP.
AT THE END OF THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, THE PREDICTION IS THE CATHOLIC CHARITIES SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WITH TWELVE FUNDED VSYS, WILL HAVE SERVED APPROXIMATELY 117 FRAIL SENIORS AND THEIR CAREGIVERS FOR A TOTAL OF 234 INDIVIDUALS. IT IS ESTIMATED THAT A MINIMUM OF 80% OF THE CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT LESS STRESS, INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND ENHANCED QUALITY OF LIFE.  IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT THE ANNUAL FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $25,385 WILL BE AUGMENTED WITH APPROXIMATELY $37,563 IN NON-FEDERAL FUNDS TO SUPPORT THE COST OF 6 ADDITIONAL VSYS THROUGH ALZ~CARE INC., THE PROVIDER AGENCY FOR CAREGIVER RESPITE THROUGH THE IMPERIAL COUNTY, AREA AGENCY ON AGING.

THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) HAS 11 VOLUNTEERS TO BE MATCHED WITH CLIENTS IN PARTNERING STATIONS, WORKING WITH SEVERELY DISABLED AND ELDERLY PERSONS WHO ARE IN NEED OF COMPANIONSHIP AND SOCIALIZATION TO REMAIN IN THEIR HOMES. 
SERVICE ACTIVITY:  11 SENIOR COMPANIONS (SCP'S) WILL WORK WITH 55 CLIENTS IDENTIFIED BY PARTNERING STATIONS AND ONE OF THE 11 WILL BE ASSIGNED TO WORK WITH 5 ADULT DAY HEALTH CARE PARTICIPANTS.   THESE IDENTIFIED CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE ONE-ON-ONE ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES, WALKING, READING, REMINISCING, COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE; ARRANGE TRANSPORTATION AND TRANSPORTING THEM WHEN NECESSARY TO MEDICAL, PHARMACY, GROCERY SHOPPING, APPOINTMENTS AS NEEDED AND REQUESTED BY CARE MANAGER.  SCP'S WILL WORK 15 HOURS WITH A MAXIMUM OF 40 HOURS A WEEK AS NEEDED TO SUPPORT CLIENTS IN-HOME NEEDS WITHIN PROGRAM GUIDELINES. 
OUTCOMES:  50 OF THE 55 IN-HOME ASSIGNED CLIENTS SERVED BY SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL BE MORE LIKELY TO REMAIN IN THEIR OWN HOME AND FEEL LESS LONELY AND ISOLATED DUE IN PART TO THEIR SENIOR COMPANION VISITS. 
NUMBER OF STATIONS AND LOCATION OF SERVICES:  7 STATIONS IN SHASTA, SISKIYOU AND TRINITY COUNTIES. 
FUNDING: CNCS FUNDING REQUESTED: $60,132 
NON FEDERAL FUNDING:  DIGNITY HEALTH PROVIDES IN-KIND THROUGH HUMAN RESOURCES, IT SUPPORT, AND OTHER CORPORATE CHARGES THAT COULD BE BILLED TO SENIOR CORPS GRANTS. ADDITIONAL IN-KIND FOR RENT, SPACE, RECOGNITIONS, BREAKFAST AND LUNCHES FOR VOLUNTEERS.  
EXCESS FUNDING:  FEDERAL TRANSIT ADMINISTRATION -- 2017 EXPANDED 5310 GRANT - $36,416 FOR VOLUNTEER MILEAGE, SUPPLIES AND SALARIES.

EXECUTIVE SUMMARY-CATHOLIC CHARITIES DIOCESE OF FRESNO, SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER PROGRAM, WILL SERVE 79 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS, ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE: INDEPENDENT LIVING/COMPANIONSHIP, RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS & HOSPICE FOR CLIENTS, COMPANIONSHIP/ ADULT DAY CARE CENTER & TRANSPORTATION FOR ASSIGNED CLIENTS.
THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ADDRESS HEALTH FUTURES/AGING IN PLACE, PERFORMANCE MEASURES, 79 VSY'S [VOLUNTEER SERVICE YEARS/SENIOR COMPANIONS] SHALL TARGET SERVICES IN THE FOLLOWING CATEGORIES: INDEPENDENT LIVING/COMPANIONSHIP [FOR 70 SENIORS+/INCLUDES SERVICE TO VETERANS], RESPITE CARE [FOR 7+ CAREGIVERS] HOSPICE [FOR 5+ CLIENTS], TRANSPORTATION [FOR 25+ SENIORS]; AS TARGETS/OUTCOMES ARE FOR A THREE YEAR GRANT. THE CORPORATION FOR NATIONAL AND COMMUNITY SERVICES FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF  $358,396 [APPROXIMATE PER YEAR] WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY APPROXIMATELY $50,000 [PER YEAR] OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
CATHOLIC CHARITIES DIOCESE OF FRESNO [CCDOF] IS A FAITH BASED NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATION SERVING THE CENTRAL SAN JOAQUIN VALLEY AREA [FROM BAKERSFIELD TO MERCED] FOR OVER 45 YEARS. CCDOF IS THE PRIMARY SPONSOR OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM AND FULLY SUPPORTS THE PROGRAM BY PROVIDING OVERSIGHT, ADMINISTRATIVE MANAGEMENT, AND IN KIND/ MATCHING FUNDS AS AN INVESTMENT IN THE OVERALL SUCCESS OF SERVING FRAIL SENIORS WHO WISH TO LIVE IN THEIR HOMES AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. CCDOF HAS OPERATED THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM FOR OVER 30+ YEARS IN FRESNO/MADERA COUNTIES.
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM SERVES BOTH FRESNO AND MADERA COUNTY AREAS AND IS LOCATED IN CENTRAL CALIFORNIA. ALL POTENTIAL SENIOR VOLUNTEERS ARE 55 YEARS AND OLDER AND MUST MEET INCOME REQUIREMENTS, HAVE VALID IDENTIFICATION, UNDERGO A BACKGROUND CHECK, BE FINGERPRINTED AND HAVE CLEARANCE BY THEIR PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIAN TO VOLUNTEER. THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM DOES NOT DIRECTLY PLACE COMPANIONS IN THE HOMES OF CLIENTS; PARTNER AGENCIES IN THE COMMUNITY FACILITATE THIS PART OF THE PROGRAM. PARTNER AGENCIES, UNDER A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING [MOU], REFER ELIGIBLE FRAIL SENIOR CLIENTS IN NEED OF SERVICES OF THE PROGRAM AND ARE THEN PLACED WITH A TRAINED COMPANION, TO PROVIDE COMPANION SERVICES IN THEIR HOMES, TO HELP THEM STAY AT HOME TO MAINTAIN THEIR INDEPENDENCE AS LONG AS POSSIBLE. COMPANIONS ASSIST IN A WIDE RANGE OF SERVICES INCLUDING: LIGHT MEAL PREPARATION, SHOPPING, TRANSPORTING CLIENTS TO DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, LIGHT HOUSEHOLD TASKS, RESPITE CARE, AND MOST IMPORTANTLY FRIENDSHIP. COMPANIONS AID IN HELPING CLIENTS MAINTAIN HAPPY HEALTHY INDEPENDENT LIVES.  MOST COMPANIONS VOLUNTEER 20 HOURS PER WEEK AND RECEIVE A MODEST NON-TAXABLE STIPEND, TRANSPORTATION ALLOWANCE AND THE PROVEN BENEFITS OF VOLUNTEERING, BETTER HEALTH AND INCREASED HAPPINESS. THERE IS NO COST TO CLIENTS WHO ARE IN NEED OF A COMPANION.  
REV 2017
ENGAGES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.

FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES', INC. (F&CS) SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) CURRENTLY SERVES THE OHIO COUNTIES OF STARK, PORTAGE, AND SUMMIT WITH 56 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS WHO ANNUALLY PROVIDE 59,508 HOURS OF COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE SERVICES TO 136 HOMEBOUND AND/OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHICH ALLOW THEM TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY.  THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $211,997 IS SUPPLEMENTED BY THE GOAL OF $56,597 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES TO SUPPORT 57 VSYS.
F&CS PROPOSES TO EXPAND THE SERVICES IN THEIR PROJECT OVERSIGHT TO INCLUDE THE COUNTIES OF MONTGOMERY, PREBLE, CLARK, GREENE, AND MIAMI.  THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM IN THIS REGION WILL HAVE AN ESTIMATED 35 UNDUPLICATED VOLUNTEERS.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS OF THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS HEALTHY FUTURES, INDEPENDENT LIVING, AND RESPITE FOR CAREGIVERS. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL SENIOR HOUSING FACILITIES AND THE LOCAL CHAPTERS OF UNITED WAY, AREA AGENCY ON AGING, AND LOCAL SENIOR CENTERS, THE SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS SERVING IN MONTGOMERY, PREBLE, CLARK, GREENE, AND MIAMI COUNTIES IN OHIO WILL PROVIDE RESPITE TO CAREGIVERS OR COMPANIONSHIP TO CLIENTS THAT WILL INCLUDE SOCIALIZATION AND ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING. WITH F&CS OVERSIGHT, THE EXPECTED RESULTS ARE THAT 35 SENIOR VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN AND CONTRIBUTE TO THEIR COMMUNITY SO THAT 50+ BENEFICIARIES WILL BE ABLE TO CONTINUE TO LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND THAT BOTH CLIENTS AND CAREGIVERS RECEIVING RESPITE SERVICES WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND/OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. 
FAMILY & COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC. HAS A LONG STANDING HISTORY OF PROVIDING QUALITY SERVICES AND MEETING EVER-CHANGING COMMUNITY NEEDS. BY EXPANDING THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM, F&CS WILL BRING THIS EXPERTISE TO THE COUNTIES OF MONTGOMERY, PREBLE, CLARK, GREENE AND MIAMI, AND OPERATE AN EFFICIENT PROGRAM DEDICATED TO THOSE IT SERVES. WITH MANAGEMENT OVERSIGHT FROM SCP STAFF AS WELL AS F&CS ADMINISTRATION, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM WILL HAVE THE SUPPORT NECESSARY TO COMPLY WITH ALL GRANT AND FEDERAL REGULATIONS, AND ENSURE THAT BOTH VOLUNTEERS AND PROGRAM RECIPIENTS HAVE AN EXPERIENCE THAT IS LIFE CHANGING, COMPASSIONATE, AND ENGAGING, AND GIVES THEM  INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY.
FOR THIS PURPOSE, F&CS IS REQUESTING 31 VSY'S WITH A CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $188,171, WHICH WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $23,861 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.

IN 1981, GRANTS FOR THE CHORE-HOUSEKEEPER PROGRAM WERE SUBMITTED TO EAST CENTRAL ILLINOIS AREA AGENCY ON AGING(ECIAAA). CHELP STARTED WITH TWO CHORE-HOUSEKEEPERS AND THIRTEEN CLIENTS, THIS PROGRAM IS FUNDED BY THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT ON AGING(IDOA) AND THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT OF HUMAN SERVICES-DIVISION OF REHABILITATION SERVICES (DORS). 

THESE TWO PROGRAMS ARE DESIGNED TO PROVIDE HOUSEKEEPING AND PERSONAL CARE TO PERSONS WHO ARE DISABLED AND ARE UNABLE TO DO THE NECESSARY HOUSEHOLD TASKS FOR THEM TO LIVE AT HOME RATHER THAN WITH THEIR ADULT CHILD OR IN A NURSING HOME. CHELP WILL FOCUS ON PROVIDING SERVICES WHICH PROMOTE INDEPENDENCE. THE ELDERLY STRUGGLE TO STAY OUT OF NURSING HOMES AND HOSPITALS. THEY NEED ASSISTANCE WITH FOOD PREPARATION, LAUNDRY, HOUSEKEEPING, AND OTHER DAILY ACTIVITIES. 

CHELP PROVIDES HOMEMAKER SERVICE TO PEOPLE IN THEIR HOME. OUR CLIENTS ARE MOSTLY PEOPLE OVER 60 WHO NEED ASSISTANCE WITH DAY TO DAY ACTIVITIES IN THEIR HOME. 

ACROSS THE UNITED STATES OLDER ADULTS ARE FINDING IT HARDER TO CARE FOR THEMSELVES AND MAY BE LOOKING AT NURSING HOME PLACEMENT BUT WITH OUR ASSISTANCE PEOPLE ARE ABLE TO STAY IN THEIR HOME LONGER. OUR RESEARCH HAS SHOWN THAT THERE IS APPROXIMATELY 17,133 PEOPLE OVER THE AGE OF 65 LIVING IN THE MACON COUNTY AREA AND ABOUT 55.2% OF THESE PEOPLE NEED SOME ASSISTANCE CARING FOR THEMSELVES. 

WHILE THERE ARE CURRENTLY 3 OTHER PROVIDERS IN MACON COUNTY WE SPECIALIZE IN ALL SENIOR SERVICES PROGRAMS OFFERED BY THE ILLINOIS DEPARTMENT ON AGING. CHELP ALSO HIRES THE BEST OF THE BEST TO CARE FOR THE CLIENTS WE PROVIDE SERVICE TO. 

CHELP IS A NOT FOR PROFIT AGENCY GOVERNED BY A BOARD OF DIRECTORS. DIANE DREW IS EXECUTIVE DIRECTORS SHE HAS OVER 20 YEARS OF EXPERIENCE. 

CHELP HAS OVER 200 CLIENTS AND 100 STAFF MEMBERS TO CARE FOR THESE CLIENTS. IT IS OUR GOAL TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF CLIENTS TO 350. 

MISSION STATEMENT: THE PURPOSE OF CHELP IS TO STABILIZE, MAINTAIN, AND IMPROVE THE HOME ENVIRONMENT OF RESIDENTS OF MACON COUNTY BY MEANS OF EDUCATION AND ASSISTANCE TO ENABLE SENIORS, DISABLED OR INDIVIDUALS IN EMERGENCY SITUATIONS TO MAINTAIN THEMSELVES IN THEIR OWN HOME SO AS TO PREVENT SHORT OR LONG TERM INSTITUTIONALIZATION. 

VISION: CHELP'S VISION IS TO KEEP ALL OLDER ADULTS AND DISABLED IN THEIR HOMES FOR AS LONG AS POSSIBLE BY HELPING THEM KEEP THEIR INDEPENDENCE AND DIGNITY WITH ANY EXTRA HELP THEY REQUIRE.

THE MISSION OF FAMILY SERVICES IS AN AGENCY COMMITTED TO IMPROVING THE LIVES OF PEOPLE IN MONTGOMERY COUNTY.  THE AGENCY HAS THREE MAIN GOALS:  TO HELP PEOPLE IMPROVE THEIR LIFE PROSPECTS, TO HAVE FAMILY FUNCTIONS ADAPTIVELY, AND TO HELP CLIENTS REDUCE RISKS TO ACHIEVING AND MAINTAINING SELF-SUFFICIENCY.  
THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF MONTGOMERY COUNTY, PA IS REQUESTING $199,907 OF FEDERAL SUPPORT TO MANAGE 33 VSYS WITH THE NEW FUNDING STRUCTURE OF $6,000/VSY AND 50 VOLUNTEERS AT SIX VOLUNTEER STATIONS TO SUPPORT COMPANIONSHIP AND RESPITE CARE. FAMILY SERVICES CONTRIBUTES $76,525 OF NON-FEDERAL SUPPORT.  
50 VOLUNTEERS WILL ASSIST CLIENTS WITH AGING IN PLACE BY ASSISTING WITH TRANSPORTATION, FOOD ASSISTANCE AND OTHER SERVICES.  THESE CLIENTS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE ONE ON ONE ASSISTANCE TO CLIENTS HELPING THEM WITH SOCIALIZATION, ADVOCACY, RECREATION AND NON MEDICAL ASSISTANCE WITH ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING FOR A MINIMUM OF 4 HOURS/WEEK.  THESE SERVICES WILL ASSIST THE CLIENT IN REMAINING INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOME AND PROVIDE CAREGIVERS WHO CARE FOR THEIR LOVED ONES NEEDED REST AND RESPITE. THE CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, AS A RESULT OF HAVING A SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEER IN THEIR HOME.  
AT THE END OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT,  75 CLIENTS WILL RECEIVE SERVICES TO HELP THEM REMAIN INDEPENDENT IN THEIR HOME.  AN ESTIMATED 57 PEOPLE WILL SHOW AN INCREASE IN SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. 75 CAREGIVERS WILL RECEIVE RESPITE SERVICES WITH 57 REPORTING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.

HENRY STREET SETTLEMENT HAS BEEN PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE, INTEGRATED, AND HIGH-QUALITY SERVICES IN HEALTH CARE, SOCIAL SERVICES, AND THE ARTS SINCE 1893. THROUGH OUR SENIOR SERVICES DIVISION, HENRY STREET HAS CONTINUED TO PROVIDE LIFE-SAVING INTERVENTIONS FOR OLDER ADULTS THROUGHOUT THE NEW YORK CITY AREA, INCLUDING AS THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE CITY-WIDE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP), THE LARGEST MEALS ON WHEELS PROGRAM IN NYC, OUR GOOD COMPANIONS SENIOR CENTER, AND OUR VLADECK CARES/NATURALLY OCCURRING RETIREMENT COMMUNITY (NORC). OVER THE GRANT PERIOD OF JULY 1, 2018 TO JUNE 30, 2020, HENRY STREET WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND PROVIDE VOLUNTEER OPPORTUNITIES FOR 105 SCP VOLUNTEERS. ALL 105 OF OUR SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS IN THE SCP PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF HEALTHY FUTURES, AGING IN PLACE. SCP ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE, BUT NOT BE LIMITED TO, PROVIDING COMPANIONSHIP, ESCORTING THEM TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, AND ASSISTING THEM WITH TASKS OF DAILY LIVING. SENIOR COMPANIONS ARE TRAINED TO IDENTIFY CLIENT NEEDS, TO PROVIDE SOCIAL STIMULATION, TO BE FAMILIAR WITH LOCAL RESOURCES, AND TO CONNECT CLIENTS WITH THEIR SUPERVISORS IF AND WHEN CLIENTS ARE IN NEED OF IMMEDIATE INTERVENTION OR CASE MANAGEMENT. AT THE END OF OUR THREE-YEAR GRANT, HENRY STREET ANTICIPATES THAT 90% OF OUR SENIOR COMPANION CLIENTS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES OR PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT, IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE SCP PERFORMANCE MEASURES. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $471,870 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $105,662 FROM IN-KIND AND PRIVATE SOURCES.

FEDERATION OF ORGANIZATIONS IS THE SPONSOR ORGANIZATION OF THE SUFFOLK COUNTY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. FEDERATION IS A NON-PROFIT SOCIAL SERVICE AGENCY, FOUNDED BY FAMILY ADVOCATES IN 1972. THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY FEDERATION EXPAND THROUGHOUT SUFFOLK, NASSAU, QUEENS AND KINGS COUNTIES. THE MISSION OF THE AGENCY IS TO ASSIST INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES IN MEETING THEIR OWN NEEDS WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES THROUGH SELF-HELP, PROVISION OF QUALITY SERVICES, ADVOCACY AND DEVELOPMENT OF RESOURCES. 
FEDERATION OF ORGANIZATIONS IS REQUESTING 40 VSY?S, AND IT IS PROJECTED THAT AN ESTIMATED 51 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE. SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ASSIST HOMEBOUND ELDERLY AND THOSE WITH DISABILITIES, AS WELL AS ADULTS WITH SEVERE MENTAL ILLNESS, THROUGH A NETWORK OF SIX VOLUNTEER STATIONS. SENIOR COMPANIONS WILL ADDRESS CRITICAL NEEDS IDENTIFIED IN OUR COMMUNITY; AMONG THESE NEEDS ARE SOCIAL ISOLATION AND SENIORS WANTING TO AGE IN PLACE IN THEIR OWN HOMES. VOLUNTEERS WILL OFFER SERVICES SUCH AS COMPANIONSHIP, FRIENDSHIP, ONE-TO-ONE CONVERSATION, ASSISTANCE WITH ATTENDING COMMUNITY OUTINGS, OCCASIONAL TRANSPORTATION, RECREATION ACTIVITIES, ASSISTANCE WITH LIGHT HOUSEKEEPING/HOME MANAGEMENT TASKS, AND PEER SUPPORT. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF FEDERATION?S SCP IS HEALTHY FUTURES, WITH PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON HELPING THOSE SERVED LIVE INDEPENDENTLY AND AGE IN PLACE.  RESEARCH CONDUCTED BY RELIABLE SOURCES, SUCH AS THE SUFFOLK COUNTY OFFICE FOR THE AGING, THE NATIONAL COUNCIL ON AGING, HELPGUIDE.ORG, THE US CENSUS BUREAU, THE NATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF MENTAL HYGIENE DIRECTORS, AND THE NYS OFFICE OF MENTAL HEALTH, DOCUMENT EVIDENCE OF VARYING COMMUNITY NEEDS IN SUFFOLK COUNTY. ADDITIONALLY, THE SOCIAL CARE INSTITUTE FOR EXCELLENCE DIVISION, THE SUFFOLK COUNTY RESPITE CARE PROGRAM, CARING PEOPLE, INC., AND FEDERATION OF ORGANIZATIONS? RESIDENTIAL SERVICES IDENTIFIED NEEDS OF SENIORS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH MENTAL ILLNESS RESIDING IN SUFFOLK COUNTY, AND PROVIDED INFORMATION AS TO HOW FEDERATION?S SCP CAN BEST ADDRESS THESE NEEDS THROUGH VOLUNTEER SERVICE.  AT THE END OF THE 12-MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, SOCIALLY ISOLATED SENIORS, INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND ADULTS WITH MENTAL ILLNESS WILL INCREASE THEIR LEVEL OF INDEPENDENCE, BE ABLE TO AGE IN PLACE AND REMAIN LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY, DUE IN PART TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED BY THE SENIOR COMPANIONS.

THE MISSION OF THE NYS OFFICE FOR PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES (OPWDD) IS TO HELP PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES TO LIVE RICHER LIVES.  THE VISION SUPPORTS ENJOYMENT OF THE MEANINGFUL RELATIONSHIPS IN THE LIVES OF PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES WITH FRIENDS, FAMILY AND OTHERS, EXPERIENCING PERSONAL HEALTH AND GROWTH, LIVING IN THE HOME OF THEIR CHOICE, HAVING A JOB IN THE COMMUNITY AND FULLY PARTICIPATION IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.  GUIDING PRINCIPLES ON HOW THE OPWDD CONDUCTS ITS BUSINESS INCLUDE "PUTTING PEOPLE FIRST" BY MAXIMIZING OPPORTUNITIES AS NEEDED SUPPORTS AND SERVICES.  OPWDD PROMOTES EXCELLENCE IN SERVICES, WHILE REQUIRING ACCOUNTABILITY AND RESPONSIBILITY  AND BY NURTURING PARTNERSHIPS AND COLLABORATIONS.  AS A SUPPORT TO THE SERVICES PROVIDED WITHIN OPWDD TO THE NYS POPULATION OF PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES, WE REQUEST 60 VSY'S AND AN OVERALL GRANT BUDGET OF $230,171 WITHIN THIS GRANT APPLICATION FOR 2017-18.  NYS OPWDD WILL SUPPLEMENT $1,845,691.  SERVICE CATEGORIES TO BE ADDRESSED INCLUDE PROMOTING HEALTH AND INDEPENDENCE VIA ASSISTANCE WITH "ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING", PROMOTING INDIVIDUALIZATION VIA RECREATION AND LEISURE ACTIVITIES AND STRIVING FOR PREPAREDNESS AND INDEPENDENCE IN "COMMUNITY INCLUSION" WHICH ADDRESSES LIVING IN THE GENERAL COMMUNITY AND GETTING INVOLVED IN VOLUNTEERING, EMPLOYMENT, DEVELOPING RELATIONSHIPS, AND PARTICIPATING IN PROGRAMS WITH THE COMMUNITY AT LARGE.  THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THIS PROJECT IS TO SUPPORT INDIVIDUALS WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AS THEY MOVE IN TO THEIR COMMUNITIES.  THE SCP WILL ASSIST IN EDUCATING THE PUBLIC ON THE BENEFIT OF INCLUDING PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES INTO COMMUNITY NEIGHBORHOODS, JOB SITES AND ACTIVITIES.  IT WILL ALSO BENEFIT THE SENIOR COMMUNITY POPULATION BY OFFERING OPPORTUNITIES FOR THEIR INVOLVEMENT WHILE PROMOTING A BETTER LIFESTYLE WITH THE STIPEND SUPPORT OF THIS PROGRAM. IN THE 2015-18 PROJECT GRANT PERIOD, THE FOCUS TO FURTHER INVOLVE SC'S IN COMMUNITY INNOVATIONS VIA VOLUNTEERING/EMPLOYMENT, COMMUNITY, ARTS, SENIOR CENTERS, AND OPENING MANY MORE SC SITES WITHIN OPWDD  AND  THE VOLUNTARY SECTOR SERVING PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.  AN ESTIMATED 375 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE MORE THAN 880 INDIVIDUALS.  FURTHER EFFORTS TO UTILIZE SC'S IN OPPORTUNITIES LIKE EMPLOYMENT SUPPORT, FAITH BASED ACTIVITIES, RETIREMENT AND OTHER COMMUNITY BASED OPPORTUNITIES WILL BE PRIORITIZED TO SUPPORT FURTHER INCLUSION AND INDEPENDENCE TO PEOPLE WITH DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES.
ENGAGES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES.

ALL OF THE ESTIMATED 64 SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE IN THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF BUILDING A ?HEALTHY FUTURE? FOR THE MOST VULNERABLE IN OUR COMMUNITY.    100% OF THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM VOLUNTEERS WILL BE ENGAGED IN PROVIDING COMPANION AND RESPITE SERVICES TO FRAIL OLDER ADULTS AGE 65 AND OLDER AND/OR TO ADULTS UNDER AGE 65 WHO HAVE ONE OR MORE PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL OR MENTAL HEALTH LIMITATIONS.   ALL SERVICES WILL BE BASED IN-HOME TO SUPPORT INDEPENDENT LIVING IN THE COMMUNITY.  SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE SOCIALIZATION; ESCORT TO MEDICAL, BUSINESS OR SOCIAL APPOINTMENTS; ASSISTANCE WITH INSTRUMENTAL ACTIVITIES OF DAILY LIVING, INFORMATION AND ACCESS TO OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED SERVICES.   THESE ACTIVITIES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH A NETWORK OF 20 VOLUNTEER STATIONS IN THE GREATER WATERBURY AREA. 
AT THE END OF THE 12 MONTH PERFORMANCE PERIOD, IT IS ANTICIPATED THAT:
 1)    32 (95%) OF 34 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES WHO RECEIVE A MINIMUM OF 24 HOURS OF COMPANION SERVICES  WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND,
 2)   30 (95%) OF 32 CAREGIVERS WHO RECEIVE A MINIMUM OF 24 HOURS OF RESPITE SERVICE FOR THEIR FRAIL FAMILY MEMBER WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.   
THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $298,974 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $33,272 IN NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES.
