THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM OF NORTHWEST MICHIGAN HAS AN ESTIMATED 33 VOLUNTEERS THAT WILL SERVE THE 10 COUNTIES OF NORTHWEST MICHIGAN AND BE PLACED IN OUTCOME ASSIGNMENTS. SOME OF THEIR ACTIVITIES WILL INCLUDE; PROVIDING TRANSPORTATION AND ASSISTANCE ACCESSING THE COMMUNITY TO ATTEND DOCTOR APPOINTMENTS, GROCERY SHOP, PICK UP PRESCRIPTIONS, VISITING OR PROVIDING RESPITE FOR A CAREGIVER. THEY HAVE BEEN SPONSORED BY CATHOLIC HUMAN SERVICES (CHS) FOR OVER 32 YEARS AND IN THAT TIME THE PROGRAM HAS GROWN TO REPRESENTATION IN ALL TEN COUNTIES. THE MISSION STATEMENT OF CHS IS TO ENHANCE THE LIVES OF THOSE WE SERVE BY PROVIDING HOPE-FILLED SOCIAL, EMOTIONAL AND SPIRITUAL SUPPORT TO ALL PEOPLE. CHS PROVIDES SERVICES TO ALL FAITHS, ALL INCOMES AND ALL FAMILIES. CHS PROVIDES THE FOLLOWING SERVICES TO THE 21 COUNTIES OF NORTHERN MICHIGAN; ALCOHOL & DRUG COUNSELING, FAMILY COUNSELING, PREVENTION SERVICES, PREGNANCY COUNSELING & OPEN ADOPTION, EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, SENIOR COMPANION & FOSTER GRANDPARENT PROGRAMS, NURSING HOME SERVICES AND COMMUNITY SERVICES. THE FOSTER GRANDPARENT & SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM'S MISSION IS TO ENRICH THE LIVES OF THE OLDER ADULT VOLUNTEERS AS WELL AS THOSE OF THE CLIENTS AND CHILDREN WITH SPECIAL NEEDS. THE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO TAP THE TALENTS, SKILLS, KNOWLEDGE AND TRADITIONS OF THE VOLUNTEERS, ENABLE THEM TO PROVIDE SERVICE TO OTHERS, AND TO ENHANCE THEIR LATER YEARS BY BRINGING A SENSE OF VITALITY AND RENEWAL TO THEIR LIVES. WE STRIVE TO PROVIDE A VALUABLE SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY BY PAIRING OUR SC VOLUNTEERS WITH REFERRED CLIENTS IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, AS WELL AS SERVING OUR LOW INCOME VOLUNTEER WITH THE RESOURCES AND TRAINING NEEDED TO ENSURE THEIR QUALITY OF LIFE. SC VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE THEIR CLIENTS WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO ENGAGE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES, WHICH INCREASES SOCIALIZATION AND DECREASES ISOLATION. WE ARE FUNDED FOR 33 VSYS THROUGH AASA AND MAINTAIN THEIR PLACEMENT AND SERVICE HOURS. THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE PROJECT IS HEALTHY FUTURES. AT THE END OF THE 3 YEAR GRANT, THE ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES (193 RECEIVING INDEPENDENT LIVING SERVICES [EACH YEAR] AND 165 REALIZING INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT [EACH EAR] )WILL BE MET THRU; CLIENTS RECEIVING SC SERVICES WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL SUPPORT AND CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT INCREASED SOCIAL TIES AND SUPPORT DUE TO THE SC SERVICES PROVIDED TO THEIR LOVED ONE. THE CNCS FEDERAL INVESTMENT OF $0 WILL BE SUPPLEMENTED BY $321,487 NON FEDERAL RESOURCES FROM AASA AND LOCAL PARTNERS.
ENGAGES PERSONS 55 AND OLDER IN VOLUNTER SERVICE IN THEIR COMMUNITIES

THE KALAMAZOO COUNTY SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM (SCP) IS SPONSORED BY SENIOR SERVICES OF SOUTHWEST MICHIGAN, RECOGNIZED AS A LEADER THROUGHOUT THE STATE AND COUNTRY FOR PROVIDING COMPREHENSIVE, INNOVATIVE, AND LIFE SUSTAINING SERVICES THROUGH AN INTEGRATED SYSTEM OF PROGRAMS.  WITH AN AGENCY MISSION OF ENHANCING AND PROMOTING THE INDEPENDENCE AND WELL-BEING OF OLDER ADULTS, ADULTS WITH DISABILITIES AND THOSE THAT CARE FOR THEM, THE SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM ENHANCES THAT MISSION BY ENABLING OLDER ADULTS TO MAINTAIN THEIR HEALTH, INDEPENDENCE, AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT THROUGH VOLUNTEERISM.

TYPES OF POPULATIONS SERVED
35 SCP LOW-INCOME ADULTS, 55 YEARS AND OLDER WILL SERVE AS VOLUNTEERS, PROVIDING ONE-TO-ONE SUPPORT AND COMPANIONSHIP TO HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS LIVING ALONE AND FRAIL OR CHRONICALLY ILL ADULTS LIVING WITH FAMILY MEMBERS.  IN ADDITION, A SMALL PERCENTAGE OF OUR CLIENTS SERVED RESIDE IN ASSISTED LIVING OR LONG-TERM CARE FACILITIES AND HAVE NO INFORMAL SUPPORT SYSTEM TO HELP THEM MAINTAIN THEIR DIGNITY AND CONNECT THEM TO THE OUTSIDE WORLD.

PRIMARY FOCUS AREA
HEALTHY FUTURES IS THE PRIMARY FOCUS AREA OF THE KALAMAZOO SENIOR COMPANION PROGRAM. 

VOLUNTEER SERVICE ACTIVITIES
SENIOR COMPANION VOLUNTEERS WORK TO FILL GAPS IN COMMUNITY OUTREACH SERVICES, SUCH AS VISITING HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS, INCREASING SOCIALIZATION OPPORTUNITIES FOR ISOLATED INDIVIDUALS, ACCOMPANYING FRAIL INDIVIDUALS TO MEDICAL APPOINTMENTS, ASSISTING WITH GROCERY SHOPPING AND OTHER ERRANDS, CONNECTING PEOPLE WITH PROGRAMS AND INFORMATION TO HELP THEM HAVE HEALTHIER LIVES, AND PROVIDING RESPITE SERVICES FOR FULL-TIME HOME CAREGIVERS.

LOCATION OF SERVICE ACTIVITIES
SCP VOLUNTEERS PROVIDE IN-HOME SERVICES TO MAKE DAILY TASKS EASIER FOR ADULTS WITH SPECIAL NEEDS LIVING IN RURAL AND URBAN KALAMAZOO COUNTY, INCLUDING THE CITIES AND TOWNS OF KALAMAZOO, PORTAGE, SCHOOLCRAFT, VICKSBURG, RICHLAND, COMSTOCK, AND PARCHMENT.  

EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF VOLUNTEER SERVICES
OVER THE COURSE OF THE THREE YEAR GRANT PERIOD, 35 UNDUPLICATED SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL SERVE 300 HOMEBOUND OR OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND AT LEAST 90% OF THOSE INDIVIDUALS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT. IN ADDITION, 4 SCP VOLUNTEERS WILL PROVIDE RESPITE SERVICES TO 4 CAREGIVERS OF HOMEBOUND OLDER ADULTS AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND AT LEAST 90% OF CAREGIVERS WILL REPORT HAVING INCREASED SOCIAL TIES/PERCEIVED SOCIAL SUPPORT.

FEDERAL FUNDING LEVEL
NO FEDERAL FUNDING IS ALLOCATED OR BEING REQUESTED FOR THIS SCP PROJECT AT THIS TIME.

NON-FEDERAL FUNDING LEVEL
THE ANTICIPATED LEVEL OF NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES IS $202,919. FUNDING SOURCES INCLUDE THE STATE OF MICHIGAN (AASA) $169,364;   SENIOR SERVICES $17,153; AND VOLUNTEER STATION AND COMMUNITY IN-KIND CONTRIBUTIONS ($16,402)
